excerpts: I chose the Classic Black milk tea (without boba of course) - smooth, frothy, and had a distinct, robust black tea flavor while still containing a balance of the familiar malty-like milk element.
classic black.author: Anna B.
classic black.review:
Boba Guys creates one of the best classic milk tea drinks I've had in a while! There are around 5 locations in the numerous neighborhoods of San Francisco.

I chose the Classic Black milk tea (without boba of course) - smooth, frothy, and had a distinct, robust black tea flavor while still containing a balance of the familiar malty-like milk element. I ordered the drink 50% sweetened (the recommended sweetener level suggested on the menu), since nowadays I prefer tea and even coffee drinks to be less sweet.

My sister ordered the Jasmine Green milk tea (with boba), also ordering it half sweetened. I sampled her drink (trying to strategically sip it so I didn't suck up a tapioca pearl through the straw) and it was a superbly made tea drink, too! The green tea had a mellow, natural flavorings combined with a hint of a floral-esque taste.

FYI, the tea drinks can also be ordered as a hot version (12 or 16 oz size); iced version (16 or 24 oz size). And there are four milk options to choose from, including vegan options: organic dairy milk (the milk I chose for my tea drink), almond milk, oat milk, or no milk.

Overall, an exceptional milk tea experience! And I'm super happy there is now a convenient location in LA County!

excerpts: I got the Hong Kong milk tea with boba, and my friends got an iced matcha latte and a classic black milk tea with soymilk (yes!
classic black.author: Tara A.
classic black.review:
Boba Guys definitely has some of the best boba in the city! When they first opened, I saw a lot of it on instagram/twitter/facebook and didn't think too much of it. To me, it mostly seemed like a novelty hipster place where people just went to take pictures (ha ha ha). The mission district is a bit of a drive from my house so I never had an urge to try it either. One of my friends finally suggested we go after dinner and I obliged because I was curious and she really liked it the last time she had it.. and also she was driving haha!

There was absolutely noooo parking on a Friday night so one of us double parked while the other 2 went in to order. I got the Hong Kong milk tea with boba, and my friends got an iced matcha latte and a classic black milk tea with soymilk (yes! You can sub reg milk for soy).

We were the only ones there so the drinks came out in a few minutes. I took my first sip and I was in milk tea heaven!!! It has a hint of condensed milk so that makes it sweeter too. The boba is really chewy and soft here... It's a little more overcooked than most places but that makes it so much more squishy and delicious! I got to try my friends' drinks too and the matcha latte was really good as well! The matcha flavor really stood out and it looks cool before you mix it with all the layers. Just be sure that they've mixed the matcha completely, or else you might get little bitter balls of matcha at the bottom of your drink...

I will definitely be back!! I can't believe I underestimated this place haha. The only bad thing is that drinks are a bit pricey here. Expect to spend $4-5 on a smaller sized drink with a topping, but I guess you're paying for quality!

excerpts:
Ordered: Classic Black, Jasmine
What to get:
They're all pretty standard mixes and you can't go wrong
classic black.author: James N.
classic black.review:
Ordered: Classic Black, Jasmine
What to get: They're all pretty standard mixes and you can't go wrong w/ any.

Been here only twice and thought it was alright. Strangely, I didn't get a refreshing kick out of it like some of the other better boba places I've been to. It's interesting to watch them brew tea, but consistency was off between the two instances I tried it. Not enough tea in the flavor.

excerpts: We tried the hong kong style milk tea with boba, classic black with almond jello, and a strawberry tea with boba.
They were all good.
The tea was strong.
The milk was good.
The almond jello was substantial.
The strawberry tea was fresh.
classic black.author: claudia y.
classic black.review:
when did boba get all fancy and expensive?  We tried the hong kong style milk tea with boba, classic black with almond jello, and a strawberry tea with boba.  They were all good.  The tea was strong.  The milk was good.  The almond jello was substantial.  The strawberry tea was fresh.  Boba chewy.  

Would love to try more things but spending close to $6 for boba is not good for my wallet.

excerpts: I had jasmine milk tea with tapioca and almond milk, and my husband had their classic black tea with tapioca and regular (Straus creamery!)
milk.
Both were sooooo good.
It's great how customizable their menu is (toppings, sweetness level, milk choice) and how they really want you to be happy with your drink.
Also plus for non-dairy drinkers, the almond/soy options are at no extra charge!
That made me really happy.
classic black.author: Casey C.
classic black.review:
My husband and I came here yesterday and LOVED everything about it. The space is  really nice, their teas are delicious, and the staff is so friendly! They even sell bags of their tea at the counter for home - and all are made to go with milk. 


I had jasmine milk tea with tapioca and almond milk, and my husband had their classic black tea with tapioca and regular (Straus creamery!) milk. Both were sooooo good. It's great how customizable their menu is (toppings, sweetness level, milk choice) and how they really want you to be happy with your drink. Also plus for non-dairy drinkers, the almond/soy options are at no extra charge! That made me really happy. It's the little things.

All in all, our new favorite tea place.

excerpts: and I ordered the classic black and jasmine tea.
We asked for 25% sweetness and I opted for the jelly, while she got tapioca balls and we were both satisfied with the tea itself and the toppings.
On the next visit, I decided to try something new and try an horchata boba, unlike the other drinks, this time I wasn't able to adjust the sweetness since the horchata mix was pre-made.
I tried the horchata on the first taste and the drink was overly sweet, but the staff was really helpful and offered to remake the drink and dilute the mixture by adding more milk.
I was really happy with the end result of my drink thanks to their friendly and very helpful staff.
Honestly can't wait to try the rest of their menu on future visits.
classic black.author: Limuel G.
classic black.review:
Definitely a good spot that serves some good quality boba drinks and best of all they don't use powder like some other places. I'm not a boba person and usually just enjoy the milk teas minus the tapioca, but their "balls" are homemade and pretty top notch. I really appreciate the steps into crafting a perfect cup of boba, from their homemade pearls and jellies, to the quality of teas and syrups, and the different milk options they offer. The steps they take is very methodical and they really want the customer to notice hence the lab equipment visible in all areas of their shop.

I've been satisfied with both my experiences here, on my first visit I wanted to try something pretty standard so my girlfriend and I ordered the classic black and jasmine tea. We asked for 25% sweetness and I opted for the jelly, while she got tapioca balls and we were both satisfied with the tea itself and the toppings. On the next visit, I decided to try something new and try an horchata boba, unlike the other drinks, this time I wasn't able to adjust the sweetness since the horchata mix was pre-made. I tried the horchata on the first taste and the drink was overly sweet, but the staff was really helpful and offered to remake the drink and dilute the mixture by adding more milk. I was really happy with the end result of my drink thanks to their friendly and very helpful staff. Honestly can't wait to try the rest of their menu on future visits.

excerpts: liked the classic black milk tea - great and refreshing alternative to coffee.
Grab one and head over to the nearby Dolores Park.
classic black.author: Wolfgang G.
classic black.review: liked the classic black milk tea - great and refreshing alternative to coffee. Grab one and head over to the nearby Dolores Park.

excerpts: My favorite is the jasmine milk tea, but you can't go wrong with the classic black milk tea.
classic black.author: Aaron W.
classic black.review:
Okay fine...I'll admit that one of the first reasons for why I wanted to come here a couple years ago was because they put their milk tea in a mason jar. I mean come on, HOW HIPSTER IS THAT?! Yeah there's other boba places that do that now, but Boba Guys was one of the first places that pioneered this mason jar/glass jar boba movement. It makes me sad that now they mainly just use regular cups...but oh well, they had a good run.

This place isn't just about being hipster and glamorous though. The boba and milk tea is actually good! They have a pretty wide variety of options, but I like sticking to the originals. My favorite is the jasmine milk tea, but you can't go wrong with the classic black milk tea. Go ahead and try the Rose milk tea and the Hong Kong style ones as well because those are both excellent choices as well. 

What separates this place from others is the fact that their boba is actually good too. It always seems to be the right balance of chewiness and firmness! Yum. These guys really are the boba guys.

excerpts: Soft and chewy boba, but my favorite is the classic black tea with almond jelly.
classic black.author: Trinh N.
classic black.review:
4 stars for making boba milk tea with real milk and not that creamer crap you see at all the other boba places. If you see boxes of coffee mate piled up (ahem Tpumps), RUN! They are serving you crap.

Pluses: quality milk tea with quality ingredients. Soft and chewy boba, but my favorite is the classic black tea with almond jelly. 

Minuses: I think their jasmine milk tea is a little weak and can use more tea flavor. Their sweetness level is inconsistent and they seem to change it on a whim maybe based on a couple of reviews. First time I had it, it was overly sweet. The second time was perfect, but the last time was bland.  For guys in lab coats, you'd think they'd take a more scientific approach to making their drinks and make it more consistent. Their new permanent store has been opened for maybe a month or two now and it still kind of looks like they just moved in. It's kind of a small storefront, so any clutter looks like a lot of disorganized clutter. Milk tea could be creamier.

I love that they use real milk though, so I will keep supporting their business!

excerpts: (Thai Tea, Hong Kong Tea, your give coffee milk tea) and a number of different kinds of teas.
It's gratifying because you usually go to one place and they have an assortment of that TYPE of tea/milk tea (ex.
a list of Hong Kong styled milk tea + [insert flavor]).
They also have a variety of snacks at the front container.
There were SMALL WAFFLES,
OKAY.
THEY LOOKED BEAUTIFUL AND DELICIOUS.
Oh, and for those who haven't had this kind of matcha latte before where the layers are initially separate, remember to Instagram or
whatever first, then stir it before drinking.
They also keep a pitcher of water and a stack off cups on the side table where the straws are, or at least they did while we were there.
If you see that the pitcher(s) is empty, move or leave it on the pickup counter so the staff doesn't have to wade out into the crowd to get it.
It also has the bonus of getting the pitcher refilled more quickly.
Anyways, their milk tea isn't overly sweet, but I'd highly recommend the 25% level of sweetness.
My friend found her 50% matcha latte to be a bit on the sweeter side
and I'm inclined to agree.
I'm hoping to visit one of their other locations soon, they're spreading like wildfire!
coffee milk tea.author: Christine L.
coffee milk tea.review:
My friend and I actually found out about Boba Guys because of their stand at San Francisco Matcha Festival. The weather that day was in the high 80s and low 90s, so if the trio colored matcha strawberry latte wasn't eye catching enough, then the fact everybody was standing in an open field under the blazing sun was. 

On our way back to the train station, we actually took the wrong bus, ended up going the opposite, and became very, very lost. By coincidence, we ended up a block away from this particular Boba Guys on 19th Street and decided to drop by. And WOW. Apparently (by the amount of Matcha Festival cups lying around inside and out of the store), a good deal of the festival attendants came out this way to try out more of their stuff. So congrats, Boba Guys! You're investment seemed to pay off pretty well while we there! 

This particular store is pretty small. It's a counter, a bit of room, and a counter-bar along the window. During the time we were there, 30-40 people were trying to occupy that space all at once. There was a literal line that went out the door and down past the next door building and a number of people passing us by were calling us crazy. Which, screw you too, buddy. But that does highlight the point that this place wasn't really built to have a whole lot of people sit down and linger here, though they did say their other locations ARE. They all seem to have a clean, almost See's-candy like aesthetic, but more hipster. Largely relies on natural light, which I appreciate. 

To me, Boba Guys covers an variety of styles and types of milk tea (Thai Tea, Hong Kong Tea, your give coffee milk tea) and a number of different kinds of teas. It's gratifying because you usually go to one place and they have an assortment of that TYPE of tea/milk tea (ex. a list of Hong Kong styled milk tea + [insert flavor]). They also have a variety of snacks at the front container. There were SMALL WAFFLES, OKAY. THEY LOOKED BEAUTIFUL AND DELICIOUS. Oh, and for those who haven't had this kind of matcha latte before where the layers are initially separate, remember to Instagram or whatever first, then stir it before drinking. They also keep a pitcher of water and a stack off cups on the side table where the straws are, or at least they did while we were there. If you see that the pitcher(s) is empty, move or leave it on the pickup counter so the staff doesn't have to wade out into the crowd to get it. It also has the bonus of getting the pitcher refilled more quickly. Anyways, their milk tea isn't overly sweet, but I'd highly recommend the 25% level of sweetness. My friend found her 50% matcha latte to be a bit on the sweeter side and I'm inclined to agree. I'm hoping to visit one of their other locations soon, they're spreading like wildfire!

excerpts: My two favorite drinks here are the thai tea and the coffee milk tea.
I have yet to find another coffee milk tea that can hold a candle to the one here.
It is a bit on the sweet side
so I'd suggest getting less sugar if you don't like particularly sweet drinks.
However, it's such a good blend of flavors with some strong, tasty coffee.
I have a bad habit of comparing all other thai teas to the one here as well.
coffee milk tea.author: Lakshmi M.
coffee milk tea.review:
I am such a sucker for Boba Guys. Frankly, this place has ruined most other boba places for me because of its great quality. I can actually taste the tea in my drinks and the high quality of the milk is seriously refreshing. I also really appreciate that they have non-dairy options (woohoo almond/soy milk!). I've definitely gotten a couple of friends completely hooked on this place.

My two favorite drinks here are the thai tea and the coffee milk tea. I have yet to find another coffee milk tea that can hold a candle to the one here. It is a bit on the sweet side so I'd suggest getting less sugar if you don't like particularly sweet drinks. However, it's such a good blend of flavors with some strong, tasty coffee. I have a bad habit of comparing all other thai teas to the one here as well. 

The classic milk tea and hong kong milk tea are also great choices! If you want something that's outside of the box, I would recommend the strawberry matcha~

excerpts: I impulsively went for the $3.50 Iced Coffee Milk Tea since I wasn't getting any guidance from the order taker.
Then I was asked a battery of questions that led me to customize my drink.
coffee milk tea.author: Ed U.
coffee milk tea.review:
Now what is it about boba that brings out the youth in Asia, or is it actually euthanasia? That might depend on how much boba tea you guzzle, which if you are young, gifted and Asian, could be enough to give you a permanent brain freeze or cause suffocation by excess tapioca balls. Now I'm not a doctor, I just play one on TV, but the popularity of boba tea has been unequivocally mind-blowing, and the Boba Guys, Andrew Chau and Bin Chen, appear to be riding the wave by offering their own fashion-forward take on it.

I finally tried their product at their first shop after dinner at Hogs & Rocks up the block. It's not my first time trying boba tea, but it might as well have been, since it took me a while to make my way through their menu as I was surrounded by impatient hipsters heaving audible groans in my direction. I impulsively went for the $3.50 Iced Coffee Milk Tea since I wasn't getting any guidance from the order taker. Then I was asked a battery of questions that led me to customize my drink. First, it was the tapioca balls over coffee jelly for an extra fifty cents.

Then I chose the Straus Family Organic Milk over a soy or almond milk substitute, which I assume caters to the lactose intolerant among us. Finally, I had them turn the sweetness up to 100% which is their default option. I must admit the result was pretty refreshing (photo: http://bit.ly/1mpEuVo) as I pondered the meaning of the aardvark logo (photo: http://bit.ly/1R5KaAG), though in hindsight, I probably would have taken the sweetness down a notch. Now that I know the routine, I can more confidently order my boba among the young, gifted and Asian lest I be taken out by euthanasia.

BOBA - 4 stars...refreshing brightness if a tad too sweet
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...hip and tight space like a pair of snug white chinos
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...aggressively cheery
TOTAL - 4 stars...the Boba Guys may be on to something here

excerpts: Get the 24-ounce iced coffee milk tea, regular milk, with 25% sweetness.
The coffee milk tea (yes, coffee + tea + milk) is my favorite.
I'm not a jittery mess afterward, but I definitely don't have it during the evening of a work week
(I'm old, I know).
coffee milk tea.author: Adena B.
coffee milk tea.review:
Get the 24-ounce iced coffee milk tea, regular milk, with 25% sweetness. I mean, if they had a 48 ounce, I would probably need all of 0.002 seconds to decide to get that one instead.

DON'T JUDGE ME. 

But seriously, do they sprinkle crack in their drinks? What is it that keeps me coming back?

It's the almond jelly, it has to be. I mean, that or the crack. 

I'm not normally a fan of bubble tea, but this stuff's delicious! The coffee milk tea (yes, coffee + tea + milk) is my favorite. I'm not a jittery mess afterward, but I definitely don't have it during the evening of a work week (I'm old, I know). I always get an iced 24 ounce, because after waiting in that line (almost always ~10 minutes), I want the biggest version of that drink possible.

Sometimes, I've even gone twice in a day.

DON'T JUDGE ME.

excerpts:
My drink: 
I got the Coffee Milk tea with almond milk, 25% sweetness and boba.
coffee milk tea.author: Stephanie A.
coffee milk tea.review:
My first time trying Boba Guys and it was great! I went on a Sunday afternoon around 4pm. The line was out the door but it was worth the wait. Their ingredients are hand crafted, and the quality is impeccable. 

My drink: 
I got the Coffee Milk tea with almond milk, 25% sweetness and boba. And it was perfection. 

Ambiance: 
Fresh white paint and earthy tones give this environment an openness (which is needed because it's small). It was a bit warm inside but with the door open and the large windows, it helped minimized the stuffiness. 

My experience: 
I met the manager while ubering (she was my rider) and she was sweet as pie!! Her staff were very customer-oriented, conscientious, and professional. All in all, I'd go back again.

excerpts: I had a sip of my friend's coffee milk tea.
I thought it tasted good, but wouldn't choose that drink here.
coffee milk tea.author: Shannon L.
coffee milk tea.review:
I happened to run into this Boba Guys location on the way to Dolores Park and had to grab a drink.  

This time I tried a simple classic: Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.  You can usually tell if a milk tea place is good if their jasmine milk tea is good... and this place is good.  I'm still a bigger fan of Ashas (has an SF and Berkeley location) but Boba Guys is always a great idea if you're in the neighborhood.   

I had a sip of my friend's coffee milk tea.  I thought it tasted good, but wouldn't choose that drink here.  There's much more interesting and better tasting drinks.  

If you want something super Instagrammable and yummy, I highly suggest the matcha latte with strawberry and boba.

excerpts: My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea with boba... the boba ended up tasting like coffee.
coffee milk tea.author: Stefanie C.
coffee milk tea.review:
I'm excited that a Boba Guys location opened up closer to where I live. The other one is too far away! Or maybe I'm just spoiled. Anyways, I cannot resist a pit stop for boba when I'm taking a walk in the area. The line gets long pretty fast, but it's a small place so most people just grab and go so it's not too crowded. Plus there are a ton of unique menu items so you will have plenty of time to decide what you really want.

I settled on the Hong Kong style milk tea with boba. Tasty. Fresh. Sweet. Everything you could want in a good milk tea. The service is good, and the atomsphere is super hip. The wait in line is always more bearable with good music in the background! Anyways, I had a little taste of the beverages that my friends got, and everything seems delicious. My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea with boba... the boba ended up tasting like coffee. That was awesome.

I still cannot figure out the Boba Guys animal mascot... how peculiar.

excerpts: I do recommend the Coffee Milk Tea if you really love the coffee taste.
coffee milk tea.author: Wendy Y.
coffee milk tea.review:
I love Boba Guys! I just wish they were located in a better neighborhood with better parking. 

It's really funny for me to say that one of my favorite drinks here is the Hong Kong Milk Tea (besides the Matcha Tea Latte). I was born and raised in Hong Kong so I find it sad or amazed that the Hong Kong Milk Tea here is legit. They really got their recipe right because it tastes like home. I was very hesitant to try it because can a hipster/American boba shop really make great Hong Kong Milk Tea? Boy, was I wrong... Maybe it doesn't tastes exactly like the ones in Hong Kong since I haven't been back in a long time, but it's surely close enough for me.

Overall, don't be afraid to try new drinks! I highly recommend the Hong Kong Milk Tea and the Matcha Tea Latte! They are both great drinks. I do recommend the Coffee Milk Tea if you really love the coffee taste.

excerpts: The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea.
There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer.
There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly.
I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%.
The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly.
Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom
coffee milk tea.author: Milton F.
coffee milk tea.review:
Decided to come to this place on a whim. My fiance and I just finished having brunch in Redwood city and had some time to kill before we headed over to Fort Mason for APE 2014 (Alternative Press Expo). As we passed by we noticed a few people in line, but not too bad. 

Finding parking in the mission is always a challenge, so keep in mind you may have to circle a few times since there aren't too many parking garages around the area. We finally found parking 5 blocks away and made our way over. There's not a big menu selection so it was not too hard to decide what to get. 

They only serve strictly milk tea in various forms, no fruit milk tea, or fruity drinks. The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea. There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer. There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly. You can also adjust the sweetness level to your liking (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%)

I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%. The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly. Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom and you'll get a huge serving of sugar if you don't. 

All and all, it's a nice place to get milk teas, albeit a bit out of the way for me. For Boba it's a bit on the pricier side.. about $4-4.50 depending if you get addons. I'd come back if I was in the area.

excerpts: I ordered their coffee milk tea, and frankly, it wasn't that great.
The coffee tasted very bitter, and the quality reminded me of instant coffee.
coffee milk tea.author: Alvin W.
coffee milk tea.review:
Came here once with a group of friends after getting dinner in the Mission district. I usually go to the Boba Guys in downtown SF for their matcha latte, but I wanted to try something different.

I ordered their coffee milk tea, and frankly, it wasn't that great. The coffee tasted very bitter, and the quality reminded me of instant coffee. The drink was very watery, probably due to the amount of ice added.

Maybe next time, I'll stick with trying the matcha latte.

excerpts: Okay, so I am in love with coffee milk tea.
The one place that I get the coffee milk tea from is in SoCal, called 7leaves.
HOWEVER, I came across boba guys and I have always wanted to try it and,
with my luck, they have coffee milk tea.
I decided to give it a try and OMG
I fell in love again!
They make their coffee milk tea just as good as I like it.
I don't know what it is, but that mixture is just hella good and hella refreshing.
I haven't tried anything else since I have been going here, but I am willing to... unless I change my mind and stick to the one I like HAH.
They have two locations in SF, one by union square and this one.
There could be more, I don't know.
But I wish this location was closer to my house..
I love it!
Good job boba guys.
coffee milk tea.author: Katie L.
coffee milk tea.review: Okay, so I am in love with coffee milk tea. The one place that I get the coffee milk tea from is in SoCal, called 7leaves. HOWEVER, I came across boba guys and I have always wanted to try it and, with my luck, they have coffee milk tea. I decided to give it a try and OMG I fell in love again! They make their coffee milk tea just as good as I like it. I don't know what it is, but that mixture is just hella good and hella refreshing. I haven't tried anything else since I have been going here, but I am willing to... unless I change my mind and stick to the one I like HAH. They have two locations in SF, one by union square and this one. There could be more, I don't know. But I wish this location was closer to my house.. I love it! Good job boba guys.

excerpts: I've tried a variety of their drinks and my favorites are the coffee milk tea and the jasmine milk tea.
coffee milk tea.author: Vivian L.
coffee milk tea.review:
My favorite milk tea place in the city! I've tried a variety of their drinks and my favorites are the coffee milk tea and the jasmine milk tea. They are a bit more expensive than traditional boba shops, but the quality of their drinks is well worth it!

The Strauss creamery milk really makes a difference! I've also tried substituting their drinks with soy milk instead. Too watery for my liking, and it takes away from the authentic milk tea taste. 

Their default sweetness is a little too sweet for me though. I usually get either 50% or 75% sweet. 

I'm not a boba fan, but occasionally, I will get their honey boba. The texture is soft, but not too chewy, and the honey adds even more flavor to the drink. 

My favorite topping is the almond jelly. It tastes exactly like the almond jello dessert that my mom used to make and it definitely complements their milk teas really well. 

I'll be coming back soon to try the rest of their drinks!

excerpts: I got the coffee milk tea with tapioca pearls and man !
did that coffee have me energized !
It was sweetened perfectly.
I really enjoyed this so I will be back !
coffee milk tea.author: Nakia P.
coffee milk tea.review:
I've always passed by this place and I really loved the vibe the employees gave off. They were super helpful with choosing what I wanted and it was really clean! 

I got the coffee milk tea with tapioca pearls and man ! did that coffee have me energized ! It was sweetened perfectly. I really enjoyed this so I will be back !

excerpts:
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!
coffee milk tea.author: Kitty K.
coffee milk tea.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: My sister got the coffee milk tea and it just tasted like iced coffee.
Minus 2 stars for the bad grass jelly and and plain coffee milk tea.
coffee milk tea.author: May S.
coffee milk tea.review:
It's my first time here and I got the iced matcha latte with grass jelly.  It was good and had a lot of matcha flavor.  It was a bit sweet so next time 75% sweetness would be perfect.  I forgot I wanted to try the boba too so I asked the cashier if I could add some and turns out its 50 cents for any and all toppings so my extra boba was free. The boba is really chewy and soft!  I wouldn't recommend the grass jelly.  It was cut into super small pieces, which made it hard to eat and the texture was a little hard.  My sister got the coffee milk tea and it just tasted like iced coffee.  Nothing special, which is why I'm only give 3 stars.  

Minus 2 stars for the bad grass jelly and and plain coffee milk tea.

excerpts: I tried the simplest drink, coffee milk tea.
I mean common if they messed that order up then something is up!
lol but luckily it was so bomb!
Yes go have it, best wake me up drink.
coffee milk tea.author: Kay O.
coffee milk tea.review:
I love how easy the menu was, I didn't have to look at a bazillion different milk tea, slushy, or whatever else they have in boba houses. I tried the simplest drink, coffee milk tea. I mean common if they messed that order up then something is up! lol but luckily it was so bomb! Yes go have it, best wake me up drink. The sweetness I got was regular and it was just perfect! 

Customer service was good, the guy who made the drinks was really nice and friendly. He smiled a lot which made it feel inviting. 

The mug with the logo cost $12. Which I got haha but it's a little too pricey. The store location was every easy to spot even at like 9:30 pm. 


Overall I had a good experience.

excerpts: My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea and he seemed to be happy with it.
I usually don't get tapioca in my drinks
but I thought I'd try theirs it since it was my first time here.
coffee milk tea.author: Linz C.
coffee milk tea.review:
I thought this place was just "OK."  If i was craving boba and in the area i would definitely come back, but i wouldn't go out of my way and go all the way down to the mission for a milk tea. 

Their drinks range between $4-5.50 which is pretty steep compared to the $1.00 teaway.  I got the jasmine milk tea which was REALLY REALLY SWEET!!! Drinkable, but SWEET! My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea and he seemed to be happy with it.  I usually don't get tapioca in my drinks but I thought I'd try theirs it since it was my first time here.  At first I thought they were a bit hard but after a while it began to grow on me. 

What I really came here for though was the sugar spun cotton candy!! I was hoping for one of their more exotic flavors like thai tea or sesame, but they only had lemon cookie.  The cashier was kind enough to give us a sample to make sure we like it before we buy it.  It was delicious! I would definitely come back for the cotton candy and to get my hands on a rose milk tea (i would have gotten that but i didn't see it until after i ordered my drink).

excerpts: Ordered coconut green tea with boba and their coffee milk tea with boba.
They get points for having both almond milk and soy milk.
Both drink were seriously not good,both thin and watery.
Coconut tasted very fake.
The coffee milk tea lacked black tea flavor, and the coffee part tasted like gas station coffee.
The chai milk tea sounded good, maybe the others are better.
But I won't be back to find out.
Go to i-tea, Honey-B, or Bambu.
Those places are delicious!
coffee milk tea.author: Traci K.
coffee milk tea.review:
First time here, last time here. Line was out the door. Wasn't sure what to expect,  and was okay with being surprised with the very limited menu (I'm used to all the other bubble tea places with gigantic selection). I thought maybe it was a testament to the high quality drinks I would be getting. Ordered coconut green tea with boba and their coffee milk tea with boba. They get points for having both almond milk and soy milk. 
Both drink were seriously not good,both thin and watery. Coconut tasted very fake. The coffee milk tea lacked black tea flavor, and the coffee part tasted like gas station coffee. 
The chai milk tea sounded good, maybe the others are better. But I won't be back to find out. 
Go to i-tea, Honey-B, or Bambu. Those places are delicious!

excerpts: A pleasant treat in the Mission as an alternative to coffee (or get coffee, since they have coffee milk tea here too).
Been going since they opened.
coffee milk tea.author: Jeremy W.
coffee milk tea.review: The original location! A pleasant treat in the Mission as an alternative to coffee (or get coffee, since they have coffee milk tea here too). Been going since they opened.

excerpts: I got a jasmine milk tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea.
Both were pretty good.
coffee milk tea.author: Josephine C.
coffee milk tea.review:
I love how their milk tea tastes more like tea than crazy flavorful syrups. I enjoy the taste of tea and coffee. I'm glad I found a place like this. 

I got a jasmine milk tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea. Both were pretty good. I would come back again to try their horchata. 

Its pretty low key and mellow.

excerpts:
no line @4PM
Coffee milk tea is best
Get 50% sweetness because regular sweetness makes me all jittery
coffee milk tea.author: Arthur L.
coffee milk tea.review:
Note to self:

There is parking @4PM on Thursdays
There was no line @4PM
Coffee milk tea is best
Get 50% sweetness because regular sweetness makes me all jittery
The boba is good.

will be back if ever in the area (y)

excerpts: I ordered a simple drink, a 16 oz. coffee milk tea with boba with regular sweetness.
It was $4 which was a bit much because I know a few places that offer 24 and 32 oz bubble tea drinks for the same price.
Before I finish my thoughts about the price, my drink was done.
I was suprised it took less than 45 seconds, considering there was two people ahead of me.
it was a bit bitter
but I'm used to super sweet and sugar filled drinks
so I guess it wasn't bad.
The boba had a good texture and chewiness.
But it was a bit clumped as I got towards the middle, so
I had 3 boba-less sips and then as I moved my straw, I got like 10 tapiocas at once.
Also, there was a lot of boba towards the end but that may have been because it was clumped.
Overall, the boba was good, drink was not bad
but it's a bit expensive considering the small size.
If it is a bit cheaper, I would come here twice a week
but for now, I would  come here 2-3 times a month.
coffee milk tea.author: Kevin L.
coffee milk tea.review:
So today was the first day of school and I just got out. I saw a post from a friend and wanted to try it. Store was kinda small but I wasn't staying so I didn't mind. The cashier was friendly and asked about my first day of school. 
     I ordered a simple drink, a 16 oz. coffee milk tea with boba with regular sweetness. It was $4 which was a bit much because I know a few places that offer 24 and 32 oz bubble tea drinks for the same price. Before I finish my thoughts about the price, my drink was done. I was suprised it took less than 45 seconds, considering there was two people ahead of me. it was a bit bitter but I'm used to super sweet and sugar filled drinks so I guess it wasn't bad. 
     The boba had a good texture and chewiness. But it was a bit clumped as I got towards the middle, so I had 3 boba-less sips and then as I moved my straw, I got like 10 tapiocas at once. Also, there was a lot of boba towards the end but that may have been because it was clumped. 
     Overall, the boba was good, drink was not bad but it's a bit expensive considering the small size. If it is a bit cheaper, I would come here twice a week but for now, I would  come here 2-3 times a month.

excerpts:
Some examples:
- their coffee milk tea has gone down in quality over the last 9 months or so.
coffee milk tea.author: Chris M.
coffee milk tea.review:
Boba Guys is kind of hit or miss. If you get it when it's good, then it is rather fantastic. Otherwise, it's really meh.

Some examples:
- their coffee milk tea has gone down in quality over the last 9 months or so. It used to be quite good, and now it's watered down or something.
- back in their Suika pop up days, they did a really nice jasmine milk tea. They moved to their permanent location, and I went back hoping for the same quality jasmine milk tea. I sadly ended up throwing my drink away after a sip 2/3 times, and never got the jasmine milk tea again. It tasted water down and funky in a bad way.
- occasionally their boba just tastes....off. Hard to describe, but there are days when it's A+ and other days when it tastes like burnt plastic or something.

I currently like their strawberry jasmine tea fresca a lot. The drink itself has been fairly consistent (across both mission & union square locations), though I'm always wary of adding boba to it because it might ruin an otherwise good drink.

It's also impossible to get them to add no ice. They usually forget and I end up with an iced drink. The first few times I had them remake my drink, but now I'm kind of "meh, typical boba guys mediocre service" about it. I hate iced drinks cuz my teeth are a little cold sensitive and it also waters down the drink, but at least I don't immediately chuck away the drink like I do when the boba tastes funky.

I'd probably give them 2.5 stars. The strawberry jasmine tea fresca really bumps up their favorability, but I can't forgive them for everything just because of it.

excerpts: On both accounts, the drinks I've tried (coffee milk tea, Hong Kong milk tea, and horchata milk tea) all taste the same.
Like water.
But, I actually like water
so I take that back.
I had to force myself to finish the coffee milk tea.
Ended up just throwing it out.
Normally, if I don't like a drink, I'd let the barista know
so they could fix it
(it'd be a waste to throw the whole drink away).
coffee milk tea.author: Lulu T.
coffee milk tea.review:
One star is being generous. I thought I'd give this place a second chance. You know, maybe that first time, it was made wrong or they were having a bad day... Or maybe not. On both accounts, the drinks I've tried (coffee milk tea, Hong Kong milk tea, and horchata milk tea) all taste the same. Like water. But, I actually like water so I take that back. I had to force myself to finish the coffee milk tea. Ended up just throwing it out. Normally, if I don't like a drink, I'd let the barista know so they could fix it (it'd be a waste to throw the whole drink away). But even if they did, with their going rate, it'd probably still taste the same. 

Maybe I guess one star for that almond jelly and interior. And props for trying to be healthy and not using artificial flavoring etc etc. But really, milk tea isn't supposed to be healthy or good for you. That's like trying to make healthy cookies (yeah, they don't taste good do they?). 

In short, definitely would not come back. Sorry not sorry. I'd rather go to quickly's to be honest. Even if they do use flavored syrups, at least it tastes better.

excerpts: Got the basic milk tea, coffee milk tea, and golden honey black tea.
Their drinks aren't bad at all, they definitely taste like real tea, made with real effort, but I feel the tea-milk-syrup ratios are a little off.
Maybe just my taste.
The coffee milk tea is cool because they definitely use cold-brew coffee to mix with tea, but again, the ratios are off.
I like cold brew coffee, but it tends to be more acidic, and their recipe doesn't balance out the sourness of the cold brew's acidity.
It doesn't beat a milk tea with a shot of espresso.
The golden honey black tea, one of their special, "slow brewed" to-order teas, just tasted like a milk tea with honey..good, but not worth $5.
coffee milk tea.author: Peter N.
coffee milk tea.review:
3.5
Been here a few times, and based on their style, presentation, and philosophy, I wanted to really like this place, but they're just not quite there. 

Got the basic milk tea, coffee milk tea, and golden honey black tea.  Their drinks aren't bad at all, they definitely taste like real tea, made with real effort, but I feel the tea-milk-syrup ratios are a little off. Maybe just my taste. The boba itself was awesome though, chewy, and just sweet enough to complement the drink.

The coffee milk tea is cool because they definitely use cold-brew coffee to mix with tea, but again, the ratios are off. I like cold brew coffee, but it tends to be more acidic, and their recipe doesn't balance out the sourness of the cold brew's acidity. It doesn't beat a milk tea with a shot of espresso. The golden honey black tea, one of their special, "slow brewed" to-order teas, just tasted like a milk tea with honey..good, but not worth $5. 

Again, I love their style, commitment to using organic ingredients, and I can appreciate the hipster, "third wave" kind of approach to brewing milk teas, especially in the Mission. It just hasn't translated into great tasting tea that could stand out in an oversaturated boba market. I'll keep coming back to support the biz because I believe in the potential. And because I go into the Mission a lot. In the meantime I hope they're seeking and being receptive to feedback that could improve their recipes.

excerpts: The drink I mostly get is the coffee milk tea and the horchata.
Tastes super sweet, which is what I really like!
Lines here are usually long, but I think it's worth the wait!
coffee milk tea.author: Nicole S.
coffee milk tea.review: My most favorite milk tea spot in the Bay Area! The drink I mostly get is the coffee milk tea and the horchata. Tastes super sweet, which is what I really like! Lines here are usually long, but I think it's worth the wait!

excerpts: The liquid (coffee milk tea) was good, but the pearls themselves were undercooked and crunchy.
Not a huge fan.
coffee milk tea.author: Michelle H.
coffee milk tea.review: The liquid (coffee milk tea) was good, but the pearls themselves were undercooked and crunchy. Not a huge fan.

excerpts: Got their coffee milk tea can't really taste the coffee flavor would recommend getting classic milk tea with extra sweet because with regular sweet it was bitter
coffee milk tea.author: Heat L.
coffee milk tea.review: Got their coffee milk tea can't really taste the coffee flavor would recommend getting classic milk tea with extra sweet because with regular sweet it was bitter

excerpts: Finally, I ordered classic milk tea (Decaf Black) that is non-caffeine which is really suit me.
Because I cannot take coffee or stronger tea.
They could make me feel very awake later.
I added black pearl into my drink because they are famous with their boba.
The boba is soft and sweet.
I got unsweetened milk tea and less ice.
I would say it's perfect for me.
Because the tea don't taste sweet but with its boba, it's kind satisfied.
decaf black.author: Jaane F.
decaf black.review:
I get to know this boba shop from my sister, she came here on last Monday but it closed. My hubby and I came on yesterday Sunday around 3 something. And we line for 20 minutes to get inside the shop and ordered drinks. Their shop really small and not much space you can stand or sit. The wait for getting drink wasn't too long maybe only 3-5 minutes. They are efficient once you ordered. 

I looked at their menu from their shop, I was undecided because they have so much premium tea and house special tea. Finally, I ordered classic milk tea (Decaf Black) that is non-caffeine which is really suit me. Because I cannot take coffee or stronger tea. They could make me feel very awake later. I added black pearl into my drink because they are famous with their boba. The boba is soft and sweet. I got unsweetened milk tea and less ice. I would say it's perfect for me. Because the tea don't taste sweet but with its boba, it's kind satisfied. My hubby ordered lychee green tea with black pearl. And it taste light to us.

You can choose organic milk, soy milk or almond milk. Added topping would cost $0.50. You can adjust sugar and ice level. They serve 2 sizes for hot and cold. The parking here I guess not that easy to find. We got über here so everything is easy for us, we just get down from the car and line.

I would really recommended their decaf milk tea for people who can't take caffeine because you don't really can see it much from any boba shop. I like it.

excerpts: My wife ordered the decaf black milk tea and I had the lychee green milk tea with boba.
Both teas tasted very light and refreshing as you can tell that  they really strive to deliver quality drinks.
I could tell that the milk had a higher quality taste and the boba wasn't so overly sweet.
You can goose from several milk options ranging from organic milk, almond milk and soy milk.
decaf black.author: Chris A.
decaf black.review:
My wife and I came to this shop after the cherry blossom festival based on the recommendation by the sister in law. Since we were in the area, we definitely had to see what the hype was all about this boba shop. It seemed like we came at an opportune time as the line wasn't really long and the stories we have heard is that the wait can be pretty horrendous at times. 

My wife ordered the decaf black milk tea and I had the lychee green milk tea with boba. Both teas tasted very light and refreshing as you can tell that  they really strive to deliver quality drinks. I could tell that the milk had a higher quality taste and the boba wasn't so overly sweet. You can goose from several milk options ranging from organic milk, almond milk and soy milk. Regardless of what you choose, it seems that you can't really go wrong with whichever drink you choose.

Overall, we see the hype about this shop and for me, the hype is well warranted. This shop serves up some great tasting boba and is definitely a must go if you are in the city.

excerpts: I got the DECAF BLACK (50% sugar)
because I wanted something decaffeinated (my body doesn't tolerate caffeine well).
At first I was going to pick the HORCHATA, which is the most popular decaf drink on the menu, but I could NOT adjust the sugar level on that one
so I went with the decaf black tea, which the girl at the store "recommended".
The decaf black was VERY SWEET at 50%.
It did not taste anything like a decaf black tea, but more like jasmine tea...
I could not tell what was special about this drink or this boba place from drinking this tea.
But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black.
I feel like I was rigged.
decaf black.author: Wendy F.
decaf black.review:
SO SWEET. Please have more less-sweet decaf drink options!!! 

This was my first time drinking boba in more than a year and I was a little disappointed.

I got the DECAF BLACK (50% sugar) because I wanted something decaffeinated (my body doesn't tolerate caffeine well). At first I was going to pick the HORCHATA, which is the most popular decaf drink on the menu, but I could NOT adjust the sugar level on that one so I went with the decaf black tea, which the girl at the store "recommended". Not sure if she really knows the drinks all that well yet. 

The decaf black was VERY SWEET at 50%. It did not taste anything like a decaf black tea, but more like jasmine tea...I could not tell what was special about this drink or this boba place from drinking this tea. I think this is why there is only one picture of that drink on Yelp right now (which is mine lol).

But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black. I feel like I was rigged. The rose tea had a very aromatic, flora scent, while the ice matcha was just beautiful to look at. 

Anyways, if I liked boba more I would have loved this place. Just sucks that I don't drink caffeinated that often.

excerpts: I got the decaf black milk tea, 25% sweet no ice, and I expected much more tea flavor than I got.
decaf black.author: Andrea W.
decaf black.review: Not impressed. I got the decaf black milk tea, 25% sweet no ice, and I expected much more tea flavor than I got. I was also somewhat disappointed that the Thai tea sugar level can't be adjusted and that it's really sweet (according to the cashier). Interior is nicely decorated and has a nice clean look, but drinks are just okay. I had a sip of my friend's horchata which was really creamy, not too sweet (can't adjust sweetness on this either), and not too heavy on the cinnamon taste. But horchata being better than the actual milk tea at a boba shop is just...kind of =/. The pearls are good too, pretty chewy. But, not really liking the milk tea! All prices on the board include tax which is nice; price is on the expensive side at $3.75 not including pearls ($.50 more I assume) and for a smaller-than-standard (where my standard is Sharetea cup sizes) cup.

excerpts:
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
decaf black.author: Kitty K.
decaf black.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: My go to from Boba guys is usually the matcha latte, but I went with the Hong Kong Style (Milk Tea).
Can't go wrong with this if you can't decided.
I suggest you ask the cashier about the suggested sweetness level as they don't recommend 100% as it can be a little too sweet for most people.
The boba is always great and made just right.
Can't go wrong with any of their items here.
hong kong style.author: Chris N.
hong kong style.review:
If you're familiar with Boba in the Bay Area you should've heard of them by now. With a few locations in the Bay they have gotten more and more popular! 

This location does get busy, but the employees work efficiently and get drinks out in a timely manner. The lines are almost always long at this location. There also isn't much a sitting space so it's more of order your drink, wait, then go. 

Now onto the important stuff, the drinks! My go to from Boba guys is usually the matcha latte, but I went with the Hong Kong Style (Milk Tea). Can't go wrong with this if you can't decided. I suggest you ask the cashier about the suggested sweetness level as they don't recommend 100% as it can be a little too sweet for most people. The boba is always great and made just right. Can't go wrong with any of their items here.

excerpts: Some of my favorite drinks from here are the Classic Milk Tea, Hong Kong Style Milk Tea, and the Strawberry Matcha Latte!
hong kong style.author: Michael L.
hong kong style.review:
Boba guys is a solid place for me to get a boba. I've been to many of their locations and the consistency of their drinks has always been the same. I can also taste the quality they put into their drinks! 

On my most recent visit, I came at night with my friend and got the Ube Halaya with boba, one of their seasonal drinks. The drink was good and had a light Taro flavor, I definitely tasted the coconut milk more though. Not my favorite drink from here but I like how they are always experimenting with different flavors and combinations. 

They also make really good tapioca balls here. I always add them to any drink I get. They have the perfect amount of chew and sweetness to them! Some of my favorite drinks from here are the Classic Milk Tea, Hong Kong Style Milk Tea, and the Strawberry Matcha Latte!

excerpts: Ended up asking an employee for their two best sellers and got the Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style drinks.
I wasn't a huge fan of the Hong Kong Style one as it seemed to be lacking in sugar, but the Matcha was incredible.
Went back a couple days later, to get the Strawberry Matcha Latte as it was recommended by friend and was pretty good to say the least.
hong kong style.author: Timothy D.
hong kong style.review:
Ahhhh oh so famous Boba Guys. I've seen so many of my friends get these over the past couple months, but unfortunately we don't have one in Virginia so this was a must try.

I was right in the area and happened to see it as I exploring Mission. It was not a large location, but I could definitely tell that lines can get pretty long so it looked like I came at a good time. 

Ended up asking an employee for their two best sellers and got the Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style drinks. I wasn't a huge fan of the Hong Kong Style one as it seemed to be lacking in sugar, but the Matcha was incredible. Went back a couple days later, to get the Strawberry Matcha Latte as it was recommended by friend and was pretty good to say the least. It really gets me thinking about who comes with these drink ideas like putting strawberry puree in matcha. 

P.S I thought it was also a little funny/cool that they sell shirts, hats and mason jars on the side.

excerpts: We got the Lychee Green Tea, Strawberry Matcha, and Hong Kong Style Milk Tea.
The HK Milk Tea was flavorful, except next time I think I would go for a lower sweetness level, you definitely taste the sweetness at 100%.
hong kong style.author: Hong L.
hong kong style.review:
After seeing so many pictures of Boba Guys, we finally got to try it on our day in the city. We got the Lychee Green Tea, Strawberry Matcha, and Hong Kong Style Milk Tea. The HK Milk Tea was flavorful, except next time I think I would go for a lower sweetness level, you definitely taste the sweetness at 100%. Boba pearls were chewy and cooked to perfection. 

As per recommendations, Strawberry Matcha was definitely worth the try. My boyfriend really enjoyed his drink and it's something different. It's not on the menu above but when you get to the register it's posted to the side. 

Store itself is pretty small so it's more of a grab and go. Street parking so best to walk or take public transportation. Prices were reasonable and I like their anteater logo, nicely designed.

excerpts: I got a 16oz (smaller size) Hong Kong Style tea with tapioca and 25% sweetness, which meant that it was only condensed milk and no additional syrup/sweeteners.
hong kong style.author: Lucine O.
hong kong style.review:
Boba Guys had been recommended by a friend, so I decided to stop by when I was in the Mission this weekend. There was a line that extended out the door (it was Saturday late afternoon/early evening) and we waited ~10-13min to order. I got a 16oz (smaller size) Hong Kong Style tea with tapioca and 25% sweetness, which meant that it was only condensed milk and no additional syrup/sweeteners.

I really enjoyed my tea; I had been craving good boba tea for a while now and this hit the spot. Price was pretty standard for boba tea; I paid $4.50. The employees were really friendly. The shop itself is small & pretty crowded. They also only have one register which didn't really help with the growing line, but at least they were really fast with preparing the drinks -- once I ordered I only had to wait a minute or two. Overall would recommend.

excerpts: I would go back again and perhaps try the Hong Kong style tea which is made with condensed milk.
hong kong style.author: Deborah L.
hong kong style.review:
I got the classic milk tea with boba. Was it exceptional? Not really. I think this appeals more to people who like the light and fresh tea taste with their boba. I personally like how boba tea was originally made - with creamer. It feels more satisfying to me, as it is thicker, creamier with more flavor. 
Having said this. I would go back again and perhaps try the Hong Kong style tea which is made with condensed milk.

excerpts: So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk.
It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding.
Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had.
I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect!
Do i even need to get started on their boba?
There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...
It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness
hong kong style.author: Tina L.
hong kong style.review:
Boba Guys is one of the places that I think truly makes San Francisco so unique and special. Their drinks are so unique and you can't find them anywhere else! You can also tell they really put effort into the quality of their drinks and care about their customers' needs. Not once have I ever been disappointed by their drinks or customer service! 

I love the location of this Boba Guys. It's located smack-dab right in the Mission, surrounded by tons of yummy restaurants and pretty close to the Castro and Dolores Park! BEWARE THOUGH, parking can be a nightmare though and it might take you a while to find. The shop itself is pretty small, and there's usually a line of customers trailing down the sidewalk. The wait can be long, but it's worth it if you have the time. This is a great place to grab boba after lunch or dinner with friends or family! 

What's great about their drinks is that you can alter the sweetness and ice level, and for the ones that have milk you can substitute it for a non-dairy version, such almond milk or oat milk! So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style. My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea. The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk. It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding. Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had. I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect! Do i even need to get started on their boba? There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness and I can't get enough.

Overall, this place is a must if you're ever in San Francisco. It's an experience worth having and the boba is definitely worth it!!

excerpts: I got the hong kong style tea with boba, and it was so perfect.
What separates it from other boba places I've been to (chatime, cocos, kung fu, vivis) is the high quality of tapioca.
Its substantially chewy and has a nice bounce.
Also the ratio of tea to boba is spot on.
I asked for less ice and 25% sugar.
Although i didn't use it, I like the option of adding sugar syrup.
Service was friendly, ambiance was chill, and prices reflected the high quality of the drink.
Would go again 10/10!
hong kong style.author: Laura E.
hong kong style.review:
Ive always passed by the location in NYC but never went in. WHAT A MISTAKE THAT WAS!! If the new york location is anything like the mission location, i have a lot to look forward to when i return!

I got the hong kong style tea with boba, and it was so perfect. What separates it from other boba places I've been to (chatime, cocos, kung fu, vivis) is the high quality of tapioca. Its substantially chewy and has a nice bounce. Also the ratio of tea to boba is spot on. I asked for less ice and 25% sugar. Although i didn't use it, I like the option of adding sugar syrup. Service was friendly, ambiance was chill, and prices reflected the high quality of the drink. Would go again 10/10!

excerpts: I ordered a large 16 oz hot Hong Kong style milk tea to satisfy me on a cold evening.
It was ok but nothing made it spectacular.
I guess it's nice that they have a few seat inside.
hong kong style.author: Yi Z.
hong kong style.review:
I've never quite understood why people love Boba Guys. It's alright, I suppose, but what makes it so special and why are there always such long lines? The hours of operation here are too short - who closes a boba shop at 6pm (on a Sunday) and even 9pm on other days is too early for considering its prime Mission location.

After several attempts, I was finally there in line at a time when the shop was open. I ordered a large 16 oz hot Hong Kong style milk tea to satisfy me on a cold evening. It was ok but nothing made it spectacular. I guess it's nice that they have a few seat inside.

excerpts: Hong Kong style tea was similar to the teas I get at HK cafes.
Boba was soft with slightly chewy texture.
Overall, I like the tea here
but it is a bit more on the pricey range at $4-5 for a regular size.
hong kong style.author: Diana C.
hong kong style.review:
Fresh tasting tea. The jasmine tea was excellent. The matcha tea was similar to Starbucks matcha latte but minus the syrup so it was more on the slightly bitter side. Hong Kong style tea was similar to the teas I get at HK cafes. Boba was soft with slightly chewy texture. Overall, I like the tea here but it is a bit more on the pricey range at $4-5 for a regular size. My only drawback from this place is the way they handle their honey or syrup because I could feel the stickiness from handling my cup. 

Maybe if you never had boba before, you would be mind blown because milk tea is awesome in general and you've been missing out your whole life. But if you visit boba shops a lot, Boba Guys doesn't really stand out in particular. They do have some interesting menu options that are different from your regular boba places.

Shop is quite small and there's four stools by the window counter. Definitely a cute hipster place for tourists to come check out and discover the world of boba and get that Instagram photo in. I hear lines can get pretty long. They even have a funny sign that advises customers to stand with "appropriate spacing as if you are at a middle school dance". Best to come at night when there is no wait since they close at 9/10 PM.

excerpts: Ever since that first time, I've paid Boba Guys multiple visits and tried their classic milk tea, hong kong style tea, and the earl grey tea.
All of them are great and their "grade A balls" live up to the name.
ALSO, there are plenty of customization options (sweetness, milk, toppings)!
Note: just like in-n-out fries, the shelf life for boba guys boba isn't very long...
hong kong style.author: Alex J.
hong kong style.review:
From my various samplings of boba places around the bay area, I've always heard rumblings of the popular boba guys, but never had the chance to give it a try.  Luckily, we were in the area and I finally got to give it a try...the best thing? NO LINE! woop woop!
Ever since that first time, I've paid Boba Guys multiple visits and tried their classic milk tea, hong kong style tea, and the earl grey tea.  All of them are great and their "grade A balls" live up to the name.  ALSO, there are plenty of customization options (sweetness, milk, toppings)!
Note: just like in-n-out fries, the shelf life for boba guys boba isn't very long...

excerpts: Of course, Boba Guys have great staples like standard milk tea, Hong Kong style milk tea, and matcha green tea.
Tea has countless health benefits, and tastes great.
One important note is that I love unsweetened bitter tea.
hong kong style.author: Joanna S.
hong kong style.review:
As a young professional, caffeine is what gets me through the day, but coffee is too strong and eventually makes me crash. So, my favorite afternoon pick-me-up is tea from Boba Guys. I'm already obsessed with the Lychee Rose, which I'll have with or without soy milk and with little to no sugar. 

Of course, Boba Guys have great staples like standard milk tea, Hong Kong style milk tea, and matcha green tea. Tea has countless health benefits, and tastes great. One important note is that I love unsweetened bitter tea. It is super refreshing. 

If you've never had a milk tea, give it a try. It you are a regular, Boba Guys will give you high quality drinks at a reasonable price!

excerpts: This is one of the few regular bubble tea places that serve the Hong Kong style milk tea, which is black milk tea made with condensed milk.
I really enjoy it as it's not too sweet (but I do usually get 50% sweetness on drinks here).
They also serve a Horchata drink which is unique and good as well.
Hong Kong style milk tea
hong kong style.author: Angie N.
hong kong style.review:
Definitely one of my favorite places for boba in the city. If you're trying bubble tea for the first time, go to Boba Guys and you won't be disappointed. I've had consistently good quality of tapioca and tea from this place. For sure 5 stars for the drinks and marketing, but had to knock off one star because of long lines and there's very little seating. This is a place to grab and go unless you come at a really random time. I wish there was more seating here so I could hang out while drinking my bubble tea.

This is one of the few regular bubble tea places that serve the Hong Kong style milk tea, which is black milk tea made with condensed milk. I really enjoy it as it's not too sweet (but I do usually get 50% sweetness on drinks here). They also serve a Horchata drink which is unique and good as well. Their classics like the jasmine milk tea and the iced matcha latte are always delicious and a staple for me. To me, their menus and choices are straightforward and easy to understand. Even first timers would be able to go through the bubble tea ordering process.

Positives:
+ Consistently good quality
+ Interesting marketing
+ Some unique drinks

Negatives:
- Pretty long lines
- Very little seating available

Recommend:
+ 50% sweetness
+ Hong Kong style milk tea 
+ Iced matcha latte

excerpts: I got the Hong Kong style milk tea with pearls, which I liked, but I didn't think it was exceptional.
The tea to milk ratio was good and the pearls were soft and chewy.
My boyfriend got the strawberry matcha milk tea which is heavily advertised in their store and recommended on yelp, but it was TOO sweet.
The first sip was good because it was different, but every sip after that just tasted like artificial strawberry syrup.
They were sampling their Kiwi Guava drink and that was really tasty, so maybe next time we'll try other things on their menu.
hong kong style.author: Quan D.
hong kong style.review: This place is cute and super hipster! But their milk tea is alright. I got the Hong Kong style milk tea with pearls, which I liked, but I didn't think it was exceptional. The tea to milk ratio was good and the pearls were soft and chewy. My boyfriend got the strawberry matcha milk tea which is heavily advertised in their store and recommended on yelp, but it was TOO sweet. The first sip was good because it was different, but every sip after that just tasted like artificial strawberry syrup. They were sampling their Kiwi Guava drink and that was really tasty, so maybe next time we'll try other things on their menu.

excerpts: And their hong kong style milk tea was pretty good too.
hong kong style.author: Ali F.
hong kong style.review:
4 stars for their matcha green tea latte. It had great flavor and is better than other places. And their hong kong style milk tea was pretty good too. 1 star for their horchata which had no flavor and was very watery. 

Expect a line outside, especially on hot days. There is only some small bar seating by the window so it's best to get your drinks to-go.

excerpts: Hong Kong style milk tea - Hubby liked it.
I did not.
It was too bitter for my liking.
Maybe extraaaaa condensed milk
would be good
hong kong style.author: Jinkie G.
hong kong style.review:
We don't live in SF, but when we visit, we like to try new things.
Only downfall to this location is that it's all street parking.
I had to really convince hubby to drive around, patiently lol
I believe the other location has a few parking garages close by.

Strawberry matcha latte - mix it all together 5/5!!!
Raspberry pineapple tea fresca - my son's drink. Tasted kind of weird to me, but he liked it lol
Hong Kong style milk tea - Hubby liked it. I did not. It was too bitter for my liking. :( Maybe extraaaaa condensed milk would be good lol

We also tried the cotton candy (Sugar and Spun), which we enjoyed!
Strawberry shortcake and peanut butter & jelly. 4/5!

+ Almond, soy, and organic milk options
+ Sweetness levels
+ Friendly & quick service. They were really patient w us!

excerpts: The hong kong style milk tea had a very strong tea taste which is great, but the condensed milk was not even enough to balance the drink out.
The matcha latte with oat milk took a little getting use to, but I did think it was okay.
There was so much hype here that I expected it to taste amazing, but I was quite underwhelmed by the drinks here.
hong kong style.author: Stephanie C.
hong kong style.review: It's definitely not worth the hype. The hong kong style milk tea had a very strong tea taste which is great, but the condensed milk was not even enough to balance the drink out. The matcha latte with oat milk took a little getting use to, but I did think it was okay. There was so much hype here that I expected it to taste amazing, but I was quite underwhelmed by the drinks here.

excerpts: They have a lot of options such as Hong Kong style milk tea, Hojicha and Matcha lattes.
hong kong style.author: Nancy L.
hong kong style.review:
The line for this one is definitely not as long as the one in Union Square. Also, I have an appreciation for the bigger store so that you have room to stand when you're waiting for your drink. 

Boba Guys drinks average between $4-5, which is a little more than I hope to pay, but it's for delicious good quality boba tea. They have a lot of options such as Hong Kong style milk tea, Hojicha and Matcha lattes.I've heard great things about their Dirty Horchata, which I believe is Horchata with espresso on top. 

The ambience here is great, the staff are friendly and the decor is very clean and modern. Would highly recommend this one over the one in Union Square!

excerpts: I ordered a Earl Grey milk tea with almond jelly (75% sugar), and my friend ordered a Hong Kong style milk tea with boba (25% sugar).
hong kong style.author: Julie Z.
hong kong style.review:
Had my first Boba Guys experience here recently and am now dying to go back to try more drinks! I ordered a Earl Grey milk tea with almond jelly (75% sugar), and my friend ordered a Hong Kong style milk tea with boba (25% sugar). Both were delicious! 

Boba Guys is known for using real tea, not powders, and I could really tell! The tea was of excellent quality, and the homemade almond jelly really tastes of almond and adds a nice texture to the drink. 

Service was super friendly and quick! There's often a line out the door, but it moves really fast and the drink is worth the few minute wait.

This location is in a prime spot on Valencia Street in the Mission District, near many shops and restaurants, perfect to stop in for a quick drink!

excerpts: Im very picky about the way I like my tea and the Hong Kong style tea
was on point.
It def had the authentic tea tones and flavor
hong kong style.author: Yinja L.
hong kong style.review:
My new favorite boba spot. I honestly don't know why it took me so long to finally try it out but it's AMAZING. The Matcha Latte is on point, sorry to all my other matcha latte's perhaps I'll take you back another day. 

I love how they use local and more natural ingredients. Some of their toppings are made in house which is so cool to me. I haven't been to another place that does something like that. 

Im very picky about the way I like my tea and the Hong Kong style tea was on point. It def had the authentic tea tones and flavor I always look for. 

The boba is definitely Grade A all the way, just like their service! The person that helped us was super friendly. 

I will be coming back real soon to get more Grade A boba!!

excerpts: Just like all the desserts or any sweets I have tried that are Hong Kong or Hong Kong Style
this was just mediocre.
I don't know if people in Hong Kong don't have taste buds or anything but everything I have ever tried Hong Kong Style are Bland A.F. with no sugar and no flavor.
One thing that I remember most is two weeks into February...
wait
I mean April but same feelings, on my birthday as a kid I use to look forward to the Hong Kong Piece Of Cake my Grandma Bling use to get me.
Phuckin
Luved Dat Sh*t.
Now a days that is just A Waste Of Stomach Space
so I guess for this Flavor Boba Guys Nails
hong kong style.author: Peter C.
hong kong style.review:
ChauTime Season 3:  Episode 2 Pick A Price For Me Please, I'll Spend Whatever!!!

Secrecy fuels passion, when we figure the simplest truth behind something that was previously unknown that what gives us a wildfire of emotions running through our veins. 

Let me be the Boba straw as I guide you through your lid, to puncture through the hole, tell you to suck though this straw, to slurp up that brew to order silky milk tea flavor, and let you have a mouthful of these Soft Squishy Pearly Precious Tapioca Boba Balls to choke on and swallow and gargle. 

In My Favorite City San Francisco life's so quick, sometimes just blinking you might miss the beauty of everything when you close, your eyes. Life's short, if you're not prepared you can miss out on a lot of opportunities... just don't miss out on Boba Guys one of my ChauHandZ Top 3 Best Boba places in the Universe right along with Tpumps S.F.(Heart Eyes X Super Kawaii Emoji) X BobaTime L.A. (Dab Boy X Bad Boy Emoji)


Flavors:

Strawberry Matcha Latte- 2On like Tinasashe. Got me on a wave like mixing Purple Syrup with the Sprite. The Strawberry Syrup is the right amount of sweetness as Grape Syrup is in Codeine.
