excerpts: I tried jasmine milk tea, classic milk tea and Hong Kong style milk tea and hk style milk tea is way too sweet.
I recommend classic though.
One thing they can improve is OPEN EARLIER!
So when us students get off campus lunch can get some boba!
Should consider open at around 11 am instead of 2pm....
hong kong style.author: Anna L.
hong kong style.review: Boba guys is awesome! It's near my school so it's convenient. I tried jasmine milk tea, classic milk tea and Hong Kong style milk tea and hk style milk tea is way too sweet. I recommend classic though. One thing they can improve is OPEN EARLIER! So when us students get off campus lunch can get some boba! Should consider open at around 11 am instead of 2pm....

excerpts: Ended up asking an employee for their two best sellers and got the Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style drinks.
I wasn't a huge fan of the Hong Kong Style one as it seemed to be lacking in sugar, but the Matcha was incredible.
Went back a couple days later, to get the Strawberry Matcha Latte as it was recommended by friend and was pretty good to say the least.
iced matcha latte.author: Timothy D.
iced matcha latte.review:
Ahhhh oh so famous Boba Guys. I've seen so many of my friends get these over the past couple months, but unfortunately we don't have one in Virginia so this was a must try.

I was right in the area and happened to see it as I exploring Mission. It was not a large location, but I could definitely tell that lines can get pretty long so it looked like I came at a good time. 

Ended up asking an employee for their two best sellers and got the Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style drinks. I wasn't a huge fan of the Hong Kong Style one as it seemed to be lacking in sugar, but the Matcha was incredible. Went back a couple days later, to get the Strawberry Matcha Latte as it was recommended by friend and was pretty good to say the least. It really gets me thinking about who comes with these drink ideas like putting strawberry puree in matcha. 

P.S I thought it was also a little funny/cool that they sell shirts, hats and mason jars on the side.

excerpts: I got the iced matcha latte with 75% of sweetness and tapioca.
iced matcha latte.author: Aprille B.
iced matcha latte.review:
I think is this my favorite bubble tea place everrr!

I got the iced matcha latte with 75% of sweetness and tapioca.

Parking on the side.

There's plenty of seats and tables.

Employees are nice and friendly.

Music is great. Good vibes.

excerpts: So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk.
It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding.
Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had.
I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect!
Do i even need to get started on their boba?
There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...
It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness
iced matcha latte.author: Tina L.
iced matcha latte.review:
Boba Guys is one of the places that I think truly makes San Francisco so unique and special. Their drinks are so unique and you can't find them anywhere else! You can also tell they really put effort into the quality of their drinks and care about their customers' needs. Not once have I ever been disappointed by their drinks or customer service! 

I love the location of this Boba Guys. It's located smack-dab right in the Mission, surrounded by tons of yummy restaurants and pretty close to the Castro and Dolores Park! BEWARE THOUGH, parking can be a nightmare though and it might take you a while to find. The shop itself is pretty small, and there's usually a line of customers trailing down the sidewalk. The wait can be long, but it's worth it if you have the time. This is a great place to grab boba after lunch or dinner with friends or family! 

What's great about their drinks is that you can alter the sweetness and ice level, and for the ones that have milk you can substitute it for a non-dairy version, such almond milk or oat milk! So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style. My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea. The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk. It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding. Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had. I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect! Do i even need to get started on their boba? There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness and I can't get enough.

Overall, this place is a must if you're ever in San Francisco. It's an experience worth having and the boba is definitely worth it!!

excerpts: I requested the iced matcha latte with boba and she asked how much "sweetness" I wanted and offered that she usually goes with 50% which I appreciated and went with.
The woman who made/served the drink let me know to shake up the drink before sipping on it.
I took a few pics and took a sip
and it was perfect- cool milky perfection with warm, soft boba and a soft honey flavor.
My only requests next time would be to have more of the albums/books with the current featured drinks and I'll probably ask for less ice next time.
iced matcha latte.author: Zinia G.
iced matcha latte.review: I've been wanting to come here (or any of their locations) for ages, but finally made it here this evening after picking up my car from Honda on Folsom. I was expecting a long line (that's been my experience every time I've attempted to go to one), and there wasn't one at all! My lucky day. The woman who took my order was nice. I told her it was my first time. I requested the iced matcha latte with boba and she asked how much "sweetness" I wanted and offered that she usually goes with 50% which I appreciated and went with. The woman who made/served the drink let me know to shake up the drink before sipping on it. I took a few pics and took a sip and it was perfect- cool milky perfection with warm, soft boba and a soft honey flavor. My only requests next time would be to have more of the albums/books with the current featured drinks and I'll probably ask for less ice next time.

excerpts: Tried the iced matcha latte and Hong Kong
iced matcha latte.author: Anmy V.
iced matcha latte.review:
35 min from waiting in line out the door to getting my boba.
4 stools inside to sit along the window.
$3.75 - $5.75 + extra for boba 
I couldn't even see the grass jelly in my drink - it  was super minimal. 
Over hyped, would not wait in line, doesn't stand out from other boba places.
Tried the iced matcha latte and Hong Kong

excerpts: So far, I've only tried the Iced Matcha Latte (with almond milk, 25% sweetness) and my life is forever changed.
iced matcha latte.author: Traci A.
iced matcha latte.review:
I've spent years thinking I didn't like Boba, and after visiting Boba Guys I realize that I've wasted a serious amount of precious time! YUMTOWN! 

So far, I've only tried the Iced Matcha Latte (with almond milk, 25% sweetness) and my life is forever changed. No shame in stopping to take a pic on the sidewalk. 

There is a reason why there's always a line outside of this place. Actually, several reasons. And they're all those little chewy Boba balls in the bottom of a tasty, delicious drink you can eat!

excerpts: I ordered the Iced Matcha Latte with almond milk (at no additional charge, pretty neat) and quite enjoyed it.
The matcha flavor is bold and full-bodied, but not too overpowering over the almond milk.
The honey came through very nicely and was a tasty, untraditional touch.
A bit pricey, but that's definitely reflected in the quality ingredients.
Would come back.
iced matcha latte.author: Patricia Z.
iced matcha latte.review:
Good stuff.

A few of my friends and I were itching for boba, so we stopped by Boba Guys on a Sunday afternoon. There was a short line, probably about 10 minutes or so. I ordered the Iced Matcha Latte with almond milk (at no additional charge, pretty neat) and quite enjoyed it. The matcha flavor is bold and full-bodied, but not too overpowering over the almond milk. The honey came through very nicely and was a tasty, untraditional touch. A bit pricey, but that's definitely reflected in the quality ingredients. Would come back.

excerpts: [[Iced Matcha Latte with Boba]]
Lately, I have been obsessed with anything matcha, so this drink was definitely calling my name.
The matcha was smooth, bold, and not chalky.
I absolutely hate it when matcha drinks are chalky.
Yuck!
The boba was soft and chewy; a little sweet, but not too bland either.
iced matcha latte.author: Michelle T.
iced matcha latte.review:
I love me some boba. Always. And after seeing soOooOO many photos on social media, I knew I had to try it when I visited SF. 

I went here twice. In one day. I was THAT obsessed. The store itself is quite small and only offers a bar-countertop with just 4 stools available for seating. So if you plan to sit around to do do any work, this is not the place to do that. The line can get long and extend outside, but it does move pretty quick. 

[[Iced Matcha Latte with Boba]] Lately, I have been obsessed with anything matcha, so this drink was definitely calling my name. The matcha was smooth, bold, and not chalky. I absolutely hate it when matcha drinks are chalky. Yuck! The boba was soft and chewy; a little sweet, but not too bland either. Add-ons are an extra 50 cents, but so worth it! 

The first time I went, I didn't have them change the sweetness level and kept it at 100%. Now I am one to usually take my drinks pretty sweet. But this was just way too sweet. So the 2nd time I went, I had them knock it down to 75% and it was a little better. The next time I go, I think I'll do 50% sweetness.

You can choose from regular milk, almond, or soy milk you won't get charged extra! Sweet! 

It is a bit pricey here. If I remember correctly it was around $5 for the 24 oz. However, the pricing is reflected in the quality ingredients, so it's definitely worth it.

My first time here, I drove, so I was lucky enough to find a spot (metered, of course) within a 5 minute walking distance. The second time, I Uber-ed it so no need to pay for parking, yay!

I am hoping that Boba Guys will one day open in Orange County because I will be all over that shiz.

excerpts: Their classics like the jasmine milk tea and the iced matcha latte are always delicious and a staple for me.
To me, their menus and choices are straightforward and easy to understand.
+ Iced matcha latte
iced matcha latte.author: Angie N.
iced matcha latte.review:
Definitely one of my favorite places for boba in the city. If you're trying bubble tea for the first time, go to Boba Guys and you won't be disappointed. I've had consistently good quality of tapioca and tea from this place. For sure 5 stars for the drinks and marketing, but had to knock off one star because of long lines and there's very little seating. This is a place to grab and go unless you come at a really random time. I wish there was more seating here so I could hang out while drinking my bubble tea.

This is one of the few regular bubble tea places that serve the Hong Kong style milk tea, which is black milk tea made with condensed milk. I really enjoy it as it's not too sweet (but I do usually get 50% sweetness on drinks here). They also serve a Horchata drink which is unique and good as well. Their classics like the jasmine milk tea and the iced matcha latte are always delicious and a staple for me. To me, their menus and choices are straightforward and easy to understand. Even first timers would be able to go through the bubble tea ordering process.

Positives:
+ Consistently good quality
+ Interesting marketing
+ Some unique drinks

Negatives:
- Pretty long lines
- Very little seating available

Recommend:
+ 50% sweetness
+ Hong Kong style milk tea 
+ Iced matcha latte

excerpts: But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black.
I feel like I was rigged.
The rose tea had a very aromatic, flora scent, while the ice matcha was just beautiful to look at.
iced matcha latte.author: Wendy F.
iced matcha latte.review:
SO SWEET. Please have more less-sweet decaf drink options!!! 

This was my first time drinking boba in more than a year and I was a little disappointed.

I got the DECAF BLACK (50% sugar) because I wanted something decaffeinated (my body doesn't tolerate caffeine well). At first I was going to pick the HORCHATA, which is the most popular decaf drink on the menu, but I could NOT adjust the sugar level on that one so I went with the decaf black tea, which the girl at the store "recommended". Not sure if she really knows the drinks all that well yet. 

The decaf black was VERY SWEET at 50%. It did not taste anything like a decaf black tea, but more like jasmine tea...I could not tell what was special about this drink or this boba place from drinking this tea. I think this is why there is only one picture of that drink on Yelp right now (which is mine lol).

But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black. I feel like I was rigged. The rose tea had a very aromatic, flora scent, while the ice matcha was just beautiful to look at. 

Anyways, if I liked boba more I would have loved this place. Just sucks that I don't drink caffeinated that often.

excerpts: I got the Hong Kong milk tea with boba, and my friends got an iced matcha latte and a classic black milk tea with soymilk (yes!
iced matcha latte.author: Tara A.
iced matcha latte.review:
Boba Guys definitely has some of the best boba in the city! When they first opened, I saw a lot of it on instagram/twitter/facebook and didn't think too much of it. To me, it mostly seemed like a novelty hipster place where people just went to take pictures (ha ha ha). The mission district is a bit of a drive from my house so I never had an urge to try it either. One of my friends finally suggested we go after dinner and I obliged because I was curious and she really liked it the last time she had it.. and also she was driving haha!

There was absolutely noooo parking on a Friday night so one of us double parked while the other 2 went in to order. I got the Hong Kong milk tea with boba, and my friends got an iced matcha latte and a classic black milk tea with soymilk (yes! You can sub reg milk for soy).

We were the only ones there so the drinks came out in a few minutes. I took my first sip and I was in milk tea heaven!!! It has a hint of condensed milk so that makes it sweeter too. The boba is really chewy and soft here... It's a little more overcooked than most places but that makes it so much more squishy and delicious! I got to try my friends' drinks too and the matcha latte was really good as well! The matcha flavor really stood out and it looks cool before you mix it with all the layers. Just be sure that they've mixed the matcha completely, or else you might get little bitter balls of matcha at the bottom of your drink...

I will definitely be back!! I can't believe I underestimated this place haha. The only bad thing is that drinks are a bit pricey here. Expect to spend $4-5 on a smaller sized drink with a topping, but I guess you're paying for quality!

excerpts: My boyfriend got the Iced Matcha Latte.
That is the weird green one you see pictures of.
He actually really LOVED it, and it was his FIRST time drinking bubble tea.
Yes, I know.
He's dated an Asian for 3.5 years, yet this is only his first bubble tea experience!
iced matcha latte.author: Nadia H.
iced matcha latte.review:
I got the classic milk tea. How can you go wrong with that? It was literally the perfect drink to fulfill my craving. I asked for extra tapioca balls. So the man at the register, who was VERY kind might I add, suggested that I have less sugar in the milk tea. This was the best thing he could have said! The tea would have been way to sweet if he didn't recommend that. It was perfect, and I'm glad I got the 24 oz!

My boyfriend got the Iced Matcha Latte. That is the weird green one you see pictures of. He actually really LOVED it, and it was his FIRST time drinking bubble tea. Yes, I know. He's dated an Asian for 3.5 years, yet this is only his first bubble tea experience! Shame on me :)!

The one downfall is the line goes out the door. You would think it would be quick since it's only tea they are serving, but it took at least 45 minutes of a wait. They do say that their bubble tea is the best quality with no fake powders and artificial syrups. So that may explain why it takes a little more time.

I will be coming back for sure.

excerpts: Maybe next time I'll come back to try the iced matcha latte since I've heard good reviews about that.
iced matcha latte.author: Kim T.
iced matcha latte.review:
I was so excited to finally see what the hype was all about and was thoroughly disappointed.

I ordered an iced lychee green milk tea with boba. It was nothing special. The drink itself did not taste like lychee at all, was bitter, and had an odd aftertaste. The pearls, which I had heard were heavenly, tasted normal. 
Also tried the jasmine milk tea here and it was pretty good, but still nothing special to rave about. 

Small but cute aesthetic interior & really good service but the drinks itself were subpar. Maybe next time I'll come back to try the iced matcha latte since I've heard good reviews about that.

excerpts: I got the iced matcha latte in the 24oz cup which was $4.95!
iced matcha latte.author: Michelle T.
iced matcha latte.review:
One of the best boba spots out there! They use Strauss milk in their milk teas and they do not use powder. I got the iced matcha latte in the 24oz cup which was $4.95! It's steep compared to other boba places but trust me, it's worth it! 

I came in at around 3pm on a weekday and it wasn't too busy. Total wait time was probably 3minutes. I recommend to everyone to get 50% sweetness for any drink because 100% is compared to soda (according to the workers).

excerpts: I got the iced matcha latte with organic milk, 50% sweetness and honey boba.
It wasn't overly sweet and the boba had a good texture.
Drink wasn't powdery and tea flavor was strong.
I thoroughly enjoyed my drink, and in my opinion it may be even better than Half & Half in LA.
My fiance got the rose milk tea, and we were also pleased with his drink.
Worth checking out if you're in the Mission!
iced matcha latte.author: Jessica Y.
iced matcha latte.review: I was pleasantly surprised by Boba Guys today- I got the iced matcha latte with organic milk, 50% sweetness and honey boba. It wasn't overly sweet and the boba had a good texture. Drink wasn't powdery and tea flavor was strong. I thoroughly enjoyed my drink, and in my opinion it may be even better than Half & Half in LA. My fiance got the rose milk tea, and we were also pleased with his drink. Worth checking out if you're in the Mission!

excerpts: I got the iced matcha latte at about half sugar.
It had a good matcha flavor and texture, but was still a bit sweet, so I probably could've gone with about 25% sugar.
iced matcha latte.author: Stephanie H.
iced matcha latte.review:
The line here is pretty long on the weekends. On a Sunday afternoon, we had to wait about 15-20 minutes in a line that went out the door. I've been to the Boba Guys in New York, and thought that it was a bit overrated and expensive. This location is marginally cheaper (by about 50 cents) and is better than the NYC location.

I got the iced matcha latte at about half sugar. It had a good matcha flavor and texture, but was still a bit sweet, so I probably could've gone with about 25% sugar. The tapioca was the perfect consistency for me -- very chewy without being soft.

Boba Guys is always consistent in its very good quality. If you have the time and money to spare, it's a good bubble tea option, but it's not worth the 30 minute wait!

excerpts: The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea.
There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer.
There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly.
I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%.
The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly.
Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom
iced matcha latte.author: Milton F.
iced matcha latte.review:
Decided to come to this place on a whim. My fiance and I just finished having brunch in Redwood city and had some time to kill before we headed over to Fort Mason for APE 2014 (Alternative Press Expo). As we passed by we noticed a few people in line, but not too bad. 

Finding parking in the mission is always a challenge, so keep in mind you may have to circle a few times since there aren't too many parking garages around the area. We finally found parking 5 blocks away and made our way over. There's not a big menu selection so it was not too hard to decide what to get. 

They only serve strictly milk tea in various forms, no fruit milk tea, or fruity drinks. The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea. There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer. There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly. You can also adjust the sweetness level to your liking (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%)

I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%. The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly. Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom and you'll get a huge serving of sugar if you don't. 

All and all, it's a nice place to get milk teas, albeit a bit out of the way for me. For Boba it's a bit on the pricier side.. about $4-4.50 depending if you get addons. I'd come back if I was in the area.

excerpts: I ordered the iced matcha latte with almond milk + boba.
I ordered this mainly because it was under the "good drinks to try if it's your first time here" part of the menu, but I think the drink could have been better.

Some of the boba was hard and although they told me to give my drink a good stir before I drank it, I don't think the amount of sugar on the bottom of the cup mixed well and fully diluted with the rest of the drink.
Honestly I can't judge a place by one drink, so I would come back again to try some of the other drinks that I saw on the menu, like the Calpico one and the lychee rose one!
iced matcha latte.author: Kiana N.
iced matcha latte.review: I'm not going to make this review too lengthy, but all I have to say is that boba is definitely better in the 626 or OC. The service here was good and the line wasn't too bad since it moved pretty quickly, but the drink itself was just okay. I ordered the iced matcha latte with almond milk + boba. I ordered this mainly because it was under the "good drinks to try if it's your first time here" part of the menu, but I think the drink could have been better. Some of the boba was hard and although they told me to give my drink a good stir before I drank it, I don't think the amount of sugar on the bottom of the cup mixed well and fully diluted with the rest of the drink. Honestly I can't judge a place by one drink, so I would come back again to try some of the other drinks that I saw on the menu, like the Calpico one and the lychee rose one!

excerpts: But they had a lot of other drinks on the menu that made me want to try something different - they offer an horchata boba (that's very original), an iced matcha latte, Hong Kong style boba (black tea with condensed milk), and a Thai tea boba (I love Thai iced tea).
I'd like to try the matcha latte and the Thai tea the next time I visit!
iced matcha latte.author: Sylvia K.
iced matcha latte.review:
Am I in a science laboratory or in a boba shop?? It's a mix of the two and I love it! There are all kinds of glass beakers and glass test tubes that hold tea leaves and tools like matcha whisks and such. Such a creative idea on styling the space. There was even like a glass beaker terrarium on the counter. They have a statement on their outside window by the door about how they put a lot if science into their boba making process, which is pretty clever. The only thing that would make this even more awesome is if the employees wore white lab coats and safety glasses while making the boba. But I guess that would be really hot - it was already a warm day in the Mission when I visited and it gets pretty warm inside this little shop, especially with lots of people inside. They also had some fans on, so maybe there's no central AC. So...maybe no lab coats...

They also sell cute mason jars with their logo (I think it's an aardvark? They like boba too!) for $10. Not only is it cute, but it's reusable! If you bring the glass mason jar in, you get 25 cents off your order. So you're helping the environment by reducing waste and saving some money too! Technically, you'll need to visit 40 times to break even, but if you are planning to go everyday, or even like every week for a year, it will pay for itself. Plus you can use it for other beverages at home too. It has a handle. 

Ok, so how about the most important thing - the boba? I ordered the classic milk tea with tapioca balls - it was my visit and I needed to go with something basic. But they had a lot of other drinks on the menu that made me want to try something different - they offer an horchata boba (that's very original), an iced matcha latte, Hong Kong style boba (black tea with condensed milk), and a Thai tea boba (I love Thai iced tea). 

The milk tea was really good - just the perfect sweetness. Very refreshing on such a warm day. Maybe it tasted good because they use local Straus milk, I don't know. The tapioca was just a tad chewier than I prefer. But the liquid part was yummy. I'm not a boba connoisseur but I know what I like when I taste it. Even though it was busy, my order came out in like five minutes from the time that I ordered it. Speedy! 

I'd like to try the matcha latte and the Thai tea the next time I visit!

excerpts: Large Iced Matcha Latte with tapioca balls.
:) A bit expensive for some boba though.
iced matcha latte.author: D H.
iced matcha latte.review: Rating based on the drinking that I always get! Large Iced Matcha Latte with tapioca balls. :) A bit expensive for some boba though.

excerpts: Iced Matcha latte: Perfect balance of matcha flavour without making it too bitter.
iced matcha latte.author: Theresa L.
iced matcha latte.review:
I've come here multiple times and have experienced both the long line and no line at all - it really depends on what time you arrive. 

Here are the drinks I've tried:
Hong Kong style tea with condensed milk: VERY sweet, even when we ordered less sweet. I've also tried it with half sweet, and in this case the coffee like flavour of the hong kong style tea showed through more. Either way, their hong kong style tea is pretty good.
Jasmine milk tea: Standard jasmine milk tea, refreshing and well made.
Iced Matcha latte: Perfect balance of matcha flavour without making it too bitter. 

Their boba is quite nice and chewy too with a good consistency. They also sell boba guys mason jars which look pretty cute if you want to fit into the hipster mission district. I think my only complaint is that it's quite expensive when it comes to milk tea places and it's just on par with other places such as sharetea/chatime/kung fu tea.

excerpts: Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style.
They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order.
All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients.
This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet.
Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price
iced matcha latte.author: Cherylynn N.
iced matcha latte.review:
Boys and girls rarely agree on anything but I think there is one thing they CAN agree on: good balls ARE essential. Perfectly symmetrical, soft, squishy, and bouncy. Balls like this get me super excited especially when I'm enjoying a mouthful of them. 

BOBA BALLS that is you pervs!

The Boba Guys have perfected the boba balls down to a science and I love that they use top notch, organic ingredients. They even make their own syrup which means they are serious about their balls; I mean their boba drink. 

I adored Boba Guys when they were at their pop-up at Ken Ken Ramen (http://bit.ly/1fiXJcx) and was ecstatic to find out they would have their brick and mortar. Over 3 months later after their grand opening, I finally was able to make my way to Boba Guys' brick and mortar since they extended their hours of operation. And they now accepted CC's. Yay!

Not only do the Boba Guys now have a permanent space with several stools, they have expanded their menu. Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style. They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order. All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients. This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet. *Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price* 

I decided to stick with their basic Classic Milk Tea ($4) which was sadly not as good as I remembered them to be when they were at Ken Ken Ramen. I like that they use very little sweetener but the tea flavor was too subtle and our drink needed MORE ice. After a 30 minute wait for our drink on a hot Saturday afternoon, our drink arrived to us almost room temperature. By the time we walked back to the car, all the ice (the little that there was in the cup) was all melted. *Sad Pouty Lip*

It was a crowded so the wait was somewhat understandable; I mean fobbee teens who have nothing better to do wait for up to 2 hours at Tpumps. 

3 stars for the boba milk tea but an extra star for their deliciously satisfying pandan macarons (3 for $5) and for carrying Sugar & Spun's cotton candy in cookie butter: http://bit.ly/GOf9i9. 

Not going to lie, it's been nearly 2 weeks but I'm still a little bummed about their boba milk tea. Oh well, at least the balls were good. A good pair; I mean set is all you need sometimes right?

excerpts: My friend got the iced matcha latte with horchata milk rather than regular milk.
iced matcha latte.author: Nina Y.
iced matcha latte.review:
Really nice boba place. Looks really nice and clean. So I don't think that that this is the best boba I've ever had, I'm not even sure what would be, but this is a pretty good place, albeit on the expensive side.

I ended up ordering the horchata el salvadorian style boba with almond jelly. The cashier recommended it because it had a bit of almond in the milk used for the drink portion. My friend got the iced matcha latte with horchata milk rather than regular milk. Also delicious! 

Overall, great place, great cashiers. 

Protip: Always ask for suggestions.

excerpts: I got the Iced Matcha Latte w/ Boba ($4.50) and
my roommate got the Horchata w/Boba ($4.50).
I know it's a little pricey, but you can taste it in the quality of the tea and the boba.
I really liked the Matcha Latte, it certainly had a very strong matcha taste, and didn't taste watered down at all like other milk teas.
iced matcha latte.author: Cara O.
iced matcha latte.review:
Did I just drive down to the Mission so that I could get milk tea from Boba Guys? Yeah, I did, and I would do it again.

I first discovered Boba Guys after a night out in the Mission getting my Wing Wednesday on, down the street. Of course, when we saw this ultra hipster boba spot, we just had to try it. I originally got the Duke of Earl Grey Milk Tea w/Boba ($4.45), which was absolutely delicious.

Today, I drove down with my roommate because we just had to get out of the library. I was surprised to see that the line went well out the door. However, the staff were all very quick and kind. I got the Iced Matcha Latte w/ Boba ($4.50) and my roommate got the Horchata w/Boba ($4.50). I know it's a little pricey, but you can taste it in the quality of the tea and the boba. I really liked the Matcha Latte, it certainly had a very strong matcha taste, and didn't taste watered down at all like other milk teas. You could tell this tea was made with love! 

They've got some other really interesting flavors we wanted to try like Camomile Mint, Lychee Green Tea, Indian Chai, and Roe Black Tea. Their almond jelly and grass jelly are made in-house, AND you can have the option between Straus Family Organic Milk, Almond Milk, or Organic Soy Milk. 

Yep, totally worth the drive.

excerpts: Went with a few friends last week and we ordered four separate drinks, including the iced matcha latte with boba, Hong Kong style, and hojicha.
The Iced Matcha Latte drink is also highly recommended, while the Hong Kong style was good but not quite anything special.
The Iced Matcha Latte drink is also highly recommended, while the Hong Kong style was good but not quite anything special.
iced matcha latte.author: Matthew L.
iced matcha latte.review:
Had never bothered going to this place, but had definitely heard the hype. 

Went with a few friends last week and we ordered four separate drinks, including the iced matcha latte with boba, Hong Kong style, and hojicha. Personally, I ordered the Hojicha at 0% sugar, while I also got a taste of the other drinks. 

Through my experience, I concluded one thing - AMAZING tea flavors! I highly recommend that if you go to Boba Guys, order one of their premium milk teas, and order it with a lower sugar content level. Many milk tea places mask the poor quality of their actual teas with sweetening agents, and if you actually try their teas with low sweetness levels, it becomes alarmingly similar to just drinking milk and no tea. However, my Hojicha was very flavorful by itself, and it complemented nicely with the general sweetness of the boba toppings. 

The Iced Matcha Latte drink is also highly recommended, while the Hong Kong style was good but not quite anything special.

excerpts: I was most disappointed by the Iced Matcha Latte.
I got it with almond milk, and it was waaayyy too milky with barely any tea flavor.
iced matcha latte.author: Samantha C.
iced matcha latte.review:
I've come back several times, hoping for a better drink with each visit... but more times than not, I've left disappointed :( 

I was most disappointed by the Iced Matcha Latte. I got it with almond milk, and it was waaayyy too milky with barely any tea flavor. It was also served to me lukewarm and tasted extremely watered down. 

I do like that they use high-quality ingredients like Strauss organic milk and Califia almond milk. They also make all the toppings in-house! The boba is nice and chewy, and the grass jelly is extremely fresh and fun to eat. I do, however, wish they came in smaller chunks that actually fit through the straw.

excerpts:
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
iced matcha latte.author: Kitty K.
iced matcha latte.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: and I got the iced matcha latte with grass jelly.
It was good and had a lot of matcha flavor.
It was a bit sweet so next time 75% sweetness would be perfect.
I forgot I wanted to try the boba too
so I asked the cashier if I could add some and turns out its 50 cents for any and all toppings so my extra boba was free.
The boba is really chewy and soft!
I wouldn't recommend the grass jelly.
It was cut into super small pieces, which made it hard to eat and the texture was a little hard.
iced matcha latte.author: May S.
iced matcha latte.review:
It's my first time here and I got the iced matcha latte with grass jelly.  It was good and had a lot of matcha flavor.  It was a bit sweet so next time 75% sweetness would be perfect.  I forgot I wanted to try the boba too so I asked the cashier if I could add some and turns out its 50 cents for any and all toppings so my extra boba was free. The boba is really chewy and soft!  I wouldn't recommend the grass jelly.  It was cut into super small pieces, which made it hard to eat and the texture was a little hard.  My sister got the coffee milk tea and it just tasted like iced coffee.  Nothing special, which is why I'm only give 3 stars.  

Minus 2 stars for the bad grass jelly and and plain coffee milk tea.

excerpts: Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush.
iced matcha latte.author: Jennifer L.
iced matcha latte.review:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!

excerpts: The iced Matcha Latte is good as well, but that Strawberry purée though?!
Also tried the Strawberry Rice Milk if you want that yummy purée without the caffeine.
Those boba pearls are the best I've ever had.
MyDH described them as "nice, 'gentle,' and soft.
Who says that about boba??
But they are that good!!
LOL.
Quality ingredients and its apparent!
iced matcha latte.author: Anna R.
iced matcha latte.review: My new favorite spot for teas and bobas! I came here two days in a row -- both times for the Strawberry Matcha Latte! The iced Matcha Latte is good as well, but that Strawberry purée though?! Also tried the Strawberry Rice Milk if you want that yummy purée without the caffeine. Those boba pearls are the best I've ever had. MyDH described them as "nice, 'gentle,' and soft." Who says that about boba?? But they are that good!! LOL. Quality ingredients and its apparent!

excerpts: Their iced matcha latte is truly phenomenal.
I could drink a gallon of it without thinking twice.
Yes, it's that good.
I love that they sweeten their drinks with honey and allow you to adjust the level of sweetness.
The customer service is also top-notch.
Now, whenever I'm told SF doesn't have a single praiseworthy boba place, I counter immediately with Boba Guys.
iced matcha latte.author: Michele L.
iced matcha latte.review: I was ready to accept the fact that SF lacked a good boba place...until I came here.  Their iced matcha latte is truly phenomenal.  I could drink a gallon of it without thinking twice.  Yes, it's that good.  I love that they sweeten their drinks with honey and allow you to adjust the level of sweetness. The customer service is also top-notch.  Now, whenever I'm told SF doesn't have a single praiseworthy boba place, I counter immediately with Boba Guys.

excerpts: I got the iced matcha latte with boba and trust me, I'm a HUGE fan of everything matcha but the drink wasn't what I was expecting.
I came with big expectations due to all the hype but the drink was nothing more than what I've tasted at other decent places.
The boba was a little disappointing-
it lacked the softness and the chewiness and flavor as well.
It didn't compliment the drink at all.
I loved the interior of the shop- small but cute and cozy.
I would've given a 3/5 stars but since I didn't even try the milk teas or any of their other menu items, I decided to go with a 4/5.
iced matcha latte.author: Caitlin L.
iced matcha latte.review: I got the iced matcha latte with boba and trust me, I'm a HUGE fan of everything matcha but the drink wasn't what I was expecting. I came with big expectations due to all the hype but the drink was nothing more than what I've tasted at other decent places. The boba was a little disappointing- it lacked the softness and the chewiness and flavor as well. It didn't compliment the drink at all. I loved the interior of the shop- small but cute and cozy. I would've given a 3/5 stars but since I didn't even try the milk teas or any of their other menu items, I decided to go with a 4/5.

excerpts: I got the iced matcha latte.
Matcha was great and the tapioca balls were done to perfection.
Only thing is I got it 100% sweetened which is the "default".
I hope a normal person does not need that much sweetener in their life.
Next time I'll definitely tone it down a little(a lot).
Reason for the 4/5 is that although they do have some variety; they don't have as many choices as most boba places.
I did see that they have some kind of ice cream on the menu though
so I'm definitely gonna give that a go next time too!
Overall you have to try this place at least once!
iced matcha latte.author: Najeemah W.
iced matcha latte.review: Unsurprisingly, my experience at Boba Guys was really good. There was a lengthy line as I'm sure is normal. But once you do order it only takes about 5 minutes. I got the iced matcha latte. Matcha was great and the tapioca balls were done to perfection. Only thing is I got it 100% sweetened which is the "default". I hope a normal person does not need that much sweetener in their life. Next time I'll definitely tone it down a little(a lot). Reason for the 4/5 is that although they do have some variety; they don't have as many choices as most boba places. I did see that they have some kind of ice cream on the menu though so I'm definitely gonna give that a go next time too! Overall you have to try this place at least once!

excerpts: The drinks are really good also especially the Iced Matcha Latte.
The boba is soft so that's a plus
and I rarely get boba.
Recommend if you're in SF.
iced matcha latte.author: Thuy M.
iced matcha latte.review: Usually I take time to write a review and don't write one immediately but I had to give Boba Guys a 5 atar. I ordered 5 drinks but walked out with 7. The manager is the best manager I've ever met, he put  customers first. I first heard about boba guys from instagram and since I am in San Francisco, I might as well try it. Arrived here and the line is out the door. The girls messed up on my drinks which I wasn't really getting angry about but the manager came out and apologized to me and he will personally make me the correct drink. Not only did he remake my drink he also gave me the drinks that was messed up and some boba guys pins. This never happened to me before. The manager is really awesome. The drinks are really good also especially the Iced Matcha Latte. The boba is soft so that's a plus and I rarely get boba. Recommend if you're in SF.

excerpts: I had the iced matcha latte and the muscat oolong (my favorite), while my friend tried the classic, hong kong style, and lychee green tea (i think she liked the classic best out of those options).
iced matcha latte.author: Ellen K.
iced matcha latte.review:
My friend and I came back from SF three weeks ago, and we're still talking about Boba Guys. We had it almost everyday we were there.

Bubbles are the perfect consistency. Almond jelly is sooooo good. 25% sweetened is just enough.

I had the iced matcha latte and the muscat oolong (my favorite), while my friend tried the classic, hong kong style, and lychee green tea (i think she liked the classic best out of those options).

Ugh, now I'm sitting at work craving Boba Guys... :(

excerpts: I ordered the Iced Matcha Latte with boba.
The drink had the right amount of sweetness, but it tasted like seaweed.
I read that green tea can taste like that; however I didn't care for it.
The boba on the other hand had a great soft and chewy consistency.
iced matcha latte.author: Helen H.
iced matcha latte.review: It's not a place to hang out with friends. It's a place where you take your drink to go. The place is really small and had a line out the door. I ordered the Iced Matcha Latte with boba. The drink had the right amount of sweetness, but it tasted like seaweed. I read that green tea can taste like that; however I didn't care for it. The boba on the other hand had a great soft and chewy consistency. Sugar and Spun cotton candy is also sold here, but they didn't have the flavors I wanted to get.

excerpts: We got Thai tea and iced matcha latte bbts.
This place seems overhyped.
Missed out on seasonal or special items, which aren't posted on the main menu, but at the cashier, so we only realized after we paid.
Wouldn't necessarily go again next time I'm in SF.
iced matcha latte.author: Michelle C.
iced matcha latte.review: No line when we went. We got Thai tea and iced matcha latte bbts. This place seems overhyped. Missed out on seasonal or special items, which aren't posted on the main menu, but at the cashier, so we only realized after we paid. Wouldn't necessarily go again next time I'm in SF.

excerpts: I decided to try out the iced matcha latte and my boyfriend tried the hong kong style.
I loved both drinks.

The boba balls were not too soft and chewy, the price was very typical in comparison to other boba places (that's if you don't purchase the mason jar), the service was on the longer side to most boba places i've been to, and finding parking can be tough.
I would most likely come back, but hopefully when its not so busy!
iced matcha latte.author: Charlene B.
iced matcha latte.review: So, where I live there aren't many boba places AT ALL (and if there are, the quality is as cheap as the prices they sell for). My boyfriend came to Boba Guys on President's Day (a Monday), and we were enough to find prime time parking along the street right across the shop. When we arrived (around 230pm) there was a bit of a line. It took about 15 minutes to actually reach the inside, which was small and a bit cramped (like most boba places). The register had a display just the to the left of it which showed their signature mason jars and some treats they were selling (sugar spun cotton candy!). I decided to try out the iced matcha latte and my boyfriend tried the hong kong style. I loved both drinks. The boba balls were not too soft and chewy, the price was very typical in comparison to other boba places (that's if you don't purchase the mason jar), the service was on the longer side to most boba places i've been to, and finding parking can be tough. I would most likely come back, but hopefully when its not so busy!

excerpts: *Iced Matcha Latte:
My fave
iced matcha latte.author: Kathy Y.
iced matcha latte.review:
I LOVE BOBA GUYS.

Let's get it straight, it's not your typical boba joint and it does cost a bit more, but it's SO WORTH IT. I am not someone who has to get their daily/weekly boba fix (seriously, I get almond milk instead of real milk), but I come here every time I visit SF. The employees are super nice and they are all about organics, so what's not to love??

*Iced Matcha Latte: My fave
*Thai Tea: Dee-lish
*Earl Grey: Soooooo good
*Muscat Oolong: Yuuumm

excerpts: I ordered the iced Matcha Latte and it was powdery and watered down tasting.
The boba was also still very warm which wasn't refreshing at all and ended up melting most of the ice almost instantly.
The boba was also undercooked, resulting in chewy balls of rubber.
My girlfriend got the ice coffee and that too was watered down.
It tasted like cheap instant coffee.
I wad really excited to try this place and it ended up being a total disappointment.
iced matcha latte.author: Kenichiro C.
iced matcha latte.review: I was not impressed with the Boba Guys at all. I ordered the iced Matcha Latte and it was powdery and watered down tasting. The boba was also still very warm which wasn't refreshing at all and ended up melting most of the ice almost instantly. The boba was also undercooked, resulting in chewy balls of rubber. My girlfriend got the ice coffee and that too was watered down. It tasted like cheap instant coffee. I wad really excited to try this place and it ended up being a total disappointment.

excerpts: Iced matcha latte and Hong Kong style milk tea are definitely worth trying.
Ask for extra ice because it is not cold enough when you get it.
But when the ice settles, it tastes really good.
It's a little on the pricey side and the location is really random..
Boba in the mission district?
Definitely a hipster boba spot
but it is really good.
Service is alright, nothing to rave about.
They also sell macarons but every time I come, they're already sold out.
iced matcha latte.author: Brenda K.
iced matcha latte.review: Iced matcha latte and Hong Kong style milk tea are definitely worth trying. Ask for extra ice because it is not cold enough when you get it. But when the ice settles, it tastes really good. It's a little on the pricey side and the location is really random.. Boba in the mission district? Definitely a hipster boba spot but it is really good. Service is alright, nothing to rave about. They also sell macarons but every time I come, they're already sold out.

excerpts: Had the iced matcha latte.
Sad they don't have bigger sizes because it was so delicious!
Only suggestion is adding a bit more ice to the drink.
I understand how annoying it is to get a drink that fills the cup with 75% ice.
But the ice in my drink melted within the first 5 mins.
The entire time I was drinking my tea it was still on the warm side.
Nonetheless the flavor was amazing.
And the tapioca balls were the best I've tasted in a boba drink yet.
Still getting 5 stars in my book.
Next time I'll ask for extra ice ;)
iced matcha latte.author: Lissette V.
iced matcha latte.review: Had the iced matcha latte. Sad they don't have bigger sizes because it was so delicious! Only suggestion is adding a bit more ice to the drink. I understand how annoying it is to get a drink that fills the cup with 75% ice. But the ice in my drink melted within the first 5 mins. The entire time I was drinking my tea it was still on the warm side.  Nonetheless the flavor was amazing. And the tapioca balls were the best I've tasted in a boba drink yet. Still getting 5 stars in my book. Next time I'll ask for extra ice ;)

excerpts: I didn't really like my boyfriend's iced matcha latte.
Honestly I love the attitude and lifestyle of the neighborhood, especially since I live nearby.
However it really irked me and my elitist view of being Asian and knowing boba when people come in here not knowing a thing about tapioca.
But that's just my own personal tick.
iced matcha latte.author: Malia B.
iced matcha latte.review:
Went here today after seeing friends' photos of milk tea and boba in Mason jars and thought, "How hipster!" I knew coming in that the price was high ($4 compared to Teaway Express's $1.07) but I thought it would be worth it. It really wasn't. I got the Hong Kong style milk tea expecting it to be sweet and creamy with condensed milk-- it wasn't. It was very watery and thin. The tapioca itself is average-- good flavor, average texture; not as soft as Tpumps's honey boba. Also, my drink didn't even come in a mason jar! Disappointment all around. I didn't really like my boyfriend's iced matcha latte. 
Honestly I love the attitude and lifestyle of the neighborhood, especially since I live nearby. However it really irked me and my elitist view of being Asian and knowing boba when people come in here not knowing a thing about tapioca. But that's just my own personal tick. 
The one saving grace so far was the green tea cotton candy. It was a little shocking at first, strong, slightly salty matcha with sweet sugar, but it was soon addicting.

excerpts: I settled for a jasmine green tea with boba, which my normal go to order.
There is an extremely small counter seating inside, but somehow I was able to find a seat.
(Note that if you sit there though, you might be in several photos of people trying to instagram in front of super cute painting of an anteater drinking a boba.
I just squished myself to the side.)
After ordering, it took about another 15 minutes to actually get my boba.
After my first sip, I was very disappointed.
After a 45 minute, I was expecting my mind to be blown.
The jasmine tea had a weird after taste to it.
I could not put my finger on it, but later I realized that this was because they probably used the tea leaves or tea bags a little too long which caused a bitter after taste.
The boba was just average, just OK.
I had a sip of someone's oolong tea and this was a little better with no aftertaste.
jasmine.author: Jane L.
jasmine.review:
Living in Southern California, I have had my fair share of bobas.  Not to say that all the bobas I have had are good, but most of the time even the ones that are just meh taste OK to me.  So, for the most part, I will drink just about any boba.  I was in SF recently for a quick trip and while doing some sightseeing, I landed in Mission.  After struggling to find Mission (I was trying to be adventurous and took public transportation, which was an EPIC fail), I was ready for a cool drink.  The last time I was in SF, I remember that I passed by Boba Guys, but the line was way too long.  However, this time around, the line was still long, but not as long as before.  So, I waited about 20 minutes to order my boba. 

As for the menu itself, you can customize your boba (similar to all the other boba places) with the type of milk, sweetness, ice, etc. I settled for a jasmine green tea with boba, which my normal go to order.  There is an extremely small counter seating inside, but somehow I was able to find a seat.  (Note that if you sit there though, you might be in several photos of people trying to instagram in front of super cute painting of an anteater drinking a boba.  I just squished myself to the side.) After ordering, it took about another 15 minutes to actually get my boba.  After my first sip, I was very disappointed.  After a 45 minute, I was expecting my mind to be blown.  The jasmine tea had a weird after taste to it.  I could not put my finger on it, but later I realized that this was because they probably used the tea leaves or tea bags a little too long which caused a bitter after taste.  The boba was just average, just OK.  I had a sip of someone's oolong tea and this was a little better with no aftertaste. Maybe if I had it with a milk the aftertaste could have been hidden, but still this was very disappointing to me. 

It looks like SF does not have too many boba options, but with the long wait and poor boba at the end, I do not think I will ever come back here.  (Random comparison, I went to a pretty popular boba place near LA this weekend.  Even though, there was a wait, I was able to get a very good boba within 15 minutes of when I entered the store).

excerpts: My sister ordered the Jasmine Green milk tea (with boba), also ordering it half sweetened.
I sampled her drink (trying to strategically sip it
so I didn't suck up a tapioca pearl through the straw) and
it was a superbly made tea drink, too!
jasmine.author: Anna B.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys creates one of the best classic milk tea drinks I've had in a while! There are around 5 locations in the numerous neighborhoods of San Francisco.

I chose the Classic Black milk tea (without boba of course) - smooth, frothy, and had a distinct, robust black tea flavor while still containing a balance of the familiar malty-like milk element. I ordered the drink 50% sweetened (the recommended sweetener level suggested on the menu), since nowadays I prefer tea and even coffee drinks to be less sweet.

My sister ordered the Jasmine Green milk tea (with boba), also ordering it half sweetened. I sampled her drink (trying to strategically sip it so I didn't suck up a tapioca pearl through the straw) and it was a superbly made tea drink, too! The green tea had a mellow, natural flavorings combined with a hint of a floral-esque taste.

FYI, the tea drinks can also be ordered as a hot version (12 or 16 oz size); iced version (16 or 24 oz size). And there are four milk options to choose from, including vegan options: organic dairy milk (the milk I chose for my tea drink), almond milk, oat milk, or no milk.

Overall, an exceptional milk tea experience! And I'm super happy there is now a convenient location in LA County!

excerpts: However, the jasmine milk tea is a solid choice as well!
Be prepared for a wait, you never really know how long the line can get around here, it's not as bad here though compared to the hayes valley or union square location!
jasmine.author: Noor H.
jasmine.review:
I love boba. I have it way too often, but it's so good I can't stop myself. Boba guys is definitely one of my favorite places to grab a cup when i'm in SF. The hong kong milk tea is my go-to, which features black tea with condensed milk, so it's very creamy and very good. 
The mission location is nice and tiny, it's not really somewhere to stick around, I would suggest taking it and walking 5 minutes to dolores, where you can relax with your boba and people watch. My only tip is avoid the horchata milk tea, I tried it before and it really wasn't good. However, the jasmine milk tea is a solid choice as well! Be prepared for a wait, you never really know how long the line can get around here, it's not as bad here though compared to the hayes valley or union square location!

excerpts: I have tried the matcha, jasmine, horchata and original milk tea.
All great, but for me to know if a boba shop is good, always go for their regular milk tea.
I always base it on how good they make the most basic and original milk tea.
And if they make it good and not like the "usual milk tea" then you got me.
jasmine.author: Madel R.
jasmine.review:
I have to give this place 5 stars for location, cleanliness, simple shop, customer service, and consistency.

They serve the the best boba in my opinion and i say this because I have never been disappointed. Whether it be this location, the one on Stockton St. or the one in 16th St. Consistency in good quality is key. This is why I keep coming back. 

I have tried the matcha, jasmine, horchata and original milk tea. All great, but for me to know if a boba shop is good, always go for their regular milk tea. I always base it on how good they make the most basic and original milk tea. And if they make it good and not like the "usual milk tea" then you got me. The actual boba is always the same texture, not soft and soggy and not hard, cooked just right.

Thank you for making such great bobz!

excerpts: My friend's jasmine milk tea was floral and not too sweet.
jasmine.author: Megan K.
jasmine.review:
I've been wanting to come here for years but didn't get the chance until a friend took me a few weeks ago. Even though it wasn't really cold-drink weather, we really enjoyed our boba drinks from here! I had the strawberry fresca with their signature boba. My friend's jasmine milk tea was floral and not too sweet. I really want to come back and try their kiwi guava drink next time.

I liked how unique their drinks were. It's a tiny shop so you probably won't be able to sit but it's definitely worth a visit if you are a boba lover!

excerpts: Strawberry jasmine tea fresca
- I had this at the wedding I attended and not at this shop, but I'll throw it in this review anyway because it was perfectly refreshing, just like the description says.
I liked it a lot!
Soy milk tea - also an item I tried at the wedding.
The couple was so thoughtful to include this milk tea option for guests who can't have dairy!
jasmine.author: Nicole M.
jasmine.review:
There is so much hype regarding this place, and the only time I've ever had it was at an amazing wedding I attended - so I was very excited to come to the actual shop for the first time. 

Horchata - very smooth with a great cinnamon flavor. I only tried a sample of this and liked it, but do think that it would have been too heavy for me as a whole drink. 
Strawberry matcha latte - I hear that this is the drink to get, so I've been wanting to try it for quite some time. It comes out in three beautifully-colored layers. I personally would have preferred more of a strawberry flavor, but I enjoyed this regardless (though not as much as other people seem to).
Hojicha roasted green milk tea - I absolutely love hojicha in general because of the fragrant "ricey" flavor. It was good here and my fiance liked his drink.
Strawberry jasmine tea fresca - I had this at the wedding I attended and not at this shop, but I'll throw it in this review anyway because it was perfectly refreshing, just like the description says. I liked it a lot!
Soy milk tea - also an item I tried at the wedding. The couple was so thoughtful to include this milk tea option for guests who can't have dairy! I'm so glad I'm not lactose intolerant though, because the soy milk tea tastes watered down and isn't nearly as delicious as regular milk tea.

I love how they allow you to sample things at the counter - one of the things we tried was this lychee coconut juice that isn't on their regular menu. I took a sip of it after I had already ordered, but we all agreed it would be something we would like to get next time! Great taste with both the lychee and coconut flavors coming through, and wonderfully refreshing on a warm day. I do feel that the prices at Boba Guys are very slightly higher than some other places, but they use organic milk and no powders in their drinks, so it's worth it. I can't say this is one of my favorite boba spots, but I'd definitely come back to try some of their other things, like the muscat oolong!

excerpts: so I like to stick with the basic jasmine milk tea with boba.
The tea flavors are fairly strong
but I feel like they make the drink so sweet!
When I get 75% sweetness it still tastes like it's half sugar.
Luckily, they have really great customer service and will remake you a drink if you ask.
Boba is typically good here with a chewy consistency and strong taste as well.
jasmine.author: Anna L.
jasmine.review:
This is not my favorite boba place in SF but is one of the them that won't let you down.  If you're a tourist or even have never tried it before, I would give it a chance. 

I'm not much of an explorer when it comes to my boba tastes so I like to stick with the basic jasmine milk tea with boba. The tea flavors are fairly strong but I feel like they make the drink so sweet! When I get 75% sweetness it still tastes like it's half sugar. Luckily, they have really great customer service and will remake you a drink if you ask. Boba is typically good here with a chewy consistency and strong taste as well. Other drinks that are popular are the HK milk tea (super sweet side), Thai tea, and the strawberry matcha. 

Honestly I think a main reason I don't like boba guys as much is because their milk teas just doesn't taste like the traditional places (ten ren) that are my favorite! they aren't bad though, so definitely give it a try.

excerpts: So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk.
It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding.
Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had.
I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect!
Do i even need to get started on their boba?
There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...
It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness
jasmine.author: Tina L.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys is one of the places that I think truly makes San Francisco so unique and special. Their drinks are so unique and you can't find them anywhere else! You can also tell they really put effort into the quality of their drinks and care about their customers' needs. Not once have I ever been disappointed by their drinks or customer service! 

I love the location of this Boba Guys. It's located smack-dab right in the Mission, surrounded by tons of yummy restaurants and pretty close to the Castro and Dolores Park! BEWARE THOUGH, parking can be a nightmare though and it might take you a while to find. The shop itself is pretty small, and there's usually a line of customers trailing down the sidewalk. The wait can be long, but it's worth it if you have the time. This is a great place to grab boba after lunch or dinner with friends or family! 

What's great about their drinks is that you can alter the sweetness and ice level, and for the ones that have milk you can substitute it for a non-dairy version, such almond milk or oat milk! So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style. My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea. The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk. It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding. Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had. I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect! Do i even need to get started on their boba? There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness and I can't get enough.

Overall, this place is a must if you're ever in San Francisco. It's an experience worth having and the boba is definitely worth it!!

excerpts: I went back and decided to go with a more classic type drink, Jasmine Milk Tea, with Almond Jelly.
This time 25% sweet.
Was I crazy?
Had I developed an affinity for a more pure milk tea drink without tons of sweetener?
Had my first sip and BINGO!
That's the type of drink that made me realize Boba Guys definitely has something.
Absolutely, refreshing and well brewed Jasmine Tea, creamy Strauss milk and 25% sweetness was perfect.
I suppose, for those without a sweet tooth ... do yourself a favor and get 25% for a slight sweetness that allows you to taste the flavor of the milk tea.
The almond jelly was okay, a little more of the harder side and difficult to drink through the straw leaving me to have about half of it left over in my cup.
jasmine.author: Janet N.
jasmine.review:
Finally got to cross Boba Guys off my long list of boba bookmarks! 

Truth be told, I didn't want to burst anyone's boba bubble with my first impression of Boba Guys. During my first trip I got their Strawberry Matcha Latte with boba and was really let down, it was way too sweet, the drink seemed a bit too gritty for my liking and I felt that the strawberry overwhelmed the matcha flavor. The boba was indeed cooked well, which was the only redeeming factor. I was pretty let down considering the drink wasn't what my Instagram hopes and dreams were tastewise and almost $6 for a drink didn't make sense. Instead of throwing my hands up and finalizing my thoughts on my experience, I decided to give them a second chance.

I went back and decided to go with a more classic type drink, Jasmine Milk Tea, with Almond Jelly. This time 25% sweet. Was I crazy? Had I developed an affinity for a more pure milk tea drink without tons of sweetener? Had my first sip and BINGO! That's the type of drink that made me realize Boba Guys definitely has something. Absolutely, refreshing and well brewed Jasmine Tea, creamy Strauss milk and 25% sweetness was perfect. I suppose, for those without a sweet tooth ... do yourself a favor and get 25% for a slight sweetness that allows you to taste the flavor of the milk tea. The almond jelly was okay, a little more of the harder side and difficult to drink through the straw leaving me to have about half of it left over in my cup. 
Side note, the almond jelly does contain dairy (for those lactose intolerant).

Price is a bit steep for a drink, but I can see how it translates as Boba Guys provides quality ingredients and doesn't use gimmicks in order to draw in customers. The service is always fast when I had visited and the shop smells amazing. A few drawbacks are that the shop itself is a bit on the smaller side, closed on Mondays, drinks on the sweeter side and the AC unit drips onto your head if you are standing in the doorway.

excerpts: and I ordered the Jasmine Green Tea with lychee
and I DEFINITELY recommend this one.
Sooo refreshing and the lychee was great.
I also suggest getting it 75% or 50% sweet.
jasmine.author: Ranae A.
jasmine.review:
This was on my "must-try" list when visiting San Francisco last week!

My friends all ordered the strawberry matcha latte with boba and it was definitely worth trying! I wanted to get the dirty horchata, but it is pre-mixed so I could not order it dairy free. :( I ended up getting a regular matcha latte and it was enjoyable, not "powdery", but not the most amazing thing.

We came back a second time before going home and I ordered the Jasmine Green Tea with lychee and I DEFINITELY recommend this one. Sooo refreshing and the lychee was great. I also suggest getting it 75% or 50% sweet.

excerpts: The jasmine tea was excellent.
The matcha tea was similar to Starbucks matcha latte
but minus the syrup so it was more on the slightly bitter side.
jasmine.author: Diana C.
jasmine.review:
Fresh tasting tea. The jasmine tea was excellent. The matcha tea was similar to Starbucks matcha latte but minus the syrup so it was more on the slightly bitter side. Hong Kong style tea was similar to the teas I get at HK cafes. Boba was soft with slightly chewy texture. Overall, I like the tea here but it is a bit more on the pricey range at $4-5 for a regular size. My only drawback from this place is the way they handle their honey or syrup because I could feel the stickiness from handling my cup. 

Maybe if you never had boba before, you would be mind blown because milk tea is awesome in general and you've been missing out your whole life. But if you visit boba shops a lot, Boba Guys doesn't really stand out in particular. They do have some interesting menu options that are different from your regular boba places.

Shop is quite small and there's four stools by the window counter. Definitely a cute hipster place for tourists to come check out and discover the world of boba and get that Instagram photo in. I hear lines can get pretty long. They even have a funny sign that advises customers to stand with "appropriate spacing as if you are at a middle school dance". Best to come at night when there is no wait since they close at 9/10 PM.

excerpts: I got their jasmine milk tea which is one of their most popular drinks according to yelp.
I felt like this drink was a little too watered down even with light ice.
jasmine.author: Shelly S.
jasmine.review:
A little disappointed in this place. From the long line outside of this place, I'd expect their drinks to be extraordinary. I'm very picky when it comes to boba drinks, especially coming from SoCal where there are boba shops literally in every block. 

From all the Instagram and snap chat pictures, I was looking forward to my visit here. Boba guys was nothing but ordinary. I got their jasmine milk tea which is one of their most popular drinks according to yelp. I felt like this drink was a little too watered down even with light ice. The drink wasn't too sweet which I actually prefer, but it lacked flavor from both milk and green tea. 

If you're a fruity type of person, you may not find anything on the menu that you like. They only have one drink that consists of fruit - Lychee green tea. 

Boba guys is most likely a one time visit for me. Now that I've tried it, I can cross that off my bucket list.

excerpts: I purchased two jasmine green teas with boba and I asked for extra boba as well.
This place is always so stingy with their boba
so I wanted more in my drink.
It's 50 cents for boba
so they charged me $1 since I wanted 2 servings of boba.
When they called my order, I went up to get my drinks
and I was so disappointed.
There was barely any boba in my drink and I asked the person behind the counter (black man with glasses) if there were 2 servings of boba in the drinks since I paid for extra.
He had the rudest tone, rolled his eyes, and just said "yes".
What kind of customer service is that?!?!
Also, why would you talk to another POC like that???
I paid for extra boba and I know that I didn't receive that.
And the tea was very watered down, it barely had any flavor!
It felt like I straight up drinking tap water with boba in it.
Today was the most disappointing experience and it's upsetting that I brought this to their attention
and they didn't bother fixing it.
Instead they chose to be so rude and disrespectful.
I won't be coming here any more
jasmine.author: Jasmine V.
jasmine.review:
Today was my 3rd and LAST time coming here. The first two times would have been worth 3 stars since the tea was alright, but the customer service was good. Today was the worst customer service I've received from this place. I purchased two jasmine green teas with boba and I asked for extra boba as well. This place is always so stingy with their boba so I wanted more in my drink. It's 50 cents for boba so they charged me $1 since I wanted 2 servings of boba. When they called my order, I went up to get my drinks and I was so disappointed. There was barely any boba in my drink and I asked the person behind the counter (black man with glasses) if there were 2 servings of boba in the drinks since I paid for extra. He had the rudest tone, rolled his eyes, and just said "yes". What kind of customer service is that?!?! Also, why would you talk to another POC like that??? I paid for extra boba and I know that I didn't receive that. And the tea was very watered down, it barely had any flavor! It felt like I straight up drinking tap water with boba in it. Today was the most disappointing experience and it's upsetting that I brought this to their attention and they didn't bother fixing it. Instead they chose to be so rude and disrespectful. I won't be coming here any more and I'll be sure to let my friends know to avoid this place.

Long story short: don't come here for the super over hyped watered down tea, average boba, and shitty customer service.

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea with scrambled almond jelly was exactly what my body craved.
jasmine.author: Ruth C.
jasmine.review: Jasmine milk tea with scrambled almond jelly was exactly what my body craved. (Kaya toast was just okay... the plush, thick slice of toast took a few minutes, and was a little conservative on coconut spread.) I caught them just before peak evening rush and was glad to control the sweetness towards the lower end of the scale. Good quality milk. Snagged one of the few stools to nosh for a few minutes before wading back out through the line of customers.

excerpts: I ordered: jasmine milk tea, Thai milk tea and strawberry tea fresca.
The quality of the drinks was just as delicious!
It was pure bliss to drink boba tea drinks right after our ceremony haha.
Every time I drink Thai milk tea, I will remember the wedding all over again.
jasmine.author: Ali N.
jasmine.review:
I had Boba Guys cater my summer wedding and it was AMAZING! 

For catering, I ordered 120 drinks for 142 guests. I was able to select 3 flavored drinks. I ordered: jasmine milk tea, Thai milk tea and strawberry tea fresca. The quality of the drinks was just as delicious! It was pure bliss to drink boba tea drinks right after our ceremony haha. All of our guests enjoyed it and raved about it even after the wedding. 

Thanks Boba Guys for coming to my wedding! Best decision ever. Every time I drink Thai milk tea, I will remember the wedding all over again.

excerpts: The cashier was very friendly and attentive in suggesting to get between the regular milk tea or the Jasmine.
He suggested Jasmine since it has less caffeine since it's so late in the night to drink milk tea.
jasmine.author: Cindy D.
jasmine.review:
