Came 30 minutes before closing, and had no line to wait through, so I was very pleased. The cashier was very friendly and attentive in suggesting to get between the regular milk tea or the Jasmine. He suggested Jasmine since it has less caffeine since it's so late in the night to drink milk tea. 

However, I was really craving regular milk tea, so I got the Classic Milk Tea 100% sweet, and my friend ordered the Thai Tea (asked for 100% sweet, but was told, they only make this in 75% sweet). My classic milk tea was made with organic milk and was delicious & very satisfying. The tea flavor was very strong and flavorful. The Thai tea's flavor was good, but not sweet enough like how most places are. 

Price is a bit on the higher end. Parking is very difficult to find in this area. 

But I highly recommend this spot and I will definitely be coming back!

excerpts: My top drinks that I order here are Thai Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk tea 50% sweet, Matcha Green Milk Tea, Rose Milk Tea, and Horchata!
jasmine.author: Michele G.
jasmine.review:
Visited this location many times. Coveniently a couple blocks away from Dolores Park.

This location is very small. It has extremely limited seating, which consists of one bench outside and four bar stool seats inside.

They sell merchandise like water bottles and bags. They also sell some snacks and sweets which is advertised by the cashier.

I believe this is the first location Boba Guys opened at.

Great service at this location. Staff was friendly.

Their drinks are very high quality. My favorite boba shop in the city. Their drinks have a tea-y taste instead of an artificial taste. 

They have many different milk options. Soy, Califa Almond, Straus Milk, and Oats milk which is a very nice selection.

Now about their Boba Balls! So delicious and addicting. Their boba balls are chewy, a tad sweet and overall good quality. I hate it when tapioca balls are super soft or mushy, it's gross. This place has by far one of the best tapioca balls.

My top drinks that I order here are Thai Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk tea 50% sweet, Matcha Green Milk Tea, Rose Milk Tea, and Horchata!

excerpts: I always get the Jasmine Green Tea (almond milk) at 50% sweetness with boba.
You pay about $1 more than most boba places, but hey, that SF rent is $$$$, so I get it.
The ONLY suggestion I'd make is to lighten up on the ice.
I paid for a 24oz, but probably only had about 12oz of actual liquid (if that) + the boba pearls at the bottoms.
So just ask for really light ice.
jasmine.author: Kristina M.
jasmine.review:
Overall pretty solid boba! Hella courteous staff with a minimalist/hipster vibe. Simple menu (which I like vs reading though a million options like at Quickly). I like how you can pick your level of sweetness. Every drink starts out as 100% sweet (like a can of soda), & then you can go down in incriminates of 25%. I always get the Jasmine Green Tea (almond milk) at 50% sweetness with boba. 
You pay about $1 more than most boba places, but hey, that SF rent is $$$$, so I get it. 
The ONLY suggestion I'd make is to lighten up on the ice. I paid for a 24oz, but probably only had about 12oz of actual liquid (if that) + the boba pearls at the bottoms. So just ask for really light ice. :)

excerpts: If you're a first timer I would recommend the regular milk tea or the jasmine milk tea!
jasmine.author: Nimeela D.
jasmine.review:
This is a great place to go when it's warm outside! They have enough flavors to please everyone's palates. If you're a first timer I would recommend the regular milk tea or the jasmine milk tea!

Note : this location is the only one that does NOT have the seasonal mango flavored drinks!

excerpts: I usually end up picking some fruity flavor from there (strawberry jasmine tea fresca, strawberry matcha, and peach green tea were all great).
jasmine.author: Christine L.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys is the only boba shop in the Mission, so the line is often pretty long. Weekend afternoons/nights are the worst. 

I'd say the sweetness is similar to the average boba tea, but I always get 25% sweetness because I don't like it that sweet. Boba is softer rather than firmer (which I like). 

They don't have a huge variety of drinks, but in a way it makes it seem more "high-class" and easy to choose. Before you order, make sure to check out the seasonal flavors on the side of the ordering counter. I usually end up picking some fruity flavor from there (strawberry jasmine tea fresca, strawberry matcha, and peach green tea were all great). 

Overall, it's a bit expensive for the price ($4-5), but if you're here, you probably don't have an easy alternative. At least you can Instagram a hipster pic of your tea on the pretty patterned wall outside. 

Note: Watch your step at the entrance. You can tell there were originally yellow markings to show that there's a step there, but it's worn off over time. They should probably repaint it!

excerpts: I order the jasmine milk tea with boba, and it is SO GOOD.
It's super creamy, but you can definitely taste the tea, and it's never watered down.
jasmine.author: Elena T.
jasmine.review:
When I visit SF, Boba guys is a must in places I have to visit.  I order the jasmine milk tea with boba, and it is SO GOOD.  It's super creamy, but you can definitely taste the tea, and it's never watered down.  The boba is also a perfect texture :)   

Note: Their drinks are super sweet, so I always get 75% sweetness (I think that's also what they normally recommend on getting)

The only downside to this location is that it's super small (although their other locations are on the smaller side also), so it can get pretty packed sometimes and the line can get pretty long.

excerpts:
We ordered:
-1 16 oz. iced Jasmine Milk Tea without toppings, organic milk, 25% sugar //
Asked for no ice, still got ice.
Jasmine tea flavor is super faint- overpowered by milk (at least 2/3 of the cup was milk instead).
jasmine.author: Hurjane V.
jasmine.review:
ERRR. Not worth the hype, TBH. 

Waited in line for around 20 minutes and was super excited since everyone seemed to be enjoying their drinks. 

We ordered:
-1 16 oz. iced Jasmine Milk Tea without toppings, organic milk, 25% sugar // Asked for no ice, still got ice. Jasmine tea flavor is super faint- overpowered by milk (at least 2/3 of the cup was milk instead). Also, organic milk tasted more like soymilk since it wasn't rich or creamy at all....a 1/5 drink.

-1 16 oz. iced HK Style Milk Tea with pearls, organic milk, 50% sugar // Condensed milk overkill- can't imagine what it would be if it was 100% sweetness! There was barely any boba and the boba was too stiff- not soft at all. It says "blended with condensed milk"...felt like I was eating straight out of the jar myself.

Pros:
+Fast service. Waited in line for 20 minutes, ordered in 1 minute, got the drink in 2 minutes. 
+Cute concept. Cute ant-eater, crisp interior. Good selection of basics on the menu!

Cons:
-Meh service. Lady looked piss the whole time...good thing I didn't tip. 
-Pricey. $8 for two drinks? I would rather spend my $8 on a cream tart at Tartine's. 

Tips/Observations:
-Why don't they have a stamp card system? Not that I would want one..but I'm sure there are die-hard fans here. 
-Small space. Definitely grab and go unless you manage to steal a spot by the window. 
-What is their signature drink here? 

Overall, not impressed. They can't even get the basic teas right....not even sure what more to expect.

Nice try, Boba Guys. May attempt to get it again at a different location...and try their swirly pink drink.

excerpts: My favorite is the Strawberry Jasmine fresca.
It's so refreshing and boba is done perfectly.
If only they expand down in Cupertino or San Jose!
jasmine.author: Halina H.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys is always on my mind whenever I make a trip to San Francisco!! Customer service is on point, no matter which location you go to. My favorite is the Strawberry Jasmine fresca. It's so refreshing and boba is done perfectly. 
If only they expand down in Cupertino or San Jose!

excerpts: Horchata and jasmine flavours were delicious, strawberry matcha latte was way too bitter for my liking.
jasmine.author: Kartik M.
jasmine.review: Good boba, but a bit overrated. Definitely don't think it's worth waiting the super long lines, unless your a visitor and/or it's your first time. Horchata and jasmine flavours were delicious, strawberry matcha latte was way too bitter for my liking.

excerpts: My girlfriend got the jasmine milk tea and absolutely loved it.
We haven't really been able to find it anywhere else back here on the east coast.
jasmine.author: Brian S.
jasmine.review: It is a little on the pricey side, but still good bobba. We didn't have a long wait when we went, walked right in and got it. I got my normal classic milk with bobba, and thought it was really good. My girlfriend got the jasmine milk tea and absolutely loved it. We haven't really been able to find it anywhere else back here on the east coast.

excerpts: This time I got a jasmine milk tea, 50% sweetness, with boba.
jasmine.author: Hayley D.
jasmine.review:
Every time I come here it's so so good. This time I got a jasmine milk tea, 50% sweetness, with boba. 

Staff was super nice, and my tea was ready super quick. Coming on the weekday is the way to go -- no line at all. On the weekends it takes around 30 min in line.

excerpts: I gave their jasmine tea a shot.
You have the option of choosing a topping, type of milk, and sweetness.
50% sweetness was enough to taste the jasmine flavor with a kick of sugar.
I have to be honest, the milk tea looked equivalent to murky swamp water.
It looked displeasing at first, but after the first sip, it tasted just all right.
I think all the hype is mainly about their so-called "grade-A balls.
jasmine.author: Rachelle Y.
jasmine.review:
The sign outside welcomed customers with, "come in and try our grade-A balls." I gave their jasmine tea a shot. You have the option of choosing a topping, type of milk, and sweetness. 50% sweetness was enough to taste the jasmine flavor with a kick of sugar. I have to be honest, the milk tea looked equivalent to murky swamp water. It looked displeasing at first, but after the first sip, it tasted just all right. I think all the hype is mainly about their so-called "grade-A balls." The consistency was sweet and chewy, aka any typical description of tapioca balls.  

Maybe it's the location, but the standards of this boba guys is mediocre.

excerpts: Their classics like the jasmine milk tea and the iced matcha latte are always delicious and a staple for me.
To me, their menus and choices are straightforward and easy to understand.
+ Iced matcha latte
jasmine.author: Angie N.
jasmine.review:
Definitely one of my favorite places for boba in the city. If you're trying bubble tea for the first time, go to Boba Guys and you won't be disappointed. I've had consistently good quality of tapioca and tea from this place. For sure 5 stars for the drinks and marketing, but had to knock off one star because of long lines and there's very little seating. This is a place to grab and go unless you come at a really random time. I wish there was more seating here so I could hang out while drinking my bubble tea.

This is one of the few regular bubble tea places that serve the Hong Kong style milk tea, which is black milk tea made with condensed milk. I really enjoy it as it's not too sweet (but I do usually get 50% sweetness on drinks here). They also serve a Horchata drink which is unique and good as well. Their classics like the jasmine milk tea and the iced matcha latte are always delicious and a staple for me. To me, their menus and choices are straightforward and easy to understand. Even first timers would be able to go through the bubble tea ordering process.

Positives:
+ Consistently good quality
+ Interesting marketing
+ Some unique drinks

Negatives:
- Pretty long lines
- Very little seating available

Recommend:
+ 50% sweetness
+ Hong Kong style milk tea 
+ Iced matcha latte

excerpts: I ordered a large jasmine milk tea with boba.
I find their jasmine milk tea really good, and their boba is made perfectly!
This is just my go-to choice from boba guys.
I chose organic milk and 75% sweet...
YUM.
There is always a line when I go, but it's never an unbearable wait.
The boba shop is small itself so the line looks long.
Def worth a try if you haven't!
jasmine.author: Lucy L.
jasmine.review: Rarely do I go to Boba guys due to sucky parking, however when I'm in the Mission, I'll stop by for my boba fix. I ordered a large jasmine milk tea with boba. I find their jasmine milk tea really good, and their boba is made perfectly! This is just my go-to choice from boba guys. I chose organic milk and 75% sweet... YUM. There is always a line when I go, but it's never an unbearable wait. The boba shop is small itself so the line looks long. Def worth a try if you haven't!

excerpts: Love the aardvark, love the interior, LOVE the Jasmine Milk Tea (at 75% sweetness)!
The lines can be heinous but boy is it worth it.
The staff is cute and friendly, but the boba is cuter and friendlier.
I went with the Jasmine Milk Tea with regular tapioca (bomb) and my boyfriend got the Horchata Milk Tea with regular tapioca which was equally dank.
jasmine.author: Nicole W.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys ROCKS. Love the aardvark, love the interior, LOVE the Jasmine Milk Tea (at 75% sweetness)! The lines can be heinous but boy is it worth it. The staff is cute and friendly, but the boba is cuter and friendlier. I went with the Jasmine Milk Tea with regular tapioca (bomb) and my boyfriend got the Horchata Milk Tea with regular tapioca which was equally dank. You can really taste the quality with that Strauss milk...

This place is awesome!

excerpts: My go to boba to use for comparing is Jasmine Green Milk Tea.
Boba Guys is able to make it just perfect!
I get it with 75% sugar (which is the recommended).
They are kind enough to ask if dairy is ok; since so many Asians are lactose intolerant.
If you could handle the dairy, then I'd recommend having the real stuff!
jasmine.author: Mo W.
jasmine.review: My go to boba to use for comparing is Jasmine Green Milk Tea. Boba Guys is able to make it just perfect! I get it with 75% sugar (which is the recommended). They are kind enough to ask if dairy is ok; since so many Asians are lactose intolerant. If you could handle the dairy, then I'd recommend having the real stuff!

excerpts: I always order the jasmine milk tea here, and both the drink and the tapioca are just perfect.
Beware of crazy lines during certain busy hours!
jasmine.author: Annie C.
jasmine.review: Something about their drinks is just so good. I always order the jasmine milk tea here, and both the drink and the tapioca are just perfect. Beware of crazy lines during certain busy hours!

excerpts: I've also tried the Jasmine Milk Tea, Horchata Milk Tea, and Classic Milk Tea, all are really good as well.
There's usually a line out the door which moves at a steady pace.
If you get the chance, check this place out!
They also have another location in Hayes Valley.
jasmine.author: Elaine N.
jasmine.review: I have to admit at first I was doubtful that boba guys was legit, to me it was just another hipster boba place in the mission. After my first visit my opinion was quickly changed, their teas are great, they have great staff, and they have really unique drinks. My go to is the Strawberry Matcha Latte, it comes out as a beautiful 3-layer drink of green, white, and pink. I've also tried the Jasmine Milk Tea, Horchata Milk Tea, and Classic Milk Tea, all are really good as well. There's usually a line out the door which moves at a steady pace. If you get the chance, check this place out! They also have another location in Hayes Valley.

excerpts: I got the Jasmine milk tea with boba, regular sweet.
The Jasmine milk tea was really good with just the right amount of sweetness.
I also taste the actual tea in my milk tea.
Which really impressed me.
The boba was just right.
Really really squishy.
Boba guys, keep up the great customer service and smiles.
You guys rock!
jasmine.author: Jonathan Z.
jasmine.review: Super cool place for boba. I was craving for boba after a long tiring day because I remember coming here couple years back but I wasn't sure if it was actually the boba guys I went too. But it turns out it was! I recognize the customer service's voice! I got the Jasmine milk tea with boba, regular sweet. The Jasmine milk tea was really good with just the right amount of sweetness. I also taste the actual tea in my milk tea. Which really impressed me. The boba was just right. Really really squishy. Boba guys, keep up the great customer service and smiles. You guys rock!

excerpts: This week I ordered a large jasmine milk tea (no boba, $4.25.)
Sweet & creamy, with a strong floral taste.
Quality tea, Straus organic milk, & simple syrup made in-house makes all the difference in flavor.
Totally hit the spot.
jasmine.author: Fancypants X.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys' cups read "we take boba and tea to the next level." They must've read my mind because my milk tea craving has been on a whole 'nother level recently; so much so that it has pretty much replaced my daily cup of coffee, no joke. 

Like other milk tea aficionados, I followed Boba Guys from their pop-up location in Ken Ken Ramen to now their very own space -- a small, modern storefront on 19th & Valencia. 

This week I ordered a large jasmine milk tea (no boba, $4.25.) Sweet & creamy, with a strong floral taste. Quality tea, Straus organic milk, & simple syrup made in-house makes all the difference in flavor. Totally hit the spot.

excerpts: My friend got the JMT (Jasmine Milk Tea), whereas I took a bold leap of faith and got the Horchata Milk Tea.
The price of their boba isn't really outrageous.
jasmine.author: Bryan W.
jasmine.review:
This was my second time trying Boba Guys in San Francisco and the experience just wasn't as good as I'd have hoped.

My friend and I were zooming around the city and were craving boba. I suggested Boba Guys since my friend had never tried this place before. I had checked out the location at Union Square before and was fine with their HK Milk Tea. So why not give this place a try?

Protip: if you are annoyed at trying to find parking, I recommend just turning your emergency lights on somewhere near the tea shop because you can get in and out really quickly.

We arrived right at 6pm (time they were supposed to close), but luckily they were still serving drinks. My friend got the JMT (Jasmine Milk Tea), whereas I took a bold leap of faith and got the Horchata Milk Tea. The price of their boba isn't really outrageous. For a normal 16 oz cup, it's about $3.75, which is decent.

My friend enjoyed her JMT, but I couldn't figure out for the life of me why I didn't really think my Horchata Milk Tea wasn't that good. I think it was because I kept thinking I was drinking horchata, but was overwhelmed by the amount of milk. This makes sense I guess, given the drink, but I've had Horchata Milk Tea before and it was better than this...

Even though my experience at Boba Guys was a bit subpar, I will probably come back again and try their other drinks. I still have yet to check out the Strawberry Matcha Late (one of their bests), so maybe next time?

tl;dr decent boba shop with prices that are not outrageous. Just avoid the Horchata

Drink well and prosper,

excerpts: It did not taste anything like a decaf black tea, but more like jasmine tea...
I could not tell what was special about this drink or this boba place from drinking this tea.
jasmine.author: Wendy F.
jasmine.review:
SO SWEET. Please have more less-sweet decaf drink options!!! 

This was my first time drinking boba in more than a year and I was a little disappointed.

I got the DECAF BLACK (50% sugar) because I wanted something decaffeinated (my body doesn't tolerate caffeine well). At first I was going to pick the HORCHATA, which is the most popular decaf drink on the menu, but I could NOT adjust the sugar level on that one so I went with the decaf black tea, which the girl at the store "recommended". Not sure if she really knows the drinks all that well yet. 

The decaf black was VERY SWEET at 50%. It did not taste anything like a decaf black tea, but more like jasmine tea...I could not tell what was special about this drink or this boba place from drinking this tea. I think this is why there is only one picture of that drink on Yelp right now (which is mine lol).

But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black. I feel like I was rigged. The rose tea had a very aromatic, flora scent, while the ice matcha was just beautiful to look at. 

Anyways, if I liked boba more I would have loved this place. Just sucks that I don't drink caffeinated that often.

excerpts: the jasmine milk tea is a close second, it's my go to at any boba shop but
boba guys do it right.
i enjoy the flavors and how well they compliment one another rather than the jasmine overpowering the milk tea, which seems to be a challenge at other boba shops.
jasmine.author: Caed Khiara S.
jasmine.review:
pretty much, if i was given the chance to have the location closer to where i am. i would spend a lot more money at boba guys, it's insane. i haven't tried any of their snacks, i'm basing this more of the drinks i've purchased or know from close friends or my significant other. i went to three of the ( insert the number of locations they have in sf here ) but i'm doing a review on this one based off of my recent trip.

i won't hold this against them because i understand making mistakes happen rarely or when there's new employees under training. been there, no hard feelings. they did get my order wrong but one of the employees were kind enough to make the drink i originally ordered once again. -- they made a green tea latte, the one i ordered was the strawberry green tea latte. they were completely understanding and considerate, truly appreciated the service despite the minor mistake!

i usually purchase the strawberry green tea latte, make sure to take a pic for ig to see and stir afterwards hah. i do like it, i enjoy the sweetness the strawberry gives and the slight bitterness of the green tea. the whole milk that's in between balances both flavors out.

the jasmine milk tea is a close second, it's my go to at any boba shop but boba guys do it right. i enjoy the flavors and how well they compliment one another rather than the jasmine overpowering the milk tea, which seems to be a challenge at other boba shops. plus, it must've been good if my boyfriend downed it during dinner.

if you're ever in the city, i would recommend trying out the thai tea and the other two beverages i mentioned. it's a small spot, it's not a place to hang with groups of people or even with one companion on the side. it's kind of a place where you get your drink and bounce to venture out the city with a refreshing drink between your hands. i've always enjoyed my drinks and the timing is never wrong, it will get busy. a line will build but you get your drinks as soon as possible despite that.

excerpts: My brother and I swear by one drink at every boba tea shop and it is the Jasmine Milk Tea.
Came here with the only intention of ordering Jasmine Milk Tea - while I typically like it 50% sweet, my crazy brother likes to ask for 150% sweet.
I could barely taste the Jasmine Tea in it!
Why??
Usually 50% sweet hits the spot, but for some reason, the drink had no flavor.
Not sweet.
No Jasmine.
What's up with that??
When I visit him in SoCal, you'll see me at Seven Leaves where Jasmine Milk Tea is done right.
jasmine.author: Jennifer L.
jasmine.review:
My brother and I swear by one drink at every boba tea shop and it is the Jasmine Milk Tea. As simple as it sounds, very few places can make it just right. 

Brother recently came up from LA and we paid this place a visit. Came here with the only intention of ordering Jasmine Milk Tea - while I typically like it 50% sweet, my crazy brother likes to ask for 150% sweet. 

Basically, tried it. Don't like it. I could barely taste the Jasmine Tea in it! Why?? Usually 50% sweet hits the spot, but for some reason, the drink had no flavor. Not sweet. No Jasmine. What's up with that?? So confused... 

Side note: Brother told me I ordered the drink all wrong - can't mess with the original taste apparently...unless you want more sweet, of course. Fine, I'll give it a another chance. 

SO I gave it a second try this past weekend. Came back with my BFF yesterday and ordered the same drink. Original. Regular sweet, regular ice. Results = omg, still no. The original is wayy too sweet. I took one sip of it and didn't want it anymore. All I could taste was the sugar and no tea flavor. 

All in all, my brother loves you guys, but I don't. When I visit him in SoCal, you'll see me at Seven Leaves where Jasmine Milk Tea is done right. 

P.S. Service was friendly and drinks were made quickly. Drinks were a def no go though. 

Two stars for the service. Zero for the flavor in drinks.

excerpts: Got both the jasmine green tea and the lychee.
Really good!
Came in at the right time, no line out the door.
jasmine.author: Myleen R.
jasmine.review: Got both the jasmine green tea and the lychee. Really good! Came in at the right time, no line out the door.

excerpts: I've tried their HK style (condensed milk!!), thai tea (condensed milk!!), classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea... all were delicious!
(I'm passing on the coconut green milk tea.. it was blegh to me..)
I love how you can customize what type of milk you want - regular, almond, soy, and how their toppings are homemade!
(Their boba is not homemade, but they are indeed soft and chewy as advertised!)
jasmine.author: Kris C.
jasmine.review:
My yelp rating of Boba Guys varies from a 4 star vs. a 5 star, just how my drinks here vary from good vs. realllllllly good. 

Inconsistency is something that a few others and I have noticed about this place, and that's probably the only reason why my rating shifts from a 4 and 5.

I usually order the Iced Matcha Green Tea Latte with soy milk! The first time I ordered it, it was the best I've had from here... creamy and delicious... still able to taste just the slightest bit of bitterness from the green tea, but the overall sweetness from their homemade syrup. The inconsistency that I mentioned about is the way they whisk their matcha powder. I understand that it may be hard to whisk extrrreeeeemely thorough, but I sometimes end up drinking balls and clumps of matcha powder, which you can imagine is very bitter and unpleasant. It makes the experience of drinking the drink a little dreadful to be honest. (That sounds very dramatic and sad haha.. but there's some truth to it!)   

That really is the only gripe I have about this place! I've tried their HK style (condensed milk!!), thai tea (condensed milk!!), classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea... all were delicious! (I'm passing on the coconut green milk tea.. it was blegh to me..) I love how you can customize what type of milk you want - regular, almond, soy, and how their toppings are homemade! (Their boba is not homemade, but they are indeed soft and chewy as advertised!)

excerpts: My husband and I got the Jasmine Milk Tea and Strawberry Matcha Latte to share.
But I ended up basically drinking all of the Strawberry Matcha Latte since it was SO GOOD.
The Jasmine Milk Tea was good but not as unique.
The place was small so we took the drinks to go.
jasmine.author: Christine K.
jasmine.review: I had been wanting to try Boba Guys for the longest time because I saw it all over food Instagrams and was so happy to finally try it! My husband and I got the Jasmine Milk Tea and Strawberry Matcha Latte to share. But I ended up basically drinking all of the Strawberry Matcha Latte since it was SO GOOD. The Jasmine Milk Tea was good but not as unique. The place was small so we took the drinks to go.

excerpts: We got the jasmine milk tea with tapioca: organic milk + 75% sugar.
It costed us $4.50 for the 16 oz and $5.50 for the 24 oz.
The drink was good, but nothing special.
We waited around 30 minutes in line and the drink was honestly NOT worth the wait.
jasmine.author: Jen S.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys was good, but really nothing special. I personally didn't see what all the "hype" was so it was quite underwhelming for me.

I think there's always a line out the door at this place because 1) it's small and 2) there's only one person at the register. No more than 4 people can stand in line inside the store so obviously the line will go out the door and there's only ONE person at the register so obviously the order process will be slow, which consequently leads to a long line.

We got the jasmine milk tea with tapioca: organic milk + 75% sugar. It costed us $4.50 for the 16 oz and $5.50 for the 24 oz. The drink was good, but nothing special. We waited around 30 minutes in line and the drink was honestly NOT worth the wait. Good thing was, our drinks came out RIGHT after we ordered, so we did not have to wait long at all for our drinks once we ordered.

4/5 stars because I would not go out of my way to go to a Boba Guys. However, if I'm around the area and there is no line, I would get a drink here. Overall, this place is really nothing special and I don't see what the "hype" is, but at least now I can say that I've tried Boba Guys and I'm able to make a conscious decision to not wait in line ever again!

TL;DR: Drink is good. Line is not worth. But if you've never had, you should try.

excerpts: Also tried the jasmine milk tea here
and it was pretty good,
jasmine.author: Kim T.
jasmine.review:
I was so excited to finally see what the hype was all about and was thoroughly disappointed.

I ordered an iced lychee green milk tea with boba. It was nothing special. The drink itself did not taste like lychee at all, was bitter, and had an odd aftertaste. The pearls, which I had heard were heavenly, tasted normal. 
Also tried the jasmine milk tea here and it was pretty good, but still nothing special to rave about. 

Small but cute aesthetic interior & really good service but the drinks itself were subpar. Maybe next time I'll come back to try the iced matcha latte since I've heard good reviews about that.

excerpts: I ordered a jasmine milk tea and I loved it.
This is my favorite boba chain out here in the Bay Area and I recommend it to everyone all the time because it's absolutely the best.
jasmine.author: Kristen L.
jasmine.review:
I ordered a jasmine milk tea and I loved it. This is my favorite boba chain out here in the Bay Area and I recommend it to everyone all the time because it's absolutely the best. I'm not sure why this location has a lower rating compared to the others, but I didn't think it tasted any different from the other locations I've tried. 

-Kristen

5 stars from Kristen, Edmund wasn't here to rate.

excerpts:
- Jasmine milk tea with boba
- Horchata with boba
- Muscat oolong milk tea with boba
My jasmine milk tea felt very watered down.
I couldn't really taste the tea.
I know people might say it tastes watered down because they use milk instead of creamer, but that shouldn't affect the tea strength, just the creaminess.
I had adjusted mine to be no ice and 25% sugar, too.
jasmine.author: Eifeh S.
jasmine.review:
If you're looking for trendy, hipster boba, Boba Guys is for you. If you're looking for authentic, Taiwan-style boba, do not expect to get it here. 

I think that living in Taiwan has made me hypercritical of boba in the US. That said, I can still appreciate boba here. With all the hype around Boba Guys, I was very skeptical. Now that I've been, I can say that I was unimpressed. 

- Jasmine milk tea with boba
- Horchata with boba
- Muscat oolong milk tea with boba

I went with three friends: all of us of Taiwanese decent, all of us have lived in Taiwan. We all felt the tea was very bland and the boba itself too sweet. My jasmine milk tea felt very watered down. I couldn't really taste the tea. I know people might say it tastes watered down because they use milk instead of creamer, but that shouldn't affect the tea strength, just the creaminess. I had adjusted mine to be no ice and 25% sugar, too. My other friends also felt the teas were watered down and the drinks too sweet. 

My friend complained about the cups. The lids are a little annoying and pop off if you squeeze the cup. Also, the tea kind of goes everywhere when you try putting the straw in. 

I feel like Boba Guys is targeted at a very specific group of people: the trendy, hip crowd. Boba isn't meant to be fancy and describing it as "heirloom tea with organic milk" only adds to the annoyingness of Boba Guys. But that's just me. I mean, boba wasn't created to be some healthy, pretentious drink, but that seems to be how they're trying to market it here. 

Anyways, boba goodness might be subjective. As long as you're not looking for a CoCo or 50嵐, you can try Boba Guys and decide for yourselves. Personally, I won't be back. There is better boba in the city.

excerpts: I particularly enjoyed the jasmine flavor, taro, and Thai iced tea.
Pleasant and fast service as well
, I wish this was the kind of place I had on campus ( or in Illinois in general ), it would make a lot of students so happy!
jasmine.author: Emma H.
jasmine.review: Wow, I didn't know that I was missing such good boba until I came here. Most of the places I've gone to you take a gamble if you get Boba as to whether they'll be chewy and FRESH or hard as rocks and just sit in your stomach. We went to Boba guys twice for days and, between four drinks everything was perfect. I particularly enjoyed the jasmine flavor, taro, and Thai iced tea. Pleasant and fast service as well, I wish this was the kind of place I had on campus ( or in Illinois in general ), it would make a lot of students so happy!

excerpts: Thai,  horchata, rose, green, black, milk, chai, jasmine, and Hong Kong.
Thai tea was classic, tasty, sweet, everything you want.
Classic milk tea was for lack of better words...
Classic, a little low on sweetness.
Hong Kong was allright, tasted like a mix of classic and Thai tea.
Horchata: "it nibbled on my tastebuds"
, it was cinnamony, everything you expect from horchata.
**cant change Thai tea sweetness, premade.
jasmine.author: Himmat S.
jasmine.review:
Was hankering for some boba after dinner on Valencia. A friend suggested this place as she had been here before and said it was good. 

Cafe: funny signs and quirky sayings are inviting as soon as you walk in. Like a lot of places in sf it's a pretty small standing area and seating bar area for about 2 or 3 people. 

Menu: much different and simpler than any boba place I've been too. The items on the menu are basic teas: Thai,  horchata, rose, green, black, milk, chai, jasmine, and Hong Kong. 

Toppings: tapioca balls (boba balls), almond jelly, grass jelly.  Tried the grass jelly and almond milk on the side, the almond jelly tasted like the inside of a coconut ( a little earthy, jiggly and like almond lol), the grass jelly was a little better and more tasteless but both I wouldn't put in my drink. 

Taste/order: Ordered everything on the menu. Boba itself was chewy and fresh, save a few old hard ones that got mixed in. Thai tea was classic, tasty, sweet, everything you want. Classic milk tea was for lack of better words... Classic, a little low on sweetness. Hong Kong was allright, tasted like a mix of classic and Thai tea. Horchata: "it nibbled on my tastebuds", it was cinnamony, everything you expect from horchata. Rose: pretty decent actually, surprised me with the sweet little kick it had. 

Service: very friendly. The lady at the cashier was patient and understanding, she probably had dealt with confusion about the menu before. 

Drink sizes: 16oz and 24oz 

*can switch milks around in drinks: almond milk instead of regular, other options, a lot of boba places don't have. 

**cant change Thai tea sweetness, premade. 

3 stars because old boba balls threw me off, drink choice was different but nothing was amazing for me, nothing I couldn't get from a different place for less price, oh yeah and it was a bit pricey for no reason, couldn't change the sweetness of my favorite drink. Imo if you are a more specialized stop like this, make the teas amazing :) 

Check me out on Instagram! @themodelsingh

excerpts: I've tried the strawberry fresca jasmine tea, classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and lychee green tea.
All were good except for the lychee green tea... there was no lychee flavor and tasted a little weird...
Definitely try their milk tea drinks instead.
Their most popular drinks are the classic milk tea and jasmine milk tea.
This place won't disappoint.
I also love their homemade almond jelly topping!
Add this to your drink!
jasmine.author: Kimberly H.
jasmine.review:
Definitely one of the better boba drink places around. 

I've tried the strawberry fresca jasmine tea, classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and lychee green tea. All were good except for the lychee green tea... there was no lychee flavor and tasted a little weird... Definitely try their milk tea drinks instead. You can adjust the sweetness level as well. 

Their most popular drinks are the classic milk tea and jasmine milk tea. This place won't disappoint. I also love their homemade almond jelly topping! Add this to your drink! (+50c)

excerpts: The classic and the jasmine milk tea was bland, watery, and tasteless.
Why are you skimping on the ice?
jasmine.author: Owie N.
jasmine.review:
Mixed reviews for this place so I will give my two cents as well...

The Bad:

1) No more ice matcha latte on a Saturday afternoon. One would think you would be fully stocked on the weekend especially SATURDAY!!!
2) Lackluster pearl drinks.
3) Slow much??? There was not even a line. 

The REALLY BAD:

1) You know it was awfully bad when your WHITE boy think it's bad.
2) The classic and the jasmine milk tea was bland, watery, and tasteless. Why are you skimping on the ice? 
3) Real tea, not powder forms please!

Dear Boba Guys,

Please keep your balls together. You left me underwhelmed with your over-hyped pearl drinks to only be in the trash halfway finish. I always finish my pearl drinks, but not this time. What a shame.

excerpts: I usually go for the more "traditional" teas like Jasmine and Earl Grey, but I love their Horchata and Lavender Black as well!
I LOVE that they use real, loose-leaf teas.
I also appreciate that they use real milk and even offer dairy-free options for the lactose intolerant who still want to enjoy milk tea.
Their drinks taste freshly made and high quality.
They are also one of the few places I've found that offer almond pudding (house made) as one of their toppings.
If you enjoy almond pudding like I do, definitely give it a try with your drink here!
I really love it in my Jasmine Milk Tea.
If you're a milk tea connoisseur, this place is DEFINITELY worth checking out!
jasmine.author: Carole Y.
jasmine.review:
My favorite boba joint to date!

Their menu offers a variety of teas, but it's not so extensive that indecisive people like me get perplexed just looking at it. I usually go for the more "traditional" teas like Jasmine and Earl Grey, but I love their Horchata and Lavender Black as well! I LOVE that they use real, loose-leaf teas. I also appreciate that they use real milk and even offer dairy-free options for the lactose intolerant who still want to enjoy milk tea. Their drinks taste freshly made and high quality. 
They are also one of the few places I've found that offer almond pudding (house made) as one of their toppings. If you enjoy almond pudding like I do, definitely give it a try with your drink here! I really love it in my Jasmine Milk Tea.
If you're a milk tea connoisseur, this place is DEFINITELY worth checking out!

excerpts: Since it was my first time, I went with the regular Jasmine Milk Tea.
jasmine.author: Amanda K.
jasmine.review:
I think I've been spoiled by all the boba selection in Socal D:

Since it was my first time, I went with the regular Jasmine Milk Tea. The tea here was good quality and had a fresh taste but didn't really leave an impression in terms of flavor or novelty. 

Props for good hype and marketing though!

*Also parking is a struggggle because the area has lots of shops and restaurants around (but then again where in SF is it easy to park haha)

excerpts:
I've tried two items at this location:

+ Jasmine milk tea, iced with whole milk, 50% sweetness, $3.50
The jasmine on the other hand was very fragrant and floral, and although it still tasted a bit watered down, I enjoyed it way more than the Classic.
jasmine.author: Noimee L.
jasmine.review:
$8 for two cups of disappointment. Wah wah wahhhh.

Now, I'm not a boba snob by any means, but I'm gonna try to stay away from this location from now on. My last visit here was mediocre and unsatisfying to say the least. 

I've tried two items at this location:

+ Jasmine milk tea, iced with whole milk, 50% sweetness, $3.50
+ Classic milk tea, iced with almond milk, 50% sweetness, $3.50

Boba texture was inconsistent throughout both drinks--- a mad turn off for me. While some of the balls were good, others were disgustingly hard to chew. I was a bit confused. Were the bobaristas just having a bad day, or are the boba gods just testing me?

I also found the flavor of the Classic Milk Tea boring and a little G rated. I was expecting a more potent black tea sensation to seduce and satiate my olfactory receptors then cleanse and caress my taste buds, but nope. My drink was super watery and I could barely taste the tea -_- 

To make matters worse, there were little pieces of almond jelly floating around my drink that did not belong there. It didn't really do much for the taste but it did look reaaally weird, like tiny flakes of dandruff. Who wants to see dandruff in their boba drink? Surely, not I. And once again, I fall into a state of disappointed confusion. Why boba guys, why.

The jasmine on the other hand was very fragrant and floral, and although it still tasted a bit watered down, I enjoyed it way more than the Classic. Not sure if there were any rogue almond jelly pieces in this drink though because the milk may have camouflaged it. 

The good:

*Thumbs up for organic milk and customization options! Not many boba places offer soy/almond milk swatches. 

*Pretty quick service! It gets pretty busy here but you'll get your drink in less than ten minutes.

The bad:

*Claustrophobes beware. Not very roomy inside.

*Inconsistent boba. Some chewy, some hard, some inedible. 

*Poor overall drink quality. I didn't ask for almond jelly, yet pieces of it still managed to find its way into my drink. Whaddahail.


*Oh and good luck finding parking, ha.


The end:


I was ready to fall in love with you, Boba Guys. But the chemistry was just not there.  Whatevs. To play it safe next time I'll be going to the Union Square location instead. Peaaace.

excerpts: I also tried their jasmine milk tea with boba that was pretty yummy.
The boba is perfectly soft and chewy.
I appreciate that they use high quality teas and milks (organic).
The only reason I had to knock it down a star is because I didn't like the regular (black) milk tea very much.
It tasted bland and watery to me.
But overall, a great boba place.
I want to try the whole menu 0_o
jasmine.author: Tiffany O.
jasmine.review:
Oh man...I wish they would open one of these in SoCal! I'm so glad I made the drive out here despite the traffic and parking because I love some good boba.
I got the muscat oolong  milk tea with almond jelly (75% sweet). It was a really amazing combination :) And quite different- I've never had muscat (grapes) in milk tea before. They also make their almond jelly and grass jelly in house which makes it extra amazing. I also tried their jasmine milk tea with boba that was pretty yummy. The boba is perfectly soft and chewy. I appreciate that they use high quality teas and milks (organic). The only reason I had to knock it down a star is because I didn't like the regular (black) milk tea very much. It tasted bland and watery to me. But overall, a great boba place. I want to try the whole menu 0_o

excerpts: This time I tried a simple classic: Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.
You can usually tell if a milk tea place is good if their jasmine milk tea is good... and this place is good.
I'm still a bigger fan of Ashas (has an SF and Berkeley location)
jasmine.author: Shannon L.
jasmine.review:
I happened to run into this Boba Guys location on the way to Dolores Park and had to grab a drink.  

This time I tried a simple classic: Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.  You can usually tell if a milk tea place is good if their jasmine milk tea is good... and this place is good.  I'm still a bigger fan of Ashas (has an SF and Berkeley location) but Boba Guys is always a great idea if you're in the neighborhood.   

I had a sip of my friend's coffee milk tea.  I thought it tasted good, but wouldn't choose that drink here.  There's much more interesting and better tasting drinks.  

If you want something super Instagrammable and yummy, I highly suggest the matcha latte with strawberry and boba.

excerpts: The jasmine milk tea and matcha latte with normal sweetness are both my favorites!
Although every time I order a drink they always taste a little different, I wish there was a little more consistency in how sweet the drinks are.
But they do seem nice enough to adjust drinks
(I just never stick around to do it because it tends to be crowded)!
Anyways, love boba guys and will continue to support!
jasmine.author: Jenny E.
jasmine.review: The jasmine milk tea and matcha latte with normal sweetness are both my favorites! Although every time I order a drink they always taste a little different, I wish there was a little more consistency in how sweet the drinks are. But they do seem nice enough to adjust drinks (I just never stick around to do it because it tends to be crowded)! Anyways, love boba guys and will continue to support!

excerpts: so I took it back and had them replace it with Jasmine milk tea which was decent.
I'm still a fan of their actual boba, but sad to say the quality has gone down.
I expect more especially if I'm paying over $4 for a drink.
Good service though.
I appreciate that they've replaced my drink every time I wasn't satisfied with no questions asked.
jasmine.author: Stephanie G.
jasmine.review: I don't know what happened, but it's definitely not as good as it used to be. They've become inconsistent. Their horchata (my old favorite) has tasted off the past two times I ordered it. Just didn't have enough spice to it or something so I took it back and had them replace it with Jasmine milk tea which was decent. I'm still a fan of their actual boba, but sad to say the quality has gone down. I expect more especially if I'm paying over $4 for a drink. Good service though. I appreciate that they've replaced my drink every time I wasn't satisfied with no questions asked.

excerpts: I'm usually just a simple regular jasmine milk tea with no toppings or passion/lychee or strawberry mango with real fruit buts kinda gal.
We literally buy milk tea every week sometimes 3 times starting from Friday - Sunday and sometimes it can come out to be as muchh as a car payment per month!
jasmine.author: Jennie D.
jasmine.review:
The hype is real and the line is worth the wait.  I'm usually just a simple regular jasmine milk tea with no toppings or passion/lychee or strawberry mango with real fruit buts kinda gal.  We literally buy milk tea every week sometimes 3 times starting from Friday - Sunday and sometimes it can come out to be as muchh as a car payment per month!    I don't like to try anything new or any other flavors but these below is purdyyyy GOOD!

Matcha tea 
Strawberry matcha
Thai tea

All YUMZ and all natural and organic is such a plus!!!
They even ask you what kind of milk you want - regular, low fat or soy milk too!

Love!

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea with pearls and it was good!
It wasn't as sweet as other places
and I didn't even have to ask to reduce the sugar!
I liked it a lot :D the pearls were chewy and delicious.
One of the better ones that I've tried!
I enjoyed my little adventure for sure.
Plus the cashier was kinda cute
so I gave him a tip lol
jasmine.author: Lydia K.
jasmine.review:
So I was coming back from work and well Bart got stuck. So I got off and a friend was going to pick me up. I saw that boba guys was .3 miles away from me so I decided why not. I heard about boba guys before and wanted to try since last year but am never in the city. 

I got the jasmine milk tea with pearls and it was good! It wasn't as sweet as other places and I didn't even have to ask to reduce the sugar! I liked it a lot :D the pearls were chewy and delicious. One of the better ones that I've tried! I enjoyed my little adventure for sure. Plus the cashier was kinda cute so I gave him a tip lol the drink was $4

Def going back to try other flavors!

excerpts: Favorites are Earl Grey from the slow bar, Matcha Green Tea Latte, and Jasmine Milk Tea.
All delicioso!
Sucks that this place is $5 a cup though :(
They should consider doing a stamp card like Quickly's and all the other boba places!
jasmine.author: Angela L.
jasmine.review:
For the most part this place is pretty consistent. I've sometimes had waaaay too sweet drinks, and then when I ask for less sugar, they're like super watered down.

Favorites are Earl Grey from the slow bar, Matcha Green Tea Latte, and Jasmine Milk Tea. All delicioso! Sucks that this place is $5 a cup though :( They should consider doing a stamp card like Quickly's and all the other boba places!

excerpts: The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea.
There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer.
There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly.
I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%.
The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly.
Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom
jasmine.author: Milton F.
jasmine.review:
Decided to come to this place on a whim. My fiance and I just finished having brunch in Redwood city and had some time to kill before we headed over to Fort Mason for APE 2014 (Alternative Press Expo). As we passed by we noticed a few people in line, but not too bad. 

Finding parking in the mission is always a challenge, so keep in mind you may have to circle a few times since there aren't too many parking garages around the area. We finally found parking 5 blocks away and made our way over. There's not a big menu selection so it was not too hard to decide what to get. 

They only serve strictly milk tea in various forms, no fruit milk tea, or fruity drinks. The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea. There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer. There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly. You can also adjust the sweetness level to your liking (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%)

I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%. The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly. Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom and you'll get a huge serving of sugar if you don't. 

All and all, it's a nice place to get milk teas, albeit a bit out of the way for me. For Boba it's a bit on the pricier side.. about $4-4.50 depending if you get addons. I'd come back if I was in the area.

excerpts: I've tried their Classic Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, and HK Style Milk Tea.
I've loved all of them so far.
The Jasmine Milk Tea is creamy yet fragrant.
My go-to is going to be the HK Style Milk Tea.
I grew up drinking that while frequenting HK cafes in San Francisco.
It tastes just like it, and while I do have a slight intolerance for condensed milk, I will go out of my way just to have it whenever I'm near a Boba Guy's establishment!
jasmine.author: Theresa L.
jasmine.review:
You really can't go wrong with Boba Guys.

I've been to all their locations, even to their other one in Brisbane called the Burrow. I've tried their Classic Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, and HK Style Milk Tea. I've loved all of them so far. The Jasmine Milk Tea is creamy yet fragrant. My go-to is going to be the HK Style Milk Tea. I grew up drinking that while frequenting HK cafes in San Francisco. It tastes just like it, and while I do have a slight intolerance for condensed milk, I will go out of my way just to have it whenever I'm near a Boba Guy's establishment! Quality is always great here.

Wait time is usually quick. The bobaristas listen in on your order and usually start on it right away if there's no crazy rush.

excerpts: Jasmine Milk Tea, 50% sweet with boba but was sadly super disappointed.
The boba was chunked together (about 10-15 bobas) and only half of the boba in my cup was sip-able through the straw.
jasmine.author: Lauren K.
jasmine.review:
I've loved Boba Guys for the past couple of years and I'm completely obsessed with the Stockton Street location but had to opt for the Mission location since the other one wasn't taking Postmates orders. I Postmates whenever I'm unable to get the boba myself. 

Yesterday night, I ordered my usual drink- Jasmine Milk Tea, 50% sweet with boba but was sadly super disappointed. The boba was chunked together (about 10-15 bobas) and only half of the boba in my cup was sip-able through the straw. My boyfriend got the thai iced tea and he literally fished out the boba and split them apart manually and put them back in the cup. I found it pretty unacceptable especially since we paid $10 just for the delivery (yes, I know it's not boba guy's fault for the expensive delivery cost but I wanted to show how much of dedicated Boba Guys fan/drinker I was that I'm willing to spend extra just to get it) and $10 for the 2 drinks. The tea itself was watery and not sweet at all. It felt like I was straight drinking the half and half milk with some water thrown in and chunky boba at the bottom.

I will never order from this location again and will opt for the more consistent, Stockton location.

excerpts: I had the Jasmine Milk Tea (regular milk, regular sweetness) and it was PERFECT.
I've never had a milk tea where the taste of the actual tea overpowered the amount of sugar in the drink.
jasmine.author: Reena P.
jasmine.review:
REAL tea + Strauss Milk = one of the best milk teas I've had in a really long time!  I'm kinda bummed this place doesn't have better reviews.  I had the Jasmine Milk Tea (regular milk, regular sweetness) and it was PERFECT.  I've never had a milk tea where the taste of the actual tea overpowered the amount of sugar in the drink.  It didn't taste powdery or artificial at all.

The tiny spot makes it slightly difficult to wait around for your drink in, but we happened to be there when the line wasn't long at all.  The staff was not so attentive and didn't greet or make small talk.  It was a really simple, Hi, what can I get you? and to the point service.

If it was a little closer, I'd definitely frequent here more often, but I'm happy to know there is a great boba spot that tastes like tea in the Mission!

excerpts: I've been to the Stockton location a few times and tried different drinks such as classic, jasmine, earl grey, and oolong all with regular sweetness, less ice, and boba.
Hojicha is a stronger version of jasmine tea
so I was expecting more flavor.
jasmine.author: Danae L.
jasmine.review:
Their classic milk tea is awesome and I should probably stick with that from now on.

I've been to the Stockton location a few times and tried different drinks such as classic, jasmine, earl grey, and oolong all with regular sweetness, less ice, and boba.
Hojicha is a stronger version of jasmine tea so I was expecting more flavor. I'm guessing this tea isn't their forte since I barely tasted any tea. 

If you have a choice, I would recommend visiting the Stockton location instead. There are more pedestrians given that it's near Union Square.

excerpts: Another favorite is the soy jasmine milk tea.
jasmine.author: Cecille W.
jasmine.review:
I love this place so much, I would visit every single day if it wasn't so far from where I live. It's funny because in the front they have a sign that says "Come in a taste our grade-A balls". And let me tell you THEY REALLY ARE GRADE-A. Definitely the best boba I've ever had - if you like the sweet, extra chewy kind (soft boba lovers this is not for you). My favorite is their strawberry matcha latte, I don't know any other place that makes a drink like this. It has the perfect amount of sweetness and strawberry flavor. I'm a sucker for matcha anything so I freaking love  this and their original matcha latte). Another favorite is the soy jasmine milk tea. 

Customer service is awesome as well. One of the first times I went they messed up my order and it wasn't that big of a deal to me, but they gave me two waffles :D I'm such a big fan they gave me some Boba Guy pins too LOL. Anyways, must try if you're in the area.

excerpts: Got the Jasmine Milk Tea drink with Grass Jelly - w/ Almond Milk and 75% sweetness!
jasmine.author: Wing L.
jasmine.review:
You can't miss this place with the little sign hanging outside! Place inside is pretty small and there's usually a line too. The line goes by pretty fast though!

Came here on a Saturday afternoon with my boyfriend and we shared a drink. Got the Jasmine Milk Tea drink with Grass Jelly - w/ Almond Milk and 75% sweetness!

Basically, you pick:
- Type of drink (what kind of milk tea you want)
- Toppings (boba, grass jelly, almond jelly)
- Type of milk (whole milk, soy milk, almond milk)
- Level of sweetness (0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%)

I think 75% was pretty good, not too sweet and you still get the tea flavor. The grass jelly was a little firmer than I liked it.

Staff is super friendly and they use Square for credit card transactions - makes thing super easy! They sell Boba Guys merch here too and they also have homemade cotton candy! They usually always have samples when you purchase boba - so try some. The Li Hing Pineapple cotton candy flavor was tasty and different!

excerpts: They only had two options for milk tea back then, Classic Milk Tea or Jasmine.
I got the classic milk tea which was pretty good and boba's texture was perfect.
I didn't even know they had mason jars, but I had mine to go
jasmine.author: Stephanie L.
jasmine.review:
I remember the first time I had boba guys. It was literally a hole in the wall place that sold Japanese curry and milk tea. Sounds a bit questionable right? I remember it was raved about back then too and mention of long lines. When I got there, it was empty except for one customer helping themselves to delicious smelling japanese curry. I literally thought I went to the wrong place. I asked the worker if this was Boba Guys and they said yes. They only had two options for milk tea back then, Classic Milk Tea or Jasmine. I got the classic milk tea which was pretty good and boba's texture was perfect. I didn't even know they had mason jars, but I had mine to go so of course I didn't get one.

Now I recently came to the new location. Based on reviews, I tried the muskat oolong milk tea, it's very unique and it wasn't bad. The only downside was it was a tad too sweet for me (will ask for half sweet in the future). But the tapioca had perfect consistency, it was nice and chewy and sweet. I will definitely come back to try their other selections of milk tea. I really like their idea of the slow bar (yes, they use freshly brewed tea :O amazeballs). 

They didn't have macarons that day :( but I tried their cotton candy and it was pretty good.

The place itself is very small, more like a grab and go place. They have very limited seating. It's also in the mission and parking can be a bit difficult. But at least this new location is hard to miss and you can actually tell it's a boba joint.

Will definitely be back.

excerpts: Jasmine MT is also good!
And the service is great!
Love the workers !!
jasmine.author: Rachel E.
jasmine.review: Not a big fan of matcha green tea, but this was very yummy and good! I do recommend boba guys bc they have a different taste compared to your typical boba spots! Definitely #1 on my list of boba places! Jasmine MT is also good! And the service is great! Love the workers !!

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea with boba, which was just alright.
The milk tea wasn't strong enough I guess, so it tasted watered down.
The boba was chewy and was fine.
I mean service wise
, it's good.
I just don't really understand the hype.
I don't think I'll be going to this location anymore.
It's really nothing special to me, but I wanted to give it a second chance.
Stopped by on a Thursday late afternoon and the place wasn't too crowded.
All in all, I'd go somewhere else to get your boba fix, but if you're in the area I guess why not.
jasmine.author: Maggie W.
jasmine.review: It might just be this location, but it didn't hit the spot. I got the jasmine milk tea with boba, which was just alright. The milk tea wasn't strong enough I guess, so it tasted watered down. The boba was chewy and was fine. I mean service wise, it's good. I just don't really understand the hype. I don't think I'll be going to this location anymore. It's really nothing special to me, but I wanted to give it a second chance. Stopped by on a Thursday late afternoon and the place wasn't too crowded. All in all, I'd go somewhere else to get your boba fix, but if you're in the area I guess why not. You could ask them to fix your preferred sweetness level and they do have some things you can buy, such as cotton candy or teas. They do have a few chairs as well.

excerpts: I had a few sips of friends' Jasmine Milk Tea and Hong Kong Milk tea, but was equally unimpressed.
The tea flavor tasted like it had been watered down and relied on the sugar to overcompensate.
jasmine.author: Tony P.
jasmine.review:
I guess the high expectations I had of Boba Guys going in made my experience average at best. I got the horchata with pearls (4.25); honestly there's no way to make sugary, cinnamon-y milk taste bad, but it wasn't anything special. If you've ever drank the milk after eating Cinnamon Toast Crunch, the horchata was nearly indistinguishable. I had a few sips of friends' Jasmine Milk Tea and Hong Kong Milk tea, but was equally unimpressed. The tea flavor tasted like it had been watered down and relied on the sugar to overcompensate. I will say the pearls had a nice chewiness and slight sweetness which is what I look for in good pearls.

I would say try it if you're dying to see what the buzz is about but it's not worth it to become a regular.

excerpts: I ordered the jasmine tea with boba and it was so delicious I thought I was gonna cry.
My friend got the matcha green tea with cream and I tried some
and it was so good.
I don't like matcha
and I actually really enjoyed how this one tasted.
The aesthetic of the place is definitely a plus and the service is so amazing.
I ordered and literally 30 seconds after I left the register it was ready!
The girl on bar was like sonic the hedgehog or something
(the bar is right next to the register
so she was like lightning quick at pouring in the tea, milk, sweetner and boba).
To date, this is the best boba/milk tea I have ever had.
And that says a lot coming from a Bay Area native from San Jose.
Just spectacular.
jasmine.author: Kyle D.
jasmine.review:
I cannot think of one bad thing to say about this place. If you're like me and like your boba on the soft, almost creamy side, you will adore this place. I ordered the jasmine tea with boba and it was so delicious I thought I was gonna cry. My friend got the matcha green tea with cream and I tried some and it was so good. I don't like matcha and I actually really enjoyed how this one tasted. The aesthetic of the place is definitely a plus and the service is so amazing. I ordered and literally 30 seconds after I left the register it was ready! The girl on bar was like sonic the hedgehog or something (the bar is right next to the register so she was like lightning quick at pouring in the tea, milk, sweetner and boba).
To date, this is the best boba/milk tea I have ever had. And that says a lot coming from a Bay Area native from San Jose. Just spectacular.

excerpts: I got 50% sweet jasmine with oat milk.
Perfect (and vegan without jelly)!
Somehow I guess I got lucky, based on reviews, and the line wasn't long at all.
Quick and friendly service.
jasmine.author: An B.
jasmine.review:
Tasty boba tea. I got 50% sweet jasmine with oat milk. Perfect (and vegan without jelly)!
Somehow I guess I got lucky, based on reviews, and the line wasn't long at all. Quick and friendly service.

excerpts: This is by far the best boba place for  authentic jasmine green tea place I've tried in San Francisco.
The price is doable and not too pricey.
Just about right $4.
The jasmine green tea was very fresh and tasted amazing.
jasmine.author: Jenny S.
jasmine.review:
This is by far the best boba place for  authentic jasmine green tea place I've tried in San Francisco. The price is doable and not too pricey. Just about right $4. The jasmine green tea was very fresh and tasted amazing. 

I also got the regular milk tea, I felt like it was a bit too much milk, but overall was way better than quicklys and those other chain stores. 

I also got The mason jar they have, i would say it's quite pricey but then again you get 25cent off any drink when you bring back the mug! So if you drink boba enough you'll get your money's worth :) I'll have to admit this is the most creative jar I've seen also. It has a handle where you can easily hold and even a straw hole on top !! I love it :)

excerpts: The friendly Asian dude with glasses told us that Classic & Jasmine were the most popular, but come on, I HAD to try the horchata!
It's cute and they have seasonal flavors like strawberry jasmine tea (I wish I tried this instead).
I left wondering why in the world they had an aardvark in their logo, and it turns out that it's because 'they have a built in boba straw'.
It finally makes some sense!
jasmine.author: Christine L.
jasmine.review:
I get a boba craving every time I visit home! After all, living in Maine does NOT present the best opportunities for enjoying boba. 

I persuaded the bf to come with me to try the Horchata w/ boba as well as the Classic Milk Tea w/ grass jelly. The friendly Asian dude with glasses told us that Classic & Jasmine were the most popular, but come on, I HAD to try the horchata! 

On to the review... the Classic and Horchata were both extremely sweet. It's cool that they make their own syrup and all, and they do allow for customization,  but I didn't think the regular would be so sugary! The small 16oz drinks also came PACKED with ice, not so cool considering that these drinks came out to $4 a pop. The boba was sweet and chewy, but not any sweeter or chewier than any decent competition. I personally LOVE grass jelly, but I was disappointed by their homemade batch. The squares were a bit too firm and large to easily get sucked up through the straw, and a cup of grass jelly with no drink is never any fun! 

At the end of the day, this place is okay. It's cute and they have seasonal flavors like strawberry jasmine tea (I wish I tried this instead). I left wondering why in the world they had an aardvark in their logo, and it turns out that it's because 'they have a built in boba straw'. It finally makes some sense!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I shared the jasmine milk tea and the matcha latte, both at 75% sweetness.
The jasmine milk tea was good, not the best we've had
but it was good.
However, the matcha latte totally overshadowed the jasmine milk tea because it was sooo yummy!
Matcha flavor was on point and the boba was cooked perfectly.
I'll admit, the first time I had Boba Guys
I wasn't too impressed, but this trip completely changed my mind!
Would recommend the matcha latte 10/10!!
jasmine.author: Alyssa W.
jasmine.review: I've been to Boba Guys before but I've never been to this location! It's small and cute with only a few seats. The drinks are pricey, but I don't drink boba very often anymore so I didn't mind too much. My boyfriend and I shared the jasmine milk tea and the matcha latte, both at 75% sweetness. The jasmine milk tea was good, not the best we've had but it was good. However, the matcha latte totally overshadowed the jasmine milk tea because it was sooo yummy! Matcha flavor was on point and the boba was cooked perfectly. I'll admit, the first time I had Boba Guys I wasn't too impressed, but this trip completely changed my mind! Would recommend the matcha latte 10/10!!

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea: Standard jasmine milk tea, refreshing and well made.
jasmine.author: Theresa L.
jasmine.review:
I've come here multiple times and have experienced both the long line and no line at all - it really depends on what time you arrive. 

Here are the drinks I've tried:
Hong Kong style tea with condensed milk: VERY sweet, even when we ordered less sweet. I've also tried it with half sweet, and in this case the coffee like flavour of the hong kong style tea showed through more. Either way, their hong kong style tea is pretty good.
Jasmine milk tea: Standard jasmine milk tea, refreshing and well made.
Iced Matcha latte: Perfect balance of matcha flavour without making it too bitter. 

Their boba is quite nice and chewy too with a good consistency. They also sell boba guys mason jars which look pretty cute if you want to fit into the hipster mission district. I think my only complaint is that it's quite expensive when it comes to milk tea places and it's just on par with other places such as sharetea/chatime/kung fu tea.

excerpts: Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style.
They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order.
All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients.
This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet.
Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price
jasmine.author: Cherylynn N.
jasmine.review:
Boys and girls rarely agree on anything but I think there is one thing they CAN agree on: good balls ARE essential. Perfectly symmetrical, soft, squishy, and bouncy. Balls like this get me super excited especially when I'm enjoying a mouthful of them. 

BOBA BALLS that is you pervs!

The Boba Guys have perfected the boba balls down to a science and I love that they use top notch, organic ingredients. They even make their own syrup which means they are serious about their balls; I mean their boba drink. 

I adored Boba Guys when they were at their pop-up at Ken Ken Ramen (http://bit.ly/1fiXJcx) and was ecstatic to find out they would have their brick and mortar. Over 3 months later after their grand opening, I finally was able to make my way to Boba Guys' brick and mortar since they extended their hours of operation. And they now accepted CC's. Yay!

Not only do the Boba Guys now have a permanent space with several stools, they have expanded their menu. Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style. They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order. All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients. This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet. *Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price* 

I decided to stick with their basic Classic Milk Tea ($4) which was sadly not as good as I remembered them to be when they were at Ken Ken Ramen. I like that they use very little sweetener but the tea flavor was too subtle and our drink needed MORE ice. After a 30 minute wait for our drink on a hot Saturday afternoon, our drink arrived to us almost room temperature. By the time we walked back to the car, all the ice (the little that there was in the cup) was all melted. *Sad Pouty Lip*

It was a crowded so the wait was somewhat understandable; I mean fobbee teens who have nothing better to do wait for up to 2 hours at Tpumps. 

3 stars for the boba milk tea but an extra star for their deliciously satisfying pandan macarons (3 for $5) and for carrying Sugar & Spun's cotton candy in cookie butter: http://bit.ly/GOf9i9. 

Not going to lie, it's been nearly 2 weeks but I'm still a little bummed about their boba milk tea. Oh well, at least the balls were good. A good pair; I mean set is all you need sometimes right?

excerpts:
Ice Tea w/Boba 
Jasmine

Milk Tea w/Boba
Strawberry Fresca Jasmine
Milk Tea

w/Boba
 
Note
jasmine.author: China D.
jasmine.review:
Love this place so much! It's hands down the best boba tea place I've tried in SF. Sometimes on a nice day the line is out the door, that's how good it is! 


My goto drinks are: 

Thai Ice Tea w/Boba 
Jasmine Milk Tea w/Boba
Strawberry Fresca Jasmine Milk Tea w/Boba
 
Note I always ask for 50% sweetness, you should too if you want to taste more of the tea! 

The boba and aloe jelly is made in house and so is the syrup! They don't use fructose syrup!!! 

They also use stratus farms milk

excerpts: If you like more simple flavors I'd reccomend the Jasmine milk tea!
jasmine.author: Kasey L.
jasmine.review: By far my favorite boba place and I'm not much of a boba person! Their strawberry matcha latte is such a unique flavor and I love it! If you like more simple flavors I'd reccomend the Jasmine milk tea!

excerpts: I wanted to try something new, since I've had the Classic and Jasmine already.
I had trouble choosing between Hotchata and Iced Matcha, so I asked the guy (co-owner, I believe), decided I wanted a little caffeine, and went with the matcha.
jasmine.author: Alyssa T.
jasmine.review:
"I'M SO HAPPY RIGHT NOW."

That's literally what I kept repeating as I sat in Boba Guys' new shop and sipped on my boba. I've already reviewed Boba Guys' pop-up store, but I just can't get enough of them so I thought I'd give this page some lovin' as well. I'm so glad I finally decided to visit their new shop because it pretty much made my day.

There was no line when I walked in, just a small crowd of people waiting for their drinks. I wanted to try something new, since I've had the Classic and Jasmine already. I had trouble choosing between Hotchata and Iced Matcha, so I asked the guy (co-owner, I believe), decided I wanted a little caffeine, and went with the matcha. With boba, of course. 

I think this goes without saying that I LOVED MY DRINK. The boba was the perfect chewy, the matcha perfectly sweet, and I never wanted it to end. I kinda wish they offered Large sizes because I'd get it every time, no shame. I actually thought about getting a second drink, and was so, so close...

I said this in my last review and I'll say it again: Boba Guys is QUALITY. Straus organic milk, homebrewed tea, and NO POWDERS. I don't think you can find all of that in any boba place. Their overall brand is awesome as well - I especially love the handpainted aardvark in the store :)

I hear the Guys like to experiment (just look at their lab coats and beakers!), so I hope I get to visit again when they do something weird and awesome with their drinks. 'Til next time!

excerpts: made with the standard condensed milk) and jasmine green milk tea.
The drinks were a little watery though.
jasmine.author: Cheryl W.
jasmine.review: I don't really understand the hype of this place, especially since its more expensive than other places ($4-5 for a regular drink). Boba is good and made with fresh-tasting tea but tapioca is a bit too sweetened. Got the Hong-Kong style (yum! made with the standard condensed milk) and jasmine green milk tea. The drinks were a little watery though.

excerpts: My friend got the Jasmine Milk Tea which I loved.
The tea flavor is really fragrant and you can actually tell that they used Jasmine tea.
jasmine.author: Jenn L.
jasmine.review:
Okay I'm giving this place 4 stars for my friend's drink haha.

I ordered the strawberry matcha, but I wasn't a huge fan. The matcha flavor wasn't very strong and it honestly just tasted like milk with boba. Their pearls are really good though, they have that perfectly chewy consistency down.

My friend got the Jasmine Milk Tea which I loved. The tea flavor is really fragrant and you can actually tell that they used Jasmine tea. The balance of milk and sweetness is just right, and again, pearls were perfect.

Friend's drink saved my impression of the place, would go back to try other drinks if I'm ever in the Mission!

excerpts: I ordered a Jasmine milk tea without modification (normal dairy, no sweetness adjustment).
The milk tea was not very milky, as if it was watered down, and it was not sweet at all.
jasmine.author: Nadeem A.
jasmine.review:
I'm always on the lookout for good tapioca milk tea, so I decided to give Boba Guys a try when I was in the area.  I had read about the hype online, so I had high expectations for my milk tea.

First, let me describe my perfect tapioca milk tea.  The milk tea is creamy, slightly sweet, with good tea flavor.  The tapioca balls are soft and sweet, with no hard centers.

I ordered a Jasmine milk tea without modification (normal dairy, no sweetness adjustment). The milk tea was not very milky, as if it was watered down, and it was not sweet at all.  The tapioca was good, however.

Considering the out of way location, the quality, and the price, I probably won't be back.

excerpts: I got the Jasmine Milk Tea.
This place uses loose leaf and brews their own tea.
The drink was probably some of the best milk teas I have ever had.
i will definitely come back the next time I am in the area.
jasmine.author: Jonathan E.
jasmine.review: This place is really good. I've been here once, but technically twice. The first time I came, I didn't go in because it was a Friday night and the line was out the door. Parking was also ridiculous and hard to find. I went back the next day. The line was still out the door, but for good reason. Like most boba places in SF, there is not really much room inside the shop to actually hang out. The inside area is more for people to wait on their drinks. The line though, showed how popular the place is. I was recommended to come here by a friend of mine. I got the Jasmine Milk Tea. This place uses loose leaf and brews their own tea. The drink was probably some of the best milk teas I have ever had. i will definitely come back the next time I am in the area.

excerpts: The Jasmine milk team and macha milk tea are so perfect.
This is going to become a regular habit for me!
jasmine.author: Jaching H.
jasmine.review: Best boba I've had in the city! The boba itself was cooked perfectly - just a little chewy yet firm. The Jasmine milk team and macha milk tea are so perfect. This is going to become a regular habit for me!

excerpts: and she did not like her Jasmine milk tea one bit.
She said hers was also watered down.
So 2/2 that was a NAYYYY
