, I'm sure I'm not coming back for 4 buck funky water
(considering I don't even like to drink water).
jasmine.author: Yvonne L.
jasmine.review:
I've recently found my old account for Yelp and I'm in the midst of transferring over my reviews. The rating and the review are exactly the same so their overall review didn't change as I've deleted my reviews from my old account and it's not inactive. Reposting the old reviews with my previous ratings was the only way I can transfer these over unfortunately.

Review date: 4/2/2013 
I should have known better with a place that calls tapioca "boba" that it might not be legit. I walked in and at the bar there were a group of teenage hipsters (bleh...) and two older men. No ASIAN people surrounding this joint, it's a plus and a minus. I should have also known better when I saw the hipsters that maybe I should just go but nope my best friend wanted to get her drink out of a mason jar. I'm not into the mason jar hype so I got mine in a to-go cup so I can judge purely on the drink and not how "awesome" it is to get tapioca - oops I meant boba - in a mason jar. I got the soy milk tea because I asked if the drink would be sweeter because it is made with soy milk (I like my tapioca on the sweeter side) the lady said yes so I settled. Mine was super watered down and it didn't have much flavor in general. Basically I spent $4 on brown water. I didn't think much of it because I have a somewhat picky palette but my friend on the other hand is easier to please and she did not like her Jasmine milk tea one bit. She said hers was also watered down. So 2/2 that was a NAYYYY, I'm sure I'm not coming back for 4 buck funky water (considering I don't even like to drink water).

excerpts: We ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Grass Jelly with Almond Milk & 75% sweetness level.
Not too bad!
I couldn't really taste the tea flavor at first because it was pretty sweet, but after a few stirs, it was the perfect balance.
jasmine.author: Ian K.
jasmine.review:
Pretty cool place in the Mission! There seems to always be a line here, but it's worth the wait. My girlfriend and I were in the area and decided to stop by here for a snack on a weekend afternoon. We've always heard about this place since friends have raved about it, so it seemed only fitting that we stopped by.

We ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Grass Jelly with Almond Milk & 75% sweetness level. Not too bad! I couldn't really taste the tea flavor at first because it was pretty sweet, but after a few stirs, it was the perfect balance. It's a little harder to "shake it up" since the drink comes with a lid as opposed to being vacuum sealed like some other places are.

The staff here is very friendly and lets you take your time when you order. They also have merchandise with the Boba Guys logo here as well as some homemade cotton candy. The Li Hing Pineapple flavored cotton candy was pretty great! Better than I expected. Also, their almond jelly and grass jelly are homemade too!

I would definitely come here again to try the other tea flavors (they have speciality tea flavors as well) and the other toppings. The almond jelly would be worth trying next time!

excerpts: It is quite pointless to get jasmine since it tastes almost like every other boba place.
But man that Strawberry Jasmine Tea Fresca is just so refreshing.
Like I can actually taste the Jasmine, the strawberry and the tea independently yet together in the same sip!
But you might wanna drink it cold/water.
I got mine in a bottle, didn't have any ice left
so it was too sweet.
But it was good!
Definitely recommend.
jasmine.author: Thu N.
jasmine.review:
Actually really good. It is quite pointless to get jasmine since it tastes almost like every other boba place. 

But man that Strawberry Jasmine Tea Fresca is just so refreshing. Like I can actually taste the Jasmine, the strawberry and the tea independently yet together in the same sip! But you might wanna drink it cold/water. I got mine in a bottle, didn't have any ice left so it was too sweet. But it was good! Definitely recommend.

excerpts: The almond milk jasmine with boba is my way to go.
Run, don't walk, to boba guys (....expect a wait though).
jasmine.author: Kathy O.
jasmine.review:
Bit of background - I'm not the hugest boba fan in the world....and I'm seriously loving this place.

Dairy free milk options? Check!
Gluten free boba? Check!
Teas made from actual tea leaves and not powdered "stuff"? Check!
Homemade grass jelly? CHECK!

Everything tastes incredibly fresh and I love how you can completely customize your sweetness level. 

The almond milk jasmine with boba is my way to go. Run, don't walk, to boba guys (....expect a wait though).

excerpts: I haven't tried many things, but the black milk tea and jasmine milk tea are very good.
I also tried the strawberry matcha latte from the special menu and it was amazing.
It wasn't what I expected, so i was pleasantly surprised.
Definitely should try that out!
Price is good.
The quality is amazing, so it's definitely worth.
Definitely will be back for more!!
jasmine.author: Maggie W.
jasmine.review:
The bubble tea here is amazing. The tea flavor is super strong, bubbles are on point, and they use organic ingredients. I haven't tried many things, but the black milk tea and jasmine milk tea are very good. I also tried the strawberry matcha latte from the special menu and it was amazing. It wasn't what I expected, so i was pleasantly surprised. Definitely should try that out!
Price is good. The quality is amazing, so it's definitely worth.
Definitely will be back for more!!

excerpts: Jasmine taste is somewhat strong, but it tastes more milky or watered down than anything else.
jasmine.author: Phoebe C.
jasmine.review:
3.5 stars? 3.7, maybe? 

What I liked: 
-Service. They were part of a commercial the day we went, so the film crew had some miscellaneous supplies that were piled up by the wall. Service was also slower and the line was out the door, so the owner gave everyone 15% off their orders, which was unexpected but definitely appreciated. They also continued to apologize as we were in line, which was not necessary, but a gesture that shows the type of customer service they uphold.
-Branding. I've seen their anteater while perusing Instagram and was already intrigued. It's so cute and such a simple but memorable and effective marketing tactic as a newcomer to the already-saturated boba market. 

Good, but not great:
-Iced original milk tea with boba. I can tell that the quality of the tea leaves is not the best I've had (e.g., Ten Ren/Tastea). It's not that strong. As I continued to drink my 16 oz tea, it becomes a bit more diluted, more so than is expected with ice melting. 
-Same with boba...good, but not great. I can't pinpoint it exactly, but I think I would have preferred it to be more QQ and honey-infused. I am a boba fiend, or nitpicky amateur boba connoisseur at best. 

Skip:
-Jasmine milk tea. Jasmine taste is somewhat strong, but it tastes more milky or watered down than anything else. Even my friend who got this drink preferred my original milk tea.

Overall good and would come back again, 'cause why not, I love boba...but not the best I've ever had (Drake's words, not mine).

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea with almond milk and enjoyed it.
jasmine.author: Andrea F.
jasmine.review:
Boba guys did not disappoint! The boba itself had a good consistency, not too hard and not too chewy. I liked that they offer almond milk as a choice for the milk teas, along with regular milk and soy milk. I got the jasmine milk tea with almond milk and enjoyed it. It wasn't too sweet and the tea wasn't watered down.

The service was good. The cashier was helpful in helping me decide what to order. And despite the line that went out the door, I thought our drinks were brought out in a timely manner. Would definitely come back to try their other drinks!

excerpts: Thai Tea is also a favorite, Jasmine, and Honey Black Tea.
jasmine.author: Bernadette F.
jasmine.review:
Best boba. Hands down. Wins with texture, taste, and how it doesn't toughen up at all in a cold beverage. The organic milk and almond milk are to die for, but I'm personally I just stick to the almond milk. My personal favorite drink is Iced Matcha with almond milk and no sweetener. I just love how earthy their match is. Thai Tea is also a favorite, Jasmine, and Honey Black Tea. 

Also if you're brave enough, try the charcoal pineapple cake! It's dry at first, but the jam in the middle makes it all worth it.

excerpts: I've tried a variety of their drinks and my favorites are the coffee milk tea and the jasmine milk tea.
jasmine.author: Vivian L.
jasmine.review:
My favorite milk tea place in the city! I've tried a variety of their drinks and my favorites are the coffee milk tea and the jasmine milk tea. They are a bit more expensive than traditional boba shops, but the quality of their drinks is well worth it!

The Strauss creamery milk really makes a difference! I've also tried substituting their drinks with soy milk instead. Too watery for my liking, and it takes away from the authentic milk tea taste. 

Their default sweetness is a little too sweet for me though. I usually get either 50% or 75% sweet. 

I'm not a boba fan, but occasionally, I will get their honey boba. The texture is soft, but not too chewy, and the honey adds even more flavor to the drink. 

My favorite topping is the almond jelly. It tastes exactly like the almond jello dessert that my mom used to make and it definitely complements their milk teas really well. 

I'll be coming back soon to try the rest of their drinks!

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea and almond jelly.
I didn't really like the tea that much
and it took me a long time to drink it.
I ended up tossing it.
The almond jelly tasted really weird and kind of digusting imo.
I do like a strong tea flavor and that's what I got
but I also just got a really bad headache right after.
I'm not sure if I'd come back.
I am just happy that when I went, there was only 2 people in front of me.
I probably would've been extra disappointed if I had to wait an hour in line like how some other yelpers had reviewed.
jasmine.author: Christine N.
jasmine.review:
I heard nothing but good things about this place so I wanted to try it out anyway.
I got the jasmine milk tea and almond jelly. I didn't really like the tea that much and it took me a long time to drink it. I ended up tossing it. The almond jelly tasted really weird and kind of digusting imo. I do like a strong tea flavor and that's what I got but I also just got a really bad headache right after. I'm not sure if I'd come back. I am just happy that when I went, there was only 2 people in front of me. I probably would've been extra disappointed if I had to wait an hour in line like how some other yelpers had reviewed.

excerpts: This includes Indian Chai, Jasmine Green tea, various milk teas etc.
jasmine.author: Jake N.
jasmine.review:
I was very impressed with this place. It is the best boba tea I have had so far in San Francisco.

They offer a range of interesting flavors, including decaf (which some other places don't have). This includes Indian Chai, Jasmine Green tea, various milk teas etc.

The boba balls themselves are delicious, chewy and flavorful, while still fairly soft. I had them in a warm tea, which was a new experience and great for a cold afternoon. I am really looking forward to going back.

excerpts: I got the jasmine green tea w almond milk!
Anytime I've gotten my tea w almond milk at other places, it just turns out watery and nasty!
But nothing was lacking w their version of almond milk tea, plus you don't get that heavy feeling that you usually do w non dairy creamer...
With 100% sweetness, it was sweetened perfectly to my taste.
The boba was also on the chewier side (some softer than the others) which I personally like more.
Great experience here...
jasmine.author: Brittany D.
jasmine.review: Great customer service, the cashier I had took his time helping me out while giving genuinely helpful advice! I got the jasmine green tea w almond milk! Anytime I've gotten my tea w almond milk at other places, it just turns out watery and nasty! But nothing was lacking w their version of almond milk tea, plus you don't get that heavy feeling that you usually do w non dairy creamer... :). With 100% sweetness, it was sweetened perfectly to my taste. The boba was also on the chewier side (some softer than the others) which I personally like more. Great experience here...

excerpts: Jasmine Milk (soy) with 1/2 almond jelly & 1/2 tapioca balls $5.
jasmine.author: Shannon Z.
jasmine.review:
Jasmine Milk (soy) with 1/2 almond jelly & 1/2 tapioca balls $5. 

Warning Boba Guys are not consistent with quality of product, and depending on the staff you will either have the best boba tea ever or the most watered down (and lacking boba).

excerpts: My friend got the jasmine milk tea and I ordered the lychee milk tea with boba and enjoyed every bit of it.
It was fresh and real.
And my real I mean, it's not made from powders like some other places.
Boba was good, the place itself is adorable too.
Even though there's only about 4 seats inside against the window.
jasmine.author: Mariel Ashley S.
jasmine.review: Didn't like this place the first time I had it, I actually don't even remember what I ordered. Came back another time, almost a year later with a friend and fell in love. Maybe my taste buds have changed or maybe they made it better this day but my goodness, it was delicious! My friend got the jasmine milk tea and I ordered the lychee milk tea with boba and enjoyed every bit of it. It was fresh and real. And my real I mean, it's not made from powders like some other places. Boba was good, the place itself is adorable too. Even though there's only about 4 seats inside against the window.

excerpts: Jasmine Milk Tea: $4

Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it.
We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission)
so it was worth the slight wait.
jasmine.author: Kitty K.
jasmine.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: and I was debating between the Hong Kong Milk Tea and the Jasmine Milk Tea but when in doubt, I always default to a boba place's Jasmine Milk Tea to compare it against other places.
I had mine at 75% sweet and found it just sweet enough to enjoy.
I actually think I'd be even okay if it was 100% sweet.
It wasn't heavy
so I had an easy time finishing my drink.
It was refreshing!
Next time I'm in the city
, I'm definitely coming back to try the HKMT.
c:
jasmine.author: Carena N.
jasmine.review: Finally!  A new boba place that I can confidently recommend!  They have a small selection of flavors and I was debating between the Hong Kong Milk Tea and the Jasmine Milk Tea but when in doubt, I always default to a boba place's Jasmine Milk Tea to compare it against other places.  I had mine at 75% sweet and found it just sweet enough to enjoy.  I actually think I'd be even okay if it was 100% sweet.  It wasn't heavy so I had an easy time finishing my drink.  It was refreshing!  Next time I'm in the city, I'm definitely coming back to try the HKMT.  c:

excerpts: I ended up with the lychee green tea with almond jelly and my husband got the jasmine milk tea with almond jelly as well, both 50% sweetness.
jasmine.author: Jacklyn L.
jasmine.review:
This was my first time at boba guys and it was great! The barista was super helpful with recommendations and patient as I waffled between the many choices. 

I ended up with the lychee green tea with almond jelly and my husband got the jasmine milk tea with almond jelly as well, both 50% sweetness. Mine didn't have a super robust lychee flavor, and was mote heavy on the tea, but well balanced with the sweetness of the jelly. 

A great spot to get boba, will definitely come again! Lives up to the hype!

excerpts:
- you can have it to go or for here in a mason jar (i think it is  super cute)
Original
Jasmine
Horchata
Soy
They serve samples though in a cute sake cup and i tried the jasmine which was really good (regretted a bit getting the horchata but gives me a reason to go back)
jasmine.author: Laurie W.
jasmine.review:
I feel like I'm kinda in between a 4-5 stars with this place...so i went and did a 5...cant keep all my 5 stars to myself!

this place is not in the midst of the crazy mission district - i would say the quieter side.  

It's kinda like a hole in a wall but not hard to miss.  Theres only 4 flavors so dont expect too much.  $4 (they dont show the price either) - you can have it to go or for here in a mason jar (i think it is  super cute)
Original
Jasmine
Horchata
Soy

I decided to go different and went with horchata (thinking it was like horchata milk tea, which it wasnt) and friend got the soy.  It was definitely horchata horchata but you have the boba to chew so its interesting.  I think they said they use organic milk cuz it leaves a clean finish, no milky after taste.  Not too sweet so cool with me.  Soy milk tea definitely has a strong tea taste and again, leaves a clean finish.  It kinda has a coffee taste too.  

The boba isnt anything SUPER DUPER fancy (i still prefer t pumps' boba cuz it has a sweet finish), a nice chew though

They serve samples though in a cute sake cup and i tried the jasmine which was really good (regretted a bit getting the horchata but gives me a reason to go back) i also tried their experimental strawberry milk tea (nope for me)

The guy wore a little science white coat which i thought was really cute but i dont know if thats the uniform or if he just likes to wear one around.  But good service though. 

They also take card!  I'll be back!

excerpts: I would recommend classic milk tea, hong kong style, jasmine milk tea, and matcha iced latte.
jasmine.author: Yushi C.
jasmine.review:
This is probably my favorite boba place. I drink a lot of tea so when I drink milk tea, I still want to taste the tea. A lot of boba shop disappoint me because of how watery or sugary their drinks are. At boba guys, I believe that they use real tea to make their milk teas. The people working their are also really friendly and will fix your drink if you don't like it. 
I had ordered a hong kong style milktea and it wasnt sweet enough so I brought it back and they remade one for me. They also have the best boba. Their boba is cooked perfectly with it being chewy and soft. 
I would recommend classic milk tea, hong kong style, jasmine milk tea, and matcha iced latte.

excerpts: Liked even more the Strawberry Jasmine tea my companion ordered.
Even sweeter and even less heavy.
Happy with mine.
Next time would have hers.
jasmine.author: Jason B.
jasmine.review:
Following a dream.

The founders: www.bobaguys.com/story/

The customers: Barely a line around 1pm for an enjoyable signature Classic with black tea, choice of milk (Straus, almond or soy) and homemade almond jelly.

It wasn't as sweet or heavy as expected. Staff was so enthusiastic and informative in helping make the decision. You could tell they believed in the dream. Really liked the almond jelly.

Liked even more the Strawberry Jasmine tea my companion ordered. Even sweeter and even less heavy. Happy with mine. Next time would have hers. Reasonable $4 for 16oz.

Back to those customers: Returning around 6pm the line was out the door. This time ordered the Kaya toasted brioche topped with homemade coconut jam.

It was really sweet, surprisingly thick and a very good deal for $3.50. Loved it as much as the Hong Kong version (www.yelp.com/biz/boba-guys-san-francisco-6?hrid=WGaOzrn5Cmda7mBPvyy2mg) and bet it pairs well with tea.

Living the four star dream.

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea was not super sweet and light on the Jasmine flavor.
jasmine.author: Nikki S.
jasmine.review:
Not bad since there are not many boba places in the area. 

Jasmine milk tea was not super sweet and light on the Jasmine flavor.

Hong Kong milk tea was a bit too sweet due to the condensed milk for my liking but good.

The boba is that perfect chewy consistency. 

Quick yet I think a bit pricey at $4 ...

Grab some flavored cotton candy with that tea.

excerpts: The menu isn't as broad as at other establishments, but if you just want a simple jasmine milk tea, definitely choose this place!!
jasmine.author: Neha S.
jasmine.review:
So, so good! I drink gallons of bubble tea, so can say with confidence that this is one of the better places to drink boba in SF. In fact, Sharetea might be the only place better.

I think that Boba Guys really outclasses its competitors because of the quality of its ingredients. The milk doesn't taste like it's come out of some can, the tea clearly didn't arrive at the store in powdered form, and the boba has the absolute perfect consistency.

The menu isn't as broad as at other establishments, but if you just want a simple jasmine milk tea, definitely choose this place!!

excerpts: I always order the jasmine milk tea with boba, and it's always been consistent.
The boba was just okay, but the jasmine tea was pretty bold in flavor.
jasmine.author: Tina C.
jasmine.review:
If you like your boba drinks with a strong tea taste, then come to Boba Guys. 

I always order the jasmine milk tea with boba, and it's always been consistent. The boba was just okay, but the jasmine tea was pretty bold in flavor.

Interested in trying the other drinks, but it's not really the place to try your boba luck at around $4ish a cup.

excerpts: I had the Jasmine Milk Tea which was pretty good.
The prince is reasonable and friendly customer service.
jasmine.author: Shirley G.
jasmine.review: I had the Jasmine Milk Tea which was pretty good. The prince is reasonable and friendly customer service.

excerpts:
Ordered: Classic Black, Jasmine
What to get:
They're all pretty standard mixes and you can't go wrong
jasmine.author: James N.
jasmine.review:
Ordered: Classic Black, Jasmine
What to get: They're all pretty standard mixes and you can't go wrong w/ any.

Been here only twice and thought it was alright. Strangely, I didn't get a refreshing kick out of it like some of the other better boba places I've been to. It's interesting to watch them brew tea, but consistency was off between the two instances I tried it. Not enough tea in the flavor.

excerpts: My friends and I tried their famous jasmine milk tea, strawberry green tea Fresca, classic milk tea and horchata milk tea.
All were extremely sweet for 50% sweetness.
The boba was symmetrical, soft, and had a hint of flavor which is really nice to have but the drink alone was not parring well with the boba itself.
It was sugar on sugar.
The jasmine milk tea was
Soo sweet
it tasted like milk and sugar to the point where the jasmine tea taste was not even pronounced!
The strawberry green tea Fresca, although very nice looking on IG
the taste is like a melted strawberry artificial Popsicle that was poured into more sugar and added water for some dilution.
Very disappointing!
I would not recommend boba guys!
However I did hear that the best one is downtown
so if I am in that area I will try it again.
Parking wise, it's not worth going to this location just for the boba.
Parking is extremely difficult so save 30 minutes just to get a parking spot.
jasmine.author: Roseanne V.
jasmine.review: TOOO SWEET! I really wanted to understand the hype about this place but It was a let down! I have traveled east to west coast, trying new and upcoming boba and this place is all just a gimmick in my opinion. My friends and I tried their famous jasmine milk tea, strawberry green tea Fresca, classic milk tea and horchata milk tea. All were extremely sweet for 50% sweetness. The boba was symmetrical, soft, and had a hint of flavor which is really nice to have but the drink alone was not parring well with the boba itself. It was sugar on sugar. The jasmine milk tea was Soo sweet it tasted like milk and sugar to the point where the jasmine tea taste was not even pronounced! The strawberry green tea Fresca, although very nice looking on IG the taste is like a melted strawberry artificial Popsicle that was poured into more sugar and added water for some dilution. Very disappointing! I would not recommend boba guys! However I did hear that the best one is downtown so if I am in that area I will try it again. Parking wise, it's not worth going to this location just for the boba. Parking is extremely difficult so save 30 minutes just to get a parking spot.

excerpts: Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush.
jasmine.author: Jennifer L.
jasmine.review:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!

excerpts:
Boba Guys offers both heated and iced drinks from a menu of year-round flavors like jasmine, horchata and "classic milk," and a choice between three additions -- referred to as toppings -- include its popular tapioca pearls and house-made grass and almond jellies.
While most boba shops in the Bay Area rely heavily on artificial syrups and flavorings, Boba Guys' use of natural and organic resources captures distinct flavors. 
Real jasmine, rose, strawberry and lavender exemplify the best of its signature and seasonal blends.
Nervous first-time visitors might want to start with the Jasmine Milk Tea, its flavor a step above the basic, but no-less-tasty Classic Milk Tea.
Seasonal selections include a light Strawberry Jasmine Fresca, which makes for the perfect refreshment, but a large is suggested because a regular 16-ounce cup leaves the customer wanting more.
The locally-sourced organic Straus Creamery milk has a tendency to be too thick and creamy for my taste, albeit better than the Coffeemate creamer powder used by other boba tea shops. 
Soy milk and Califia Almondmilk are perhaps better alternative options.
A house-made simple syrup of white and brown sugars that sweetens all drinks overwhelms most tastes, but chatting with the "bobaristas" increases the customer's chances of getting the perfect level of sweetness.
Customizable high quality thirst-quenchers served with a smile from bobaristas for around $5 constitutes a steal by San Francisco standards.
Boba Guys is located at 19th and Valencia streets and on Stockton Street in Union Square. 
Loose-leaf tea blends are available online. 
The 19th Street location is open noon to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, until 10 p.m. Friday and Saturday, and 6 p.m. on Sunday. 
The Union Square location is open 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. on Friday, noon to 10 p.m. on Saturday, and is closed on Sunday.
- See more at: http://broadview.sacredsf.org/9190/features/tas-tea-boba/#sthash.emzNb5hl.dpuf
jasmine.author: Julia-Rose K.
jasmine.review:
Locals and visitors alike line up out the door and down the block outside of the self-proclaimed tea bar with the "highest quality boba in San Francisco," drawing customers off the Mission's populous Valencia Street.
Patient patrons enter into a minimalist white-on-wooden motif tea bar to try Boba Guys'  impressive boba tea selection, facing a black on white decal of the shop's boba-slurping anteater mascot.
The boba -- chewy, honey-soaked tapioca pearls that add both texture and flavor to each drink -- are not the only item that gives Boba Guys bragging rights. A variety of incomparably revitalizing house-made tea blends sets Boba Guys apart from other Bay Area boba joints.
Boba Guys offers both heated and iced drinks from a menu of year-round flavors like jasmine, horchata and "classic milk," and a choice between three additions -- referred to as toppings -- include its popular tapioca pearls and house-made grass and almond jellies.
While most boba shops in the Bay Area rely heavily on artificial syrups and flavorings, Boba Guys' use of natural and organic resources captures distinct flavors. Real jasmine, rose, strawberry and lavender exemplify the best of its signature and seasonal blends.
Nervous first-time visitors might want to start with the Jasmine Milk Tea, its flavor a step above the basic, but no-less-tasty Classic Milk Tea.
The premium Indian Chai and Rose Black Tea stand apart as original and astonishingly rich blends. The chai blend achieves the ideal balance between sugar and spice without sweetener.
Seasonal selections include a light Strawberry Jasmine Fresca, which makes for the perfect refreshment, but a large is suggested because a regular 16-ounce cup leaves the customer wanting more.
The locally-sourced organic Straus Creamery milk has a tendency to be too thick and creamy for my taste, albeit better than the Coffeemate creamer powder used by other boba tea shops. Soy milk and Califia Almondmilk are perhaps better alternative options.
A house-made simple syrup of white and brown sugars that sweetens all drinks overwhelms most tastes, but chatting with the "bobaristas" increases the customer's chances of getting the perfect level of sweetness.
Customizable high quality thirst-quenchers served with a smile from bobaristas for around $5 constitutes a steal by San Francisco standards.
Boba Guys is located at 19th and Valencia streets and on Stockton Street in Union Square. Loose-leaf tea blends are available online. The 19th Street location is open noon to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, until 10 p.m. Friday and Saturday, and 6 p.m. on Sunday. The Union Square location is open 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. on Friday, noon to 10 p.m. on Saturday, and is closed on Sunday.
- See more at: http://broadview.sacredsf.org/9190/features/tas-tea-boba/#sthash.emzNb5hl.dpuf

excerpts: I've tried the Horchata, Jasmine, and the Coffee.
Sweet!
Sweet!
and Sweet!
The quality of boba and the drinks are comparable to most good places, but the base level of sweetness in the drinks is way too high!
I had to get mine 50% sweet on the third try to get the sweetness down to an acceptable level.
Other than that, this place is just
jasmine.author: Matthew S.
jasmine.review:
Got a super sweet tooth? Then come on in! Otherwise, you might wanna try somewhere else.

I've tried the Horchata, Jasmine, and the Coffee. Sweet! Sweet! and Sweet! 
The quality of boba and the drinks are comparable to most good places, but the base level of sweetness in the drinks is way too high! I had to get mine 50% sweet on the third try to get the sweetness down to an acceptable level. Other than that, this place is just "A-OK".

Pro Tip: if you like more tea and less sugar, get 50% sweet - its like regular sweet!

excerpts: - Jasmine Green tea with soy + boba: weak flavor
, soy might have watered it down, but even when I tried something milky (Horchata, below)
I was still unimpressed.
Boba was raw in the center (by raw
jasmine.author: Jocelyn L.
jasmine.review:
Gave Boba Guys a second chance after a below par experience, and reluctantly give a two star review.  I admire establishments that commit to responsible ingredients, so I'm sad that it it couldn't impress in the taste and price.

- Jasmine Green tea with soy + boba: weak flavor, soy might have watered it down, but even when I tried something milky (Horchata, below) I was still unimpressed.  Boba was raw in the center (by raw I mean the center is hard and crumbly)

- Horchata with grass jelly: literally just tasted like milk and cinnamon. As in I could've poured myself a glass of milk and sprinkled cinnamon on it. Grass jelly just ok, a bit firm in my opinion.

I can't say I'll be coming back with the steeper price range since the taste doesn't justify it.

excerpts: Today I got one of the specials, a Jasmine + Strawberry concoction of awesomeness.
jasmine.author: Alexander K.
jasmine.review:
I got boba here today, drank it, and then went back and drank another.

Boba texture is so crucial, and this place's is great.  Perhaps a bit on the soft side, but delightful nonetheless.

Horchata w/ boba is original and delicious (very sweet, but I'm not complaining).  Today I got one of the specials, a Jasmine + Strawberry concoction of awesomeness.

As if this place wasn't magical enough, they have a copy of the first Harry Potter on the table for anyone to read.  No other books, just HP.  Killin' it.

excerpts: Highly recommend the Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba AND pudding.
jasmine.author: Catherine C.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys just gets better and better. My boyfriend knows the owners, and they are constantly experimenting with new flavors and upping their milk tea game!

Highly recommend the Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba AND pudding. 

There's actually something here on the menu that is even more addicting than their milk tea...THE HONG KONG TOAST. Warm thick cut toast that is soft and chewy with a generous layer of marscarpone (at least that's what I suspect it is) and honey. JUST WOW.

excerpts: I tend to get the original or the Jasmine tea with tapioca.
The tapioca is soooo good.
Great consistency and chewy.
The milk is soooo smooth.
I guess this is how it is when you use Strauss Family Creamery organic milk.
jasmine.author: Joanne W.
jasmine.review:
THERE IS SOMETHING MAGICAL IN THE TEA HERE. IT'S LIKE THEY PUT PIXIE DUST AND UNICORN TEARS IN HERE.

I remember trying Boba Guys a while ago when I first moved to San Francisco. They were in KenKen Ramen, and my friends had told me it's "one of the best bubble teas they had." I felt like that was a far-fetched statement. I went, had their bubble tea, and I totally fell in love.

THEN, they opened an actual store. Every time I was in the Mission, or had friends visiting from out of town, I would bring them here. You can't go wrong with a place that is found by two guys that are passionate about bubble tea. They're also super duper nice!

I tend to get the original or the Jasmine tea with tapioca. The tapioca is soooo good. Great consistency and chewy. The milk is soooo smooth. I guess this is how it is when you use Strauss Family Creamery organic milk. LOVE!

Word on the street is that they're opening one near Union Square. My wallet is SO going to be empty.

excerpts: Liking these two drinks better than the jasmine milk tea I had at their first location that I couldn't taste enough of tea.
jasmine.author: Yvonne K.
jasmine.review:
Horchata with boba was goood. Just the right about of sweetness.
Hong Kong Style Milk Tea was also on point.

Liking these two drinks better than the jasmine milk tea I had at their first location that I couldn't taste enough of tea. 

Their cotton candy looked interesting but a little pricey to buy. Looked like they had samples at the register though..

Really glad they have their own little place now. No more trekking over to the Mission only to see that they aren't there.

excerpts: I couldn't decide between getting the jasmine milk tea or the regular milk tea.
I decided to go with the regular milk tea because it's the most popular drink to get.
jasmine.author: Jennifer H.
jasmine.review:
Love the name and I think the place is adorable! 

It's a small little shop around the street corner. Their menu is simple and clean so you're not bombarded with so many different choices. They let you customize your drink to any way you want it! (ex: wanting more tea as opposed to milk in your drink or vice versa, 50% sugar, 50% ice, etc..) It is pricey for boba around 4-6 dollars but it's NOT cash only so yay! They accept credit card which makes it super convenient! I couldn't decide between getting the jasmine milk tea or the regular milk tea. I decided to go with the regular milk tea because it's the most popular drink to get. My boyfriend got the muscat oolong milk tea which is a slow brew tea which means they brew the tea leaves on the spot! The slow brew options are also more expensive, because each drink is $5.50 and the regular ones are only $4.00. 

I enjoyed their black milk tea with boba. I got mine at 75% sugar because I like my drinks not too sweet. The tea was good and it was balanced with the milk. However, I didn't think it stood out to me in comparison to other black milk teas I've had before. I thought their boba was good. It was slightly too firm for me but it was still chewy. I tried my boyfriend's muscat oolong milk tea and that was definitely unique. It has this nice surprising kick at the end where the muscat taste comes through. Overall I think their drinks are good and I would come back again if I'm in the area.

excerpts: They have a good selection of drinks ranging from your typical Green Milk Tea or Jasmine Milk Tea to Horchata Milk Tea, which I thought is quite a unique flavor to add to the menu since it is more of a Mexican drink.
Sadly, I didn't order it for my first time.
Aside from the menu on the wall, there is a 'special' menu on the side by the cash register on mini-clipboards.
I ordered a Strawberry Jasmine Tea-Fresco and my boyfriend
(wow, he finally shows up again on my Yelp reviews..been MIA on my adventures..) got the Strawberry-Calpico Tea-Fresco(?).
Strawberry Jasmine Tea-Fresco is good.
It's sweet
and I feel like you can taste the flavors of the strawberry.
My bf ordered the Strawberry-Calpico Tea-Fresco and was a bit disappointed because he felt that it didn't taste like Calpico.
I got a sip of his drink and it tasted like my drink, mixed with yogurt -
so I guess you can say strawberry yogurt..
but in liquid form?
Haha.
jasmine.author: Mandy G.
jasmine.review:
I normally go to T pumps, ShareTea, or Purple Kow for my boba fix. I am happy to announce that I got out of my comfort zone and finally tried Boba Guys!! 

There are only 2 shops for Boba Guys - Stockton St and 19th St. I came to the one on 19th St because it is not only closer, but I naively thought this was on 19th AVE (lulz). Located in the hipster area of Mission, this storefront is small. Since it is Mission, parking is a bit hard to find due to metered spots. I luckily got a prime parking by the front of the store..but only after circling a bit. 

Small storefront with only a bar-countertop seating by the front window that has only about 3-4 seats, and a bench in front of the windows. They have a good selection of drinks ranging from your typical Green Milk Tea or Jasmine Milk Tea to Horchata Milk Tea, which I thought is quite a unique flavor to add to the menu since it is more of a Mexican drink. Sadly, I didn't order it for my first time. Aside from the menu on the wall, there is a 'special' menu on the side by the cash register on mini-clipboards. The staff was very nice and got our drinks done by the time we finished ordering (whaaa)!! 

I ordered a Strawberry Jasmine Tea-Fresco and my boyfriend (wow, he finally shows up again on my Yelp reviews..been MIA on my adventures..) got the Strawberry-Calpico Tea-Fresco(?). You get to choose your size (16 oz - 24 oz), toppings (tapioca, almond jelly, grass jelly), Milk (Straus Family Organic Milk, Almond Milk, Soy milk), and sweetness level (see chart on wall). 

Strawberry Jasmine Tea-Fresco is good. It's sweet and I feel like you can taste the flavors of the strawberry. My bf ordered the Strawberry-Calpico Tea-Fresco and was a bit disappointed because he felt that it didn't taste like Calpico. I got a sip of his drink and it tasted like my drink, mixed with yogurt - so I guess you can say strawberry yogurt..but in liquid form? Haha. 
I also ordered a Hong Kong Style Toast with condensed milk, which was 1 thick toast, sliced into 1/4th's, with whipped cream spread and honey or condensed milk drizzled over it. Was a bit of a disappointment for me, but slightly met my expectation.. 

Overall, I think I would come back if I was in the area. It's a bit of a drive since I am not in the area often, looking for parking is complicated, and the drinks remind me of T pumps - only difference is that they use organic products and loose-leaf tea instead of powder. Also, I'm sure the lines are long during the day (came at night) and it's just too much of a hipster hype for me :(

excerpts: i told him lychee flavor very faint though jasmine tea could be tasted.
chatted with him about recent trends in boba teas.
he later told me he was the owner and they would make another tea for me.

drink: lychee jasmine milk tea(4.5)

drink had more pronounced lychee taste, still subtle.
-seems

straus milk  ominated the drink
-boba included

but i passed
-size average, not grande as others.

jasmine.review:
Boba Guys gets  5 stars for exceptional service. rating the tea @4.5 stars

a young chinese guy asked me how i liked my tea. i told him lychee flavor very faint though jasmine tea could be tasted. chatted with him about recent trends in boba teas. he later told me he was the owner and they would make another tea for me.

drips:

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea which was REALLY REALLY SWEET!!!
Drinkable, but SWEET!
jasmine.author: Linz C.
jasmine.review:
I thought this place was just "OK."  If i was craving boba and in the area i would definitely come back, but i wouldn't go out of my way and go all the way down to the mission for a milk tea. 

Their drinks range between $4-5.50 which is pretty steep compared to the $1.00 teaway.  I got the jasmine milk tea which was REALLY REALLY SWEET!!! Drinkable, but SWEET! My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea and he seemed to be happy with it.  I usually don't get tapioca in my drinks but I thought I'd try theirs it since it was my first time here.  At first I thought they were a bit hard but after a while it began to grow on me. 

What I really came here for though was the sugar spun cotton candy!! I was hoping for one of their more exotic flavors like thai tea or sesame, but they only had lemon cookie.  The cashier was kind enough to give us a sample to make sure we like it before we buy it.  It was delicious! I would definitely come back for the cotton candy and to get my hands on a rose milk tea (i would have gotten that but i didn't see it until after i ordered my drink).

excerpts: Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly
- I tasted more of the milk versus the jasmine tea flavor.
jasmine.author: Philana C.
jasmine.review:
I've been wanting to try Boba Guys for a pretty long time! I finally got to try them on a hot and sunny day in San Francisco. Perfect for the cold drink! When we first arrived, there was a small crowd inside and outside the store. We ordered and shared the following drinks:

Rose Milk Tea with Almond Jelly - I noticed that the tea was actually brewed from real tea leaves! I really liked this drink! You can really taste the rose tea flavor. I think this would be my favorite drink! The almond jelly was soft and yummy. However, I definitely prefer their boba over the almond jelly.

Ice Matcha Latte with Tapioca - I love anything with matcha in it, so I had to get this. Flavor was pretty strong. One thing I did not like was that every sip I took, there were small specks of the matcha powder. However, I did loved the bobas! They were sweet and chewy! 

Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly - I tasted more of the milk versus the jasmine tea flavor. I think I have had better at other boba places.

Prices are a bit expensive; however, Boba Guys do use fresh ingredients including organic milk and they brew tea leaves instead of using all that powder and artificial ingredients. Also, we only had to wait for about 10 minutes even though there was a huge line and crowd ordering and waiting for their drinks.

excerpts: I was deciding between Jasmine Milk Tea, Duke of Earl Grey, and Rose Tea
and since this was my first time here, I decided to go simple and get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.

JASMINE MILK TEA W/ BOBA
Was a hefty $4 and though it was good, it wasn't $4 good.
You can taste both the jasmine and the milk tea without either flavor overwhelming the other.
But the boba was... interesting.
I have mixed feelings toward it.
It hardened a bit
so it wasn't fresh
and if you're going to call yourself "Boba Guys", ya better have some good boba!
But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea.
Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm...
We'll see how this goes.
But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea.
Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm...
We'll see how this goes.
jasmine.author: Sandy T.
jasmine.review:
I finally made it out to Boba Guys! I was deciding between Jasmine Milk Tea, Duke of Earl Grey, and Rose Tea and since this was my first time here, I decided to go simple and get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.

JASMINE MILK TEA W/ BOBA
Was a hefty $4 and though it was good, it wasn't $4 good. You can taste both the jasmine and the milk tea without either flavor overwhelming the other. But the boba was... interesting. I have mixed feelings toward it. It hardened a bit so it wasn't fresh and if you're going to call yourself "Boba Guys", ya better have some good boba! It did have an interesting chew to it though, almost like the Hi-Chew candy.

With this drink alone, Boba Guys did not win me over. But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea. Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm... We'll see how this goes. Until next time!

TIP: Watch out for the step! I didn't realize it was there when I was leaving and tweaked my ankle a bit. Thankfully, I wasn't hurt for more than two minutes but do be careful.

excerpts: However, their jasmine milk tea was good.
jasmine.author: Ashley D.
jasmine.review:
Hong Kong style milk tea was not good. It was below average. I've had Hong Kong milk teas from different places and this is probably the worst one I've ever drank. It was very creamy/milky and barely had any tea taste to it. And like their menu claims it's suppose to have some bitterness to it, but what I got was straight up milky. It tasted like homemade milk tea when I add too much milk or condensed milk. 

However, their jasmine milk tea was good.

excerpts: I tried their Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba.
Pricey for just a cup of tea, but I'm willing to support the cause.
Great quality tea, love the anteater logo...nothing to complain here!
So happy for my cup of hipster tea!
jasmine.author: Jennifer L.
jasmine.review:
There's Boba in the Mission?

Boba Guys saved my ass a trip all the way to the Outer Richmond. Yes, I was too lazy to drive out to Purple Kow! This was a sufficient milk tea fix and it was closer proximity to where I was at the moment.

I tried their Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba. Pricey for just a cup of tea, but I'm willing to support the cause. Great quality tea, love the anteater logo...nothing to complain here! So happy for my cup of hipster tea! :)

excerpts:
Update:
Could not even finish the Jasmine green tea with boba... just downgraded to one star.
jasmine.author: Mendel L.
jasmine.review:
I expected decent tea and boba at this place called Boba Guys. Sadly, it's just another mediocre boba shop in SF. 

I heard they focused on quality tea, and yes it seems they do. But when you let the milk overpower the tea and include sub par boba... Well for $4 bucks... not quite worth it.

Update:
Could not even finish the Jasmine green tea with boba... just downgraded to one star.

excerpts: I got the regular milk tea (basically black milk tea) with boba and 75% sweetness and my boyfriend got the Jasmine milk tea.
Super small shop
but it's really good!
jasmine.author: Katie L.
jasmine.review: It was my first time here but I've seen my share of Boba Guys posts. It's all street parking around here, but it wasn't as packed as you would expect with the one near Union Square. I got the regular milk tea (basically black milk tea) with boba and 75% sweetness and my boyfriend got the Jasmine milk tea. Super small shop but it's really good!

excerpts: I ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba as usual and not only the boba was tasteless, the milk tea was also very watered down.
It literally tasted like boba in water.
Their milk tea used to have this creamy milky taste
jasmine.author: Sherry Y.
jasmine.review:
I'm very sad to announce boba guys is no longer as good as it used to be. In fact, their milk tea got so borderline disgusting that I ended up throwing it away after a few sip. 

When it was still a pop up store in Mission I've been many times and every time the boba, the milk and the tea were just amazing. This is the first time I've been to their new permanent store and the experience was very disappointing. I ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba as usual and not only the boba was tasteless, the milk tea was also very watered down. It literally tasted like boba in water. Their milk tea used to have this creamy milky taste but I cannot taste any milk in my tea at all this time.

I hope Management will see my review and fix this quickly. Otherwise, there'll be one less thing for me to look forward to when I visit SF in the future.

excerpts: I loved the jasmine soy milk tea I ordered.
No extra charge for soy - whaaat!
Even more awesome.
Maybe their drinks are a bit pricey but at least I'm not being penalized for my inability to digest lactose.
jasmine.author: Amanda C.
jasmine.review:
Finally, a brick and mortar for Boba Guys! And a bigger menu? HURRAH!

I have an ongoing duel with lactose so I love Boba Guys for providing me with a dairy free boba solution. You can ask them which items on the menu can be substituted with soy milk. I loved the jasmine soy milk tea I ordered. No extra charge for soy - whaaat! Even more awesome. Maybe their drinks are a bit pricey but at least I'm not being penalized for my inability to digest lactose. F you, starbucks.

If you're not in the mood for boba, I highly recommend their almond jelly. It is delicious, soft and creamy, with a little wiggle jiggle.

Parking is easy. Check out those little side streets!

excerpts: It's very simple; there's only a few options to select from and what stood out to me was the strawberry jasmine green tea (which I think was a limited time only) and my boyfriend got the Horchata milk tea (we had to ask the baristas what was popular and what they liked the best and their customer service was on point!
Thanks guys!)
One sip of our drinks and we were in LOVE.
jasmine.author: Trisha L.
jasmine.review:
My boyfriend and I went here not too long ago because 1. I've never been to Boba Guys before and 2. I was craving boba. I've heard such great reviews about this place and it's crazy that I've never gone (since I've been living in Daly City/ San Francisco for 2 years). The store is pretty small itself, so you might not want to hang around inside the store, but admire the decor while you're waiting for your drink! It's very nice.

Anyways, to the menu. It's very simple; there's only a few options to select from and what stood out to me was the strawberry jasmine green tea (which I think was a limited time only) and my boyfriend got the Horchata milk tea (we had to ask the baristas what was popular and what they liked the best and their customer service was on point! Thanks guys!) One sip of our drinks and we were in LOVE. They were both delicious! 

The drinks are very affordable and I do recommend you guys to come here and try their teas!

excerpts: I've decided to go with Jasmine Milk Tea with Honey Boba.
50% sweet and Half & Half milk.
The boba was semi hard/chewy but had a honey flavor to it which taste really good.
The Jasmine Milk Tea on
it's own for Half sweet was already really overpowering!
Jasmine Milk Tea with Honey Boba did not work out for me!
jasmine.author: Anney T.
jasmine.review:
I was extremely skeptical debating myself what kind of drink to get.

At first, I had Rose Black Tea in mind, however, after eating japanese food for dinner. I've decided something that was light sounds better. 
I asked the cashier what she recommended, unfortunately, it was mostly strong tea flavors that she recommended. So I opted out of her recommendations. 
I've decided to go with Jasmine Milk Tea with Honey Boba. 50% sweet and Half & Half milk.
The boba was semi hard/chewy but had a honey flavor to it which taste really good. The Jasmine Milk Tea on it's own for Half sweet was already really overpowering!
I really hoped that I actually got to sample the tea before ordering my drink!

50% Sweet, Jasmine Milk Tea with Honey Boba did not work out for me!

I will come back to try another flavor next timee!

excerpts: Got the jasmine milk tea with boba, which came out to $4.
A little pricey but the tea is great.
Boba is a little chewy for my taste but still good
jasmine.author: Kristie M.
jasmine.review: Solid boba place! Got the jasmine milk tea with boba, which came out to $4. A little pricey but the tea is great. Boba is a little chewy for my taste but still good

excerpts:
Loooved the two drinks we got:
- Milk Tea with Tapioca
- Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly
jasmine.author: Jeanie F.
jasmine.review:
Heads up: if you're going here to see the boba guys, they're probably not going to be there. (In case you're wondering, I was not going here to see the boba guys, but just wanted to point it out in case you were)

I was totally confused when we walked in as I was expecting to see the boba guys shown in all the Yelp photos, but it was some other guy who looked nothing like them. So I was thinking we're in the wrong place. I also was not aware that they're in the same space as Ken Ken Ramen, which added to my confusion. So we went in and out of the place probably looking pretty dumb before we finally decided that we were in fact in the right place.

Loooved the two drinks we got:
- Milk Tea with Tapioca
- Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly

The drinks were the perfect amount of sweet and came with a lot of tapioca. They tasted healthy and refreshing; definitely not like other places I've been to where it tastes like I'm drinking artificial flavored sugar. The almond jelly was rather interesting and kind of melted/dissolved in my mouth which was kinda fun. The balls were slightly hard and could've been cooked a little more, but still decent.

The hours suck big boooty. Like who closes at 2pm on a Saturday? Makes it hard for brunch, but hopefully they'll open later! 

Oh & they also have alcoholic boba! (see my picture for the selection)

excerpts: I had jasmine milk tea with tapioca and almond milk, and my husband had their classic black tea with tapioca and regular (Straus creamery!)
milk.
Both were sooooo good.
It's great how customizable their menu is (toppings, sweetness level, milk choice) and how they really want you to be happy with your drink.
Also plus for non-dairy drinkers, the almond/soy options are at no extra charge!
That made me really happy.
jasmine.author: Casey C.
jasmine.review:
My husband and I came here yesterday and LOVED everything about it. The space is  really nice, their teas are delicious, and the staff is so friendly! They even sell bags of their tea at the counter for home - and all are made to go with milk. 


I had jasmine milk tea with tapioca and almond milk, and my husband had their classic black tea with tapioca and regular (Straus creamery!) milk. Both were sooooo good. It's great how customizable their menu is (toppings, sweetness level, milk choice) and how they really want you to be happy with your drink. Also plus for non-dairy drinkers, the almond/soy options are at no extra charge! That made me really happy. It's the little things.

All in all, our new favorite tea place.

excerpts: I liked the milk flavor and the Jasmine tea was a good strength for me.
jasmine.author: Wendy H.
jasmine.review:
Ok Boba Guys, I think Straus Milk Guys is a better descriptor for your shop. I liked the milk flavor and the Jasmine tea was a good strength for me. You had good milk flavor without overcompensating by over-sweeting the drink. 

Your aardvark logo and mason jars are fun too, though they obviously don't affect the quality of the drink (except in my mind, of course). 

Now, if you really want to do your name justice, get your boba up to par with the rest of your drink! They are sweet, which is good, but the texture is off. They are way too chewy. They are not QQ at all, which is what I think the ultimate boba texture should be (my favorite in the states are from Sweetheart cafe in Berkeley). I like my boba not too tough (undercooked) not too mushy (overcooked) and now not too bouncy (not sure how you got your boba to be like this). You boba are what I would call chewing gum bouncy.

Best of luck to you as you try to perfect your "Grade A balls".

excerpts: We had Jasmine Milk Tea and Original Milk Tea
jasmine.author: Lilian K.
jasmine.review:
We had the Boba Guys cater at my son's first birthday party and WHAT A HIT! I've never heard so many good things about the milk tea. We had Jasmine Milk Tea and Original Milk Tea and both were huge favorites of all the party guests. 

The best part? the awesome service by Andrew himself. He delivered and served the boba milk tea with such grace, expertise (I wouldn't have the slightest clue what to put first in the cup) and a smile on his face.... I would recommend the Boba Guys for any special event!

excerpts: Loved both the Horchata and Jasmine Milk Teas.
The Horchata milk tea was, as I expected, on the sweeter side
but I didn't mind at all.
The Jasmine milk tea was so refreshing -
I could just taste the strong, natural tea leaves infused into the milk!
The boba itself was on the starchy/gummy side, but it wasn't a deal breaker.
Can't wait to come back!
jasmine.author: Josh L.
jasmine.review: Loved both the Horchata and Jasmine Milk Teas. The Horchata milk tea was, as I expected, on the sweeter side but I didn't mind at all. The Jasmine milk tea was so refreshing - I could just taste the strong, natural tea leaves infused into the milk! The boba itself was on the starchy/gummy side, but it wasn't a deal breaker. Can't wait to come back!

excerpts: Type of tea: lychee green, jasmine green, oolong, black...
jasmine.author: Nicole C.
jasmine.review:
My new obsession. I was unfalteringly loyal to Lollicup and Quickly for so many years, but I've finally found a place that offers variety without charging extra. 

Things you get to choose
Drink style: hong kong, thai tea, horchata... hot or cold?
Type of tea: lychee green, jasmine green, oolong, black...
Milk: half and half (organic- classic SF), almond, soy
Additions: boba or jelly
Sweetness: 0, 25, 50, 75, or 100% (100% is the same level you'd find other places)

The milk options without extra charge are what really got me- I'm lactose intolerant but I love boba. This place is a dream.

Their logo is also fantastic. I will be back.

excerpts: Went in here for the first time and tried the Horchata and jasmine milk tea with boba I liked how good and fresh the boba tasted.
The only thing about the location is parking
, it's hard to find.
jasmine.author: Jennifer R.
jasmine.review: Went in here for the first time and tried the Horchata and jasmine milk tea with boba I liked how good and fresh the boba tasted. The only thing about the location is parking, it's hard to find.

excerpts: They had three selections: Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Soy Milk Tea.
I got their Jasmine milk tea, and I've gotta say best Jasmine milk tea I've tried.
Bf got their Milk tea and friend got their Soy milk tea, both were interesting, but  tasted legit.
jasmine.author: Oriel F.
jasmine.review:
So we came here on a Friday afternoon, eager to try their milk tea, and hear their story. Unfortunately the guys weren't there, but the lady that served us was nice and friendly so we did got a drink.

They had three selections: Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Soy Milk Tea. I got their Jasmine milk tea, and I've gotta say best Jasmine milk tea I've tried. Bf got their Milk tea and friend got their Soy milk tea, both were interesting, but  tasted legit. their tapioca was just right.

For us poor college kids, it's a bit pricey, that's why I knocked down one star but I'm glad we tried it and had a good experience.

excerpts: Jasmine Milk Tea - $4/cup
Yes, it's pretty expensive for a cup compared to what you can find on Irving.
Sucks even more that it's almost half a cup of ice too!
The Jasmine milk tea over all is delicious.
Tapioca is plentlyful (went up to the line on the plastic to-go cup).
The tapioca could use a little work.
They're hard and a lot of them are stuck together.
I didn't get a bartender to make my drink, so
no fancy shakes to prepare my drink.
jasmine.author: Jess W.
jasmine.review:
4 stars? 3.5?
You tell me. 

Finally got a chance to come by on a Friday afternoon after wanting to come here for weeks. I even got a meter with 40 minutes - score! 

I think I understand why their hours are so strange - Boba Guys is not their own establishment? They're renting from another store during the time the store is closed? -- Just a guess after some observation. 

Jasmine Milk Tea - $4/cup 
Yes, it's pretty expensive for a cup compared to what you can find on Irving. Sucks even more that it's almost half a cup of ice too! The Jasmine milk tea over all is delicious. Tapioca is plentlyful (went up to the line on the plastic to-go cup). The tapioca could use a little work. They're hard and a lot of them are stuck together. I didn't get a bartender to make my drink, so no fancy shakes to prepare my drink. Mine was basically poured out of a container you'd make homemade lemonade which is kinda bummer. 

My friend ordered the Soy Milk Tea ($4) and it tasted a bit watered down, but I'm not sure if that's just the "style" of this flavor as I never had a soy milk tea prior to this experience. Also it's brown in color. 

They were also serving veggie or chicken (?) curry for $8 a tray. It smelled really yummy!

Boba Guys has a lot of potential. I wish they were closer to home and have less weird hours.

excerpts: I've tried the jasmine milk tea, HK milk tea, Iced green tea matcha latte
and they were all so good.
The only complaint that I have is that they make all the drinks EXTREMELY sweet.
Trust me!
jasmine.author: Laura T.
jasmine.review:
I love Boba Guys! I love that they don't use powder, they brew their teas fresh and their pretty quick. They use Straus organic milk which is a + in my book. I've tried the jasmine milk tea, HK milk tea, Iced green tea matcha latte and they were all so good. The only complaint that I have is that they make all the drinks EXTREMELY sweet. Trust me! I've been here multiple times and it was like drinking diabetes through a straw. 

Always ask for light sweetness.

excerpts: My favorite is the jasmine green.
jasmine.author: Jonathan D.
jasmine.review:
Best boba in San Francisco. Hands down. 

You can actually taste the tea and the milk at the same time. My favorite is the jasmine green. 

Although there are only three flavors, it seems as if Boba Guys have mastered the taste for all of them. I am all about quality over quantity and I'm pretty sure Boba Guys agree with me too. 

Can't wait for their new shop to open with extended hours. 

P.S. On weekends, they have horchata.... off the chain!

excerpts: I got the jasmine green tea with Boba which was pretty good except for how sweet it was.
My sister got the coffee boba tea which didn't really taste like coffee...
Just like regular milk tea.
jasmine.author: Camille A.
jasmine.review:
Like many places in San Francisco Boba guys can be spotted with A long line outside it's doors. When you order they ask for a sweetness level,boba (or jelly) and what type of milk; soy, almond, organic. The 100% sweetness was very sweet. I would have probably gone for50%. They do have a carafe of simple syrup and water on a side table to adjust sweetness. I got the jasmine green tea with Boba which was pretty good except for how sweet it was. My sister got the coffee boba tea which didn't really taste like coffee... Just like regular milk tea. They also offer bubble tea smoothies, and cotton candy which I didn't try but looked to have interesting flavors. 

This is a good place if you have a bubble tea craving. But I was surprised at the small variety of flavors. They did have mango and strawberry, Thai tea n horchata , but I was really surprised that they didn't have flavors like tarowhich I find commonly at most bubble tea places.

This place also included some bar seats but was really more of a take out bubble tea place.

excerpts: The Thai and Jasmine milk tea is good though, and the boba is well cooked- not too hard and not too soft.
jasmine.author: Karissa K.
jasmine.review: Horchata is a bit too overpowering and the sugar and cinnamon + milk ratio isn't even. The Thai and Jasmine milk tea is good though, and the boba is well cooked- not too hard and not too soft.

excerpts: Couple of my favorites are the Hong Kong, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Earl Grey.
They have options on sugar levels.
I take my friends here and they usually get something different from me and they end up loving their drink.
They can do wrong.
My friends like jellys in their boba which they say are good, but I always get boba balls.
Let me tell you their boba balls are made to perfection.
Not too chewy or hard.
Perfectly made.
jasmine.author: Soroosh A.
jasmine.review:
My favorite boba place in SF, in CA, and therefore my favorite boba place anywhere. Their diverse menu has led me to drink a plethora of their boba which have been amazing. Couple of my favorites are the Hong Kong, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Earl Grey. They have options on sugar levels. I take my friends here and they usually get something different from me and they end up loving their drink. They can do wrong. My friends like jellys in their boba which they say are good, but I always get boba balls. Let me tell you their boba balls are made to perfection. Not too chewy or hard. Perfectly made. If you like boba you must go here. 

Con: there lines are ridiculously long. I hate to wait but they are worth the wait....granted after waiting that long I usually end up getting two boba's.

excerpts: and I ordered the classic black and jasmine tea.
We asked for 25% sweetness and I opted for the jelly, while she got tapioca balls and we were both satisfied with the tea itself and the toppings.
On the next visit, I decided to try something new and try an horchata boba, unlike the other drinks, this time I wasn't able to adjust the sweetness since the horchata mix was pre-made.
I tried the horchata on the first taste and the drink was overly sweet, but the staff was really helpful and offered to remake the drink and dilute the mixture by adding more milk.
I was really happy with the end result of my drink thanks to their friendly and very helpful staff.
Honestly can't wait to try the rest of their menu on future visits.
jasmine.author: Limuel G.
jasmine.review:
Definitely a good spot that serves some good quality boba drinks and best of all they don't use powder like some other places. I'm not a boba person and usually just enjoy the milk teas minus the tapioca, but their "balls" are homemade and pretty top notch. I really appreciate the steps into crafting a perfect cup of boba, from their homemade pearls and jellies, to the quality of teas and syrups, and the different milk options they offer. The steps they take is very methodical and they really want the customer to notice hence the lab equipment visible in all areas of their shop.

I've been satisfied with both my experiences here, on my first visit I wanted to try something pretty standard so my girlfriend and I ordered the classic black and jasmine tea. We asked for 25% sweetness and I opted for the jelly, while she got tapioca balls and we were both satisfied with the tea itself and the toppings. On the next visit, I decided to try something new and try an horchata boba, unlike the other drinks, this time I wasn't able to adjust the sweetness since the horchata mix was pre-made. I tried the horchata on the first taste and the drink was overly sweet, but the staff was really helpful and offered to remake the drink and dilute the mixture by adding more milk. I was really happy with the end result of my drink thanks to their friendly and very helpful staff. Honestly can't wait to try the rest of their menu on future visits.

excerpts:
Even the jasmine milk teas that my other two friends got at 100% sweet tasted watery...

The jasmine milk tea was very strong in jasmine and very floral!
jasmine.author: Rachel L.
jasmine.review:
I really want to like this place, but I can't say I completely do from the drink I had. I got a hojicha milk tea, 50% sweet and it just tasted very strange. The hojicha was a little too roasted, which would have been fine if the overall drink wasn't watered down. It almost tasted like water with milky food coloring and hojicha flavor. My friend also ordered his hk milk tea 50% sweet and it was even more watered down and less sweet than my drink. Please have more consistency! Even the jasmine milk teas that my other two friends got at 100% sweet tasted watery...

There are two things I like about this place though: 
1. The jasmine milk tea was very strong in jasmine and very floral! 
2. The boba was nice and chewy.

Boba guys seems to know how to do the flavors, just not the milk tea part. I hope they change something, and maybe I'll like it more next time I go!

excerpts: My favorite is the jasmine milk tea, but you can't go wrong with the classic black milk tea.
jasmine.author: Aaron W.
jasmine.review:
Okay fine...I'll admit that one of the first reasons for why I wanted to come here a couple years ago was because they put their milk tea in a mason jar. I mean come on, HOW HIPSTER IS THAT?! Yeah there's other boba places that do that now, but Boba Guys was one of the first places that pioneered this mason jar/glass jar boba movement. It makes me sad that now they mainly just use regular cups...but oh well, they had a good run.

This place isn't just about being hipster and glamorous though. The boba and milk tea is actually good! They have a pretty wide variety of options, but I like sticking to the originals. My favorite is the jasmine milk tea, but you can't go wrong with the classic black milk tea. Go ahead and try the Rose milk tea and the Hong Kong style ones as well because those are both excellent choices as well. 

What separates this place from others is the fact that their boba is actually good too. It always seems to be the right balance of chewiness and firmness! Yum. These guys really are the boba guys.

excerpts: I usually go for the jasmine milk tea with boba and have never been disappointed.
Fair warning though, parking here is terrible and the lines are almost always long.
Luckily, they service is quick and friendly!
jasmine.author: Jessica W.
jasmine.review: Very popular and has quality boba! It's hard to find a boba place that is consistent. I usually go for the jasmine milk tea with boba and have never been disappointed. Fair warning though, parking here is terrible and the lines are almost always long. Luckily, they service is quick and friendly!

excerpts: I thoroughly enjoyed the classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and Hong Kong styled milk tea.
I would suggest staying with these classic flavors.
jasmine.author: Jennifer W.
jasmine.review: I thoroughly enjoyed the classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and Hong Kong styled milk tea. I would suggest staying with these classic flavors. The horchata milk tea and Thai milk tea were not that tasty, in my opinion. The horchata milk tea seemed not as creamy as I expect a milk tea to be, but I like that it wasn't that sweet. You can customize your sweetness level on most drinks. I did not find the boba pearls here to be all that consistent, sometimes too hard. They also have a slow bar menu where the tea or coffee is brewed by cup, but like it says, it's slower, and also more pricey. Since it sells itself as a hip, trendy boba place, expect to pay more for boba here overall.

excerpts: My favorite drink is their Jasmine milk tea with either their organic milk or almond milk and tapioca pearls.
I'm also impressed with their customer service and fast service.
Even on days where the line is about 25 people long, they speed through orders like crazy!
Boba Guys is easily my favorite boba place in the Bay Area!
Keep it up!!
jasmine.author: Mitchell K.
jasmine.review: I am an avid boba drinker and Boba Guys has time and time again wowed me at the quality, consistency, and value of their drinks. Their teas are actually real and are genuine tasting; they don't have a long list of flavors, but perfect the ones they do offer. My favorite drink is their Jasmine milk tea with either their organic milk or almond milk and tapioca pearls. I'm also impressed with their customer service and fast service. Even on days where the line is about 25 people long, they speed through orders like crazy! Boba Guys is easily my favorite boba place in the Bay Area! Keep it up!!

excerpts: Their jasmine milk tea is honestly the best I've ever had.
It's rich in flavor and is always fresh.
jasmine.author: Lisa H.
jasmine.review:
Their jasmine milk tea is honestly the best I've ever had. It's rich in flavor and is always fresh. I've tried the thai iced tea, horchata, hong kong style and matcha green tea as well and they are all just as delicious. The boba is really sweet and has a chewy consistency to it. 

They atmosphere of the place is really great. It's kind of like a hipster tapioca place. The wait to order is never long. I have never waited for more than 5 minutes to order and I usually get my drinks in about 2 or 3 minutes. There is a small seating area too. 

4 stars because of the price for the drink. I understand that the tea is really good quality but 4 dollars seems a little steep. Also, there's only one size for all the drinks. Sometimes I just need a large drink after a rough day. And sometimes the thirst is just real.

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea
: I often jude a milk tea shop by this standard.
It's classic, simple, but takes understanding of milk tea to get it PROPERLY made.
Well, these guys managed to screw this up.
3 of us ordered it just to be sure.
And yes, they all came out identically disgusting.
-- too watery, yet milk to tea ratio... too much milk
--so it tasted plain.
75% sweet.
100% sweet.
Both pointless
It's like adding more sugar to water.
The tea was standard jasmine but more importantly, the ratios were all wrong.
jasmine.author: Gregory F.
jasmine.review:
Gimmick or the real deal? 

It's a gimmick. And it's hype. People are just convincing themselve it's good because of the marketing (that's marketing anyway). I don't know which is worse, Tea Pumps or this place. And if you think Tea Pumps is good, you're not Asian enough or you're too Americanized to know what is "good." (Americanized versions of Asian things are always bad if you've tried the Asian-original, whether it be movies or food) And Tea Pumps and Boba Guys are oviously the PF Changs of Chinese food. "chinese" food.

For a company that markets themselves as meticulous guys scientifically crafting the best milk tea recipes, I'd say these scientists missed the mark pretty hard. I think it was not so much meticulous crafting, but more just a few guys in a kitchen mixing stuff together without the slightest culinary skill or wit whatsover... like college dorm kids that don't know how to cook or mix flavors... because these are by far the worst ratios and recipes I've ever had, aside from Tea Pumps.  

Political news needs to fact-check, BobaGuys needs to flavor-check. But they really need to think about flavors not so much in a scientific process. It's also wit and experience in a culinary sense. Like I said, it's like college dorm kids without the slightest sophistication of taste or the slightest art of cooking trying to play with a bunch of beakers n pans. Mixing flavors and devising combinations is wit and intuition, not calculation and process.

-------------
I came in with a large party and tried several flavors:

Jasmine milk tea: I often jude a milk tea shop by this standard. It's classic, simple, but takes understanding of milk tea to get it PROPERLY made. Well, these guys managed to screw this up. 3 of us ordered it just to be sure.
