And yes, they all came out identically disgusting.  -- too watery, yet milk to tea ratio... too much milk--so it tasted plain. 75% sweet. 100% sweet. Both pointless It's like adding more sugar to water. The tea was standard jasmine but more importantly, the ratios were all wrong. 

Earl Grey Milk tea: This is my staple order at any milk tea place that would serve it. I've tried it EVERYWHERE. You can say I'm a bit of a harlot for earl grey milk tea... I've been everywhere for it. Well, Boba Guys destroyed this drink. Good job. B for effort. 
It was too watery; had a sharp hint of lychee; had a gross accent of lavender, which I now assume they used the BUTT of all teas--TAZO.. or they used the post 2012 Mighty Leaf version of Earl Grey... which is beyond butt.. and I distinctly remember that nightmare to this day, and I slightly relived it in this milk tea. And the tea to mlik to water ratio was obviously wrong. It just did NOT taste good.

Horchatta Milk tea: not bad. not great. It was like a watery Horchatta with boba. Not so great. They're better off with the store-bought and just throwing boba in it. They don't know how to make horchatta properly.

Hong Kong Style: This was their best drink out of the lot. Surprisingly, for such a terrible milk tea place that Americanized the milk tea industry like Tea Pumps, which just means... detroying it.... they managed to get HONG KONG STYLE pretty good. I tried this one last in the lot... maybe anything par would seem good.

I'm not a fan of Quickly's or TapEx, but there are a few with owners that really know how to make it. But I've also had the worst of the lot, to the point of spitting it back into the cup and chucking it into the trash. And Boba Guys, along with Tea Pumps, are in a tight race for the worst.

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea is on point.
jasmine.author: Ingrid C.
jasmine.review: So good! Boba is the perfect texture, 50% sweet is just the right amount. Jasmine milk tea is on point.

excerpts: I am partial to the jasmine milk tea one - and they always give me the option of choosing what type of milk and level of sweetness.
The boba itself is soft and chewy - and they give you a generous amount per cup.
I can't recommend any other boba place as highly as Boba Guys.
jasmine.author: Sw A.
jasmine.review:
The bad reviews for this place are due to people complaining about price, long lines, and their branding (come on, really?). 
Boba Guys is wonderful.  They have some really awesome flavors like horchata and hong kong style, but all the classics are delicious as well. I am partial to the jasmine milk tea one - and they always give me the option of choosing what type of milk and level of sweetness. 
The boba itself is soft and chewy - and they give you a generous amount per cup. I can't recommend any other boba place as highly as Boba Guys.

excerpts:
I tried their HK style milk tea and their jasmine milk tea. 

I personally like the jasmine a little bit more.
jasmine.author: Stephen W.
jasmine.review:
This is my second time around and its time for a review. I tried different drinks both times in order to get a taste and see what this place is all about. I tried their HK style milk tea and their jasmine milk tea. 

If you're into just the tea flavor, these 2 drinks will be good for you. The boba itself is soft and chewy and the price for these drinks are comparable to the market price as of now. You can actually taste the tea flavor. I personally like the jasmine a little bit more. 

The drawback is the location of this boba shop. The lack of parking makes it difficult and I'm sure many people ended up leaving because of it. If you want to give this place a shot, definitely go during the day and there will be plenty of parking. If you go at night, expect a wait time to order and to find parking. 

Overall, good taste and good boba but no good on the parking hence 4 stars.

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea, and 2 STARS because I LITERALLY make the same thing (yes, I'm totally dissing my own jasmine milk tea creation)
Basically, back when I worked at peets and we had down time, I would create random drinks and I wanted to make my "own" jasmine milk tea.

If you want to make the same thing, purchase the Peet's Jasmine tea bag (exact tea flavor), add your preference of milk (half and half or heavy whipping cream for richer flavor) and add simple syrup (This process will kind of kill you a bit inside after realizing how much sugar goes into it to match the sweetness.)
jasmine.author: Harriet W.
jasmine.review:
I got the jasmine milk tea, and 2 STARS because I LITERALLY make the same thing (yes, I'm totally dissing my own jasmine milk tea creation)

I didn't even finish it before chucking it away, it kinda killed me since I paid $4 for it. 

Basically, back when I worked at peets and we had down time, I would create random drinks and I wanted to make my "own" jasmine milk tea. If you want to make the same thing, purchase the Peet's Jasmine tea bag (exact tea flavor), add your preference of milk (half and half or heavy whipping cream for richer flavor) and add simple syrup (This process will kind of kill you a bit inside after realizing how much sugar goes into it to match the sweetness.)

excerpts: Classic, jasmine, and HK milk tea are all superb, the horchata was watered down in comparison to the other drinks, I wasn't a fan.
My friends got their drinks with no boba and I think it dropped the price by like 50 cents.
jasmine.author: Ryan L.
jasmine.review: Came here on a few occasions, there's never a wait so the drinks come out relatively fast except if you get the slow bar drinks. Classic, jasmine, and HK milk tea are all superb, the horchata was watered down in comparison to the other drinks, I wasn't a fan. My friends got their drinks with no boba and I think it dropped the price by like 50 cents. I tried the lychee green tea and that was fantastic as well - steep at $5 for the slow bar drinks but it warrants a try.

excerpts: Jasmine Milk Tea: Tastes really florally and creamy.
jasmine.author: Katrina T.
jasmine.review:
ANOTHER BEST OF THE BEST BOBA PLACES. 

Lol, clearly I loveeeee boba. It's so addicting! Went here today with my cousin and gf and we loved it! They are using this small japanese restaurant as an incubator before actually finding a legit place to open up their store! CAN'T WAIT! 

They have different flavors for the day (they're pretty basic though, well today was). We each got a different flavor: 

Jasmine Milk Tea: Tastes really florally and creamy. 

Soy Milk Tea: I GOT THIS! Super light in taste! Didn't know soy boba even existed! What a clever and simple idea! 

Regular Milk Tea: YUMs. 

We wanted to take it to go, but I really wanted to take a pic of my boba in a mason jar. So cuteeeee! So glad we came here and it wasn't crowded! The workers are friendly too!

excerpts: I had a jasmine tea with almond jelly.
Once again, it was abso fabu.
I love that almond stuff.
I love the Boba Guys.
And best of all, they are such nice people.
I just wish they would come to Oakland.
COME TO OAKLAND!
jasmine.author: Veronica H.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys continues to make me SO HAPPY! 
I had a jasmine tea with almond jelly. Once again, it was abso fabu. I love that almond stuff. I love the Boba Guys. And best of all, they are such nice people. I just wish they would come to Oakland. COME TO OAKLAND!

excerpts: The jasmine is so fragrant and lightly sweet.
jasmine.author: Grace K.
jasmine.review:
Solid. 

I don't know anywhere else in the city where I can get as high quality boba as this place. For those that ranked Boba Guys low- where do you go?? 

The key is the quality of the tea. The jasmine is so fragrant and lightly sweet. My friends who had never had boba are hooked on that one. 

I favor their Thai iced tea. SO. GOOD. 

And they let u mix different types of boba and jelly!! Awesome.

excerpts: I got a jasmine milk tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea.
Both were pretty good.
jasmine.author: Josephine C.
jasmine.review:
I love how their milk tea tastes more like tea than crazy flavorful syrups. I enjoy the taste of tea and coffee. I'm glad I found a place like this. 

I got a jasmine milk tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea. Both were pretty good. I would come back again to try their horchata. 

Its pretty low key and mellow.

excerpts: Price is $6 for a spiked boba jasmine milk tea
is steep.
Everything is pre-made and taken out from the fridge.
Jasmine milk tea taste like any other milk tea
and heck you can get it at an Asian market.
People are lining out the door for this stuff (tpump, purple kow, etc, etc).
Why didn't I think of this?
I guess you can mix alcohol with pretty much anything.
jasmine.author: Elliot Y.
jasmine.review:
Heard of this spot through yelp and figured why not.  I drove by this boba shop without seeing any signs.  Parked my car, and walked by a temporary sign on the street and saw boba.  Once you walk in, I was not sure if we were in the right spot since a host asked if we wanted to eat.  I was like uh.. I'm here for a drink only.. boba!  Then she directed me to the front of the restaurant where the bar was.  This was where they served boba.

Welcome to hipster-ville.  Crowds wearing ray-bans indoors on a foggy day and flannel shirts, skinny jeans with converse and a messenger bag. Not much of a boba fan myself.  Price is $6 for a spiked boba jasmine milk tea is steep.  Everything is pre-made and taken out from the fridge.  All the guy did was pour and stir, add some alcohol, BAMN! 

So the big question, how did it taste for $6?  Well, at least the boba was good, however all of it were stuck together.  I tried to stir and separate it, but it was not separating.  Jasmine milk tea taste like any other milk tea and heck you can get it at an Asian market. People are lining out the door for this stuff (tpump, purple kow, etc, etc).  Why didn't I think of this? I guess you can mix alcohol with pretty much anything.

excerpts: Got jasmine milk tea with 50% sugar, almond milk, and almond jelly
but i didnt like it at all.
Especially disappointed with the jelly since i heard so much hype about it :( i appreciated the choice of milk and sweetness though.
jasmine.author: Jenny N.
jasmine.review: I guess this was just not my place lol. The service was nice but the drinks just didnt cut it for me. Got jasmine milk tea with 50% sugar, almond milk, and almond jelly but i didnt like it at all. Especially disappointed with the jelly since i heard so much hype about it :( i appreciated the choice of milk and sweetness though.

excerpts: I got a Spiked Jasmine Milk Tea Boba ($6), which consists of simple jasmine milk tea, vodka, sake and pearls.
Typically when you mix boba with alcohol, especially something as strong as vodka, it tends to overpower the milk tea and ends up tasting bland.
To battle this, one might make the tea to alcohol ratio higher, or just add more sugar to the tea.
I felt like none of this was done here, and the drink came out tasteless.
It gave a good buzz, but after a few sips I was ready to go.
jasmine.author: Dmitriy S.
jasmine.review:
I love boba. I love alcohol. The combination is typically a hit or miss. Sadly, this was a miss. Every since I've heard of Boba Guys, I've been thrilled to try them. Boba? In the Mission? Served out of mason jars? Can't get more hipster SF than that. A very curious concept that needs a bit of tweaking.

The menu is fairly simple. You either get normal boba, spiked boba, or one of their intriguing special creations. Boogie bear sounded good, but I decided to see what they were famous for. The guy behind the counter was fairly quiet and had a "mixologist" attitude to him. Not necessarily bad, but not chatty or welcoming.

On to the boba. I got a Spiked Jasmine Milk Tea Boba ($6), which consists of simple jasmine milk tea, vodka, sake and pearls. Typically when you mix boba with alcohol, especially something as strong as vodka, it tends to overpower the milk tea and ends up tasting bland. To battle this, one might make the tea to alcohol ratio higher, or just add more sugar to the tea. I felt like none of this was done here, and the drink came out tasteless. It gave a good buzz, but after a few sips I was ready to go. It just felt like I was drinking watered down alcoholic milk. 

Boba Guys have been around for only 2 years. There's always room for improvement. I'm a fan of their concept, but the execution needs work. You're better off going to any local boba shop and bringing a mini vodka bottle with you.

excerpts: I ordered a regular milk tea and a jasmine milk tea with pearls for my cousin.
The guy then asked if i wanted to change anything with my drink and i told him no.
We get our drinks and it did not meet my standards of milk tea..
AT ALL.
It was bitter and not sweetened at all even though the menu says that all drinks are made with 100% sweetness unless told otherwise.
jasmine.author: Brenda H.
jasmine.review:
Stopped by here the other day with my cousin since her friend had been raving about it for a number of days and since we were in the city we decided to check it out before heading home. As we drove by there was a line so I thought this place must be good since there is a line out the door ( the location is tiny, that's why the line is out the door.) I get into line and read the menu and a couple other reviews to see what i'm going to order. Everyone raves that this place is organic and it's delicious so i figured why not go with just the regular milk tea. I ordered a regular milk tea and a jasmine milk tea with pearls for my cousin. The guy then asked if i wanted to change anything with my drink and i told him no. We get our drinks and it did not meet my standards of milk tea.. AT ALL. It was bitter and not sweetened at all even though the menu says that all drinks are made with 100% sweetness unless told otherwise. I thought that my cup was bad my cousins cup of tea turned out even worst.. needless to say both my cousin and i were not satisfied with our milk teas and don't plan on coming back.

p.s: the plus side the pearls were the only thing that we enjoyed from boba guys.

excerpts: I got a jasmine milk tea with boba and grass jelly.
The tea could have have more flavor.
My friend got one of the specialty teas with boba and his was fairly strong.
Grass jelly was cut way too small and it was annoying because I could barely taste it.
jasmine.author: Winnie T.
jasmine.review:
Cute little boba shop in the Mission. My friend and I stopped by here before going to Dolores Park. 

I got a jasmine milk tea with boba and grass jelly. The tea could have have more flavor. My friend got one of the specialty teas with boba and his was fairly strong. Grass jelly was cut way too small and it was annoying because I could barely taste it. Prices were too high for what we got. 

I do like how you can choose the sweetness level and no one argues. 

Overall, I might come again only because there aren't many boba shops in the Mission and the staff is nice.

excerpts: The Classic Boba and The Jasmine Milk Tea are very fresh and you have a choice of having 75% or 100% sweet in your boba.
I also tried the Hong Khong Toast and that was delicious as well
but I don't know when I would eat that during the day.
Perhaps as a midnight snack.
Love the environment inside the building and gives a cozy feeling.
jasmine.author: Calvin M.
jasmine.review: Coming from Southern California and living in an area that has boba on every corner. This place is amazing. The Classic Boba and The Jasmine Milk Tea are very fresh and you have a choice of having 75% or 100% sweet in your boba. I also tried the Hong Khong Toast and that was delicious as well but I don't know when I would eat that during the day. Perhaps as a midnight snack. Love the environment inside the building and gives a cozy feeling.

excerpts: I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea
and it was suuuper noms.
It had a very distinct Jasmine flavor, which I really liked!
jasmine.author: Krystal O.
jasmine.review:
FINALLY had the chance to try Boba Guys this past weekend and I was thoroughly impressed! I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea and it was suuuper noms. It had a very distinct Jasmine flavor, which I really liked! The boba also had a great taste and texture to it as well. 

I also tried a sip of my friends Horchata boba which was okay too - and yes, it does taste like Horchata.. with boba. 

Also - the owner (I think?) was testing out their new "Frescas" that they're trying to launch.. and I believe the one we tried was Strawberry? But this was really good too! And I would defs come back to try it.. as I already wanted to order it that day. Will definitely come back to Boba Guyss forsure!

excerpts: Their Jasmine Milk Tea was amazing and their slow brewed Muscat Oolong was the best milk tea I've had -- even in Asia.
Maybe in a sucker for loose leaf tea and organic milk.
jasmine.author: Thomas C.
jasmine.review: Boba in the Mission? I was skeptical, but won over by their honest tea and organic milk. Their Jasmine Milk Tea was amazing and their slow brewed Muscat Oolong was the best milk tea I've had -- even in Asia. Maybe in a sucker for loose leaf tea and organic milk.

excerpts: I got a Jasmine milk tea (without boba because I'm not that into it)
- the tea was good but could be stronger.
jasmine.author: Julia N.
jasmine.review:
Cute little boba shop in Mission, with funky tea flavors and many options for milk and add-ons. 

I got a Jasmine milk tea (without boba because I'm not that into it) - the tea was good but could be stronger. My friend got the hong kong style milk tea with grass jelly. While you can't go wrong with black tea and condensed milk, milk to grass jelly proportion was way off. He ended up with so much grass jelly after finishing off most of his milk tea.

I'll come for the friendly staff and chill atmosphere, but I didn't think the milk tea was worth the $4 we each paid. Definitely better options out there!

excerpts: I had a jasmine green tea, which was amazing.
jasmine.author: Krista J.
jasmine.review:
Delicious, and I love how they only use fresh ingredients. I had a jasmine green tea, which was amazing. The boba is just how I like it - a little more on the firm side, and quite sweet.

Only downside is that they don't have many flavors, because they won't use flavored powders. I hear they'll test out introducing some fruit milk teas, which I definitely want to drink!

excerpts: Bin/Boba Guys: the jasmine milk tea was delicious.
Very flavorful, perfect balance.
jasmine.author: Mel G.
jasmine.review:
I checked out this place today with my friend, and I was particularly excited bc my friend from college, Bin, is one of the owners!  Bin/Boba Guys: the jasmine milk tea was delicious.  Very flavorful, perfect balance.  I also really enjoyed the actual boba, and the whole Boba Guys experience.

Also, it's the only boba you can drink out of a mason jar in the city. :-)  Definitely worth checking out!

excerpts: Recently, I found my perfect drink: it's hot jasmine milk tea with boba and half the sweetener.
They brew the tea fresh for the hot one (I frequently find the iced one has too much milk / not enough tea), and getting it half-sweetened makes it just right.
I also like that you can get soy or almond
jasmine.author: Chelsea M.
jasmine.review:
I guess I was predisposed to love this place, since I love boba and it's close-ish to my house. However, what sets Boba Guys above other experiences I have had is the exceptional cloud-like chewiness of the boba itself: a quality that speaks to its freshness.

I've had both stellar and pretty good bubble tea here. Recently, I found my perfect drink: it's hot jasmine milk tea with boba and half the sweetener. They brew the tea fresh for the hot one (I frequently find the iced one has too much milk / not enough tea), and getting it half-sweetened makes it just right. I also like that you can get soy or almond milk if you're inclined.

Yes, the lines can be long. But to me, they're worth it. The staff is efficient and friendly, and I crave that velvety boba All. The. Time.

excerpts: I have tried either a jasmine milk tea or green milk tea with boba at several places around the Bay Area.
jasmine.author: Suzie Y.
jasmine.review:
I think the milk teas with boba are excellent here!  

I have tried either a jasmine milk tea or green milk tea with boba at several places around the Bay Area.  I have to say, this one is my favorite so far.  

Something about the Strauss Family Dairy milk made the drink so creamy.  The tea was high quality and had good flavor and the boba had perfect texture and flavor.  The staff was very nice.    For the quality, the price was consistent with the other  higher quality places I have been to.  

I think I might ask for mine a little less sweet the next time, but otherwise, I thought this was the prefect milk tea.  I am looking forward to my next trip to Boba Guys.

excerpts: I always get Jasmine milk tea, 75%, with almond milk and boba and they always make it perfect!
My boyfriend always tries whatever he feels like and he always enjoys his drink.
Overall consistent store with nice employees :)
jasmine.author: Chi Bao N.
jasmine.review: The employees are always nice and welcoming when we visit. I always get Jasmine milk tea, 75%, with almond milk and boba and they always make it perfect! My boyfriend always tries whatever he feels like and he always enjoys his drink. Overall consistent store with nice employees :)

excerpts: Used to be all about straight up milk tea only but the jasmine milk tea is growing on me...
jasmine.author: Jay K.
jasmine.review:
Looking for quality Boba and a team that cares about the product and consumer experience? Step right up to Boba guys. Quality tea is quite a treat and the boba is consistent. Used to be all about straight up milk tea only but the jasmine milk tea is growing on me...

Not quite the place if you're looking for powder or ginormous portions. But highly recommend checking out if you want to taste the four barrel/ blue bottle equivalent of boba tea.

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea, on point.
jasmine.author: Danny C.
jasmine.review: The first time I came here, the tea quality was pretty bad, and the waits were super long. Because of a friend, I gave them a second chance, and they did impress. Jasmine milk tea, on point. Hong Kong style, could be better, but tastes like it does in most American places. Waits are pretty quick for your drink when there's no line, and the prices aren't terrible (in between $3-4). You'll have to go through hipster land to get here, so buyer beware.

excerpts: Jasmine Milk Tea - Almond Jelly
- If you're feeling more festive, go for this drink as it will be more tea for your buck.
jasmine.author: Anthony S.
jasmine.review:
I know, I know...5 stars, deal with it.

Boba Guys is trying to do something new with Boba that will actually help the longevity of the people in San Francisco -- high quality ingredients.  While they may charge a premium, you won't get cancer from the tapioca balls or the other great add ons they make (+1 for Almond Jelly). Keep in mind that the freshness might taste a bit different than the powdered stuff you're used to having (i.e. powered milk, artificial flavoring, etc)...but get used to it because it's way better. The owners are always very welcoming and it makes you just wanna come back for seconds and thirds in that same day. Seating is way better in their new location on 19th and Valencia, though you could just order to go and sit at Dolores park on a less foggy day.  

I highly recommend Boba Guys for your boba tea craving in the mission. It's not only the best choice around...but it's pretty much the best quality milk tea you'll ever have.

Typical Order: 
1. Regular Milk Tea - Almond Jelly
  - This is a classic and MUST try for a first timer.
2. Jasmine Milk Tea - Almond Jelly
  - If you're feeling more festive, go for this drink as it will be more tea for your buck.

excerpts: We ordered their signature Jasmine Tea with Tapioca.
It tea was so flavorful, and milky.
The tapioca was a perfect consistency - not to hard or chewy.
jasmine.author: Winny F.
jasmine.review:
I've been waiting to try this place for a while. All our friends and coworkers keep raving about this place and how it's gotten bubble tea down to a science! 

I didn't believe it, especially since I'm from Toronto (where BBT is everywhere) and have gone back to Taiwan to try the original  BBT. 

Well, I stand corrected. This place has awesome bubble tea. We ordered their signature Jasmine Tea with Tapioca. It tea was so flavorful, and milky. The tapioca was a perfect consistency - not to hard or chewy. The price was reasonable as well.

Two complaints, it takes soooooo long to get one cup of bubble tea. Yes. They warn you about it, but it's not fun standing inside the small shop packed like sardines... watching the team slowly brew and stir each cup (especially on hot days). The woman taking the order was a bit unconventional. She would write your order down.. Then punch it into the iPad .. How odd and inefficient. 

Would definitely go back

excerpts: We ordered the jasmine milk tea and the Hong Kong style milk tea.
The jasmine milk tea lacked any tea flavor and tasted mainly like milk but the  HK style was perfect with added condensed milk for a thicker drink.
jasmine.author: Robert T.
jasmine.review:
I was recommended by a friend to try this boba place in the mission. We ordered the jasmine milk tea and the Hong Kong style milk tea. The jasmine milk tea lacked any tea flavor and tasted mainly like milk but the  HK style was perfect with added condensed milk for a thicker drink. 

In general, the milk tea is good. They don't add a lot of ice and they have a decent amount of boba. The pearls are chewy and fresh and all ingredients here are organic!  

Downside is the higher price ($4) for only 16 oz. and there are no large sizes available. 

Definitely recommended if you want boba in the mission. Better than Quickly.

excerpts: My friends ordered the hong kong milk tea and jasmine milk tea and those both tasted good too, but I really liked my horchata drink.
jasmine.author: Jasmine A.
jasmine.review:
I am not a boba connoisseur, but in my opinion this place by far has the best actual boba I've ever had - it's cooked to the perfect consistency, not overcooked/soggy or undercooked/chalky, but juuusttt rigggght. Disregarding all the other aspects of the drink, the boba itself is pretty top notch.

I ordered the horchata milk tea w/ boba, which was really tasty - not too sweet, but just right. My friends ordered the hong kong milk tea and jasmine milk tea and those both tasted good too, but I really liked my horchata drink.

Boba lovers: definitely check this place out!

excerpts: Boba Guys have several of the classics like black milk tea and jasmine milk tea, but have also added horchata, matcha, Thai, and HK style to the mix.
Several of the toppings that were originally experimental have made the move to the regular menu as well.
jasmine.author: Andrew Y.
jasmine.review:
There are plenty of boba places throughout the city, but Boba Guys is the shop I frequent the most.

They have tripled their menu items since expanding out of their Ken Ken Ramen location, and every new addition is new and exciting.  Boba Guys have several of the classics like black milk tea and jasmine milk tea, but have also added horchata, matcha, Thai, and HK style to the mix.  Several of the toppings that were originally experimental have made the move to the regular menu as well.  If you're a bit tired from drinking boba, try switching in to their almond jelly!

Boba Guys are also offering macarons and cupcakes here too.  They have unique flavors like sesame and mango.

My favorite part of the new shop would have to be the slow bar, where the baristas brew your tea to order.  They have spent hours honing the perfect time and temperature for each type of tea in order to make some of the tastiest and unique tea blends I've had.  The slow bar menu changes here and there, but teas to try include lychee green and golden honey black.

My go-to: Muscat oolong with almond jelly, and a pandan macaron.

The shop is pretty small though, so if you want a place to sit down, try their Ken Ken Ramen location on 18th and Mission instead.  They also serve alcoholic boba there too.

excerpts: Their Jasmine Milk Tea (*order "extra strong" if you want more tea flavor) is amazing.
It's disappointing since I'm lactose intolerant, but the original Jasmine Milk Tea is so good that I'm willing to suffer through the tummy ache.
jasmine.author: Mickaela R.
jasmine.review:
Lovelovelove. Their Jasmine Milk Tea (*order "extra strong" if you want more tea flavor) is amazing. 

The only comment I have is that any drink with substituted with soymilk is not worth it. It just doesn't taste the same. It's very bland. 

It's disappointing since I'm lactose intolerant, but the original Jasmine Milk Tea is so good that I'm willing to suffer through the tummy ache.

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea w/ boba.
The tapioca was very hard.
I suspected it had something to do with the fact
it was at the end of day and having cooked tapioca myself
I knew that it could've just been a bad batch.
So I came back and gave it a second try.
jasmine.author: Elizabeth T.
jasmine.review:
High-quality boba milk tea! The best you can ask for. 

This is not the artificially-flavored unhealthy and disgusting kind of bubble tea that gives boba a bad rep. They use real tea leaves, real milk (instead of powdered cream), and tapioca cooked to the right consistency. Even the popular bubble tea places in SF asian land AKA inner sunset, joints such as TeaWay still use flavored powder in most of their products.

Trust me, I know what I'm talking about. After all, I'm from Taiwan, where bubble tea was invented! 

My favorite kind of mix for bubble on a cold winter day (like right now) is: hot tea from the slow bar (I tried rose tea) + milk + tapioca. No sugar. The tapioca is already coated with sugar and that's enough sweetness for me. 

The first time I came here it was about to close and I got the jasmine milk tea w/ boba. The tapioca was very hard. I suspected it had something to do with the fact it was at the end of day and having cooked tapioca myself I knew that it could've just been a bad batch. So I came back and gave it a second try. Just as I thought, this time the boba was soft and chewy, just right!

Pro: 
 --- real, high-quality tea
 --- real milk
 --- good boba consistency
 --- reasonable pricing ($4-$5)
 
(Not really) Con:
  --- shop is small and doesn't have much space
  --- in the mission, so don't expect to be able to park

This is from now on my goto place for bubble tea!

excerpts: I have tried their Jasmine Milk Tea, Classic Milk Tea, and this time I ordered HK style Milk Tea.
The milk is ok, but the tea is just not strong enough leaving no after taste whatsoever.
And for $4, I expect much more.
jasmine.author: Kenny O.
jasmine.review:
If you ever been to China or Hong Kong, you know Boba Guys' milk tea is too water down. I have tried their Jasmine Milk Tea, Classic Milk Tea, and this time I ordered HK style Milk Tea. The milk is ok, but the tea is just not strong enough leaving no after taste whatsoever. And for $4, I expect much more. Way to go Boba Guys!

Update: The owner PM about my experience and asked me for another chance. I gladly took it, and surprised the drink is on the house. Anyway, this time again I ordered HK style milk tea and they did make my drink base on my preference. (You can choose your sweetness/how strong the tea/milk.) The drink was OK, nothing spectacular to be honest.

excerpts: I would recommend the Jasmine Milk Tea (it taste and smell beautiful) and Hong Kong Milk Tea (it's a sweeter side with a little kick)
jasmine.author: Tuyen T.
jasmine.review: A very small tea shop locate at Mission. It's very modern and chic. The menu is very small but the quality is great. You can definitely taste the quality of the tea and the pearls are pretty good. I would recommend the Jasmine Milk Tea (it taste and smell beautiful) and Hong Kong Milk Tea (it's a sweeter side with a little kick)

excerpts: I had the jasmine milk tea, which was okay, nothing special.
It was a hot day but my drink contained no ice, it probably melted during the ultra-slow preparation.
So it was getting warm before it was half gone.
jasmine.author: David T.
jasmine.review:
This place is trying to be a hip and cool boba tea place.  Instead it's slooooooow and mediocre.

They seem to brew each glass of tea individually, which is totally unnecessary and makes the process extremely slow.  When we were there, there were less than a dozen people waiting, yet it took more than 25 minutes to get our teas.  They were out of boba (tapioca) and grass jelly, the only add-in they had was almond jelly (which wasn't bad.)

They carefully measure things using science-lab-style beakers.  Again, unnecessary and slooooow.  This is not rocket science (or any other kind of science, for that matter.)  The owners need to visit Taiwan, where bubble tea is a way of life, and see how to run an efficient operation that doesn't make people wait half an hour in their sweltering shop (which lacks even a modicum of ventilation.)

I had the jasmine milk tea, which was okay, nothing special.  It was a hot day but my drink contained no ice, it probably melted during the ultra-slow preparation.  So it was getting warm before it was half gone.  It was drinkable, thus the two stars.

I get that you're trying to be boba tea for hipsters or something, but the individual brewing and slow service does not make a better product, just a slower one.  You're going to be hurting once everyone has tried you out, because nobody is going to come back a second time.

excerpts: I usually order their jasmine milk tea, which in my opinion is the best jasmine milk tea EVER or their thai tea which is good too!
Their boba is good too, it has the right texture and sweetness.
Its kinda pricey, but the quality of the drink is very good so its worth it.
jasmine.author: Alyssa C.
jasmine.review: I love this place! I usually order their jasmine milk tea, which in my opinion is the best jasmine milk tea EVER or their thai tea which is good too! Their boba is good too, it has the right texture and sweetness. Its kinda pricey, but the quality of the drink is very good so its worth it.

excerpts: Also, they didn't have a lot of the drinks on the menu (iced milk, horchata milk tea etc), which was a slight disappointment, but I ended up ordering a Jasmine Milk Tea with boba and it was the perfect decision!
The boba was sweet and chewy and definitely better than purple kow or t pumps!
jasmine.author: Iris C.
jasmine.review:
I visited Boba Guys when it was just a little "pop-up" in some random ramen shop and back then I had no clue it would become such a hit!

It's a tiny little store off of Valencia and the day I visited it was BURNING hot and the line was out the door! They haven't been able to get AC inside so if you plan to go, go during off hours so you can get in and get out, or go at night or something so you don't suffocate in the store before you even get your boba!! Just kidding, it's not that bad.. but I have to agree with the other reviewers, they are a little on the slow side. Also, they didn't have a lot of the drinks on the menu (iced milk, horchata milk tea etc), which was a slight disappointment, but I ended up ordering a Jasmine Milk Tea with boba and it was the perfect decision! The boba was sweet and chewy and definitely better than purple kow or t pumps! I also had a sip of my friend's almond jelly and that was pretty good as well.

What really puts them above is the quality of ingredients they use and how hard they work to perfect their recipes. I really respect this business simply because they want to put out the best quality drinks without cutting any corners and for that alone, I would return even if I had to wait in their oven of a store.

excerpts: Immediately as we walked in, one of the owners greeted us with a huge smile and informed us that the only drinks that they had were the first four on the menu, which were: Classic Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Soy Milk Tea (no dairy) and Horchata Boba.
Their toppings consisted of tapioca balls, almond jelly, grass jelly, aloe vera, and coffee jelly, but I'm assuming that the default topping is boba, since they didn't ask us which topping we wanted.
They also had 2 cupcakes in the display, and they seemed to run out of macarons and other goodies, which was understandable since it was near closing time.
Oh and they have a
"Slow Bar" where you basically choose from a selection of their loose leaf teas
and they'll make it for you, but you need to wait 5 minutes.
I'm not sure how that works, but I'll probably be back to try that!
They proudly use Straus organic milk and real tea.. yes, real milk and real tea!
None of that powder stuff that most boba shops use, hence why the prices are expensive for a small cup ($4-$5.)
It's all about quality, guys!
jasmine.author: Joyce E.
jasmine.review:
My sister and I came here on a Sunday afternoon at around 5pm. Since Boba Guys is near the Mission district, parking can be relatively difficult, but if the parking gods are with you, it is possible to find a spot so don't be discouraged! Immediately as we walked in, one of the owners greeted us with a huge smile and informed us that the only drinks that they had were the first four on the menu, which were: Classic Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Soy Milk Tea (no dairy) and Horchata Boba. Their toppings consisted of tapioca balls, almond jelly, grass jelly, aloe vera, and coffee jelly, but I'm assuming that the default topping is boba, since they didn't ask us which topping we wanted. They also had 2 cupcakes in the display, and they seemed to run out of macarons and other goodies, which was understandable since it was near closing time. Oh and they have a  "Slow Bar" where you basically choose from a selection of their loose leaf teas and they'll make it for you, but you need to wait 5 minutes. I'm not sure how that works, but I'll probably be back to try that! They proudly use Straus organic milk and real tea.. yes, real milk and real tea! None of that powder stuff that most boba shops use, hence why the prices are expensive for a small cup ($4-$5.) It's all about quality, guys! My sister and I settled on the regular milk teas and paid $8.

Classic Milk Tea - The tea to milk ratio was PERFECT! I was able to taste the strong tea flavor, while enjoying the creaminess from the Straus organic milk. The boba was chewy and there was plenty of it! For sugar fiends, this isn't the milk tea for you because it's not sweet at all! My only problem with the milk tea was that it wasn't cold! It was sort of like having a milk tea sitting out for an hour, hence the reason why Boba Guys gets 4 stars and not 5. 

We waited less than 5 minutes for our milk tea, which was great considering the amount of people that were there. The shop was clean, bright, spacious, and was aesthetically pleasing! The employees (owners) were friendly and they seem really passionate about their products and look like they really enjoy serving their customers. Yes, it's definitely pricier than most boba shops, but quality is key! I'll be back!

excerpts: I was never blown away by most of their drinks in what I would call the regular menu (Hong Kong style, Jasmine Milk Tea, Horchata etc.)
but I finally found THE drink for me here.
For $5, depending on what size, the Mango Matcha Tea Fresca gets an A++
(You'll find this in the menu near the register).
It's made with a fruit puree
so it's a bit thicker than the tea drinks.
Kudos to the staff member who recommended it to me!
You got good taste.
jasmine.author: Kristine N.
jasmine.review: I was never blown away by most of their drinks in what I would call the regular menu (Hong Kong style, Jasmine Milk Tea, Horchata etc.) but I finally found THE drink for me here. For $5, depending on what size, the Mango Matcha Tea Fresca gets an A++ (You'll find this in the menu near the register). It's made with a fruit puree so it's a bit thicker than the tea drinks. Kudos to the staff member who recommended it to me! You got good taste.

excerpts: My normal preferred is the jasmine milk tea with grass jelly.
The combination of taste and freshness just makes me keep coming back to this place.
jasmine.author: Dylan C.
jasmine.review: One of the best place in SF to get super fresh and high quality boba drinks. My normal preferred is the jasmine milk tea with grass jelly. The combination of taste and freshness just makes me keep coming back to this place.

excerpts: I got the milk tea and my sister got the jasmine milk tea.
When i tried the jasmine milk tea, my first response was WHOA!!!!
that is jasmine.
Love the flavor and the smoothness of your teas.
jasmine.author: JY L.
jasmine.review:
Hi Boba Guys, 

this is a msg from someone who has been searching for good boba in SF.  When my sister told me about you guys, i was super excited.  I couldn't wait to try your boba and milk teas and i must say i have once again been disappointed.  However, you guys do have a lot of potential to make really good boba.  I can tell from what i was drinking!!! 

the problems: 
1.  Not enough boba!!! come guys, boba is cheap.  I'm sure you will make a lot more people happy if you just added a little bit more boba in there.  

2. it's too sweet!! many boba places will customize the sweetness level.  When i asked for half the sweetness, the response was oo everything is pre-made.  Yes that kinda turned me off.  I have no problem with your pre-made teas.  My problem is the fact that you can't make it less sweet because it is pre-made.   

3.  have less random hours.  people might enjoy a cup of boba milk tea after dinner. you guys are located in a hub of restaurants why not have later hours.  

Why i think you guys have potential to make REALLY good boba milk tea:
1. the boba balls are chewy but not too chewy.  It has a nice sweetness too it (hence you can make your tea less sweet!!!!!) 

2. the tea has really good flavor.  I got the milk tea and my sister got the jasmine milk tea.  When i tried the jasmine milk tea, my first response was WHOA!!!! that is jasmine.  Love the flavor and the smoothness of your teas.  Don't let that hide behind all the sweetness.  

3.  No lines!!! I didn't have to wait at all.. but that's probably because i went at a good time.  

hope you guys find this helpful and i look forward to trying your more boba less sweet milk tea next time.

excerpts: the Jasmine Milk Tea and their tea is definitely not as sweet and more tea-tasting than the ones at typical boba places (
T-pumps, Purple Cow, Tea Era).
The actual bobas were nice and chewy, but not chewy.
Heads up that they also ran out of bobas towards the end of the day (maybe about 45 min before closing), so may not want to go too close to closing time.
jasmine.author: Imee C.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys opened up their first brick and mortar store right in the heart of the Mission recently.  It's a super cute spot for a quick boba treat.  The place is pretty small and there's limited seating (only 4 chairs against a bench mounted to the wall).  

I got the Jasmine Milk Tea and their tea is definitely not as sweet and more tea-tasting than the ones at typical boba places (T-pumps, Purple Cow, Tea Era).  The actual bobas were nice and chewy, but not chewy.  Heads up that they also ran out of bobas towards the end of the day (maybe about 45 min before closing), so may not want to go too close to closing time.  I also found that the wait for the tea after ordering was longer than the typical boba place.

Would go there again if I was in the area craving boba tea and try out some of their other flavors too.

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea boba-
jasmine.author: Emily C.
jasmine.review:
Alcohol meets hipster meets boba.

Spiked milk tea boba- 3 stars: Reminded me of a white russian but without the coffee flavor. The vodka was subtle at first.. until you get halfway down the glass... and then you can taste. Overall alcohol flavor was weak- don't expect to get buzzed (or get the asian glow) off this.

Jasmine milk tea boba- 4 stars: sweet and delicious, with bobas the perfect consistency.

*Not sure if alcoholic boba is served regularly.. we came in on a Sunday at 12p.

excerpts:
This review is based solely on the jasmine milk tea I ordered:

I like bolder flavor milk teas, and I specifically asked for "stronger" tea flavor, which they did give me.
However, it may be the type of jasmine tea or milk that really made it mediocre - it had no body to it, just a really watery texture.
jasmine.author: Tiffany S.
jasmine.review:
This review is based solely on the jasmine milk tea I ordered:

I like bolder flavor milk teas, and I specifically asked for "stronger" tea flavor, which they did give me. In fact, the actual flavor (tea to milk to sugar ratio) was nearly perfect. However, it may be the type of jasmine tea or milk that really made it mediocre - it had no body to it, just a really watery texture. 

5 stars for service
3 stars for the actual product

I might go back if I were in the area and had some crazy boba craving again, but I wouldn't make a special trip just to go there.

excerpts:
Or at least the one that I tried :)

Ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly.
jasmine.author: Emily L.
jasmine.review:
You know that happy feeling that you get when you realize your drink is delicious? Well, you will be happy when you try a drink at Boba Guys! Or at least the one that I tried :)

Ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly. Drink was simple and wait time was short. Perfect amount of sweetness and flavor with milk options.

I recommend Boba Guys and will return to try another drink!

excerpts: We each ordered our own, I ordered the jasmine and she ordered the classic.
The drinks smelled really good, however, the taste did not meet our expectations.
It wasn't the worst nor was it the best.
It was middle of the pack for us.
Just glad that we were able to try it, but it was not worth it for us.
At least we tried.
jasmine.author: Tony N.
jasmine.review: Drove around for about 30 minutes to find parking for this busy area. We started to see a lot of people posted up IG and Snaps of boba milk tea from the boba guys and knew that we needed to try it out for ourselves. Since we have been on a mission to find the best boba spot, we had a high expectation of this place. The line was long as we approach and it gave her reassurance that this may have been the spot we have been waiting for. They only use fresh loose tea leaves (industry standard now when you are talking milk tea) and you had your choice of the classic tea or premium tea. You can also choose your choice of milk (organic, almond or soy). We each ordered our own, I ordered the jasmine and she ordered the classic. The drinks smelled really good, however, the taste did not meet our expectations. It wasn't the worst nor was it the best. It was middle of the pack for us. Just glad that we were able to try it, but it was not worth it for us. At least we tried.

excerpts: I ordered a hot jasmine milk tea with boba to keep warm in the cold.
I wanted to try the almond jelly
jasmine.author: Vivian V.
jasmine.review:
I ordered a hot jasmine milk tea with boba to keep warm in the cold. I wanted to try the almond jelly but they warned the jellies would dissolve. 

I've had this particular drink at other locations and the boba is good. Unfortunately, the consistency of boba at Boba Guys was extremely gooey. I'm not sure if the boba is usually like this or the gooeyness was a result of the hot water. Bottom line, don't order hot drinks with boba. 

Service was not particularly friendly, so I'd recommend an improvement on that. 

I'd give the place another try for another drink. Sample the cotton candy; it's good!

excerpts: The jasmine milk tea was delicious - a fragant taste that was not overpowered by the milk and boba.
The classic was not a standout though.
The boba was a perfect mix of chewiness and softness.
I really like that they use real tea leaves here - but you are paying for it at $4 per drink!
jasmine.author: Amelia C.
jasmine.review: The jasmine milk tea was delicious - a fragant taste that was not overpowered by the milk and boba. The classic was not a standout though. The boba was a perfect mix of chewiness and softness. I really like that they use real tea leaves here - but you are paying for it at $4 per drink!

excerpts: We had the Thai tea and jasmine milk tea.
Can't really compete with a Thai restaurants milk tea that you actually stir yourself and is actually good.
Don't get me wrong, they weren't bad but they were great.
$4 a tapioca is way too much for me as well.
Go to Irving and wonderful foods has freshly made tapioca drinks for $2.75 plus a large for +$1.
Still under the price of milk tea at boba guys.
jasmine.author: Tim M.
jasmine.review:
Came to this place after Nombe (see review if you want), and decided to get some milk tea after seeing numerous friends post about it. It was a small little hipster place and very clean looking. The place was freaking hot inside but guess cause it was 70 outside, but I wouldn't be able to sit in there,especially since there's like three seats. 

Anyways, the tapioca was good and the drinks tasted like any other tapioca place. We had the Thai tea and jasmine milk tea. Can't really compete with a Thai restaurants milk tea that you actually stir yourself and is actually good. Don't get me wrong, they weren't bad but they were great. $4 a tapioca is way too much for me as well. Go to Irving and wonderful foods has freshly made tapioca drinks for $2.75 plus a large for +$1. Still under the price of milk tea at boba guys. I know they have overhead to pay but the location isn't exactly the best location for a tapioca place. 

I'm not a boba/tapioca expert but this place is overrated. If you're in the area and want tapioca then go for it but don't drive around looking for parking and going out of your way just to go here. Plus.. Everyone got Boba guys cups with their logo on it and we got a plain cup. Not complaining but thought that was weird.

excerpts: I believe I got jasmine milk tea, and the tea itself tasted pretty good.
jasmine.author: Denise C.
jasmine.review:
This place is a little more hipster than I frequent for boba, but I was in the area and had heard about it, so I decided to give it a try.

I'm not the hugest fan of boba, but today I decided to get some in my drink.  I believe I got jasmine milk tea, and the tea itself tasted pretty good.  A little sweet, but not so much that I couldn't taste the tea. 

However, I did not enjoy the boba at all.  It wasn't sweet, it wasn't that soft; it didn't really have anything going for it, in my opinion.  I didn't even finish the boba, since I was way too full.

Also, this place is a little bit on the pricier side for boba.  It's $4, so about a dollar more than other places.  Not actually that much money, but proportionally, not as worth it, IMO.

I satisfied my curiosity and tried something new, but since I don't venture this area very much, I don't think I'll be coming here again any time soon.

excerpts: While I've never actually made it out to their actual shop, one of my friends was kind enough to pick up a jasmine milk green tea with almond jelly for me several months back.

Certainly one of the better preparations of jasmine milk green that I've had in the Bay Area so far, with tasty almond jelly and tea that isn't overwhelmed by the taste of syrup (I'm a huge fan of milk tea that actually tastes like, well, tea!).
Shame that they aren't easier to get to now that I've moved, with Mission being among those neighborhoods
I actively avoid driving to whenever possible.
jasmine.author: Johnny W.
jasmine.review: While I've never actually made it out to their actual shop, one of my friends was kind enough to pick up a jasmine milk green tea with almond jelly for me several months back. Certainly one of the better preparations of jasmine milk green that I've had in the Bay Area so far, with tasty almond jelly and tea that isn't overwhelmed by the taste of syrup (I'm a huge fan of milk tea that actually tastes like, well, tea!). Shame that they aren't easier to get to now that I've moved, with Mission being among those neighborhoods I actively avoid driving to whenever possible.

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea, half sweet.
The tea was not very strong in flavor.
The boba was sweet and kind of hard, which is a turn off.
I don't think I'll be coming back, sadly.
jasmine.author: Kat C.
jasmine.review: I was really looking forward to this place because of all the hype. Alas, it was just ok. I got the jasmine milk tea, half sweet. The tea was not very strong in flavor. The boba was sweet and kind of hard, which is a turn off. I don't think I'll be coming back, sadly.

excerpts: I go for the Jasmine Milk Tea with whole milk and less sugar.
jasmine.author: James F.
jasmine.review: I've traveled Taiwan. I tried a lot of bubble tea there but Boba Guys is the best I've tried so far. I go for the Jasmine Milk Tea with whole milk and less sugar.

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea with grass jelly.
It was really quite bad :(
The taste of the tea was weak and kinda strange.
The milk was overwhelming.
The grass jelly was a huge, especially hard lump which could barely go up the straw.
And boy was it expensive.
Not gonna waste $4 on this hipster boba again.
jasmine.author: Joel K.
jasmine.review:
Worst. Boba. I've. Ever. Had. 

I went into this place with anticipation because it looked great. I got the jasmine milk tea with grass jelly. It was really quite bad :( The taste of the tea was weak and kinda strange. The milk was overwhelming. The grass jelly was a huge, especially hard lump which could barely go up the straw. And boy was it expensive. Not gonna waste $4 on this hipster boba again.

excerpts: We got lychee green tea, and strawberry Jasmine tea!!
They sweetened it with real strawberriew!!
So good!!
Definitely a must if you're visiting San Francisco
jasmine.author: Krissy C.
jasmine.review: Really good drinks! They even have ice cream!  We got lychee green tea, and strawberry Jasmine tea!!  They sweetened it with real strawberriew!!  So good!!  Definitely a must if you're visiting San Francisco

excerpts: I had their jasmine milk tea with grass jelly!
Yum!
and No sleep!
jasmine.author: Ange G.
jasmine.review: I had their jasmine milk tea with grass jelly! Yum! and No sleep!

excerpts:
It used to be quite good, and now it's watered down or something.
- back in their Suika pop up days, they did a really nice jasmine milk tea.
They moved to their permanent location, and I went back hoping for the same quality jasmine milk tea.
I sadly ended up throwing my drink away after a sip 2/3 times, and never got the jasmine milk tea again.

It tasted water down and funky in a bad way.
- occasionally their boba just tastes....off.
I currently like their strawberry jasmine tea fresca a lot.
The strawberry jasmine tea fresca really bumps up their favorability, but I can't forgive them for everything just because of it.
jasmine.author: Chris M.
jasmine.review:
Boba Guys is kind of hit or miss. If you get it when it's good, then it is rather fantastic. Otherwise, it's really meh.

Some examples:
- their coffee milk tea has gone down in quality over the last 9 months or so. It used to be quite good, and now it's watered down or something.
- back in their Suika pop up days, they did a really nice jasmine milk tea. They moved to their permanent location, and I went back hoping for the same quality jasmine milk tea. I sadly ended up throwing my drink away after a sip 2/3 times, and never got the jasmine milk tea again. It tasted water down and funky in a bad way.
- occasionally their boba just tastes....off. Hard to describe, but there are days when it's A+ and other days when it tastes like burnt plastic or something.

I currently like their strawberry jasmine tea fresca a lot. The drink itself has been fairly consistent (across both mission & union square locations), though I'm always wary of adding boba to it because it might ruin an otherwise good drink.

It's also impossible to get them to add no ice. They usually forget and I end up with an iced drink. The first few times I had them remake my drink, but now I'm kind of "meh, typical boba guys mediocre service" about it. I hate iced drinks cuz my teeth are a little cold sensitive and it also waters down the drink, but at least I don't immediately chuck away the drink like I do when the boba tastes funky.

I'd probably give them 2.5 stars. The strawberry jasmine tea fresca really bumps up their favorability, but I can't forgive them for everything just because of it.

excerpts: FTR, I had the Jasmine tea but would love to try horchata next visit
jasmine.author: Allie Y.
jasmine.review:
Bubble tea lovers..the best bubble tea to ever exist is right here at Boba Guys.. As other reviewers have said, you taste the high quality flavor of the tea and the milk. The bubbles are perfectly chewy as well, unlike some eateries where they're just too hard, these ones are soft and come aplenty. I wish it wasn't $4 per cup because I could drink many cups of these in a row - I even had an evil thought of stealing their entire jug when they weren't looking..but I digress my evil intentions. FTR, I had the Jasmine tea but would love to try horchata next visit (at this time, I couldn't stomach any more sweets after eating Bi-Rite right before this trip).

Knowing this place exists, I *have* to come back every weekend I'm in the area! Give it a try if you are a bubble tea fanatic - I guarantee you won't be disappointed at their quality tea!

excerpts: still enjoying their fresca tea -- refreshing strawberry jasmine tea-fresco.
and a great startup story.
jasmine.author: Rob C.
jasmine.review: consistent with their other locations.  still enjoying their fresca tea -- refreshing strawberry jasmine tea-fresco.  and a great startup story.

excerpts: I ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba, and was slightly disappointed.
The beverage itself tasted watered down - hardly any tea component and more "milk".
The tapioca pearls were also of a strange consistency - a bit too soft around the curves and not as chewy as one would have hoped.
jasmine.author: Hurnan V.
jasmine.review:
I came here one afternoon to satisfy my boba cravings while in the Mission. The service staff was extremely friendly and expedient with making my drink. I ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba, and was slightly disappointed. The beverage itself tasted watered down - hardly any tea component and more "milk". The tapioca pearls were also of a strange consistency - a bit too soft around the curves and not as chewy as one would have hoped. Next time I am ordering from Boba Guys, I shall try the Hong Kong Style milk tea - hopefully it will be better than my precious experience!

Other notes--
Pros: all organic! :)
Cons: pretty pricey for the size available ($4 for regular 16oz)

excerpts: We tried their Soy Original and Jasmine Milk Tea.
The soy one done with black tea while the jasmine milk tea of course uses jasmine tea.
I preferred the jasmine tea one, but it's nice that they offer soy for those lactose intolerant folks.
If you get your drink for the shop they serve it up in these cool mason jars.
I have no idea why they use an aardvark for their logo.
jasmine.author: David K.
jasmine.review:
Interesting place.  Cliff notes version is good boba, but a bit pricy at $4 a cup.

I've tried this place twice now and it's pretty good.  It sits inside Ken Ken Ramen so go right in, you've found the right place.  They serve the boba at the bar right at the front.

There's usually 1 Boba Guy that works the bar and I've found them to usually be very friendly and more than willing to chat with you.  The guy who was working this Sundaytold us that they were going to be opening up their own location sometime soon.  They are also constantly experimenting with flavors here.  He mentioned that Sundays they were offering boba cocktails with interesting mixes like boba and beer.  I didn't venture to try it this time, but I've heard they also experiment with flavors of the non-alcoholic nature.

They use high quality tea and Strauss milk and seem pretty proud of this fact.  Their bobas are also cooked well with the right amount of sweetness.

We tried their Soy Original and Jasmine Milk Tea.  The soy one done with black tea while the jasmine milk tea of course uses jasmine tea.  I preferred the jasmine tea one, but it's nice that they offer soy for those lactose intolerant folks.  If you get your drink for the shop they serve it up in these cool mason jars.  I have no idea why they use an aardvark for their logo.

excerpts: The Hong Kong milk tea was wayyyy too sweet along with the Jasmine milk tea that my friends ordered.
We all were arguing which one was sweeter.
jasmine.author: Karina N.
jasmine.review:
I've been seeing cute pictures of their cups and logo and I thought I should go give this a try.

It was really disappointing.

The place is tiny and it feels awkward if you sit at the stool with your friends--it was just not a comfortable atmosphere. Something else that nagged me was that the price of those drinks. It might have been worth it if the portion size was bigger or the drink was phenomenal. The Hong Kong milk tea was wayyyy too sweet along with the Jasmine milk tea that my friends ordered. We all were arguing which one was sweeter. The boba was soft which was to my liking.

The workers were really nice and that's why (along with the boba) I am giving this place at least a 2 star. Other than that, its probably a one-try-thing... I wished I enjoyed it more.

excerpts: They charged very reasonable prices, provided regular, jasmine, and soy boba, and were on time and self-contained.
Oh, and the quality of their product was spot on as always.
The boba was the hit of the night!
Thanks Boba Guys!
8 D
jasmine.author: Go S.
jasmine.review:
The Boba Guys serve awesome boba that has excellent flavor, isn't too sweet, and has perfectly textured balls.  We are very happy that they are back in the Mission at Suika Bento!

Did you know that they also do catering?  We got married recently and had the privilege of having the Boba Guys come to our wedding to provide their bodacious boba.  We knew that they were in transition after Ken Ken Ramen, and we were delighted to find that they were willing to work with us.  They charged very reasonable prices, provided regular, jasmine, and soy boba, and were on time and self-contained.  Oh, and the quality of their product was spot on as always.  The boba was the hit of the night!  Thanks Boba Guys!  8 D

excerpts: Ordered the Jasmine milk tea with boba and almond jelly.
LOVED the almond jelly.
The Jasmine milk tea was a bit on the sweet side for me.
Will be sure to check if they can make it less sweet for me next time.
Otherwise, friendly staff, the boba was good
and I really like that they use quality ingredients.
jasmine.author: Julia C.
jasmine.review: Visited on a Saturday and it was pretty busy.  Ordered the Jasmine milk tea with boba and almond jelly.  LOVED the almond jelly.  The Jasmine milk tea was a bit on the sweet side for me.  Will be sure to check if they can make it less sweet for me next time.  Otherwise, friendly staff, the boba was good and I really like that they use quality ingredients.

excerpts: My favorite is the Jasmine milk tea with boba.
I've tried some others
but I alway come back to the Jasmine.
jasmine.author: Z B.
jasmine.review:
I love the Boba Guys! So much in fact, that I have to put myself on restriction to one a week or I'll be there every day:) 

I'de never had these milk teas before I tried Boba Guys. They opened a pop-up in a restaurant near my shop and that's when I got hooked. My favorite is the Jasmine milk tea with boba. I've tried some others but I alway come back to the Jasmine.

Some of the other reviews I just don't get. I feel like most people are just bitching about the price. It may seem like a lot but I feel like you are getting a quality product and that's not cheap. Nor is renting a retail space in San Francisco! I think customers forget that all the costs are not wrapped up just in the product, there is rent, employees, utilities, insurance, etc. I am a fellow business owner in the neighborhood and I know how challenging it can be.
The staff is super nice and know me by name. Half the time I go there they see me in line and by the time I get up to pay my drink has already been made! 

Giving a one star because you think it's too expensive is not providing new customers with good information about the product, it's just complaining. Those of you who think you can do it better should try, then you'll see how difficult it is to own and operate a small business.
 
I'm very happy they are here in the Mission and hope they continue to be successful!

excerpts: Get the horchata or jasmine milk tea with boba (or almond jelly).
The drinks are made with organic milks/teas and are sweetened to taste.
Good quality, great staff!
jasmine.author: Will Z.
jasmine.review: I've heard this place described as "hipster bubble tea" lol. It's a great place to stop by on the way Dolores. Get the horchata or jasmine milk tea with boba (or almond jelly). The drinks are made with organic milks/teas and are sweetened to taste. Good quality, great staff!

excerpts: To be blunt, my jasmine milk tea pretty lame.
Flavor was watered down even after I asked for it to be more sweet.
Also sucked that they had no almond jelly when it was only Thursday.
The shortage of toppings also happened on my last visit to Ken Ken, only no boba that time.
As a boba fiend, I wanna support this place so badly but unless you get more intense flavor and have your toppings regularly stocked, I dont think I will be back soon.
jasmine.author: Thomas L.
jasmine.review: Came here on a beautiful Thursday afternoon right after my grocery run to enjoy some boba. I enjoyed their milk tea w almond jelly at Ken Ken, so was hoping to enjoy the other flavors. To be blunt, my jasmine milk tea pretty lame. Flavor was watered down even after I asked for it to be more sweet. Also sucked that they had no almond jelly when it was only Thursday. The shortage of toppings also happened on my last visit to Ken Ken, only no boba that time. As a boba fiend, I wanna support this place so badly but unless you get more intense flavor and have your toppings regularly stocked, I dont think I will be back soon.

excerpts:
It wasn't until I inquired before I was told that the only options were:

- Regular Milk Tea
- Soy Jasmine Milk Tea

Both were available with boba and/or almond jelly.
jasmine.author: Mel T.
jasmine.review:
I'd been wanting to try Boba Guys for quite some time now, but could:

- never make my way down to the Mission during their limited hours
- only ever find myself in the Mission when they were already sold out

Bugger.

Anyhow, finally recently hit success..

I walked in to a simple "hi" from a gal at the bar.  I returned pleasantries, but then was a bit confused because there was no menu in sight.  How was I to know what to order?  It wasn't until I inquired before I was told that the only options were:

- Regular Milk Tea
- Soy Jasmine Milk Tea

Both were available with boba and/or almond jelly.  I opted for two of the soy jasmines, one with each of the toppings.  Too bad both weren't very good.

The tea itself was super watered down.  The boba was too soft, and the almond jelly had no almond flavor.  What a letdown. 

The one plus?  Not being in love with BG, so I won't need to worry about going out of my way for more.

excerpts: Everything is good here, my favs: Horchata, Classic HK Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Thai Ice Tea.
If you haven't tried boba before or had a somewhat "bad boba tea experience" like alot of my Caucasian friends, try Boba Guys, it will blow your mind.
jasmine.author: Ennie L.
jasmine.review: Yay boba for hispters! Made with organic Strauss milk, high quality ingredients in my Boba Tea. Yes please. Everything is good here, my favs: Horchata, Classic HK Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Thai Ice Tea. If you haven't tried boba before or had a somewhat "bad boba tea experience" like alot of my Caucasian friends, try Boba Guys, it will blow your mind.

excerpts: Next time, I wanna try the jasmine :)
jasmine.author: Stacey H.
jasmine.review:
Zomg. I've tried milk tea from practically everywhere and I've got to say that this is one of the best milk teas I've ever had, no lie.

My friends and I were planning to come here after eating dinner at Yamo this past weekend. However, the line there was so long that we decided to just come here instead. We accidentally passed by it at first and as we were walking back up the street, we discovered the Mission Night Market and spent some time there before continuing our search for this place.. which we soon realized was right next door LOL.

I judge milk tea on three factors: creaminess, sweetness, and tea flavor. Here, I got the soy milk tea. It had a good amount of creaminess and the tea flavor was subtle, but present. I really enjoyed my drink, but it would've been even better if it had been a little less sweet! My friends and I compared it to the regular though, and we all agreed that the soy was more flavorful :)

I am personally not a fan of tapioca, but I actually liked the tapioca here! The texture was perfectly soft and chewy. It was sweet, but not to the point where it changed the flavor of my drink. I found it very comparable to that of Tpumps, which is located in San Mateo (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tpumps-san-mateo#hrid:FD34G0KsvsS8AID8bydrCg).

Another thing that distinguishes Boba Guys from others besides their soy milk tea is their use of mason jars if you are drinking inside. The drink and the experience were well worth $4. I would definitely come here again! Next time, I wanna try the jasmine :)

excerpts: (Jasmine Milk Tea).
It was probably the worst milk tea I've had, worst than getting powdered milk tea.
I probably would not come back to Boba Guys just because it's not good
and it was definitely not worth $5 a cup.
jasmine.author: Polly L.
jasmine.review: Definitely NOT worth the hype. I've been seeing this place on instagram all the time and thought that it'd be amazing milk tea. I got the Rose Black Milk Tea from the slow bar expecting that it'd be superrr amazing but not really. I got it with 50% sugar since everyone here said it was too sweet and my drink ended up tasting like water. I didn't even really taste the rose tea at all. It was like water and milk mixed together, same with my friend's drink (Jasmine Milk Tea). It was probably the worst milk tea I've had, worst than getting powdered milk tea. I probably would not come back to Boba Guys just because it's not good and it was definitely not worth $5 a cup.

excerpts: Minus: jasmine tea is less than flavorful, size is a bit small.
jasmine.author: daphne w.
jasmine.review:
Plus: boba is chewy for sure, store is clean.
Minus: jasmine tea is less than flavorful, size is a bit small.

You can get more expensive boba drinks in SF.  Good for those times the craving strikes and you're in the neighborhood.

excerpts: We got the jasmine milk boba and it was okay..
it tasted like from any boba place I have been to.
Nothing really special.
There is not really a boba place around this area to get boba, so if in the area again and craving boba, I'll stop in, but I would not go out of my way to come here.
The curry here looked delicious tho, so maybe I will stop in and try that next time for lunch.
jasmine.author: James L.
jasmine.review: The boba guys are located in the ken ken ramen store in the afternoon only.  We got the jasmine milk boba and it was okay..it tasted like from any boba place I have been to.  Nothing really special.  There is not really a boba place around this area to get boba, so if in the area again and craving boba, I'll stop in, but I would not go out of my way to come here.  The curry here looked delicious tho, so maybe I will stop in and try that next time for lunch.

excerpts: however, $4 for a relatively small mason jar of jasmine green tea and boba is pretty pricy.
especially for a mason jar i can't take home with me!
yes
jasmine.author: Caitlin C.
jasmine.review:
boba guys is located in a space that's shared with ken ken ramen. the boba is served at a small bar in the front that pretty much resembles an alcohol bar, but instead of alcohol the "bartenders" whip up a mean milk tea. TRIPPY... and the restaurant is located in the back. from the other reviews, i'm sure you've figured out that the milk tea comes in a mason jar with an aardvark on it, but one thing to note is that their logo is an aardvark because it's an animal with a "built in bubble tea straw". if that's not creative, then i don't know what is!

the tea was deliciously sweet and complimented the post-ramen stage well. the balls were some of the best boba i've ever tasted. however, $4 for a relatively small mason jar of jasmine green tea and boba is pretty pricy. especially for a mason jar i can't take home with me! yes i'm super asian and super cheap, but i have been conditioned by the endless teaway/purplekow/wonderful foods trips from the past.

all in all boba guys was a good experience and i would recommend trying it at least once, but it's definitely one of the bougier boba places i've been to. i'd come back again, but not on a regular basis.

excerpts: The best Boba I ever had =) Try the Jasmine milk tea one.
jasmine.author: Audrey L.
jasmine.review: I love this place. The best Boba I ever had =) Try the Jasmine milk tea one.

excerpts: My favorite's one of their rotating flavors (the Jasmine), but the standard milk tea is excellent.
jasmine.author: Ajay N.
jasmine.review:
Before Boba Guys, it'd been a while since I've had a really authentic boba tea. Others tend to be too sweet and the boba are too gummy/chewy/old. It's really difficult to find perfectly cooked boba, but these guys have figured it out.

My favorite's one of their rotating flavors (the Jasmine), but the standard milk tea is excellent.

excerpts: I've only tried the jasmine milk tea with tapioca and it's delicious.
The tapioca has just the right consistency of chewy and sweet and the tea tastes so fresh, it's almost like you're eating jasmine flowers
jasmine.author: Malika R.
jasmine.review: My absolute favorite boba place in the bay area! I LOVE this place. I've only tried the jasmine milk tea with tapioca and it's delicious. The tapioca has just the right consistency of chewy and sweet and the tea tastes so fresh, it's almost like you're eating jasmine flowers :)

excerpts: I got the Jasmine Tea with Boba (normal sweetened)
and I had never had a greet tea boba before
and i absolutely loved it!
It wasn't overly sweet and it had such good flavor!
I will def be back for this!
jasmine.author: Brittini S.
jasmine.review: I got the Jasmine Tea with Boba (normal sweetened) and I had never had a greet tea boba before and i absolutely loved it! It wasn't overly sweet and it had such good flavor! I will def be back for this!

excerpts: When I got there, they had ran out of the regular milk tea, so I got the Jasmine, and it was amazing!
The Jasmine was delicate and simply sublime, the milk was so silky, and the tapioca was cooked perfectly.
jasmine.author: Soo L.
jasmine.review:
I love boba, so I had to see if the hype was true. When I got there, they had ran out of the regular milk tea, so I got the Jasmine, and it was amazing! The Jasmine was delicate and simply sublime, the milk was so silky, and the tapioca was cooked perfectly. The only negative is that it was a little too sweet. 

Bin Chen, one of the founders of Boba Guys,  was tending the bar and putting some blood, sweat, and tears down and I applaud his work ethic. This guy is awesome and I encourage you to try his delicious balls!

excerpts: I love their jasmine milk tea.
All the staff are so nice!
If it's not super full, they will take the time to talk to you about their teas.
jasmine.author: Alex J.
jasmine.review: Boba Guys is my favorite boba place in the bay area. I love their jasmine milk tea. All the staff are so nice! If it's not super full, they will take the time to talk to you about their teas. I also have had their kaya toast and its really good but it's really big: I was sharing it with a friend and it was a lot just to eat half of it!

excerpts: What keeps me coming back is their Jasmine milk tea with soy milk and tapioca pearls.
Their pearls are perfect!
Not much room to linger around
but it's also located in the mission and always nice to walk around or head over to Dolores Park and sip on your awesome tea!
jasmine.author: Soo-Lin H.
jasmine.review: I love their drinks. What keeps me coming back is their Jasmine milk tea with soy milk and tapioca pearls. Their pearls are perfect! Not much room to linger around but it's also located in the mission and always nice to walk around or head over to Dolores Park and sip on your awesome tea!

excerpts: I also really like the jasmine milk tea because it tastes more of brewed tea instead of milk.
They use organic milk and brew their tea in tea leaves.
It's $4 for a drink here, but it's worth it.
I also tried the pandan macarons here, which were ok.
Parking can be a hassle and the hours are really weird, but if you get the chance to try this place then do it!
jasmine.author: Vivian L.
jasmine.review: Boba Guys' drinks are so good. I was a customer ever since they were located in Ken Ken Ramen. My favorite drink has to be the rose milk tea that is slow dripped. It's the right amount of sweet and it really tastes like roses! I also really like the jasmine milk tea because it tastes more of brewed tea instead of milk. They use organic milk and brew their tea in tea leaves. It's $4 for a drink here, but it's worth it. I also tried the pandan macarons here, which were ok. Parking can be a hassle and the hours are really weird, but if you get the chance to try this place then do it!

excerpts: Got the jasmine milk tea with pearls, 50% sweet
and it was perfect.
Love the concept of using fresh brewed teas and organic milk to make the milk teas instead of powdered stuff!
Tried matcha with avocado and 100% sweet, I would recommend that you  have them cut the sweetness back on that one as the sweetness was too much and made it almost inedible for me.
Would definitely go back and to try some of the fancy other teas with milk and pearls or almond jelly (made in house)!
jasmine.author: C L.
jasmine.review: Got the jasmine milk tea with pearls, 50% sweet and it was perfect. Love the concept of using fresh brewed teas and organic milk to make the milk teas instead of powdered stuff! Tried matcha with avocado and 100% sweet, I would recommend that you  have them cut the sweetness back on that one as the sweetness was too much and made it almost inedible for me. Would definitely go back and to try some of the fancy other teas with milk and pearls or almond jelly (made in house)!

excerpts: The jasmine and horchata are my favorite :)!
jasmine.author: Colette P.
jasmine.review: My favorite place to get boba in sf :). It's fast, easy to get to and satisfying. The jasmine and horchata are my favorite :)!

excerpts: The selection was between milk tea, jasmine tea and soy milk.
