The boba was a little too well done that it sticks to your teeth when you chew it.
The milk tea was very bland and not sweet enough.
I already know
milk tea is super unhealthy so bring on the sugar!
Not sure if the tea was freshly brewed and if they made it there on the spot because I was a little distracted.
Overall, MEH.
jasmine.author: Steven S.
jasmine.review: I'm really confused because either people who have reviewed this place haven't had boba in socal or they're people from the inside.  The boba here is $4 and there were only 3 choices when I went there.  The selection was between milk tea, jasmine tea and soy milk. The boba was a little too well done that it sticks to your teeth when you chew it.  The milk tea was very bland and not sweet enough.  I already know milk tea is super unhealthy so bring on the sugar!  Not sure if the tea was freshly brewed and if they made it there on the spot because I was a little distracted.  Overall, MEH.

excerpts: I love Jasmine milk tea and every time I go to a boba joint, I always compare this drink.
It's more tea flavor
and I definitely love it!
I don't normally order boba in my drink because more than half the time it's not the right chewiness and flavorful but their boba was perfect!!
When I'm back in the city, I'll definitely stop by here again
jasmine.author: Jess J.
jasmine.review: I love Jasmine milk tea and every time I go to a boba joint, I always compare this drink. It's more tea flavor and I definitely love it! I don't normally order boba in my drink because more than half the time it's not the right chewiness and flavorful but their boba was perfect!! When I'm back in the city, I'll definitely stop by here again

excerpts: My bf ordered horchata with boba and I ordered jasmine milk tea 50% sweet with boba....
I liked mine
it wasn't overly sweet but not enough to finish it, but
I do like
the  horchata one more and he did finished his!
I didn't see they have almond jelly, so I will return to try that and gets horchata next trip.
jasmine.author: Joyce E.
jasmine.review: Parked in front of this place and there was a line out front, went to grab brunch and  came back there was still a line! Okay I was full but at that point I had to check this place out! My bf ordered horchata with boba and I ordered jasmine milk tea 50% sweet with boba.... I liked mine it wasn't overly sweet but not enough to finish it, but I do like the  horchata one more and he did finished his! I didn't see they have almond jelly, so I will return to try that and gets horchata next trip.

excerpts: I also got to try the HK milk tea and Jasmine milk tea from my other friends.
I loved the matcha latte!
Jasmine milk tea tasted very fragrant in a good way.
If I come here again I think I'd skip the horchata and get either the matcha latte or the Jasmine milk tea.
It also so happened to be their 2 year anniversary and they gave away pins to celebrate, which was cute.
The workers seemed friendly and attentive.
There's definitely limited seating inside.
Being in a group of 5 I felt like we were taking up half of their space.
Thankfully they are quick on their orders, as others have pointed out, so you can be in and out pretty quickly.
I'd definitely come here again if I happen to be in the area.
jasmine.author: Connie C.
jasmine.review: I came here the other day with a few friends. I ordered the horchata drink, which I thought was good. It's not amazing in my opinion as I've heard from others, but good. I was really debating on getting the matcha latte instead but I got to try it from my friend. I also got to try the HK milk tea and Jasmine milk tea from my other friends. I loved the matcha latte! Jasmine milk tea tasted very fragrant in a good way. If I come here again I think I'd skip the horchata and get either the matcha latte or the Jasmine milk tea. It also so happened to be their 2 year anniversary and they gave away pins to celebrate, which was cute. The workers seemed friendly and attentive. There's definitely limited seating inside. Being in a group of 5 I felt like we were taking up half of their space. Thankfully they are quick on their orders, as others have pointed out, so you can be in and out pretty quickly. I'd definitely come here again if I happen to be in the area.

excerpts: I did enjoy, however, the quality of my Jasmine Milk Tea.
jasmine.author: 3beeskitchen ..
jasmine.review:
Not impressed even with all the hype. I get the concept, hipster-ish/trendy boba place with unique flavors such as horchata. I did enjoy, however, the quality of my Jasmine Milk Tea. I barely like it sweet and the taste was on point. 

But, the boba itself was overly chewy and really, really sweet. This is not the best place in the city, but a fun novelty if you're in the area.

excerpts: I got the horacha my first time and jasmine milk tea the second time.
Am I impressed?
No, but it's not bad.
I like the concept of Boba Guys, I really do, but milk tea to me will always be milk tea.
Hey!
At least it's not the powder crap you'll get from Quicky's or Tapioca Express.
jasmine.author: Edgar G.
jasmine.review: I had to try Boba Guys since all my friends talk about it all the time. I finally tried it a few weeks back with my friend (also his first). I got the horacha my first time and jasmine milk tea the second time. Am I impressed? No, but it's not bad. I like the concept of Boba Guys, I really do, but milk tea to me will always be milk tea. Hey! At least it's not the powder crap you'll get from Quicky's or Tapioca Express.

excerpts: I went with a group of friends, which included a fanatic jasmine milk tea drinker known as my girlfriend, and we all tried each of the milk teas they offered.
They were all relatively slightly above standard, and only the jasmine milk tea stood out!
It was rather fragrant and flavorful at the same time even though it is pre-made and poured out of a container stuffed in a bar fridge.
The boba, however, is the reason that allowed me to click 4 stars instead of 3.
Although it is just normal freaking boba... we could all taste the difference because we drink this stuff on a daily basis.
The texture wasn't like overnight hard, but it had a harder and chewier yet still sweet and fresh taste to it!
It was something unique.
Get the jasmine milk tea with tapioca, and I hope you see what I am talking about!
Oh, and the 1 star off is for minor inconveniences.. short hours, hard to find, limited seating, etc.
jasmine.author: Kev L.
jasmine.review:
Pretty awesome tapioca joint. Even though the place was hard to locate, as well as the seating in the facility, the milk tea they have is well worth the difficulties. I went with a group of friends, which included a fanatic jasmine milk tea drinker known as my girlfriend, and we all tried each of the milk teas they offered. They were all relatively slightly above standard, and only the jasmine milk tea stood out! It was rather fragrant and flavorful at the same time even though it is pre-made and poured out of a container stuffed in a bar fridge. The boba, however, is the reason that allowed me to click 4 stars instead of 3. Although it is just normal freaking boba... we could all taste the difference because we drink this stuff on a daily basis. The texture wasn't like overnight hard, but it had a harder and chewier yet still sweet and fresh taste to it! It was something unique. Get the jasmine milk tea with tapioca, and I hope you see what I am talking about!
Oh, and the 1 star off is for minor inconveniences.. short hours, hard to find, limited seating, etc.

excerpts: The jasmine and rose milk teas are my absolute favorites!
The pearls are always consistent and delicious!!!
jasmine.author: Greg M.
jasmine.review: Absolute best boba place in the city!!! Awesome environment and awesome boba! These people care more about getting it right than any one else! The jasmine and rose milk teas are my absolute favorites! The pearls are always consistent and delicious!!!

excerpts: I tried the jasmine milk tea....too sweet for my taste buds, killed the jasmine tea flavor.
i've had better for cheaper.
jasmine.author: Helen T.
jasmine.review: I tried the jasmine milk tea....too sweet for my taste buds, killed the jasmine tea flavor. i've had better for cheaper.

excerpts: My favorite drink so far has been the Jasmine Milk Tea (w/almond milk)!
i go there often and reccomend it to many of my friends.
jasmine.author: Emma D.
jasmine.review: Boba guys is a friendly boba store! One of my favorite spots to visit when I'm in the mission. Glad they have nice employees, good location, and fast service. My favorite drink so far has been the Jasmine Milk Tea (w/almond milk)! i go there often and reccomend it to many of my friends.

excerpts: : I think their jasmine milk tea is a little weak and can use more tea flavor.
Their sweetness level is inconsistent and they seem to change it on a whim maybe based on a couple of reviews.
First time I had it, it was overly sweet.
The second time was perfect, but the last time was bland.
For guys in lab coats, you'd think they'd take a more scientific approach to making their drinks and make it more consistent.
Their new permanent store has been opened for maybe a month or two now
and it still kind of looks like they just moved in.
It's kind of a small storefront, so any clutter looks like a lot of disorganized clutter.
jasmine.author: Trinh N.
jasmine.review:
4 stars for making boba milk tea with real milk and not that creamer crap you see at all the other boba places. If you see boxes of coffee mate piled up (ahem Tpumps), RUN! They are serving you crap.

Pluses: quality milk tea with quality ingredients. Soft and chewy boba, but my favorite is the classic black tea with almond jelly. 

Minuses: I think their jasmine milk tea is a little weak and can use more tea flavor. Their sweetness level is inconsistent and they seem to change it on a whim maybe based on a couple of reviews. First time I had it, it was overly sweet. The second time was perfect, but the last time was bland.  For guys in lab coats, you'd think they'd take a more scientific approach to making their drinks and make it more consistent. Their new permanent store has been opened for maybe a month or two now and it still kind of looks like they just moved in. It's kind of a small storefront, so any clutter looks like a lot of disorganized clutter. Milk tea could be creamier.

I love that they use real milk though, so I will keep supporting their business!

excerpts: would love it if they had more options that did not involve milk (i.e. jasmine, green tea, etc).
jasmine.author: Tasha D.
jasmine.review: very good boba. a little too sweet for me. would love it if they had more options that did not involve milk (i.e. jasmine, green tea, etc).

excerpts: Jasmine milk tea and boba is the drink to have here.
Just enough sweetness but the boba was a little hard for my liking.
Really cute atmosphere, limited seating, but the smell of curry is real enticing.
Have to come back to try the curry and the alcoholic boba!
Tried the original black milk tea
but it was very sweet.
On the other hand the soy milk tea tastes just like vita soy milk boxes.
The waitress working the bar seemed to enjoy working there and holding conversations with the customers.
Have to give it another try to see if the experience changes.
jasmine.author: Nicole L.
jasmine.review: Jasmine milk tea and boba is the drink to have here. Just enough sweetness but the boba was a little hard for my liking. Really cute atmosphere, limited seating, but the smell of curry is real enticing. Have to come back to try the curry and the alcoholic boba! Tried the original black milk tea but it was very sweet. On the other hand the soy milk tea tastes just like vita soy milk boxes. The waitress working the bar seemed to enjoy working there and holding conversations with the customers. Have to give it another try to see if the experience changes.

excerpts: I ordered the jasmine tea w/boba and it was on point!
They use homemade syrup and organic milk!
Nothing can top that off!
jasmine.author: Janny W.
jasmine.review: I was excited to try this place as I am pretty tired of those typical milk teas from Teaway, Quickly's, T-Pump and etc. I ordered the jasmine tea w/boba and it was on point! They use homemade syrup and organic milk! Nothing can top that off!

excerpts: I tried jasmine milk tea, classic milk tea and Hong Kong style milk tea and hk style milk tea is way too sweet.
I recommend classic though.
One thing they can improve is OPEN EARLIER!
So when us students get off campus lunch can get some boba!
Should consider open at around 11 am instead of 2pm....
jasmine.author: Anna L.
jasmine.review: Boba guys is awesome! It's near my school so it's convenient. I tried jasmine milk tea, classic milk tea and Hong Kong style milk tea and hk style milk tea is way too sweet. I recommend classic though. One thing they can improve is OPEN EARLIER! So when us students get off campus lunch can get some boba! Should consider open at around 11 am instead of 2pm....

excerpts: On the other hand, my friend got the jasmine milk tea and it was very flavorful and worth the $4!!
jasmine.author: Shelley W.
jasmine.review:
The tapioca was really fresh, soft, and good! But the regular milk tea wasn't spectacular, it definitely was not worth $4.

On the other hand, my friend got the jasmine milk tea and it was very flavorful and worth the $4!!

excerpts: My favorite is the jasmine, but I also like the original black tea and the horchata.
I don't see any of the dreaded colored powders and the Strauss milk is a big plus.
This is still my first stop when I fly in from JFK to visit my parents.
My toddler knows that momma has to stop for her tea and always tries to take a swig.
I was almost late for my return flight last time because I needed to get one to hold me over until my next visit.
Please consider opening a location in Brooklyn or NYC!
I would be there like e'ry day.
jasmine.author: Katie L.
jasmine.review: Used to come to this joint when it was a pop-up in Ken Ken Ramen. I'm a boba tea junkie and had to get my fix. I practically lived on bubble tea during my pregnancy and I considered moving to the Mission just to save time on my daily commute there. Then, they opened up their shop shortly before I left San Francisco. I like their clean look and the fact that they actually use real tea. I love being able to actually taste the tea flavor. My favorite is the jasmine, but I also like the original black tea and the horchata. I don't see any of the dreaded colored powders and the Strauss milk is a big plus. This is still my first stop when I fly in from JFK to visit my parents. My toddler knows that momma has to stop for her tea and always tries to take a swig. I was almost late for my return flight last time because I needed to get one to hold me over until my next visit. Please consider opening a location in Brooklyn or NYC! I would be there like e'ry day.

excerpts: Will go back to try their jasmine tea!
jasmine.author: Mandy C.
jasmine.review: Tried both house and soy milk tea.  I love that it's from real tea and milk, not from some powder.  The soy milk overpowered the tea, so I like the house blend more.  Will go back to try their jasmine tea!   :)

excerpts: So I got the regular milk tea and my friend got the jasmine milk tea.
Unfortunately they didn't have tapioca
so we decided to try the almond jelly.
Usually I hate all kinds of jelly except tapioca
so that was being risky for my usual taste.
When they brought the cute glasses/ mason jars, I just wanted to take it home!!!
(don't worry, i didn't)
As we took the first sips of our milk tea, our minds were blown!!!
All I could think of is "WHY IS THIS
SO
DARN AMAZING???
It has the perfect tea to milk ratio and the jelly wasn't overwhelmingly sweet or fake tasting.
I CANNOT WAIT
TO COME BACK.
So now ... here's the bad points of this place (sadly, every place does have it's bad points..)
One, the parking sucks!!!
I recommend you take the bus out here or something..
Two, this place is confusing to get to because there's no sign or anything.
Three, the area is not so safe
so just be careful and
four
, it CAN get extremely busy!!
Five, the milk tea is on the ... "expensive" side.
But you get what you pay for.
Obviously Quickly or Teaway's 99 cents isn't gonna make your taste buds jumping for joy.
You have been warned of Boba Guy's awesomeness.
jasmine.author: Susie N.
jasmine.review:
Words cannot even express how much I love Boba Guys.

Listen up guys, I have been to millions and millions of Boba places. Heck! I even worked at one. Let me tell you that no ones milk tea can measure up to Boba Guys. NO ONE. Sure it took a try or two to actually find out how to attain one of these miraculously amazing milk teas but the search was so worth it. 
So here's the deal, they don't actually have their own store because they're only available in the ramen shop which isn't the greatest thing.. I have to admit, it's awfully confusing but just walk in the ramen shop and sit your butt down at the bar. After that, everything will be worth it and you'll forget about being confused. 
So I got the regular milk tea and my friend got the jasmine milk tea. Unfortunately they didn't have tapioca so we decided to try the almond jelly. Usually I hate all kinds of jelly except tapioca so that was being risky for my usual taste. When they brought the cute glasses/ mason jars, I just wanted to take it home!!! (don't worry, i didn't) As we took the first sips of our milk tea, our minds were blown!!! All I could think of is "WHY IS THIS SO DARN AMAZING???" It has the perfect tea to milk ratio and the jelly wasn't overwhelmingly sweet or fake tasting. I CANNOT WAIT TO COME BACK. So now ... here's the bad points of this place (sadly, every place does have it's bad points..) One, the parking sucks!!! I recommend you take the bus out here or something.. Two, this place is confusing to get to because there's no sign or anything. Three, the area is not so safe so just be careful and four, it CAN get extremely busy!! Five, the milk tea is on the ... "expensive" side. But you get what you pay for. Obviously Quickly or Teaway's 99 cents isn't gonna make your taste buds jumping for joy.
You have been warned of Boba Guy's awesomeness.

excerpts: I really enjoyed their jasmine milk tea!
I had the regular milk tea as well which wasn't as good, but the jasmine was delicious.
The boba was nice and chewy and sweet and the tea was great.
They also have spiked drinks, but didn't check those out.
If you're in the area and are craving good boba they are recommended!
jasmine.author: Sophia D.
jasmine.review: I really enjoyed their jasmine milk tea!  I had the regular milk tea as well which wasn't as good, but the jasmine was delicious.  The boba was nice and chewy and sweet and the tea was great.  They also have spiked drinks, but didn't check those out.  If you're in the area and are craving good boba they are recommended!

excerpts: There wasn't much variety to choose from in the menu; they only had original milk tea, soy milk tea and jasmine milk tea.
All of their milk teas are pre-made in pitchers that just sit on the counter.
My boyfriend ordered a spiked jasmine milk tea and I ordered a regular jasmine milk tea.
He took a few sips and didn't like it at all.
I guess it was simply tasteless.
Alcohol and milk tea does not go well together..
My jasmine milk tea was alright.
It tasted a bit diluted in my opinion.
The boba had perfect texture though and was chewy enough for my liking, which is good.
jasmine.author: Emily Q.
jasmine.review:
I wish this place had a sign outside saying "Boba Guys" because it took me forever to find this place. It's hidden inside this Japanese ramen restaurant, I believe. I'm from Orange County (where boba stores are literally in every corner), and I just had to satisfy my boba cravings during my trip to San Fran. I decided to hit up this place due to its high ratings on Yelp. 

I was a bit disappointed because it wasn't what I expected it to be. The boba place is a small bar area that's located inside a Japanese restaurant. There wasn't much variety to choose from in the menu; they only had original milk tea, soy milk tea and jasmine milk tea. All of their milk teas are pre-made in pitchers that just sit on the counter. So once you order, they just pour out the milk tea into a glass and serve it to you. 

My boyfriend ordered a spiked jasmine milk tea and I ordered a regular jasmine milk tea. He took a few sips and didn't like it at all. I guess it was simply tasteless. Alcohol and milk tea does not go well together.. My jasmine milk tea was alright. It tasted a bit diluted in my opinion. The boba had perfect texture though and was chewy enough for my liking, which is good.

excerpts: They offer your traditional tapioca flavors - HK milk tea, jasmine milk tea, etc.
Some other unconventional flavors included Soy milk tea and Horchata.
My friends and I tried these 4 flavors.
The one that made a lasting impression was surprisingly the soy milk tea.
It was surprisingly sweet and full of flavor, totally opposite of what you think it would taste like.
jasmine.author: Jackie M.
jasmine.review: My friends and I dropped by for tapioca after dinner. They offer your traditional tapioca flavors - HK milk tea, jasmine milk tea, etc. Some other unconventional flavors included Soy milk tea and Horchata. My friends and I tried these 4 flavors. The one that made a lasting impression was surprisingly the soy milk tea. It was surprisingly sweet and full of flavor, totally opposite of what you think it would taste like. The guy working was also handing out samples of the cotton candy they make. They had chocolate and matcha - I especially liked the matcha. I would definitely come again when in the neighborhood.

excerpts: I've tried the basics: the regular boba milk tea and the jasmine . .
.they
are both good.
Today I tried the matcha latte and had the grass jelly added.
It was pretty satisfying .
tho
i had a hard time tasting the grass jelly, but that could be my own doing b
/c matcha is a stronger tea flavor so it overpowered the grass jelly.
Maybe next time i should just get a cup of grass jelly like the brother did with the almond jelly.
I kind of wish they had custard pudding. .
.Hey
boba guys, how about some custard pudding?
But maybe the direction they're going is more the mixing of teas with fresh fruits . .
.Maybe
I will try that next time!
jasmine.author: Summer L.
jasmine.review: Welcome boba to the MIssion! Yah, it's not anything off the charts special, but it's solid, organic, and they accommodate fussy customers like a Starbucks would. . . .As a lactose intolerant Asian who wishes there were non-dairy milk options at the mainstream boba places, this place serves my needs. . . I've tried the basics: the regular boba milk tea and the jasmine . . .they are both good. Today I tried the matcha latte and had the grass jelly added. It was pretty satisfying . . tho i had a hard time tasting the grass jelly, but that could be my own doing b/c matcha is a stronger tea flavor so it overpowered the grass jelly. Maybe next time i should just get a cup of grass jelly like the brother did with the almond jelly. I kind of wish they had custard pudding. . .Hey boba guys, how about some custard pudding? But maybe the direction they're going is more the mixing of teas with fresh fruits . . .Maybe I will try that next time!

excerpts: The first time I tried their Jasmine milk tea, it was decent.
Good tea.
Average boba.
jasmine.author: Will S.
jasmine.review:
Short ver.: Watery boba. Good tea. Passable boba.

Long ver.:

I lived in Socal. And those of you looking at the low ratings reviews for bay area boba places might notice a trend. But claiming that your milk tea is not made from powder is like a restaurant claiming that their food is not shit. I think the fact that people think this is unusual and worth noting says a lot about the competition.

The first time I tried their Jasmine milk tea, it was decent. Good tea. Average boba. I thought the boba was a little soft and definitely tasteless.

The second time, I tried the same thing but the milk tea is waayyyy too watery. Its like they keep it cold by putting ice in it. 

Is it racist if I point out that the second time I came the servers on duty were caucasians? Yes? Okay, I won't make excuses for them then, they're just incompetent regardless.
Polite and nice does not a good boba make.

I think Boba Guys have their marketing and presentation down pat, now if only they can actually make good boba tea they're set. Keyword: good boba. Get those workers to try out what good boba taste like and compare it to the blah that they make and maybe they'll finally have what it takes. (hint: honey b tea in outer richmond). Also, I don't care if they make the tea from scratch in front of us. Unless that makes my drink tastes better, it's just a gimmick.

Last thing; 

Dear Boba guys,
Please do better~ I'm rooting for you. You're the only halfway decent boba place within a mile from my work place. So, you know, your success is my benefit...

excerpts: I tried both the horchata flavor and the jasmine milk tea.
The jasmine milk tea had a nice floral tea taste, but again, it didn't stand out enough to me since I can go anywhere for this drink.
The horchata was good if I never tried a good horchata.
It tasted a bit watered down to me.
If anything, I would just go to a Mexican joint and buy a good cup of horchata and mix my own tapioca balls in.
Tapioca balls were soft and chewy though, so that was a good thing.
Overall, since there really isn't many options in the Mission for tapioca, Boba Guys hits the spot.
Compared to the rest of the city though, it can easily be forgotten.
Worth a try if you're in the area and really craving tapioca I guess!
jasmine.author: Johnson S.
jasmine.review: Hmm... I'm not really sure what the rave is. I was expecting a lot from this place after reading some of the reviews. But after trying so many other joints, I can officially think of myself as a boba snob. With that said, Boba Guys seems relatively... average. Nothing that stands out to me, I don't hate it, but I can't really justify paying $4 for the little cup when I can go elsewhere in the city and pay the same price to get a larger cup. I tried both the horchata flavor and the jasmine milk tea. The jasmine milk tea had a nice floral tea taste, but again, it didn't stand out enough to me since I can go anywhere for this drink. The horchata was good if I never tried a good horchata. It tasted a bit watered down to me. If anything, I would just go to a Mexican joint and buy a good cup of horchata and mix my own tapioca balls in. Tapioca balls were soft and chewy though, so that was a good thing. Overall, since there really isn't many options in the Mission for tapioca, Boba Guys hits the spot. Compared to the rest of the city though, it can easily be forgotten. Worth a try if you're in the area and really craving tapioca I guess!

excerpts: The second time, I tried the jasmine milk tea.
You can actually taste the tea in their drinks!
Drinks aren't powdery or overly sweet.
They are slower than other places, probably because they have to wait for the tea to brew...
Price is also a bit high, but I give 5stars for having "healthy" boba and drinks that are actually good!
aha~
jasmine.author: Jen C.
jasmine.review: Organic milk tea? That got me curious so I stopped by the other day. I've had boba all over the world, and I must say, theirs' is perfectly chewy and sweet! I had soy milk tea the first time. The second time, I tried the jasmine milk tea. You can actually taste the tea in their drinks! Drinks aren't powdery or overly sweet. They are slower than other places, probably because they have to wait for the tea to brew...Price is also a bit high, but I give 5stars for having "healthy" boba and drinks that are actually good! aha~

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea and
it was kind of watered down.
The boba was okay.
I love boba and this is definitely not the best boba spot.
And disappointed that the boba guys with lab coats weren't there!
jasmine.author: Joyce L.
jasmine.review: This place is eh okay.  When my boyfriend and I came here there were only 2 flavors to choose from.  I got the jasmine milk tea and it was kind of watered down.  The boba was okay.  I love boba and this is definitely not the best boba spot.  And disappointed that the boba guys with lab coats weren't there!

excerpts: Their jasmine green milk tea.
thats my go to
jasmine.author: Kristina L.
jasmine.review: got some togo. their milk teas are pretty on point. tapioca balls are just not the same anymore to me if they aren't soaked in honey. This place is kinda pricey buts not too bad when you can actually taste the tea flavor. If I'm in the area, i'd stop by again. Their jasmine green milk tea. thats my go to

excerpts: Our order included the three milk teas on their menu: original, soy, and jasmine.
I ordered the jasmine milk tea with pearls.
The tea was well prepared, creamy from the Straus milk they used, which was nice.
The pearls were too gummy.
Was this a result of the pearls sitting around for too long whilst being delivered?
jasmine.author: Linda T.
jasmine.review:
A bunch of my officemates and I got together and ordered boba to be delivered from Boba Guys. I was really excited, since boba is delicious when done well, and these guys had sold me on their efforts to do it well. 

Verdict? Tea, tasty. Pearls, suck. 

An informal survey among the officemate pool found that we were all in agreement. Our order included the three milk teas on their menu: original, soy, and jasmine.

I ordered the jasmine milk tea with pearls. The tea was well prepared, creamy from the Straus milk they used, which was nice. The pearls were too gummy. Was this a result of the pearls sitting around for too long whilst being delivered? Doubtful, since I work 10 minutes via car from Boba Guys.

As one officemate put it: "they could corner the market on hipsters and white people." As for me, I'll continue to go to Fantasia, Verde, or Ten Ren for a solid cup of bubble tea that doesn't cost four dollars (or five when it's delivered). Sorry, Boba Guys.

excerpts: i love the jasmine tea with bobas.
so good.
it's really addicting.
the only downside is that sometimes its PERFECT and other times it's not sweet enough or it's watery.
It's $4 a pop + $1 tip
so I can feel like kind of a dummy when it isn't great.
But when it is - - - so good!!
jasmine.author: Amy M.
jasmine.review: i love the jasmine tea with bobas.  so good.  it's really addicting.  the only downside is that sometimes its PERFECT and other times it's not sweet enough or it's watery.  It's $4 a pop + $1 tip so I can feel like kind of a dummy when it isn't great.  But when it is - - - so good!!

excerpts: Ordered an original and a jasmine tea with Pork Curry.
Their milk tea has so much flavor and the tapioca balls were cooked perfectly.
It was a bit pricey though but was worth a try.
Wanted to purchase the mason jars but they had limited availability.
jasmine.author: Ej O.
jasmine.review: Wanted to try this place due to the limited hours and check out what it's about. Ordered an original and a jasmine tea with Pork Curry. Their milk tea has so much flavor and the tapioca balls were cooked perfectly. It was a bit pricey though but was worth a try. Wanted to purchase the mason jars but they had limited availability.

excerpts: I got the jasmine boba milk tea.
It's some of the freshest, chewiest tapioca balls I've ever had, great milk, and the sugar taste is not overwhelming.
The only downside is it's a bit expensive, so not really in everyone's price range in terms of boba.
I'd probably give it another try, with another drink.
In terms of how much of a tea taste I get, it's harder to tell because jasmine teas are just more subtle in general
jasmine.author: Edison T.
jasmine.review: I got the jasmine boba milk tea. It's some of the freshest, chewiest tapioca balls I've ever had, great milk, and the sugar taste is not overwhelming. The only downside is it's a bit expensive, so not really in everyone's price range in terms of boba. I'd probably give it another try, with another drink. In terms of how much of a tea taste I get, it's harder to tell because jasmine teas are just more subtle in general

excerpts: Their jasmine milk tea was good.
Their regular milk tea was even better!
Their milk tea was creamy, milky and had a very nice tea taste to it.
Although their jasmine milk tea was good, I thought the jasmine was a little bit too overpowering.
Came here for boba, but what we got instead was almond jelly
:{ I hate it when places run out of boba.
Overall I thought their milk tea was pretty good.
Parking was terrible as I got swooped two times -_-, but other than that, I would come back again but only if there is boba.
jasmine.author: Alice Z.
jasmine.review: Their jasmine milk tea was good. Their regular milk tea was even better! Their milk tea was creamy, milky and had a very nice tea taste to it. Although their jasmine milk tea was good, I thought the jasmine was a little bit too overpowering. Came here for boba, but what we got instead was almond jelly :{ I hate it when places run out of boba. Overall I thought their milk tea was pretty good. Parking was terrible as I got swooped two times -_-, but other than that, I would come back again but only if there is boba.

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea.
I liked that it was refreshing and you can really taste the quality of the milk.
However the tea flavor was really weak and the boba wasn't anything special.
I think boba guys can stand to improve their recipe.
For $4 a drink, the boba should be softer to match the quality of the milk.
I hope they will keep brainstorming to make their boba drinks more interesting because right now the drinks are super basic and the novelty of the mason jar will wear out.
jasmine.author: Tina L.
jasmine.review: I got the jasmine milk tea. I liked that it was refreshing and you can really taste the quality of the milk. However the tea flavor was really weak and the boba wasn't anything special. I think boba guys can stand to improve their recipe. For $4 a drink, the boba should be softer to match the quality of the milk. I hope they will keep brainstorming to make their boba drinks more interesting because right now the drinks are super basic and the novelty of the mason jar will wear out.

excerpts: i ordered jasmine milk tea with boba.
the boba wasnt marinated and you can feel sugar grains in the drink.
one of the worst jasmine milk tea i had.
jasmine.author: Allen Z.
jasmine.review: read lot of reviews and decided to give boba guys a try. i ordered jasmine milk tea with boba. the boba wasnt marinated and you can feel sugar grains in the drink. one of the worst jasmine milk tea i had.

excerpts: I recalled New York being very high quality (I got Thai tea and sampled my friends strawberry matcha latte), but when I tried it again in Hayes Valley a few months ago, I was incredibly disappointed; the boba was hard and flavorless, the Thai tea was like bitter water.
thai.author: Vickie N.
thai.review:
After trying this place for the third time, I'm finally ready to give my final review. I've been to locations in New York, Hayes Valley, and now here. I recalled New York being very high quality (I got Thai tea and sampled my friends strawberry matcha latte), but when I tried it again in Hayes Valley a few months ago, I was incredibly disappointed; the boba was hard and flavorless, the Thai tea was like bitter water.

This time around I got the strawberry matcha latte, and BOY is it better than I remember. I got whole milk, 100% sweetness, and boba. The boba was a nice chewy texture with a nice taste to it, and the drink was delicious- not too sweet, not too bitter, and tasted more strawberry than matcha (which I preferred). I definitely need to explore the other options as well, so I'm definitely coming back!

excerpts: I ordered the thai tea with normal sweetness.
When I tried my thai tea, I was extremely disappointed.
I did not like my drink and ended up throwing half of it away.
The people who work here are nice but there drinks don't live up to the hype.
thai.author: Karishma K.
thai.review:
Came here on Saturday with a couple of friends and although I come to the city pretty often, I have never tried boba guys. I have heard a lot about it and I have a friend who said she loved their drinks so I was excited to try this place.

We came here around 3PM on a Saturday and luckily, we did not have to wait in line for too long. I would say the wait was about 10 minutes and so we were glad because I've heard the line is usually much longer. I ordered the thai tea with normal sweetness. 

It didn't take too long for them to make our drinks and so we were in an out pretty quickly. When I tried my thai tea, I was extremely disappointed. I did not like my drink and ended up throwing half of it away. The people who work here are nice but there drinks don't live up to the hype.

excerpts: The Thai tea is decent too
but I feel they don't use enough tea, as it's mostly milk.
They also used honey as a sweetener for my matcha latte
and it was actually really good and

something I'm not very used to seeing
-Love

the ability to customize your drink from type of milk, ice level, sweetness, etc
-There is limited seating inside, as it is mostly a grab n go spot.
Some of the other locations have a lot more seating
thai.author: Jason C.
thai.review:
-Truly one of the best boba shops around, the line out the door is a testament to it's greatness. Went around 2pm on a Sunday and the line was already very long but it's always worth the wait for Boba Guys
-My favorites are the classic milk tea and matcha latte. The Thai tea is decent too but I feel they don't use enough tea, as it's mostly milk. They also used honey as a sweetener for my matcha latte and it was actually really good and something I'm not very used to seeing
-Love the ability to customize your drink from type of milk, ice level, sweetness, etc
-There is limited seating inside, as it is mostly a grab n go spot. Some of the other locations have a lot more seating

excerpts: Came here and got a Thai iced tea!
It was delicious, a bit on the sweeter side
so if you don't like yours sweet
thai.author: Melina T.
thai.review:
Came here and got a Thai iced tea! It was delicious, a bit on the sweeter side so if you don't like yours sweet I'd recommend asking them to use half of their sweetener! 

I also tried their milk tea, always a safe and good option. It was not the best I've had, but is on par with other ones I've had.

excerpts: Other drinks that are popular are the HK milk tea (super sweet side), Thai tea, and the strawberry matcha.
thai.author: Anna L.
thai.review:
This is not my favorite boba place in SF but is one of the them that won't let you down.  If you're a tourist or even have never tried it before, I would give it a chance. 

I'm not much of an explorer when it comes to my boba tastes so I like to stick with the basic jasmine milk tea with boba. The tea flavors are fairly strong but I feel like they make the drink so sweet! When I get 75% sweetness it still tastes like it's half sugar. Luckily, they have really great customer service and will remake you a drink if you ask. Boba is typically good here with a chewy consistency and strong taste as well. Other drinks that are popular are the HK milk tea (super sweet side), Thai tea, and the strawberry matcha. 

Honestly I think a main reason I don't like boba guys as much is because their milk teas just doesn't taste like the traditional places (ten ren) that are my favorite! they aren't bad though, so definitely give it a try.

excerpts: (Thai Tea, Hong Kong Tea, your give coffee milk tea) and a number of different kinds of teas.
It's gratifying because you usually go to one place and they have an assortment of that TYPE of tea/milk tea (ex.
a list of Hong Kong styled milk tea + [insert flavor]).
They also have a variety of snacks at the front container.
There were SMALL WAFFLES,
OKAY.
THEY LOOKED BEAUTIFUL AND DELICIOUS.
Oh, and for those who haven't had this kind of matcha latte before where the layers are initially separate, remember to Instagram or
whatever first, then stir it before drinking.
They also keep a pitcher of water and a stack off cups on the side table where the straws are, or at least they did while we were there.
If you see that the pitcher(s) is empty, move or leave it on the pickup counter so the staff doesn't have to wade out into the crowd to get it.
It also has the bonus of getting the pitcher refilled more quickly.
Anyways, their milk tea isn't overly sweet, but I'd highly recommend the 25% level of sweetness.
My friend found her 50% matcha latte to be a bit on the sweeter side
and I'm inclined to agree.
I'm hoping to visit one of their other locations soon, they're spreading like wildfire!
thai.author: Christine L.
thai.review:
My friend and I actually found out about Boba Guys because of their stand at San Francisco Matcha Festival. The weather that day was in the high 80s and low 90s, so if the trio colored matcha strawberry latte wasn't eye catching enough, then the fact everybody was standing in an open field under the blazing sun was. 

On our way back to the train station, we actually took the wrong bus, ended up going the opposite, and became very, very lost. By coincidence, we ended up a block away from this particular Boba Guys on 19th Street and decided to drop by. And WOW. Apparently (by the amount of Matcha Festival cups lying around inside and out of the store), a good deal of the festival attendants came out this way to try out more of their stuff. So congrats, Boba Guys! You're investment seemed to pay off pretty well while we there! 

This particular store is pretty small. It's a counter, a bit of room, and a counter-bar along the window. During the time we were there, 30-40 people were trying to occupy that space all at once. There was a literal line that went out the door and down past the next door building and a number of people passing us by were calling us crazy. Which, screw you too, buddy. But that does highlight the point that this place wasn't really built to have a whole lot of people sit down and linger here, though they did say their other locations ARE. They all seem to have a clean, almost See's-candy like aesthetic, but more hipster. Largely relies on natural light, which I appreciate. 

To me, Boba Guys covers an variety of styles and types of milk tea (Thai Tea, Hong Kong Tea, your give coffee milk tea) and a number of different kinds of teas. It's gratifying because you usually go to one place and they have an assortment of that TYPE of tea/milk tea (ex. a list of Hong Kong styled milk tea + [insert flavor]). They also have a variety of snacks at the front container. There were SMALL WAFFLES, OKAY. THEY LOOKED BEAUTIFUL AND DELICIOUS. Oh, and for those who haven't had this kind of matcha latte before where the layers are initially separate, remember to Instagram or whatever first, then stir it before drinking. They also keep a pitcher of water and a stack off cups on the side table where the straws are, or at least they did while we were there. If you see that the pitcher(s) is empty, move or leave it on the pickup counter so the staff doesn't have to wade out into the crowd to get it. It also has the bonus of getting the pitcher refilled more quickly. Anyways, their milk tea isn't overly sweet, but I'd highly recommend the 25% level of sweetness. My friend found her 50% matcha latte to be a bit on the sweeter side and I'm inclined to agree. I'm hoping to visit one of their other locations soon, they're spreading like wildfire!

excerpts: So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea.
The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk.
It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding.
Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had.
I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect!
Do i even need to get started on their boba?
There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...
It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness
thai.author: Tina L.
thai.review:
Boba Guys is one of the places that I think truly makes San Francisco so unique and special. Their drinks are so unique and you can't find them anywhere else! You can also tell they really put effort into the quality of their drinks and care about their customers' needs. Not once have I ever been disappointed by their drinks or customer service! 

I love the location of this Boba Guys. It's located smack-dab right in the Mission, surrounded by tons of yummy restaurants and pretty close to the Castro and Dolores Park! BEWARE THOUGH, parking can be a nightmare though and it might take you a while to find. The shop itself is pretty small, and there's usually a line of customers trailing down the sidewalk. The wait can be long, but it's worth it if you have the time. This is a great place to grab boba after lunch or dinner with friends or family! 

What's great about their drinks is that you can alter the sweetness and ice level, and for the ones that have milk you can substitute it for a non-dairy version, such almond milk or oat milk! So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style. My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea. The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk. It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding. Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had. I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect! Do i even need to get started on their boba? There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness and I can't get enough.

Overall, this place is a must if you're ever in San Francisco. It's an experience worth having and the boba is definitely worth it!!

excerpts: The first couple of times I got the thai tea, horchata and matchata.
They were pretty basic good tasting tea
but today I got the Strawberry matcha with almond jelly
and wow it is so tasty.
thai.author: Andrew T.
thai.review:
I've had boba guy a few times and I always thought it was good milk tea but today it was fantastic. It really does depend on what you get. The first couple of times I got the thai tea, horchata and matchata. They were pretty basic good tasting tea but today I got the Strawberry matcha with almond jelly and wow it is so tasty. I normally like my milk tea with a stronger tea flavor but this was still very refreshing and the texture from the almond jelly is so yummy in my tummy. 

I also got to try the lychee green milk tea and that was also very good. For both drinks I just got the regular sweetness just to see what they think the appropriate amount of sweetness is and it's close to being on point. I would have like to have it a bit less sweet but still overall a great drink.

excerpts: My friend got Thai Tea
and I got their regular milk tea - always a good and safe option.
I always try to get 50% sweetness
'cause some milk teas are super sweet!
Their milk tea was just alright
thai.author: Sheila C.
thai.review:
Finally got to try this place after wanting to try it for forever! My friend got Thai Tea and I got their regular milk tea - always a good and safe option. I always try to get 50% sweetness 'cause some milk teas are super sweet! Their milk tea was just alright - it tasted like any other new boba places in the East Bay area. 

Location is pretty small and parking can be a hassle depending on what time of day you decide to come. We came in the afternoon and got lucky with parking. Although we parked a a block down, it was still pretty close. 

I honestly don't understand why everyone recommends this but I wouldn't mind coming back to try a different drink. Maybe then, I'll love Boba Guys.

excerpts: I had a large thai and added in boba and grass jellies.
Longest line iv ever seen I had to wait behind like 40 people down the block
but it was good once I got in.
Prices have risen 50 cents vs whats on yelp and its weird a boba place charges extra for boba as others have said but otherwise tasty.
thai.author: Sean G.
thai.review: Good quality tea. I had a large thai and added in boba and grass jellies. Longest line iv ever seen I had to wait behind like 40 people down the block but it was good once I got in. Prices have risen 50 cents vs whats on yelp and its weird a boba place charges extra for boba as others have said but otherwise tasty.

excerpts: I ordered: jasmine milk tea, Thai milk tea and strawberry tea fresca.
The quality of the drinks was just as delicious!
It was pure bliss to drink boba tea drinks right after our ceremony haha.
Every time I drink Thai milk tea, I will remember the wedding all over again.
thai.author: Ali N.
thai.review:
I had Boba Guys cater my summer wedding and it was AMAZING! 

For catering, I ordered 120 drinks for 142 guests. I was able to select 3 flavored drinks. I ordered: jasmine milk tea, Thai milk tea and strawberry tea fresca. The quality of the drinks was just as delicious! It was pure bliss to drink boba tea drinks right after our ceremony haha. All of our guests enjoyed it and raved about it even after the wedding. 

Thanks Boba Guys for coming to my wedding! Best decision ever. Every time I drink Thai milk tea, I will remember the wedding all over again.

excerpts: Thai tea is my favorite drink ever in life
so when I go here am just in heaven.
I always go for the 24oz Thai
the
but the guava drink they have idk what is the name I forgot
but it's really good too
and the pearl is amazing
I guess people call it boba
I call it pearl lol but yea deff worth the wait line is usually kinda long but they so move really fast
thai.author: melisa r.
thai.review: I love love love this place ! Thai tea is my favorite drink ever in life so when I go here am just in heaven. I always go for the 24oz Thai the but the guava drink they have idk what is the name I forgot but it's really good too and the pearl is amazing I guess people call it boba I call it pearl lol but yea deff worth the wait line is usually kinda long but they so move really fast

excerpts: my friend ordered the Thai Tea (asked for 100% sweet, but was told, they only make this in 75% sweet).
My classic milk tea was made with organic milk and was delicious & very satisfying.
The tea flavor was very strong and flavorful.
The Thai tea's flavor was good, but not sweet enough like how most places are.
thai.author: Cindy D.
thai.review:
Came 30 minutes before closing, and had no line to wait through, so I was very pleased. The cashier was very friendly and attentive in suggesting to get between the regular milk tea or the Jasmine. He suggested Jasmine since it has less caffeine since it's so late in the night to drink milk tea. 

However, I was really craving regular milk tea, so I got the Classic Milk Tea 100% sweet, and my friend ordered the Thai Tea (asked for 100% sweet, but was told, they only make this in 75% sweet). My classic milk tea was made with organic milk and was delicious & very satisfying. The tea flavor was very strong and flavorful. The Thai tea's flavor was good, but not sweet enough like how most places are. 

Price is a bit on the higher end. Parking is very difficult to find in this area. 

But I highly recommend this spot and I will definitely be coming back!

excerpts: My top drinks that I order here are Thai Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk tea 50% sweet, Matcha Green Milk Tea, Rose Milk Tea, and Horchata!
thai.author: Michele G.
thai.review:
Visited this location many times. Coveniently a couple blocks away from Dolores Park.

This location is very small. It has extremely limited seating, which consists of one bench outside and four bar stool seats inside.

They sell merchandise like water bottles and bags. They also sell some snacks and sweets which is advertised by the cashier.

I believe this is the first location Boba Guys opened at.

Great service at this location. Staff was friendly.

Their drinks are very high quality. My favorite boba shop in the city. Their drinks have a tea-y taste instead of an artificial taste. 

They have many different milk options. Soy, Califa Almond, Straus Milk, and Oats milk which is a very nice selection.

Now about their Boba Balls! So delicious and addicting. Their boba balls are chewy, a tad sweet and overall good quality. I hate it when tapioca balls are super soft or mushy, it's gross. This place has by far one of the best tapioca balls.

My top drinks that I order here are Thai Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk tea 50% sweet, Matcha Green Milk Tea, Rose Milk Tea, and Horchata!

excerpts: I ordered the Thai Iced Tea with boba.
The tea was pretty good and made with organic Strauss milk.
They definitely take pride in using good, quality ingredients.
However, maybe I was there on a bad day because whoever cooked up the batch of boba clearly never checked that it was cooked through.
Nothing worse than biting into a boba to find it hard in the center like partially cooked pasta.
No matter how good the tea was, it didn't make up for the awful texture of the boba.
thai.author: Betty R.
thai.review:
Overpriced and simply not very good. 

Saw an article this week in SF Gate about these guys so had to come try them out for myself. Tiny little place with line out the door looked promising but didn't deliver.

I ordered the Thai Iced Tea with boba. The tea was pretty good and made with organic Strauss milk. They definitely take pride in using good, quality ingredients. However, maybe I was there on a bad day because whoever cooked up the batch of boba clearly never checked that it was cooked through. Nothing worse than biting into a boba to find it hard in the center like partially cooked pasta. No matter how good the tea was, it didn't make up for the awful texture of the boba. Definitely not worth the trip out to the Mission. 

Sorry guys but you can't call yourself the Boba Guys and post up signs about your "Grade-A Balls" if the boba you serve is not even cooked all the way through.

excerpts: My two favorite drinks here are the thai tea and the coffee milk tea.
I have yet to find another coffee milk tea that can hold a candle to the one here.
It is a bit on the sweet side
so I'd suggest getting less sugar if you don't like particularly sweet drinks.
However, it's such a good blend of flavors with some strong, tasty coffee.
I have a bad habit of comparing all other thai teas to the one here as well.
thai.author: Lakshmi M.
thai.review:
I am such a sucker for Boba Guys. Frankly, this place has ruined most other boba places for me because of its great quality. I can actually taste the tea in my drinks and the high quality of the milk is seriously refreshing. I also really appreciate that they have non-dairy options (woohoo almond/soy milk!). I've definitely gotten a couple of friends completely hooked on this place.

My two favorite drinks here are the thai tea and the coffee milk tea. I have yet to find another coffee milk tea that can hold a candle to the one here. It is a bit on the sweet side so I'd suggest getting less sugar if you don't like particularly sweet drinks. However, it's such a good blend of flavors with some strong, tasty coffee. I have a bad habit of comparing all other thai teas to the one here as well. 

The classic milk tea and hong kong milk tea are also great choices! If you want something that's outside of the box, I would recommend the strawberry matcha~

excerpts: My friend got the basic Thai Tea and it was also good!
Good balance of sweetness and tea.
thai.author: Martin N.
thai.review:
Boba Guys... where to start.

Finding this location was pretty tricky since it was basically being covered by construction, but don't worry... you will see the line.

I've seen many of my friends get Boba Guys and I really wanted to try the hype. Let me tell you, it was definitely worth the hype. I got the Horchata and it was so good! I love Horchata and this one hit the spot. The boba was soft and not overly chewy, which was awesome! 5/5 I approve.

My friend got the basic Thai Tea and it was also good! Good balance of sweetness and tea. Yummmmmmmz.

The line was not long at all. We went in and out in like 15 minutes with time to spare in the meter. It's a pretty small shop, but definitely worth the trip. 


If you are around the area, do come here. 


GET SOME BOBA, GUYS ~

excerpts: I ordered the horchata with boba and it was good and my buddy ordered the Thai tea .
We orders such basic drinks
maybe we will come back and try more !
thai.author: Monica M.
thai.review: I must say this place is too hyped for me. I've been dying to come here but they have weird hours and are always too packed . We came here yesterday around 2 pm and the line was almost 20 people deep. I was a little discouraged but I still got in line lol . I ordered the horchata with boba and it was good and my buddy ordered the Thai tea . We orders such basic drinks maybe we will come back and try more !

excerpts: Sometimes I skip a green smoothie and go for a Milk Tea or a Thai Tea with boba  lots of flavors to choose from.
thai.author: Sasha Z.
thai.review: Sometimes I skip a green smoothie and go for a Milk Tea or a Thai Tea with boba  lots of flavors to choose from.

excerpts: I ordered a Thai tea with almond jelly.
I absolutely love the almond jelly which is homemade and it is delicious.
I have tried other drinks and they have never failed me.
This place is a must visit and tots insta worthy pictures which is a added bonus.
thai.author: Aulani S.
thai.review: Yum Yum Yum... If I am ever near Boba Guys I will drag everyone I am with to this place. Even though there is always a line at this location, I do feel it is worth the wait. We arrived to find a line of about 10 people and we were number 11. We waited about 10 mins before this huge group rolled up to meet their friend who was already in line and yup thats right she was right in front of us :( I was annoyed that I had to wait for 8 more people to get a drink before I could order. About 20 mins passed and we were at the front finally ordering my drink. I ordered a Thai tea with almond jelly. I absolutely love the almond jelly which is homemade and it is delicious. I have tried other drinks and they have never failed me. This place is a must visit and tots insta worthy pictures which is a added bonus.

excerpts: Got the Thai ice tea (v basic) but can't ever go wrong with it!
I have a big sweet tooth and I loved this drink.
Didn't taste artificial with instant packets but actual tea and milk and sugar.
Very pleased.
Loveeeeeee Thai tea
thai.author: Helen N.
thai.review: Got the Thai ice tea (v basic) but can't ever go wrong with it! I have a big sweet tooth and I loved this drink. Didn't taste artificial with instant packets but actual tea and milk and sugar. Very pleased. Loveeeeeee Thai tea

excerpts: if you're ever in the city, i would recommend trying out the thai tea and the other two beverages i mentioned.
it's a small spot, it's not a place to hang with groups of people or even with one companion on the side.
it's kind of a place where you get your drink and bounce to venture out the city with a refreshing drink between your hands.
i've always enjoyed my drinks and the timing is never wrong, it will get busy.
a line will build but you get your drinks as soon as possible despite that.
thai.author: Caed Khiara S.
thai.review:
pretty much, if i was given the chance to have the location closer to where i am. i would spend a lot more money at boba guys, it's insane. i haven't tried any of their snacks, i'm basing this more of the drinks i've purchased or know from close friends or my significant other. i went to three of the ( insert the number of locations they have in sf here ) but i'm doing a review on this one based off of my recent trip.

i won't hold this against them because i understand making mistakes happen rarely or when there's new employees under training. been there, no hard feelings. they did get my order wrong but one of the employees were kind enough to make the drink i originally ordered once again. -- they made a green tea latte, the one i ordered was the strawberry green tea latte. they were completely understanding and considerate, truly appreciated the service despite the minor mistake!

i usually purchase the strawberry green tea latte, make sure to take a pic for ig to see and stir afterwards hah. i do like it, i enjoy the sweetness the strawberry gives and the slight bitterness of the green tea. the whole milk that's in between balances both flavors out.

the jasmine milk tea is a close second, it's my go to at any boba shop but boba guys do it right. i enjoy the flavors and how well they compliment one another rather than the jasmine overpowering the milk tea, which seems to be a challenge at other boba shops. plus, it must've been good if my boyfriend downed it during dinner.

if you're ever in the city, i would recommend trying out the thai tea and the other two beverages i mentioned. it's a small spot, it's not a place to hang with groups of people or even with one companion on the side. it's kind of a place where you get your drink and bounce to venture out the city with a refreshing drink between your hands. i've always enjoyed my drinks and the timing is never wrong, it will get busy. a line will build but you get your drinks as soon as possible despite that.

excerpts: I've tried their HK style (condensed milk!!), thai tea (condensed milk!!), classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea... all were delicious!
(I'm passing on the coconut green milk tea.. it was blegh to me..)
I love how you can customize what type of milk you want - regular, almond, soy, and how their toppings are homemade!
(Their boba is not homemade, but they are indeed soft and chewy as advertised!)
thai.author: Kris C.
thai.review:
My yelp rating of Boba Guys varies from a 4 star vs. a 5 star, just how my drinks here vary from good vs. realllllllly good. 

Inconsistency is something that a few others and I have noticed about this place, and that's probably the only reason why my rating shifts from a 4 and 5.

I usually order the Iced Matcha Green Tea Latte with soy milk! The first time I ordered it, it was the best I've had from here... creamy and delicious... still able to taste just the slightest bit of bitterness from the green tea, but the overall sweetness from their homemade syrup. The inconsistency that I mentioned about is the way they whisk their matcha powder. I understand that it may be hard to whisk extrrreeeeemely thorough, but I sometimes end up drinking balls and clumps of matcha powder, which you can imagine is very bitter and unpleasant. It makes the experience of drinking the drink a little dreadful to be honest. (That sounds very dramatic and sad haha.. but there's some truth to it!)   

That really is the only gripe I have about this place! I've tried their HK style (condensed milk!!), thai tea (condensed milk!!), classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea... all were delicious! (I'm passing on the coconut green milk tea.. it was blegh to me..) I love how you can customize what type of milk you want - regular, almond, soy, and how their toppings are homemade! (Their boba is not homemade, but they are indeed soft and chewy as advertised!)

excerpts: My favorites to get here are the Horchata and the Thai Tea!
thai.author: Kyrie S.
thai.review:
I am a true fan of Boba Guys! On a hot Saturday afternoon in Valencia and near Dolores Park, expect the line for this place to be out the door, but for good reason! There is so much hype about this place and the very first time I came here, we waited around 45 minutes, but it was well worth it! 

The place inside is small, with just a window bar and a few seats, making the waiting area inside a bit cramped, yet the people working and the cashiers are always so friendly and help to move the line and wait time as quickly as possible. When it came time to order, the cashier even offered her suggestions on the level of sweetness and different boba combinations to better personalize my drink, which I enjoyed.

My favorites to get here are the Horchata and the Thai Tea! Not cloyingly sweet, and the large size comes with an even affordable price.

Overall, if you're ever on Valencia and are headed to Dolores Park, stop by here and check it out, and hope the line isn't too far out the door because it's seriously that good!

excerpts: Their Thai Tea looks good too!
thai.author: Giovanna R.
thai.review:
BEST Horchata so far!! Love it! I give it 5 stars for the Horchata Boba alone! I also tried their Hong Kong milk tea, but that one was ok. Their Thai Tea looks good too! I'll have to try that next time. 

Their boba texture and taste is also one of the best I've had so far. I don't know what it's life span is, but just like most boba, you don't want to save it more than a few hours or it will get hard. Just in case! 

Definitely a great boba joint! It lives up to the hype for sure! ;-D

excerpts: There were 4 of us, 2 ordered Thai tea with boba, mine was hk style with boba and another one was coffee tea with boba.
The Thai tea, they did call our name, but the hk style and coffee tea orders, they didn't call our name and someone took it!
So their systems a bit flawed still.
thai.author: Eugenia W.
thai.review:
I for sure thought it was going to be super asian like tpumps or quicklys... but it wasn't! There are a lot of cutesy things there like cute mason jars or tote bags with their logos on them.
There were 4 of us, 2 ordered Thai tea with boba, mine was hk style with boba and another one was coffee tea with boba. There were a few people in front of us and one person had a large order. 

They're supposed to call your name when your order was ready. The Thai tea, they did call our name, but the hk style and coffee tea orders, they didn't call our name and someone took it! So their systems a bit flawed still. Hopefully it'll be better

I love you can choose the level of sweetness and whether you want boba or grass jelly. There are different kinds of tea and my coworkers loved the balls. Said it was chewy and soft. 

50% sweetness was just right, not super sweet!

excerpts: I particularly enjoyed the jasmine flavor, taro, and Thai iced tea.
Pleasant and fast service as well
, I wish this was the kind of place I had on campus ( or in Illinois in general ), it would make a lot of students so happy!
thai.author: Emma H.
thai.review: Wow, I didn't know that I was missing such good boba until I came here. Most of the places I've gone to you take a gamble if you get Boba as to whether they'll be chewy and FRESH or hard as rocks and just sit in your stomach. We went to Boba guys twice for days and, between four drinks everything was perfect. I particularly enjoyed the jasmine flavor, taro, and Thai iced tea. Pleasant and fast service as well, I wish this was the kind of place I had on campus ( or in Illinois in general ), it would make a lot of students so happy!

excerpts: Thai,  horchata, rose, green, black, milk, chai, jasmine, and Hong Kong.
Thai tea was classic, tasty, sweet, everything you want.
Classic milk tea was for lack of better words...
Classic, a little low on sweetness.
Hong Kong was allright, tasted like a mix of classic and Thai tea.
Horchata: "it nibbled on my tastebuds"
, it was cinnamony, everything you expect from horchata.
**cant change Thai tea sweetness, premade.
thai.author: Himmat S.
thai.review:
Was hankering for some boba after dinner on Valencia. A friend suggested this place as she had been here before and said it was good. 

Cafe: funny signs and quirky sayings are inviting as soon as you walk in. Like a lot of places in sf it's a pretty small standing area and seating bar area for about 2 or 3 people. 

Menu: much different and simpler than any boba place I've been too. The items on the menu are basic teas: Thai,  horchata, rose, green, black, milk, chai, jasmine, and Hong Kong. 

Toppings: tapioca balls (boba balls), almond jelly, grass jelly.  Tried the grass jelly and almond milk on the side, the almond jelly tasted like the inside of a coconut ( a little earthy, jiggly and like almond lol), the grass jelly was a little better and more tasteless but both I wouldn't put in my drink. 

Taste/order: Ordered everything on the menu. Boba itself was chewy and fresh, save a few old hard ones that got mixed in. Thai tea was classic, tasty, sweet, everything you want. Classic milk tea was for lack of better words... Classic, a little low on sweetness. Hong Kong was allright, tasted like a mix of classic and Thai tea. Horchata: "it nibbled on my tastebuds", it was cinnamony, everything you expect from horchata. Rose: pretty decent actually, surprised me with the sweet little kick it had. 

Service: very friendly. The lady at the cashier was patient and understanding, she probably had dealt with confusion about the menu before. 

Drink sizes: 16oz and 24oz 

*can switch milks around in drinks: almond milk instead of regular, other options, a lot of boba places don't have. 

**cant change Thai tea sweetness, premade. 

3 stars because old boba balls threw me off, drink choice was different but nothing was amazing for me, nothing I couldn't get from a different place for less price, oh yeah and it was a bit pricey for no reason, couldn't change the sweetness of my favorite drink. Imo if you are a more specialized stop like this, make the teas amazing :) 

Check me out on Instagram! @themodelsingh
