thai.author: Donna T.
thai.review:
**BOBA PRINCESS APPROVED**

Good Milk Tea & Boba Quality (Grade A): CHECK
Reasonable Prices (~$4 per drink w/topping):  CHECK
FAST and FRIENDLY Service: CHECK
Great Location: NO, worst ghetto neighborhood ever
Decent Ambiance: Half Check

TIPS:
+ Organic Milk Teas! Ask for less sweet
+ Must try tapioca pearls- they're perfect little balls of divinity 
+ Cash or Card accepted
+ NO Rewards/Stamp Card Available
+ To-go boba shop, no space to sit/enjoy

[[INTRO/LOCATION]]
I had a long day working in SF and just ate a mediocre dinner at Akiko's-- I needed boba dessert! Boba Guys has been on my radar for quite a while, so CARPE DIEM! My biggest woe was that I circled around the one-way 19th and 20th streets for 15+ minutes to find parking. I mean literally every nook and cranny were taken up. I parked on a curb not so legally...and just ran inside to grab my boba fix. The neighborhood isn't pretty either. I went around 7PM but I would not stay here when the sun sets...it looks completely muggy and robby. 

[[AMBIANCE]]
There were about 6-8 people inside the boba shop which made it way too crowded. I was getting claustrophobic. They have a few chairs around with a counter top but it's by no means an enjoyable atmosphere to relax at. The vibe is modern trendy with their minimalistic and hipster decorations. Their menu is limited but only to keep the quality of their products. So don't expect a 100+ items menu like TapEx haha, they only have the basics- classic milk tea, green, Thai, taro, etc.

[[MILK TEAS]]
Their organic teas are authentic. It mirrored Ten Ren's taste and quality which impressed me greatly. I opted for the regular sweetness since I wanted to taste how they originally made it- big mistake. Both the Classic Milk Tea and especially the Thai Tea were wayyy too sweet, and I like Dr. Pepper so my sweet palate is already pretty high bar. 

[[BOBA PEARLS]]
However, their boba pearls were cooked to perfection. You must try it. There is a difference between OVERCOOKED and Perfectly Cooked pearls-- Boba Guys does it right! If the pearls were overcooked, you would taste a soggy, fuzzy texture surrounding the core of the tapioca pearls before you bite into it. There would be a clear difference in textures of the outer vs inner layer of the balls. Perfectly cooked pearls are soft and chewy and with each bite, the texture is always consistent from the outer layer to the inner layer. 

Thumb rule about boba pearls: If your tongue is confused by the texture, it's overcooked. If your tongue is soothed by the consistent soft, chewy texture through each bite, it's perfectly cooked.

excerpts:
Matcha tea 
Strawberry matcha
Thai tea
thai.author: Jennie D.
thai.review:
The hype is real and the line is worth the wait.  I'm usually just a simple regular jasmine milk tea with no toppings or passion/lychee or strawberry mango with real fruit buts kinda gal.  We literally buy milk tea every week sometimes 3 times starting from Friday - Sunday and sometimes it can come out to be as muchh as a car payment per month!    I don't like to try anything new or any other flavors but these below is purdyyyy GOOD!

Matcha tea 
Strawberry matcha
Thai tea

All YUMZ and all natural and organic is such a plus!!!
They even ask you what kind of milk you want - regular, low fat or soy milk too!

Love!

excerpts: The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea.
There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer.
There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly.
I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%.
The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly.
Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom
thai.author: Milton F.
thai.review:
Decided to come to this place on a whim. My fiance and I just finished having brunch in Redwood city and had some time to kill before we headed over to Fort Mason for APE 2014 (Alternative Press Expo). As we passed by we noticed a few people in line, but not too bad. 

Finding parking in the mission is always a challenge, so keep in mind you may have to circle a few times since there aren't too many parking garages around the area. We finally found parking 5 blocks away and made our way over. There's not a big menu selection so it was not too hard to decide what to get. 

They only serve strictly milk tea in various forms, no fruit milk tea, or fruity drinks. The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea. There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer. There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly. You can also adjust the sweetness level to your liking (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%)

I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%. The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly. Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom and you'll get a huge serving of sugar if you don't. 

All and all, it's a nice place to get milk teas, albeit a bit out of the way for me. For Boba it's a bit on the pricier side.. about $4-4.50 depending if you get addons. I'd come back if I was in the area.

excerpts: My boyfriend got the thai iced tea and he literally fished out the boba and split them apart manually and put them back in the cup.
I found it pretty unacceptable especially since we paid $10 just for the delivery (yes, I know it's not boba guy's fault for the expensive delivery cost
but I wanted to show how much of dedicated Boba Guys fan/drinker I was that I'm willing to spend extra just to get it)
and $10 for the 2 drinks.
The tea itself was watery and not sweet at all.
thai.author: Lauren K.
thai.review:
I've loved Boba Guys for the past couple of years and I'm completely obsessed with the Stockton Street location but had to opt for the Mission location since the other one wasn't taking Postmates orders. I Postmates whenever I'm unable to get the boba myself. 

Yesterday night, I ordered my usual drink- Jasmine Milk Tea, 50% sweet with boba but was sadly super disappointed. The boba was chunked together (about 10-15 bobas) and only half of the boba in my cup was sip-able through the straw. My boyfriend got the thai iced tea and he literally fished out the boba and split them apart manually and put them back in the cup. I found it pretty unacceptable especially since we paid $10 just for the delivery (yes, I know it's not boba guy's fault for the expensive delivery cost but I wanted to show how much of dedicated Boba Guys fan/drinker I was that I'm willing to spend extra just to get it) and $10 for the 2 drinks. The tea itself was watery and not sweet at all. It felt like I was straight drinking the half and half milk with some water thrown in and chunky boba at the bottom.

I will never order from this location again and will opt for the more consistent, Stockton location.

excerpts: Hands down - best Thai Tea
I've had.
I had Thai Tea quite often the past few years
(my main go to drink) and I gotta say Boba Guys did an awesome job.
thai.author: Rachel K.
thai.review:
NOTE: I do not reside in SF. 

So..... since this place is in SF and not in ATL. Hands down - best Thai Tea I've had. It tasted fresh and definitely well prepared. 

I was visiting SF and one of my friend's recommended it so why not! I even bought a cute cup from them. Wish they had the mason jars :( Maybe next time.

I had Thai Tea quite often the past few years (my main go to drink) and I gotta say Boba Guys did an awesome job. I am thoroughly impressed. 

Keep it up guys! See ya'll when I come visit again!

excerpts: They serve the typical Hong Kong milk tea, Thai iced tea, etc.
Reminds me of drive thru boba in Bellevue.
The boba was soft, sweet, and chewy aka perfect!
They had a flavor I have NEVER seen before at a bubble tea place, Horchata!
It intrigued me a lot
so I ordered it.
thai.author: Eva C.
thai.review:
I really wanted bubble tea and I figured SF would be an area with some great choices to offer. Come to find out that they aren't like the ones in Seattle. Many are not owned by Asians. This place has a reputation of being called "hippy bubble tea" not sure why. I'm not from the area but from what I understand it's because it's not an Asian bubble tea place. 

I digress... This place is simple. Few options with selective jellies and boba add ins. They serve the typical Hong Kong milk tea, Thai iced tea, etc. Reminds me of drive thru boba in Bellevue. The boba was soft, sweet, and chewy aka perfect! They had a flavor I have NEVER seen before at a bubble tea place, Horchata! It intrigued me a lot so I ordered it. It was delicious!! 

I was talking to the owner a bit and he believes he has the best boba in the world. I felt that was a bold statement. He said he has compared his to many places in popular cities, however in the back of my mind I kept thinking "drive thru boba is very similar and is just as good". He boasted about how they make everything from scratch such as their own syrups. I think that's wonderful and I can't say whether that's not true for any other place but it's good to see that he is so passionate about what he serves. His business is obviously doing very well. 

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a new and unique bubble tea place in SF.

excerpts: My Thai Iced Tea tasted like water and the Earl Grey tasted like eraser.
Would not come back
thai.author: Catherine S.
thai.review: Not sure why this place is so hyped. My Thai Iced Tea tasted like water and the Earl Grey tasted like eraser. Would not come back

excerpts: But they had a lot of other drinks on the menu that made me want to try something different - they offer an horchata boba (that's very original), an iced matcha latte, Hong Kong style boba (black tea with condensed milk), and a Thai tea boba (I love Thai iced tea).
I'd like to try the matcha latte and the Thai tea the next time I visit!
thai.author: Sylvia K.
thai.review:
Am I in a science laboratory or in a boba shop?? It's a mix of the two and I love it! There are all kinds of glass beakers and glass test tubes that hold tea leaves and tools like matcha whisks and such. Such a creative idea on styling the space. There was even like a glass beaker terrarium on the counter. They have a statement on their outside window by the door about how they put a lot if science into their boba making process, which is pretty clever. The only thing that would make this even more awesome is if the employees wore white lab coats and safety glasses while making the boba. But I guess that would be really hot - it was already a warm day in the Mission when I visited and it gets pretty warm inside this little shop, especially with lots of people inside. They also had some fans on, so maybe there's no central AC. So...maybe no lab coats...

They also sell cute mason jars with their logo (I think it's an aardvark? They like boba too!) for $10. Not only is it cute, but it's reusable! If you bring the glass mason jar in, you get 25 cents off your order. So you're helping the environment by reducing waste and saving some money too! Technically, you'll need to visit 40 times to break even, but if you are planning to go everyday, or even like every week for a year, it will pay for itself. Plus you can use it for other beverages at home too. It has a handle. 

Ok, so how about the most important thing - the boba? I ordered the classic milk tea with tapioca balls - it was my visit and I needed to go with something basic. But they had a lot of other drinks on the menu that made me want to try something different - they offer an horchata boba (that's very original), an iced matcha latte, Hong Kong style boba (black tea with condensed milk), and a Thai tea boba (I love Thai iced tea). 

The milk tea was really good - just the perfect sweetness. Very refreshing on such a warm day. Maybe it tasted good because they use local Straus milk, I don't know. The tapioca was just a tad chewier than I prefer. But the liquid part was yummy. I'm not a boba connoisseur but I know what I like when I taste it. Even though it was busy, my order came out in like five minutes from the time that I ordered it. Speedy! 

I'd like to try the matcha latte and the Thai tea the next time I visit!

excerpts: We absolutely loved the Thai tea, and my personal favorite the Strawberry matcha latte with oat milk.
We also like the Horchata.
thai.author: Amber R.
thai.review: Can't say enough good things! The absolute best boba I've had in my life. We absolutely loved the Thai tea, and my personal favorite the Strawberry matcha latte with oat milk. We also like the Horchata.

excerpts: Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style.
They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order.
All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients.
This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet.
Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price
thai.author: Cherylynn N.
thai.review:
Boys and girls rarely agree on anything but I think there is one thing they CAN agree on: good balls ARE essential. Perfectly symmetrical, soft, squishy, and bouncy. Balls like this get me super excited especially when I'm enjoying a mouthful of them. 

BOBA BALLS that is you pervs!

The Boba Guys have perfected the boba balls down to a science and I love that they use top notch, organic ingredients. They even make their own syrup which means they are serious about their balls; I mean their boba drink. 

I adored Boba Guys when they were at their pop-up at Ken Ken Ramen (http://bit.ly/1fiXJcx) and was ecstatic to find out they would have their brick and mortar. Over 3 months later after their grand opening, I finally was able to make my way to Boba Guys' brick and mortar since they extended their hours of operation. And they now accepted CC's. Yay!

Not only do the Boba Guys now have a permanent space with several stools, they have expanded their menu. Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style. They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order. All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients. This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet. *Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price* 

I decided to stick with their basic Classic Milk Tea ($4) which was sadly not as good as I remembered them to be when they were at Ken Ken Ramen. I like that they use very little sweetener but the tea flavor was too subtle and our drink needed MORE ice. After a 30 minute wait for our drink on a hot Saturday afternoon, our drink arrived to us almost room temperature. By the time we walked back to the car, all the ice (the little that there was in the cup) was all melted. *Sad Pouty Lip*

It was a crowded so the wait was somewhat understandable; I mean fobbee teens who have nothing better to do wait for up to 2 hours at Tpumps. 

3 stars for the boba milk tea but an extra star for their deliciously satisfying pandan macarons (3 for $5) and for carrying Sugar & Spun's cotton candy in cookie butter: http://bit.ly/GOf9i9. 

Not going to lie, it's been nearly 2 weeks but I'm still a little bummed about their boba milk tea. Oh well, at least the balls were good. A good pair; I mean set is all you need sometimes right?

excerpts:
My goto drinks are: 

Thai

thai.author: Peter H.

I bought a Thai Iced Milk tea boba and it was good.  If you're in the Mission and want boba then yes this is the place to get it. 

I also noticed they had chocolate black sesame and matcha green tea cotton candy packed in plastic tubs so I picked up some to give to a friend.

excerpts: There are numbers of selection from Thai Tea, black tea, oolong, and even Indian Chai (rare at tapioca tea place).
Milk includes regular milk, almond milk, and soy milk.
Toppings include tapioca, almond jelly, and grass jelly.
thai.author: Charles S.
thai.review:
High quality tea and milk.  There are numbers of selection from Thai Tea, black tea, oolong, and even Indian Chai (rare at tapioca tea place).  Milk includes regular milk, almond milk, and soy milk.  Toppings include tapioca, almond jelly, and grass jelly.  For desserts, there are Hong Kong style French toast and Kaya toast from Malaysia/Singapore.  Also, you can buy tea leaf by pounds.

I drink Chai without sugar the most and taste is authentic.

excerpts: Perhaps not surprisingly, the Hong Kong, Thai Tea, and Horchata drinks still have immense amounts of sugar.
The pearls are also hit or miss--some of them are extremely chewy, whereas others clump together.
thai.author: Kat P.
thai.review:
I still need someone to change my mind about Boba Guys. I'm sorry--I don't want to admit that I'm not a fan of this place, but I've definitely had better.

Service and Space:
Yeah, it's cramped, but I've seen worse. The people who make the drinks are cheery enough, despite dealing with a large crowd that's been waiting for their sugar fix for way too long. However, when it comes down to the time it takes to make the drink itself... that's where Boba Guys loses. My friends and I waited for 10 to 20 minutes for basic brewed tea, even sans toppings.

The people who make your drinks aren't the friendliest, though, when it comes to modifying your drink, so you better hope that they make it the way you like it the first time, or risk getting some begrudging stares. 

Drinks and Food:
Although the drinks are customizable, there is still a limit on how little sugar you can add to the drink. Perhaps not surprisingly, the Hong Kong, Thai Tea, and Horchata drinks still have immense amounts of sugar. The pearls are also hit or miss--some of them are extremely chewy, whereas others clump together. The jellies are a better option for those who want reliable taste and texture.

Interestingly enough, what I like most about Boba Guys' offerings is not actually their drink menu, but rather actually the food. If you get a chance, try their Hokkaido Toast, which is a great complement to any milk tea you order. They don't go overboard with their condensed milk, and is just barely crunchy enough for you to enjoy.

Overall? If you're going here, customize the premium milk teas, as those tend to be more consistent in quality. But at least you can take an IG picture with the large logo, because that seems to be more worth that wait.

excerpts: Thai Tea is also a favorite, Jasmine, and Honey Black Tea.
thai.author: Bernadette F.
thai.review:
Best boba. Hands down. Wins with texture, taste, and how it doesn't toughen up at all in a cold beverage. The organic milk and almond milk are to die for, but I'm personally I just stick to the almond milk. My personal favorite drink is Iced Matcha with almond milk and no sweetener. I just love how earthy their match is. Thai Tea is also a favorite, Jasmine, and Honey Black Tea. 

Also if you're brave enough, try the charcoal pineapple cake! It's dry at first, but the jam in the middle makes it all worth it.

excerpts: I ordered the horchata with boba and my cousin ordered the Thai tea.
The Thai tea was good but the horchata was eh.
To me, it was very wetted down.
thai.author: Charlene P.
thai.review:
This place was okay. Decor was cute and the store had kinda a chic feel. I ordered the horchata with boba and my cousin ordered the Thai tea. The Thai tea was good but the horchata was eh. To me, it was very wetted down. The boba was eh too. 

The workers are very nice. A lady stole my cousins drink and so we ended up waiting for a while but when we told the workers what had happened, they quickly made a new one! So thank you for that!

excerpts: I ordered a Thai tea with pearls and almond jelly (homemade) and my bf ordered The iced matcha green tea latte with pearls and 75% sweetness.
The drink looked really refreshing and appetizing.
The Thai tea tastes like any regular Thai tea (nothing too special).
The green tea was average.
thai.author: Chhorvon S.
thai.review:
We came here for dinner for house of prime rib and had some time to kill. We decided to grab a drink here. Arrived to see a line outside the door. The front counter was directly at the entrance so the line didn't take too long. 

I ordered a Thai tea with pearls and almond jelly (homemade) and my bf ordered The iced matcha green tea latte with pearls and 75% sweetness. The drink looked really refreshing and appetizing. However, looks are not always what they seem. 

The pearls were hard. The almond jelly was a bit harder than I imagined and tasted artificial. I expected more of a consistency like the egg pudding toppings for the jelly. The Thai tea tastes like any regular Thai tea (nothing too special). The green tea was average. Though I did like that it did not taste chalky like other places. 

Personally, I would prefer other places in SJ like Fantasia because of the pearls/boba. This place is hip and I can see why a lot of people like it. It was just average for me.

excerpts:
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
thai.author: Kitty K.
thai.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: I've also gotten their horchata & Thai tea and they are both flavor filled and delicious!
thai.author: Bel W.
thai.review: This is my ultimate favorite boba place. Their boba is bomb and their ingredients are real and fresh. My go to is usually the Hong Kong style milk tea, but today I decided to get a match green tea latte. BOMB. I've also gotten their horchata & Thai tea and they are both flavor filled and delicious!

excerpts: This is a true challenge for a beverage connoisseur - one may pass by and miss this place, because it is so counter intuitive, its modern design, and glossy feel, reminds you nothing of boba, yet these people are crazy about boba, also cotton candy flavors such as thai tea and black sesame, waffles, and Hong Kong fat toast with melts and soaked in cream.
thai.author: Dilys S.
thai.review:
A modern lab of supreme boba and everything that is taiwanese, traditional, new and crazy about it

Traditional Taiwanese boba dipped in the traditional brown sugar syrup (customizable to honey syrup), bathed in the hot/cold bath of classical milk tea, Hong Kong style condensed milk tea, or any of the creative blends of green tea, rose, ... real tea leaves with milk... not just any milk Strauss, from a local family ranch.

I happened to run into the boba guys, specifically Andrew, who couldn't help but just educate me a bit on boba. I haven't been to Taiwan, but have drunk my fair share from Tea Era, Verde, to the Cha for Tea on UC Irvine campus, but his lecture was a new bell ring for me, so many variations, so much possibility.

They are starting their Kickstarter campaign this week, you can become a sponsor of their new lab, get a black card, or let's say 365 days supply of boba... wow, boba tea on kickstarter? yes the point is these guys are crazy, they are taking boba to a whole other level. 

This is a true challenge for a beverage connoisseur - one may pass by and miss this place, because it is so counter intuitive, its modern design, and glossy feel, reminds you nothing of boba, yet these people are crazy about boba, also cotton candy flavors such as thai tea and black sesame, waffles, and Hong Kong fat toast with melts and soaked in cream. 

It is NOT easy to find your perfect drink here, because everything is customizable, creating a challenge for you to step out of your comfort zone.  Choices can be overwhelming, but having choices is such a blessing. I will slowly try it all. Go try it, too

excerpts: and I order the Thai iced tea with boba.
It was way too sweet and it was weird because the condensed milk was not infused into the tea, but rather it was on the side of the cup.
The pearls were good, but the tea was still way too sweet.
The price was a little higher than other boba places as well.
thai.author: Lydia H.
thai.review: I went to Boba Guys for the 5th time today and I order the Thai iced tea with boba. It was way too sweet and it was weird because the condensed milk was not infused into the tea, but rather it was on the side of the cup. The pearls were good, but the tea was still way too sweet. The price was a little higher than other boba places as well.

excerpts: We got 3 drinks - thai tea, rose tea with almond jelly, and honey tea with boba.
The thai tea was the most unlucky and more than what hsould have spilled but that's separate from Boba Guys.
I got the rose tea unsweetend with almond jelly for pretty much $5.
The quantity is about the size of a grande from starbucks which is pretty pricey
I think.
The drink itself though was good but a little sweeter than what I thought it would be even without sugar.
The almond jelly was pretty good though - not sweet at all which is greatly appreciated.
thai.author: Tao Tao W.
thai.review:
was feeling some tea and also wanted some jelly this afternoon so Boba Guys was the closest. I usually always go to sharetea but my signature drink would not ever make it over here for ice blended. We did postmates Boba Guys which btw arrived wrapped in plastic wrap to prevent spillage - nice job on the packaging. We got 3 drinks - thai tea, rose tea with almond jelly, and honey tea with boba. The thai tea was the most unlucky and more than what hsould have spilled but that's separate from Boba Guys.

I got the rose tea unsweetend with almond jelly for pretty much $5. The quantity is about the size of a grande from starbucks which is pretty pricey I think. The drink itself though was good but a little sweeter than what I thought it would be even without sugar. The almond jelly was pretty good though - not sweet at all which is greatly appreciated.  I did get enough almond jelly to be able to save some for tomororw to drink with regular tea. 

overall, I found my drink at least that I can appreciate for the next time but still its PRICEY. I finished it in like 5 minutes...

excerpts: like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!)
thai.author: Jennifer L.
thai.review:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!

excerpts: The Thai Boba Tea was delicious, comparable to some of the more authentic boba places I've had.
The shop itself is cute, but cramped.
thai.author: Ritika T.
thai.review:
Solid boba place. Line is always out the door, but it's mainly because the place is tiny (just as all other SF places!). Don't let the lines ever fool you into thinking the place must be good. People really don't mind waiting in lines here in SF. I'm new to the area and I'm really looking for budget-friendly places with high-quality service and food. 

Boba Guys is one of them. 

I loved the service. It was fast and efficient. The Thai Boba Tea was delicious, comparable to some of the more authentic boba places I've had. The shop itself is cute, but cramped. Bright and colorful. 

Boba was fresh...I'd come back again.

excerpts: This was my very first time at Boba Guys and as always I order a Thai Tea
The tea was super good perfect sweetness and the boba was sweetened how I like it.
I will most definitely be back here at boba guys, to try some new flavors.
thai.author: A'Niya M.
thai.review: This was my very first time at Boba Guys and as always I order a Thai Tea.. The tea was super good perfect sweetness and the boba was sweetened how I like it. I will most definitely be back here at boba guys, to try some new flavors.

excerpts: I was hoping for one of their more exotic flavors like thai tea or sesame, but they only had lemon cookie.
The cashier was kind enough to give us a sample to make sure we like it before we buy it.
It was delicious!
thai.author: Linz C.
thai.review:
I thought this place was just "OK."  If i was craving boba and in the area i would definitely come back, but i wouldn't go out of my way and go all the way down to the mission for a milk tea. 

Their drinks range between $4-5.50 which is pretty steep compared to the $1.00 teaway.  I got the jasmine milk tea which was REALLY REALLY SWEET!!! Drinkable, but SWEET! My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea and he seemed to be happy with it.  I usually don't get tapioca in my drinks but I thought I'd try theirs it since it was my first time here.  At first I thought they were a bit hard but after a while it began to grow on me. 

What I really came here for though was the sugar spun cotton candy!! I was hoping for one of their more exotic flavors like thai tea or sesame, but they only had lemon cookie.  The cashier was kind enough to give us a sample to make sure we like it before we buy it.  It was delicious! I would definitely come back for the cotton candy and to get my hands on a rose milk tea (i would have gotten that but i didn't see it until after i ordered my drink).

excerpts: We ordered a Thai iced tea and a matcha iced tea.
One of the things that was confusing and hence the low rating is that Boba Guys charges extra for Boba!
I have never experienced a Tapioca bubble tea place that upcharges for the Tapioca pearls.
The tea itself was good and we ordered at 50% sweetness which was perfect.
So five stars for taste subtract 3 stars for charging extra for what seems like the salient aspect of the tea which is the tapioca pearls.
I can see charging extra for other additions but without the tapioca pearls, it really isn't bubble tea.
I'm glad I'm not that into drinking sweet high-calorie drinks regularly
and I won't be a regular customer knowing this.
thai.author: claire k.
thai.review: Boba Guys have been a fixture in the neighborhood ever since they took over the Japanese snack shop that was there before. I love Tapioca pearls and the milky teas I've had in the Avenues at other HK style tea shops. I hadn't visited Boba Guys before but it sounded delicious today and there was no line so my girlfriend and I went in to get a tea. We ordered a Thai iced tea and a matcha iced tea. One of the things that was confusing and hence the low rating is that Boba Guys charges extra for Boba! I have never experienced a Tapioca bubble tea place that upcharges for the Tapioca pearls. The tea itself was good and we ordered at 50% sweetness which was perfect. So five stars for taste subtract 3 stars for charging extra for what seems like the salient aspect of the tea which is the tapioca pearls. I can see charging extra for other additions but without the tapioca pearls, it really isn't bubble tea. I'm glad I'm not that into drinking sweet high-calorie drinks regularly and I won't be a regular customer knowing this.

excerpts: I got the Thai tea for $3 and it was WAYYYYYY to sweet...
Whoa.
I didn't do this
but I would definitely adjust the sweet level.
My friend tried the Horchata and he said, "It taste like normal Horchata with boba balls in it
thai.author: Sabrina L.
thai.review:
This is probably my least favorite boba place! I am not saying it's bad, but the level of variety in drinks and flavor isn't as good as other ones you can find in the city. 

I got the Thai tea for $3 and it was WAYYYYYY to sweet... Whoa. I didn't do this but I would definitely adjust the sweet level. My friend tried the Horchata and he said, "It taste like normal Horchata with boba balls in it but I can get this so much cheaper at a Mexican restaurant" All of the drinks here are around $3.

Everything here is pre-made, that's why you will get your drink so quickly. 
All and all, this wouldn't be my first choice..

excerpts:
Things you get to choose
Drink style: hong kong, thai tea, horchata... hot or cold?
thai.author: Nicole C.
thai.review:
My new obsession. I was unfalteringly loyal to Lollicup and Quickly for so many years, but I've finally found a place that offers variety without charging extra. 

Things you get to choose
Drink style: hong kong, thai tea, horchata... hot or cold?
Type of tea: lychee green, jasmine green, oolong, black...
Milk: half and half (organic- classic SF), almond, soy
Additions: boba or jelly
Sweetness: 0, 25, 50, 75, or 100% (100% is the same level you'd find other places)

The milk options without extra charge are what really got me- I'm lactose intolerant but I love boba. This place is a dream.

Their logo is also fantastic. I will be back.

excerpts: Thai tea n horchata , but
thai.author: Camille A.
thai.review:
Like many places in San Francisco Boba guys can be spotted with A long line outside it's doors. When you order they ask for a sweetness level,boba (or jelly) and what type of milk; soy, almond, organic. The 100% sweetness was very sweet. I would have probably gone for50%. They do have a carafe of simple syrup and water on a side table to adjust sweetness. I got the jasmine green tea with Boba which was pretty good except for how sweet it was. My sister got the coffee boba tea which didn't really taste like coffee... Just like regular milk tea. They also offer bubble tea smoothies, and cotton candy which I didn't try but looked to have interesting flavors. 

This is a good place if you have a bubble tea craving. But I was surprised at the small variety of flavors. They did have mango and strawberry, Thai tea n horchata , but I was really surprised that they didn't have flavors like tarowhich I find commonly at most bubble tea places.

This place also included some bar seats but was really more of a take out bubble tea place.

excerpts: The Thai and Jasmine milk tea is good though, and the boba is well cooked- not too hard and not too soft.
thai.author: Karissa K.
thai.review: Horchata is a bit too overpowering and the sugar and cinnamon + milk ratio isn't even. The Thai and Jasmine milk tea is good though, and the boba is well cooked- not too hard and not too soft.

excerpts: On my recent visit I ordered their Thai iced tea and coconut green tea with organic almond milk at 50% sweetness with boba and almond jelly.
The Thai tea was for the hubby, which he loved.
I really enjoyed my boba tea and the homemade almond jelly was delicious.
thai.author: Rosella S.
thai.review: I like the simplicity of their menu with the added appeal of quality ingredients like Strauss milk and Three Trees organic almond milk that some other boba places don't offer. I also like the fact that they offer decaf tea, which my kid enjoys a lot. On my recent visit I ordered their Thai iced tea and coconut green tea with organic almond milk at 50% sweetness with boba and almond jelly. The Thai tea was for the hubby, which he loved. I really enjoyed my boba tea and the homemade almond jelly was delicious.

excerpts: The horchata milk tea and Thai milk tea were not that tasty, in my opinion.
The horchata milk tea seemed not as creamy as I expect a milk tea to be, but I like that it wasn't that sweet.
You can customize your sweetness level on most drinks.
I did not find the boba pearls here to be all that consistent, sometimes too hard.
They also have a slow bar menu where the tea or coffee is brewed by cup, but like it says, it's slower, and also more pricey.
Since it sells itself as a hip, trendy boba place, expect to pay more for boba here overall.
thai.author: Jennifer W.
thai.review: I thoroughly enjoyed the classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and Hong Kong styled milk tea. I would suggest staying with these classic flavors. The horchata milk tea and Thai milk tea were not that tasty, in my opinion. The horchata milk tea seemed not as creamy as I expect a milk tea to be, but I like that it wasn't that sweet. You can customize your sweetness level on most drinks. I did not find the boba pearls here to be all that consistent, sometimes too hard. They also have a slow bar menu where the tea or coffee is brewed by cup, but like it says, it's slower, and also more pricey. Since it sells itself as a hip, trendy boba place, expect to pay more for boba here overall.

excerpts: I've tried the thai iced tea, horchata, hong kong style and matcha green tea as well and they are all just as delicious.
thai.author: Lisa H.
thai.review:
Their jasmine milk tea is honestly the best I've ever had. It's rich in flavor and is always fresh. I've tried the thai iced tea, horchata, hong kong style and matcha green tea as well and they are all just as delicious. The boba is really sweet and has a chewy consistency to it. 

They atmosphere of the place is really great. It's kind of like a hipster tapioca place. The wait to order is never long. I have never waited for more than 5 minutes to order and I usually get my drinks in about 2 or 3 minutes. There is a small seating area too. 

4 stars because of the price for the drink. I understand that the tea is really good quality but 4 dollars seems a little steep. Also, there's only one size for all the drinks. Sometimes I just need a large drink after a rough day. And sometimes the thirst is just real.

excerpts: Picked up a thai tea with almond jelly, tastes good!!
thai.author: Kaycee-zhanel C.
thai.review: Boba guys never fails, the wait was fine. Picked up a thai tea with almond jelly, tastes good!!

excerpts: I got Thai tea.
To me I can't really tell the difference between drinks unless it's super water downed or extremely bitter.
But overall the Thai tea I ordered from here was good!
thai.author: Monica N.
thai.review: Kind of pricey for a drink but it was good! I got Thai tea. To me I can't really tell the difference between drinks unless it's super water downed or extremely bitter. But overall the Thai tea I ordered from here was good!

excerpts: I favor their Thai iced tea.
SO.
thai.author: Grace K.
thai.review:
Solid. 

I don't know anywhere else in the city where I can get as high quality boba as this place. For those that ranked Boba Guys low- where do you go?? 

The key is the quality of the tea. The jasmine is so fragrant and lightly sweet. My friends who had never had boba are hooked on that one. 

I favor their Thai iced tea. SO. GOOD. 

And they let u mix different types of boba and jelly!! Awesome.

excerpts: Boba Guys have several of the classics like black milk tea and jasmine milk tea, but have also added horchata, matcha, Thai, and HK style to the mix.
Several of the toppings that were originally experimental have made the move to the regular menu as well.
thai.author: Andrew Y.
thai.review:
There are plenty of boba places throughout the city, but Boba Guys is the shop I frequent the most.

They have tripled their menu items since expanding out of their Ken Ken Ramen location, and every new addition is new and exciting.  Boba Guys have several of the classics like black milk tea and jasmine milk tea, but have also added horchata, matcha, Thai, and HK style to the mix.  Several of the toppings that were originally experimental have made the move to the regular menu as well.  If you're a bit tired from drinking boba, try switching in to their almond jelly!

Boba Guys are also offering macarons and cupcakes here too.  They have unique flavors like sesame and mango.

My favorite part of the new shop would have to be the slow bar, where the baristas brew your tea to order.  They have spent hours honing the perfect time and temperature for each type of tea in order to make some of the tastiest and unique tea blends I've had.  The slow bar menu changes here and there, but teas to try include lychee green and golden honey black.

My go-to: Muscat oolong with almond jelly, and a pandan macaron.

The shop is pretty small though, so if you want a place to sit down, try their Ken Ken Ramen location on 18th and Mission instead.  They also serve alcoholic boba there too.

excerpts: The Thai Tea Boba and the Horchata Milk Tea was so below average.
I was expecting at least taste like Thai Tea from an average Thai restaurant or taste like Horchata from a taqueria, but no, watered down
and the taste was bland.
I didn't even lower the sugar level for the horchata milk tea.
The Thai tea cannot be adjusted.
I was disappointed.
With the lines and the rave reviews of these two drinks by other Yelpers, I am not convinced Boba Guys are up to par.
One positive is the texture of the boba was good for the first couple of sips, then it goes down hill.
Won't recommend this place to any of my friends.
thai.author: Earvin T.
thai.review: Sorry Boba Guys was not good. I didn't even have high expectations. The Thai Tea Boba and the Horchata Milk Tea was so below average. I was expecting at least taste like Thai Tea from an average Thai restaurant or taste like Horchata from a taqueria, but no, watered down and the taste was bland. I didn't even lower the sugar level for the horchata milk tea. The Thai tea cannot be adjusted. I was disappointed. With the lines and the rave reviews of these two drinks by other Yelpers, I am not convinced Boba Guys are up to par. One positive is the texture of the boba was good for the first couple of sips, then it goes down hill. Won't recommend this place to any of my friends.

excerpts: I usually order their jasmine milk tea, which in my opinion is the best jasmine milk tea EVER or their thai tea which is good too!
Their boba is good too, it has the right texture and sweetness.
Its kinda pricey, but the quality of the drink is very good so its worth it.
thai.author: Alyssa C.
thai.review: I love this place! I usually order their jasmine milk tea, which in my opinion is the best jasmine milk tea EVER or their thai tea which is good too! Their boba is good too, it has the right texture and sweetness. Its kinda pricey, but the quality of the drink is very good so its worth it.

excerpts: For their first day, I was surprised that they ran out of Thai Iced Tea so quickly.
We walked in less than two hours after they opened!
I had the Classic Milk Tea and for some odd reason, my order took longer than usual.
My friends all got their orders, but mine never came up.
thai.author: Peter L.
thai.review:
Damn it, I wanted to be the first to review this place. I'll consider this to be the first in-depth review!

This place was first brought to my attention by home girl Linh P. a while back. Everybody that knows me knows that boba runs through my veins, and when I heard about this new location opening up, I had to get the inside scoop. Me and some friends came to the grand opening and there they were - lookin' fine as ever, rockin' those white lab coats, mixin' our drinks - the boba guys. They had their lab assistants on the side too. There was a strong distinct sweet smell that took a minute to get used to upon walking in. The space isn't all that big, but there's four seats by the windows to sit and chill with some homies. Compared to their previous location, they have a new selection of drinks lined up along with their slow bar and also various cupcakes and macarons! There's no additional charge for drink toppings!

For their first day, I was surprised that they ran out of Thai Iced Tea so quickly. We walked in less than two hours after they opened! I had the Classic Milk Tea and for some odd reason, my order took longer than usual. My friends all got their orders, but mine never came up. I eventually had to ask about my drink, which then came out after a couple of other orders placed after mine, but I cut them some slack and let it slide because they just launched.

I'm sippin' my drank and hey, it was one hell of a concoction! Hands down, the milk tea was honestly by far the best I've had yet. Perfect balance, ice cold, and made with the finest organic ingredients - just the way it should be! The grass jelly was pretty good too, but I've definitely had better. However, I caught what I think was a tea leaf in my mouth at one point which wasn't too big of an issue to me, but still questionable.

For day one and counting, they did a decent job. The whole lab experiment chemistry set-up with the coats and beakers was cute and all. I wish I had my drink in one of those cool jars rather than their to-go cups. It just seems cooler that way! I wanted to take a picture with the dynamic duo, but they were mad scientists at work and didn't seem willing for a photo-op. $4 is definitely the most I've ever paid for boba, but it'll be worth it to treat yourself to a concocted boba love potion every now and then!

excerpts: (If you like Thai ice tea you will like it, I think)
thai.author: Nichole S.
thai.review:
Let me preface with I am a recently indoctrinated huge fan of boba. I cut my teeth on Boba Time in Los Angeles. I'm spoiled.

It's really not hard to do a good Boba drink. While the product they offer is of good quality, it definitely was not of my liking. I got the Moche latte. 

Why 2 stars?
The utter lack of choices. 
The excessively sweet drink. (If you like Thai ice tea you will like it, I think)
The matte tasted a bit too strong. 

 I'm not saying be Boba Time at all. I would like some non-tea based choices. Maybe a little fruity selection. And definitely try the smoothie approach with lots if blendered  ice. Heck just a simple mocha and boba is the bomb in combination.

Moral of the story: nice people, decent service, but lacking in product. Sorry I'm just being honest based on my personal experience. I cannot speak for others.

excerpts: The Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea were wonderful - refreshing and smooth.
The staff were also really sweet and our drinks arrived quickly.
Definitely hit the mark!
Was happy to stumble upon their store front on this hot day.
Will be back if I'm in the neighborhood
thai.author: Laura C.
thai.review: The Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea were wonderful - refreshing and smooth. The staff were also really sweet and our drinks arrived quickly. Definitely hit the mark! Was happy to stumble upon their store front on this hot day. Will be back if I'm in the neighborhood

excerpts: I had Thai Tea
, it was little bland, less sweet but still tasty.
thai.author: Spinof P.
thai.review:
This boba place is so clean and stylish unlike usual boba place.
I had Thai Tea, it was little bland, less sweet but still tasty. 
I like the guys in the counter who helped me to choose and explained well. 

My friend tried Hochata. Yes! Here is in Mission! I will try it next time:)

excerpts: We had the Thai tea and jasmine milk tea.
Can't really compete with a Thai restaurants milk tea that you actually stir yourself and is actually good.
Don't get me wrong, they weren't bad but they were great.
$4 a tapioca is way too much for me as well.
Go to Irving and wonderful foods has freshly made tapioca drinks for $2.75 plus a large for +$1.
Still under the price of milk tea at boba guys.
thai.author: Tim M.
thai.review:
Came to this place after Nombe (see review if you want), and decided to get some milk tea after seeing numerous friends post about it. It was a small little hipster place and very clean looking. The place was freaking hot inside but guess cause it was 70 outside, but I wouldn't be able to sit in there,especially since there's like three seats. 

Anyways, the tapioca was good and the drinks tasted like any other tapioca place. We had the Thai tea and jasmine milk tea. Can't really compete with a Thai restaurants milk tea that you actually stir yourself and is actually good. Don't get me wrong, they weren't bad but they were great. $4 a tapioca is way too much for me as well. Go to Irving and wonderful foods has freshly made tapioca drinks for $2.75 plus a large for +$1. Still under the price of milk tea at boba guys. I know they have overhead to pay but the location isn't exactly the best location for a tapioca place. 

I'm not a boba/tapioca expert but this place is overrated. If you're in the area and want tapioca then go for it but don't drive around looking for parking and going out of your way just to go here. Plus.. Everyone got Boba guys cups with their logo on it and we got a plain cup. Not complaining but thought that was weird.

excerpts: We got Thai tea and iced matcha latte bbts.
This place seems overhyped.
Missed out on seasonal or special items, which aren't posted on the main menu, but at the cashier, so we only realized after we paid.
Wouldn't necessarily go again next time I'm in SF.
thai.author: Michelle C.
thai.review: No line when we went. We got Thai tea and iced matcha latte bbts. This place seems overhyped. Missed out on seasonal or special items, which aren't posted on the main menu, but at the cashier, so we only realized after we paid. Wouldn't necessarily go again next time I'm in SF.

excerpts: Thai Tea: Dee-lish
thai.author: Kathy Y.
thai.review:
I LOVE BOBA GUYS.

Let's get it straight, it's not your typical boba joint and it does cost a bit more, but it's SO WORTH IT. I am not someone who has to get their daily/weekly boba fix (seriously, I get almond milk instead of real milk), but I come here every time I visit SF. The employees are super nice and they are all about organics, so what's not to love??

*Iced Matcha Latte: My fave
*Thai Tea: Dee-lish
*Earl Grey: Soooooo good
*Muscat Oolong: Yuuumm

excerpts: I've also tried their thai iced tea, as well as their hong kong style, which were both a bit too sweet (although I could have asked them to tone it down).
I would suggest sticking with their boba, which has a great consistency, and is quite sweet, mostly because I'm not the biggest fan of jellies.
Also, try substituting in almond milk for the regular milk!
It adds nice body and flavor :)
thai.author: Courtney N.
thai.review:
Such a wonderful boba shop! My friends and I joke that it's the most artisan our boba gets, and it's not that much more expensive than the boba shops closer to home.

What I particularly love about this shop is that it doesn't have too many options. Most boba places have a gazillion options, and for indecisive people like me, I spend forever deciding what I want. Having fewer options makes me trust that their options were all carefully crafted/tested and are of high quality, which has been true so far! 

They even brew your tea right when you order, so it's fresh! The teas have a beautiful flavor, particularly the muscat oolong (you can really taste the muscat). I also appreciate that they have so many different options for milk (including almond and soy milk), and that they use healthy, organic products :)

My favorite so far has been the horchata with boba, which always has a delicious amount of spice and flavor. I've also tried their thai iced tea, as well as their hong kong style, which were both a bit too sweet (although I could have asked them to tone it down). I would suggest sticking with their boba, which has a great consistency, and is quite sweet, mostly because I'm not the biggest fan of jellies. Also, try substituting in almond milk for the regular milk! It adds nice body and flavor :)

excerpts: Ordered 2 Thai milk tea with pearls for the boyfriend and I. Came out to a total of like 9 bucks I think (a bit pricey for milk tea tbh).
The Thai tea came out pretty quick and I was eager to try what my friend has been raving about.
The Thai tea here is probably one of the worst boba drinks I've ever gotten.
The Thai tea tasted more like watered down milk with a tiny (veryyyyy tiny) hint of tea in it.
Blah, not sure if the Thai tea was no good that day or
if that's how it's suppose to taste.
Maybe their other drinks are better?
thai.author: Anna H.
thai.review:
My friend kept pushing me to come here and on my birthday. So I did. 

The store location is somewhat a hole in the wall, at least it felt that way because they didn't have a sign out front. 

Ordered 2 Thai milk tea with pearls for the boyfriend and I. Came out to a total of like 9 bucks I think (a bit pricey for milk tea tbh). The Thai tea came out pretty quick and I was eager to try what my friend has been raving about. The Thai tea here is probably one of the worst boba drinks I've ever gotten. The Thai tea tasted more like watered down milk with a tiny (veryyyyy tiny) hint of tea in it. FO REALLY? 

Blah, not sure if the Thai tea was no good that day or if that's how it's suppose to taste. Maybe their other drinks are better? Who knows. 

I'll pass on this boba joint next time I'm in sf. 

Ps: very awkward and quiet ambience here.

excerpts: Everything is good here, my favs: Horchata, Classic HK Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Thai Ice Tea.
If you haven't tried boba before or had a somewhat "bad boba tea experience" like alot of my Caucasian friends, try Boba Guys, it will blow your mind.
thai.author: Ennie L.
thai.review: Yay boba for hispters! Made with organic Strauss milk, high quality ingredients in my Boba Tea. Yes please. Everything is good here, my favs: Horchata, Classic HK Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Thai Ice Tea. If you haven't tried boba before or had a somewhat "bad boba tea experience" like alot of my Caucasian friends, try Boba Guys, it will blow your mind.

excerpts: Go for the Thai iced tea with boba, you won't be disappointed!
Also love the interior aesthetic of the shop.
Adorable!
thai.author: Eliza D.
thai.review: Best $4 I've spent in recent memory. Go for the Thai iced tea with boba, you won't be disappointed! Also love the interior aesthetic of the shop. Adorable!

excerpts: I love their thai boba tea, it's the perfect combination of sweet and decadent.
I've never tried their treats because I don't want to be 200 lbs
but they look so good!
Maybe tomorrow!
thai.author: Maeling D.
thai.review: I come here way too much! I love their thai boba tea, it's the perfect combination of sweet and decadent. I've never tried their treats because I don't want to be 200 lbs but they look so good! Maybe tomorrow!

excerpts: Their Thai tea and horchata with boba are unique flavors made their own way with Strauss milk
so it tastes richer.
Their boba itself is perfectly chewy!
Their shop is also really cute and their staff are extremely friendly.
thai.author: Emma G.
thai.review: Best boba I've ever had. Their Thai tea and horchata with boba are unique flavors made their own way with Strauss milk so it tastes richer. Their boba itself is perfectly chewy! Their shop is also really cute and their staff are extremely friendly.

excerpts: I got the Thai tea with grass jelly,  the jelly was hard and didn't taste like grass jelly.
Thai tea didn't have the flavor I was expecting either.
$4 for one size.
thai.author: Trynh K.
thai.review: This place was okay, not the best tea I've ever had.  And I love tea.  I got the Thai tea with grass jelly,  the jelly was hard and didn't taste like grass jelly.  Thai tea didn't have the flavor I was expecting either.  $4 for one size.

excerpts: Their thai tea is my favourite and I would definitely recommend trying it out.
thai.author: Manisha D.
thai.review: If you are finicky about a good bubble tea, like me, then you'd want to head straight to Bobba Guys! I love bubble tea, and I have tried it at a lot of different places, but nothing comes close to Bobba Guys. Their thai tea is my favourite and I would definitely recommend trying it out.

excerpts: So I settled for Thai Tea with the grass jelly.
While waiting to order, I couldn't help but notice all the food was sold out and how people actually sat there and worked.
Like a coffee shop, except for milk tea.
On to the actual product - the Thai Tea was very sweet and it did taste good.
As for the grass jelly, it screams out homemade.
thai.author: Elaine S.
thai.review:
I wanted to visit here bc of all the hype. So much hype my friend from NYC asked if I've ever had Boba Guys. I guess that's saying something about how popular it is. 

My recent visit to the Mission just had to involve Boba Guys. They are famous for the HK Style Milk Tea, but I really couldn't hand over $4 for HK Style Milk Tea. I'm too used to less than $1 HK Milk Teas in Hong Kong. So I settled for Thai Tea with the grass jelly. While waiting to order, I couldn't help but notice all the food was sold out and how people actually sat there and worked. Like a coffee shop, except for milk tea. That was pretty cool.

On to the actual product - the Thai Tea was very sweet and it did taste good. As for the grass jelly, it screams out homemade. It was a bit hard and had the bumpy edges that come along with the dried tops of home made jelly.

All in all.. Boba Guys was not as amazing as I hoped. And really expensive for what I got.

excerpts: Every flavor I've tried is amazing: matcha, horchata, Thai tea, lavender, matcha mango.
All SO GOOD.
thai.author: A H.
thai.review: Literally amazing - best bubble tea I've ever had. Every flavor I've tried is amazing: matcha, horchata, Thai tea, lavender, matcha mango. All SO GOOD.

excerpts: I could have gotten horchata at a mexican place or thai iced tea at a thai place for half the price.
I will never come back here.
If I pay $5 for boba, I want boba!!
thai.author: Brian G.
thai.review: Being a regular of Purple Kow, Tuttimelon, Infinity Tea, Tuttimelon, and Quickly, I can appreciate a wide variety of tapioca places. This place is by far my least favorite; they only have 8 flavors, all milk teas, and they ran out of boba mid-afternoon and skimped our cups. I see a photo below of a boba cup from there with only 1 layer of tapoica balls in it, I'd say that's about how hi both my my tea's were. And for $5 each i felt ripped off. I could have gotten horchata at a mexican place or thai iced tea at a thai place for half the price. I will never come back here. If I pay $5 for boba, I want boba!!

excerpts: delicious boba - just the right texture and the thai tea is to die for.
thai.author: Sarah W.
thai.review: delicious boba - just the right texture and the thai tea is to die for.

excerpts: I tried their milk tea with boba and my boyfriend had the Thai tea with boba.
We weren't to amazed by their tea.
The wait wasn't long at all here either, so that was a plus.
Overall, I probably wouldn't come back here for boba.
thai.author: Cat L.
thai.review: I came here once with my boyfriend because he was telling me how much hype this place was getting. I came and was disappointed. There's nothing too special about this boba place that stands out amongst the rest of the thousand other boba places in the Bay Area. They have limited options for boba. I tried their milk tea with boba and my boyfriend had the Thai tea with boba. We weren't to amazed by their tea. The wait wasn't long at all here either, so that was a plus. Overall, I probably wouldn't come back here for boba.

excerpts: On this visit I also picked up Cotton Candy they were selling by Sugar and Spun
and oh my goodness - divine.
I don't even like cotton candy.
cotton candy.author: Mary P.
cotton candy.review:
I love their bubble tea. This has to be the best bubble tea I've had beyond making my own at home from super high end ingredients. 

I did their Muscat Oolong and it was heavenly! I normally do the tapioca balls, but the gentleman serving us recommended the grass jelly and it was well worth it! I love that they use high end ingredients like Straus Organic milk and Califia Farms Almond Milk. 

You can adjust the sweetness and I went with 50% and it was just right, just a hint of sweet without being overwhelming. 

On this visit I also picked up Cotton Candy they were selling by Sugar and Spun and oh my goodness - divine. I don't even like cotton candy.

excerpts: Strawberry shortcake cotton candy: So good (like magic evaporating in your ) because it has that fresh strawberry flavor that reminded me of Japanese strawberry candy.
I especially liked the little crumbles of cheesecake that melt in your mouth at the same rate of the cotton!!
cotton candy.author: Candice C.
cotton candy.review:
Im a boba purist, I generally stick with classic flavors. What I love about Boba Guys is that they managed to surprise me with delightful new flavor combos and other tasty treats, while also keeping the tapioca on point!

the Boba: the texture of the boba is consistently very good, just the right amount of firmness and chewiness, not gummy or over-gelatinized like a bad take out restaurant that has boba sitting around for hours.

Flavors: Enjoyed hot bergamot milk tea and on another occasion the HK milk tea with option to adjust sweetness level. 

Strawberry shortcake cotton candy: So good (like magic evaporating in your ) because it has that fresh strawberry flavor that reminded me of Japanese strawberry candy. I especially liked the little crumbles of cheesecake that melt in your mouth at the same rate of the cotton!! How do they do it??

The real star of the night was a special with Kiefer and strawberry, it tasted like fresh strawberries in the summer, with a hint of that tart yogurt flavor and a smooth texture.

excerpts: This place also sells quality loose leaf teas in bags, and if you need more sweetness in your life, Sugar& Spun Cotton Candy.
cotton candy.author: Hazel C.
cotton candy.review:
Luck was evidently with me one Sunday afternoon as when we finally decided to stop by here, the line happened to be short. I didn't have to wait in line too long to get my boba fix!  It was my first time here, and everything looked good, so I wasn't sure what to get. My friend who was with me and who has been here before, told me everything she's tried here has been good, so she wasn't much help. 

I decided on getting the 24 oz Lychee Green Tea with almond milk, boba, almond jelly, regular ice and 50% sweetness (only $5.45 which is actually a little less than what I paid for a similar drink at Sharetea). It was great! The boba was nice and chewy and the almond jelly was tasty. Perfect for a warm afternoon.  There was a long line by the time we left the place. 

Service was very friendly. The cashier actually took the time to ask me how my day was going even though there was a line. (Am I in San Francisco? lol) My drink also came with a smile when my name was finally called. 

This place also sells quality loose leaf teas in bags, and if you need more sweetness in your life, Sugar& Spun Cotton Candy. And if you're a fan, they also sell Boba Guys totes, mason jars and pins. 

We'll be back Boba Guys!

excerpts: We also tried the cotton candy (Sugar and Spun), which we enjoyed!
Strawberry shortcake and peanut butter & jelly.
cotton candy.author: Jinkie G.
cotton candy.review:
We don't live in SF, but when we visit, we like to try new things.
Only downfall to this location is that it's all street parking.
I had to really convince hubby to drive around, patiently lol
I believe the other location has a few parking garages close by.

Strawberry matcha latte - mix it all together 5/5!!!
Raspberry pineapple tea fresca - my son's drink. Tasted kind of weird to me, but he liked it lol
Hong Kong style milk tea - Hubby liked it. I did not. It was too bitter for my liking. :( Maybe extraaaaa condensed milk would be good lol

We also tried the cotton candy (Sugar and Spun), which we enjoyed!
Strawberry shortcake and peanut butter & jelly. 4/5!

+ Almond, soy, and organic milk options
+ Sweetness levels
+ Friendly & quick service. They were really patient w us!

excerpts: Just the cotton candy.
cotton candy.author: Inez J.
cotton candy.review:
No restroom - knock off one star. Had to use another store's restaurant.

Interesting flavors. They have monthly specials. I got the lychee green tea + rose black milk tea and also lavender black milk tea thats in the september special.

I like how they didn't skimp on the milk tea when I ordered no ice (unlike other places that give you less). And also you can control the sweetness cause they have a sweetness jar/pot that you can add to your drink yourself if it's not sweet enough. Smart move.

Saw pandan macarons on yelp but they didn't have it here when I came. Just the cotton candy.

Yummy boba and HOMEMADE grass jelly whattt 

Lots of parking here. Coming back next time, but to the union square location.

excerpts: They also sell other things like special mason jars, tin cups, buttons, shirts, tea leaves, and flavoured cotton candy.
My only complaint would be the price of their cute mason jar.
I understand it has their logo and a special lid with room for a straw
but the it only saves you 25cents when you bring it in.
And initially you have to pay $12
+ the drink you want which averages $16 total..
That a bit intense for a 16oz mason jar of milk tea.
And since you only save 25cents when you bring it in again, you'll need to come here at least 48 to make it worth it...
The jar is SO cute, I just don't think it's worth $12.
BESIDES THE JAR, the milk tea at Boba Guys is amazing
and I think they've really nailed the science behind preparing good boba and drinks.
Awesome job, I just wish I was in the area more often to enjoy it.
cotton candy.author: Bianca M.
cotton candy.review:
I remember when this place was a popup shop in a ramen shop and they also served curry! Now it's just boba.
The shop is cute and the boba is perfect and the drinks are delicious. The Hong Kong style milk tea tasted authentic so I was very pleased because I usually only trust asian cafes with my HK style milk tea. I'll need to come back here and try the horchata milk tea...
Drinks come in 2 sizes: 16oz or 12oz for cold, and only 16oz for hot. It's $3.50 for a 16oz and 50cents for toppings (boba, pudding, almond jelly).
Service is fast and they're very friendly! Awesome customer service

They also sell other things like special mason jars, tin cups, buttons, shirts, tea leaves, and flavoured cotton candy. My only complaint would be the price of their cute mason jar. $12?! I understand it has their logo and a special lid with room for a straw but the it only saves you 25cents when you bring it in. And initially you have to pay $12 + the drink you want which averages $16 total.. That a bit intense for a 16oz mason jar of milk tea. And since you only save 25cents when you bring it in again, you'll need to come here at least 48 to make it worth it... The jar is SO cute, I just don't think it's worth $12.
BESIDES THE JAR, the milk tea at Boba Guys is amazing and I think they've really nailed the science behind preparing good boba and drinks. Awesome job, I just wish I was in the area more often to enjoy it.

excerpts: and they also have homemade cotton candy!
They usually always have samples when you purchase boba - so try some.
The Li Hing Pineapple cotton candy flavor was tasty and different!
cotton candy.author: Wing L.
cotton candy.review:
You can't miss this place with the little sign hanging outside! Place inside is pretty small and there's usually a line too. The line goes by pretty fast though!

Came here on a Saturday afternoon with my boyfriend and we shared a drink. Got the Jasmine Milk Tea drink with Grass Jelly - w/ Almond Milk and 75% sweetness!

Basically, you pick:
- Type of drink (what kind of milk tea you want)
- Toppings (boba, grass jelly, almond jelly)
- Type of milk (whole milk, soy milk, almond milk)
- Level of sweetness (0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%)

I think 75% was pretty good, not too sweet and you still get the tea flavor. The grass jelly was a little firmer than I liked it.

Staff is super friendly and they use Square for credit card transactions - makes thing super easy! They sell Boba Guys merch here too and they also have homemade cotton candy! They usually always have samples when you purchase boba - so try some. The Li Hing Pineapple cotton candy flavor was tasty and different!

excerpts: They didn't have macarons that day :( but I tried their cotton candy and it was pretty good.
cotton candy.author: Stephanie L.
cotton candy.review:
I remember the first time I had boba guys. It was literally a hole in the wall place that sold Japanese curry and milk tea. Sounds a bit questionable right? I remember it was raved about back then too and mention of long lines. When I got there, it was empty except for one customer helping themselves to delicious smelling japanese curry. I literally thought I went to the wrong place. I asked the worker if this was Boba Guys and they said yes. They only had two options for milk tea back then, Classic Milk Tea or Jasmine. I got the classic milk tea which was pretty good and boba's texture was perfect. I didn't even know they had mason jars, but I had mine to go so of course I didn't get one.

Now I recently came to the new location. Based on reviews, I tried the muskat oolong milk tea, it's very unique and it wasn't bad. The only downside was it was a tad too sweet for me (will ask for half sweet in the future). But the tapioca had perfect consistency, it was nice and chewy and sweet. I will definitely come back to try their other selections of milk tea. I really like their idea of the slow bar (yes, they use freshly brewed tea :O amazeballs). 

They didn't have macarons that day :( but I tried their cotton candy and it was pretty good.

The place itself is very small, more like a grab and go place. They have very limited seating. It's also in the mission and parking can be a bit difficult. But at least this new location is hard to miss and you can actually tell it's a boba joint.

Will definitely be back.

excerpts: They also sell small batch cotton candy from local makers, sugar and spun (I met them at a food truck fair before and they seem super nice) which I love.
cotton candy.author: Jocelyn K.
cotton candy.review:
I have been to boba guys a few times now and honestly, I do not get the hype at all. I am starting to think that people only like this place because it is one of the few places in the mission that has boba and that you can stand in line without feeling embarrassed that you are surrounded by middle schoolers. In terms of the quality of the drink, I find boba guys super disappointing.

I have had the golden honey black milk tea and the horchata milk tea and in both cases, the drinks tasted very watered down. The honey did not stand out in the golden honey black tea - and neither did the tea for that matter. The horchata was really only ok.

However, the texture of the boba is very good, chewy but not too soft or hard. Also, the service has always been really good and the cashier extremely pleasant to talk to. They also sell small batch cotton candy from local makers, sugar and spun (I met them at a food truck fair before and they seem super nice) which I love.

In terms of the ambiance, the place has no seating and can get super crowded. There is usually a line and there is no parking. It is more expensive than a regular boba place but it does have a hipster vibe. Generally I would say pass to boba guys unless you have some out of town guest that you are afraid will judge you for bringing them to a less hipster (more authentic or teeny boppy) boba place. If you want good boba, better to go to the sunset or richmond.

excerpts: You could ask them to fix your preferred sweetness level and they do have some things you can buy, such as cotton candy or teas.
They do have a few chairs as well.
cotton candy.author: Maggie W.
cotton candy.review: It might just be this location, but it didn't hit the spot. I got the jasmine milk tea with boba, which was just alright. The milk tea wasn't strong enough I guess, so it tasted watered down. The boba was chewy and was fine. I mean service wise, it's good. I just don't really understand the hype. I don't think I'll be going to this location anymore. It's really nothing special to me, but I wanted to give it a second chance. Stopped by on a Thursday late afternoon and the place wasn't too crowded. All in all, I'd go somewhere else to get your boba fix, but if you're in the area I guess why not. You could ask them to fix your preferred sweetness level and they do have some things you can buy, such as cotton candy or teas. They do have a few chairs as well.

excerpts: They also carry Sugar & Spun (cotton candy).
cotton candy.author: Susy C.
cotton candy.review:
I can always count on Boba Guys for excellent tea, this has never changed. 

Hong Kong style w/ condensed milk is MY current Boba Guys favorite. Strong black tea expertly brewed and just the right amount of condensed milk added? Easy Sunday. Then to top it off, perfectly cooked boba balls? 

The last time definitely had to have been a fluke. 

Really love how Boba Guys has expanded. They make their own jellies (almond & grass!) , macarons, and Kaya bread. They also carry Sugar & Spun (cotton candy). 

Also!!! They have handled mason jars with the logo for sale, $10. It's my personal favorite and I use mine daily at home. 

Oh and if you have the time and enjoy a great cup of tea, give the slow bar a shot. 

Keep up the good work guys!!

excerpts: 3 stars for the boba milk tea but an extra star for their deliciously satisfying pandan macarons (3 for $5) and for carrying Sugar & Spun's cotton candy in cookie butter:
cotton candy.author: Cherylynn N.
cotton candy.review:
Boys and girls rarely agree on anything but I think there is one thing they CAN agree on: good balls ARE essential. Perfectly symmetrical, soft, squishy, and bouncy. Balls like this get me super excited especially when I'm enjoying a mouthful of them. 

BOBA BALLS that is you pervs!

The Boba Guys have perfected the boba balls down to a science and I love that they use top notch, organic ingredients. They even make their own syrup which means they are serious about their balls; I mean their boba drink. 

I adored Boba Guys when they were at their pop-up at Ken Ken Ramen (http://bit.ly/1fiXJcx) and was ecstatic to find out they would have their brick and mortar. Over 3 months later after their grand opening, I finally was able to make my way to Boba Guys' brick and mortar since they extended their hours of operation. And they now accepted CC's. Yay!

Not only do the Boba Guys now have a permanent space with several stools, they have expanded their menu. Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style. They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order. All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients. This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet. *Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price* 

I decided to stick with their basic Classic Milk Tea ($4) which was sadly not as good as I remembered them to be when they were at Ken Ken Ramen. I like that they use very little sweetener but the tea flavor was too subtle and our drink needed MORE ice. After a 30 minute wait for our drink on a hot Saturday afternoon, our drink arrived to us almost room temperature. By the time we walked back to the car, all the ice (the little that there was in the cup) was all melted. *Sad Pouty Lip*

It was a crowded so the wait was somewhat understandable; I mean fobbee teens who have nothing better to do wait for up to 2 hours at Tpumps. 

3 stars for the boba milk tea but an extra star for their deliciously satisfying pandan macarons (3 for $5) and for carrying Sugar & Spun's cotton candy in cookie butter: http://bit.ly/GOf9i9. 

Not going to lie, it's been nearly 2 weeks but I'm still a little bummed about their boba milk tea. Oh well, at least the balls were good. A good pair; I mean set is all you need sometimes right?

excerpts: They also sell Sugar n Spun cotton candy at $4 a container which is $1 cheaper than buying it from an actual Sugar n Spun stand so that was cool.
And their adorable mason jar glasses?
cotton candy.author: Venus L.
cotton candy.review:
I've had this place bookmarked for the longest time and thanks to my cousin's spontaneous idea of coming here, I was able to uncheck it from my list. 

The inside is sort of small. There's standing room, but only 4 chairs to sit at so it's best to take your drink and go. The counter where you order has a lot of goodies behind glass so be sure to check those out.
