They also sell Sugar n Spun cotton candy at $4 a container which is $1 cheaper than buying it from an actual Sugar n Spun stand so that was cool. And their adorable mason jar glasses? $10 each. 

Parking is all on the street and it's metered so make sure to bring coins! 

My cousin, my boyfriend, and I ordered the coconut green tea, muscat oolong, and horchata boba in that order. I have to say, I was not blown away by their horchata at all. You could definitely taste the cinnamon, no doubt about that and the boba was hella soft, but it just wasn't spectacular. I actually ended up liking my boyfriend's muscat oolong better. 

Overall, it's decent. Maybe I set my expectations too high for the horchata. Definitely gonna come back and try something else next time!

excerpts: -samples of interesting cotton candy flavors like salted caramel peanut butter.
cotton candy.author: Leesa L.
cotton candy.review:
What stood out to me:

-the tea is REAL and legit. None of that powder business

-no extra charge for almond milk. Huge plus for me and my fellow lactose intolerant folk

-almond jelly... Kinda tastes like sweet tofu tbh lol would not get again (can't get it with hot drinks btw)

-samples of interesting cotton candy flavors like salted caramel peanut butter. Delish!

-a 12 oz hot drink is the same prize as a 16 oz cold drink (that you can get w/ no ice)

-wonderful staff. So nice and accommodating even when there's a huge line out the door 

Altogether no complaints! Just prob wouldn't get the almond jelly again

excerpts: I also noticed they had chocolate black sesame and matcha green tea cotton candy packed in plastic tubs
so I picked up some to give to a friend.
cotton candy.author: Peter H.
cotton candy.review:
The boba balls are correctly chewy and not mushy. 

I bought a Thai Iced Milk tea boba and it was good.  If you're in the Mission and want boba then yes this is the place to get it. 

I also noticed they had chocolate black sesame and matcha green tea cotton candy packed in plastic tubs so I picked up some to give to a friend.

excerpts: Everyone got a free sample of cotton candy but me.
"Would you like a sample of our cotton candy?
You just grab it like this....
yes, just like that.
cotton candy.author: Shannon L.
cotton candy.review:
Everyone got a free sample of cotton candy but me.  

At 6:30pm on a Saturday night, I was the only person inside aside from another girl waiting for her drink.  After that, about 5-6 more people came in and I kept hearing "Would you like a sample of our cotton candy? You just grab it like this.... yes, just like that."

Wow, why does that sound so sexual.

As for the boba, it's definitely high quality.  I got the Classic Milk Tea with almond jelly  as a standard milk tea drink, also because the horchata milk tea was sold out.  The tea is strong and the almond jelly is definitely better than the supermarket boxed kind.  

Parking is a biatch in this area and we were literally circling for 20-30 minutes before we found a spot.  Even the nearby parking garage was full.

I'll have to try other drinks to determine if this would be a boba spot I would want to take people to.  So far, it's high quality but the unique factor will be based on how well the other drinks are made.  Also, it'll have to withstand the fact that boba is making a comeback with mustache foam.

excerpts: They also have merchandise with the Boba Guys logo here as well as some homemade cotton candy.
The Li Hing Pineapple flavored cotton candy was pretty great!
Better than I expected.
cotton candy.author: Ian K.
cotton candy.review:
Pretty cool place in the Mission! There seems to always be a line here, but it's worth the wait. My girlfriend and I were in the area and decided to stop by here for a snack on a weekend afternoon. We've always heard about this place since friends have raved about it, so it seemed only fitting that we stopped by.

We ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Grass Jelly with Almond Milk & 75% sweetness level. Not too bad! I couldn't really taste the tea flavor at first because it was pretty sweet, but after a few stirs, it was the perfect balance. It's a little harder to "shake it up" since the drink comes with a lid as opposed to being vacuum sealed like some other places are.

The staff here is very friendly and lets you take your time when you order. They also have merchandise with the Boba Guys logo here as well as some homemade cotton candy. The Li Hing Pineapple flavored cotton candy was pretty great! Better than I expected. Also, their almond jelly and grass jelly are homemade too!

I would definitely come here again to try the other tea flavors (they have speciality tea flavors as well) and the other toppings. The almond jelly would be worth trying next time!

excerpts: There's also gourmet cotton candy which was pretty interesting.
I thought it was okay
but the problem was that I had to ask for the free sample.
I felt a little judged but as the Costco queen that I am, I live for samples.
I personally like freshly made cotton candy.
Since the spun sugar is so susceptible moisture, I think this premade cotton candy was on the tail end of freshness.
cotton candy.author: Anh T.
cotton candy.review:
Pretty solid place. There isn't a ton of boba places in this part of the neighborhood so this place basically has a monopoly. I thought the boba balls were pretty good but nothing to go to town about. The tea itself is made to order and is pretty good. 

There's also gourmet cotton candy which was pretty interesting. I thought it was okay but the problem was that I had to ask for the free sample. I felt a little judged but as the Costco queen that I am, I live for samples. I personally like freshly made cotton candy. Since the spun sugar is so susceptible moisture, I think this premade cotton candy was on the tail end of freshness.

excerpts: If you're down for snacks, the cotton candy from Sugar & Spun is sold here, and they have outrageous weird flavours-- my favourite being the Li Hing Pineapple.
They also have other bites, and fresh honey toast (Hong Kong Toast) topped with condensed milk whipped cream.
It's sweet and decadent, but definitely reminiscent of Japanese Honey Toast (though not as big.)
cotton candy.author: Christa Lei S.
cotton candy.review:
Bottom Line? Hipster friendly boba made accessible to people who aren't used to it as a drink (or the texture of boba.) Maybe it's not the most authentic, but Boba Guys does boba up right, and they also happen to be the closest boba place to my house SOOOO I do come here often. (They also offer delivery on Postmates and Doordash if you're lazy or bedridden like me-- something y'all might wanna think about!)

Consistently good because they are very accommodating to your tastes-- you can choose your choice of milk (regular, soy, almond, etc.) and sweetness (which is a new fad that I'm seeing as of now, but it's helpful for a diabetic like me!) Their boba is fairly sweet, so even if you get 0% sugar, if you get boba with it-- the drink is still bound to be somewhat sweet. I really appreciate their slow bar here because you know they're brewing you up some fresh tea :) If you order from the slow bar, it takes around 3-5 minutes for them to brew your tea and serve your drink. It goes by fast though, I promise. My favourites off the basic menu are the matcha and the hong kong (always down for condensed milk!) But if you want to be adventurous, I'm a huge fan of the Golden Honey Black (which has a hint of sweetness to it, even at low sweetness levels) and the Rose Black Tea (floral af, but soooo delicious.) The boba is always at perfect consistency-- chewy and warm, but like I said before-- I think they store their boba in a simple syrup mixture because it's super sweet and will add sweetness to your drink. 

If you're down for snacks, the cotton candy from Sugar & Spun is sold here, and they have outrageous weird flavours-- my favourite being the Li Hing Pineapple. They also have other bites, and fresh honey toast (Hong Kong Toast) topped with condensed milk whipped cream. It's sweet and decadent, but definitely reminiscent of Japanese Honey Toast (though not as big.) Worth the money, get it! 

All in all, Boba Guys is my go-to boba place because of their consistency and great quality drinks. The only qualm I have is when the line is out the door because their shop is WAY too small for the amount of foot traffic they get.

excerpts: *Bonus: they also sell the Sugar N Spun cotton candy here!
cotton candy.author: Connie Y.
cotton candy.review:
Their menu may not be super extensive, but what they serve is good. Boba Guys does not have a crazy menu with every fruit drink you can think of (like Quickly's or Sharetea) but they have a horchata! Their horchata was sweet with some cinnamon-y taste. The boba itself was chewy and soft. My boyfriend had a freshly brewed milk tea -- coconut tea ($5), I believe. He requested some almond jello inside. The almond jello wasn't too sweet but it was just enough to sweeten up the coconut milk tea. It was quite refreshing. I think next time I'd probably order one of the brewed teas and add almond jello in. You can also request a certain amount of sweetness. I'd probably go lighter, personally.

There's only about 4 seats inside and 2 seats outside, but if you're looking for somewhere to sit to enjoy your boba, I'd suggest walking 2 blocks over to Dolores Park. 

**Bonus: they also sell the Sugar N Spun cotton candy here!

excerpts: One of the guys told us that Boba Guys sells some of their cotton candy.
My ears perked up at "boba" and I had wanted to check out this spot.
cotton candy.author: Katherine S.
cotton candy.review:
Since I commute up to the city everyday for work and live in the South Bay, I'm not really inclined to commute up on the weekends. Tonight, I happened to be in the city for an event with Sugar & Spun present. One of the guys told us that Boba Guys sells some of their cotton candy. My ears perked up at "boba" and I had wanted to check out this spot. We piled in the car to get to Boba Guys just before they closed at 9pm. 

Whoa, they have some interesting flavors here like horchata milk tea and a matcha latte. The milk tea slow bar is made to order and has a rose milk tea on there. The menu sets them apart from your typical boba joint. Plus, they use Strauss organic milk! 

I went with the HK style tea + boba. I'm not a big drinker of milk teas (I usually go for tea without milk), but this was delicious. Not too sweet and a strong, aromatic tea flavor. 

I hope I have a chance to come back again to try something off the milk tea slow bar!

excerpts: They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc.
cotton candy.author: Kitty K.
cotton candy.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: This is a true challenge for a beverage connoisseur - one may pass by and miss this place, because it is so counter intuitive, its modern design, and glossy feel, reminds you nothing of boba, yet these people are crazy about boba, also cotton candy flavors such as thai tea and black sesame, waffles, and Hong Kong fat toast with melts and soaked in cream.
cotton candy.author: Dilys S.
cotton candy.review:
A modern lab of supreme boba and everything that is taiwanese, traditional, new and crazy about it

Traditional Taiwanese boba dipped in the traditional brown sugar syrup (customizable to honey syrup), bathed in the hot/cold bath of classical milk tea, Hong Kong style condensed milk tea, or any of the creative blends of green tea, rose, ... real tea leaves with milk... not just any milk Strauss, from a local family ranch.

I happened to run into the boba guys, specifically Andrew, who couldn't help but just educate me a bit on boba. I haven't been to Taiwan, but have drunk my fair share from Tea Era, Verde, to the Cha for Tea on UC Irvine campus, but his lecture was a new bell ring for me, so many variations, so much possibility.

They are starting their Kickstarter campaign this week, you can become a sponsor of their new lab, get a black card, or let's say 365 days supply of boba... wow, boba tea on kickstarter? yes the point is these guys are crazy, they are taking boba to a whole other level. 

This is a true challenge for a beverage connoisseur - one may pass by and miss this place, because it is so counter intuitive, its modern design, and glossy feel, reminds you nothing of boba, yet these people are crazy about boba, also cotton candy flavors such as thai tea and black sesame, waffles, and Hong Kong fat toast with melts and soaked in cream. 

It is NOT easy to find your perfect drink here, because everything is customizable, creating a challenge for you to step out of your comfort zone.  Choices can be overwhelming, but having choices is such a blessing. I will slowly try it all. Go try it, too

excerpts: Grab some flavored cotton candy with that tea.
cotton candy.author: Nikki S.
cotton candy.review:
Not bad since there are not many boba places in the area. 

Jasmine milk tea was not super sweet and light on the Jasmine flavor.

Hong Kong milk tea was a bit too sweet due to the condensed milk for my liking but good.

The boba is that perfect chewy consistency. 

Quick yet I think a bit pricey at $4 ...

Grab some flavored cotton candy with that tea.

excerpts: The almond jelly is pretty good, and that cotton candy is ok (but its just sugar and spun, so I'll just go to their website)
cotton candy.author: Jay D.
cotton candy.review:
The boba is meh, the services is poor.  The almond jelly is pretty good, and that cotton candy is ok (but its just sugar and spun, so I'll just go to their website) 

Yeah, I think for me the biggest issue is definitely the mediocre boba paired with bad service.  Hey if you're still figuring out your product, fine, I can deal.  But if you're rude and try to hype your stuff up, and any other boba tea out there crushes your offering (I mean Sharetea dominates these guys) don't be snots about your product if its mediocre.

excerpts: Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors.
I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies.
cotton candy.author: Jennifer L.
cotton candy.review:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!

excerpts: Their cotton candy looked interesting but a little pricey to buy.
cotton candy.author: Yvonne K.
cotton candy.review:
Horchata with boba was goood. Just the right about of sweetness.
Hong Kong Style Milk Tea was also on point.

Liking these two drinks better than the jasmine milk tea I had at their first location that I couldn't taste enough of tea. 

Their cotton candy looked interesting but a little pricey to buy. Looked like they had samples at the register though..

Really glad they have their own little place now. No more trekking over to the Mission only to see that they aren't there.

excerpts: What I really came here for though was the sugar spun cotton candy!!
I would definitely come back for the cotton candy and to get my hands on a rose milk tea
(i would have gotten that
but i didn't see it until after i ordered my drink).
cotton candy.author: Linz C.
cotton candy.review:
I thought this place was just "OK."  If i was craving boba and in the area i would definitely come back, but i wouldn't go out of my way and go all the way down to the mission for a milk tea. 

Their drinks range between $4-5.50 which is pretty steep compared to the $1.00 teaway.  I got the jasmine milk tea which was REALLY REALLY SWEET!!! Drinkable, but SWEET! My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea and he seemed to be happy with it.  I usually don't get tapioca in my drinks but I thought I'd try theirs it since it was my first time here.  At first I thought they were a bit hard but after a while it began to grow on me. 

What I really came here for though was the sugar spun cotton candy!! I was hoping for one of their more exotic flavors like thai tea or sesame, but they only had lemon cookie.  The cashier was kind enough to give us a sample to make sure we like it before we buy it.  It was delicious! I would definitely come back for the cotton candy and to get my hands on a rose milk tea (i would have gotten that but i didn't see it until after i ordered my drink).

excerpts: They also have some crazy cotton candy flavors.
cotton candy.author: Jenna P.
cotton candy.review: This wasn't typical American bubble tea.  It was made from scratch without the fake powders.  The boba was very fresh and the horchata flavor I got was delicious.  They also have some crazy cotton candy flavors.

excerpts: They also offer bubble tea smoothies, and cotton candy which I didn't try but looked to have interesting flavors.
cotton candy.author: Camille A.
cotton candy.review:
Like many places in San Francisco Boba guys can be spotted with A long line outside it's doors. When you order they ask for a sweetness level,boba (or jelly) and what type of milk; soy, almond, organic. The 100% sweetness was very sweet. I would have probably gone for50%. They do have a carafe of simple syrup and water on a side table to adjust sweetness. I got the jasmine green tea with Boba which was pretty good except for how sweet it was. My sister got the coffee boba tea which didn't really taste like coffee... Just like regular milk tea. They also offer bubble tea smoothies, and cotton candy which I didn't try but looked to have interesting flavors. 

This is a good place if you have a bubble tea craving. But I was surprised at the small variety of flavors. They did have mango and strawberry, Thai tea n horchata , but I was really surprised that they didn't have flavors like tarowhich I find commonly at most bubble tea places.

This place also included some bar seats but was really more of a take out bubble tea place.

excerpts: Also, they offer free samples of their delicious cotton candy; how cool!
cotton candy.author: Charmaine D.
cotton candy.review: This place looked so hipster, I was a little afraid to walk into this little store.  But I tried their Hong Kong Style milk tea, but it was so delicious I can't wait to get the chance to go again!  Also, they offer free samples of their delicious cotton candy; how cool!

excerpts: They also make uniquely-flavored cotton candy, as well as some Asian snacks.
They've done a good job with the brand so far.
I'm glad they have upgraded to their own storefront and hope they will continue to grow.
cotton candy.author: Vivian L.
cotton candy.review:
After having been on our list since they opened their old location, we finally got to try this place! We stopped by while waiting for our table at Tacolicious just a block away. Their menu was very interesting, and had a great range of types of milk tea combinations from classic, Hong Kong style, to horchata. They also have different add-ins, such as grass jelly and almond jelly, as well as different milk options including almond and soy. There's also a "slow bar" where they offer hot brewed teas.

We ordered a soy milk tea with boba to share. There was just enough tea flavor and the boba had a good chew to them. The only negative was the syrup on the boba was a little too sweet, but it wasn't a huge deal.

This location is really just a small room that had a small counter with bar stools for about 4-5 people to sit, but there's a bench right outside the store for more seating. It's tucked away in a side street, and can be easily missed.

They also make uniquely-flavored cotton candy, as well as some Asian snacks. They've done a good job with the brand so far. I'm glad they have upgraded to their own storefront and hope they will continue to grow.

excerpts: Definitely want to come back for the sugar spun cotton candy as the flavors seem intriguing.
Slow bar menu as well, when there's sufficient time to wait for the brew.
cotton candy.author: Julia C.
cotton candy.review:
Boba Guys is like my Ten Ren away from home! Surprised I made it all the way into the mission and back during a thought to be heavier lunch hour. Kudos for scoring street meter packing right out front.

The shop was empty, so service and boba turn around time was quite speedy for the only patron on site. I had the classic milk tea with boba, which was unexpectedly strong and delicious. It contained just the right balance between tea and milk, none of that artificial Quickly/Tap X shit here. Even after the ice had melted, there was still a distinct tea taste as opposed to it just being diluted. I didn't really finish my drink until early evening, which led to the result of my caffine induced insomnia for the night. 

I havn't had the chance to compare it to the pop up shop version over at Ken Ken Ramen, which many are saying are drastically better. This location didn't appear to have the alcoholic drink versions on the menu either. Maybe an update once I can sample the others? Definitely want to come back for the sugar spun cotton candy as the flavors seem intriguing. Slow bar menu as well, when there's sufficient time to wait for the brew.

excerpts: This place also offers homemade cotton candy!
Delicious flavors like li-hing pineapple.
I sampled the cotton candy and was pleasantly surprised by how delicate the candy melted in my mouth.
A fun find on my walk home.
cotton candy.author: K R.
cotton candy.review:
Delicious tea, just perfectly sweet, and perfectly QQ boba! A bit on the pricey side...so I won't be going there too often, but the quality is worth it. This place also offers homemade cotton candy! Delicious flavors like li-hing pineapple. I sampled the cotton candy and was pleasantly surprised by how delicate the candy melted in my mouth. 
A fun find on my walk home.

excerpts: And they have this gourmet "adult" cotton candy.
Umm. Yumm.
cotton candy.author: Avi S.
cotton candy.review:
I am now addicted to milk teas and boba!  Today I tried the almond jelly in the milk tea and that was yummy too.  These guys are the first boba teas I have had that are really good...not like that other generic brand that's everywhere.
And they have this gourmet "adult" cotton candy.  Umm. Yumm.

excerpts: spun cotton candy!
They had cookie butter flavor &it was delicious!!
cotton candy.author: Sabrina S.
cotton candy.review:
I don't really get the hype about this place. I came &tried the milk tea with boba &although it's refreshing, it's not really worth the $4 for a small cup. 

Sucks they don't have the mason jars either!

But their actual boba is pretty good. It had the right texture &sweetness.

And they sell sugar spun cotton candy! They had cookie butter flavor &it was delicious!!

excerpts: Sugar and Spun cotton candy is also sold here, but they didn't have the flavors I wanted to get.
cotton candy.author: Helen H.
cotton candy.review: It's not a place to hang out with friends. It's a place where you take your drink to go. The place is really small and had a line out the door. I ordered the Iced Matcha Latte with boba. The drink had the right amount of sweetness, but it tasted like seaweed. I read that green tea can taste like that; however I didn't care for it. The boba on the other hand had a great soft and chewy consistency. Sugar and Spun cotton candy is also sold here, but they didn't have the flavors I wanted to get.

excerpts: Sample the cotton candy; it's good!
cotton candy.author: Vivian V.
cotton candy.review:
I ordered a hot jasmine milk tea with boba to keep warm in the cold. I wanted to try the almond jelly but they warned the jellies would dissolve. 

I've had this particular drink at other locations and the boba is good. Unfortunately, the consistency of boba at Boba Guys was extremely gooey. I'm not sure if the boba is usually like this or the gooeyness was a result of the hot water. Bottom line, don't order hot drinks with boba. 

Service was not particularly friendly, so I'd recommend an improvement on that. 

I'd give the place another try for another drink. Sample the cotton candy; it's good!

excerpts: Soymilk, vegan tapioca balls or jelly square, vegan & GF cotton candy.
Great spot!
cotton candy.author: Lisa M.
cotton candy.review: Soymilk, vegan tapioca balls or jelly square, vegan & GF cotton candy. Great spot!  Love the coconut green tea boba drink. It's pretty sweet though- so next time I'll adjust that a bit.  But love this place!

excerpts: The register had a display just the to the left of it which showed their signature mason jars and some treats they were selling (sugar spun cotton candy!).
cotton candy.author: Charlene B.
cotton candy.review: So, where I live there aren't many boba places AT ALL (and if there are, the quality is as cheap as the prices they sell for). My boyfriend came to Boba Guys on President's Day (a Monday), and we were enough to find prime time parking along the street right across the shop. When we arrived (around 230pm) there was a bit of a line. It took about 15 minutes to actually reach the inside, which was small and a bit cramped (like most boba places). The register had a display just the to the left of it which showed their signature mason jars and some treats they were selling (sugar spun cotton candy!). I decided to try out the iced matcha latte and my boyfriend tried the hong kong style. I loved both drinks. The boba balls were not too soft and chewy, the price was very typical in comparison to other boba places (that's if you don't purchase the mason jar), the service was on the longer side to most boba places i've been to, and finding parking can be tough. I would most likely come back, but hopefully when its not so busy!

excerpts: I also loved their artesian cotton candy, made with organic ingredients and NO FOOD COLORing!
cotton candy.author: Kay L.
cotton candy.review: Such good boba here! Perfect blend of milk with tea.  I also loved their artesian cotton candy, made with organic ingredients and NO FOOD COLORing!

excerpts: The boba is great - but try the cotton candy!
It seems like a weird addition to the menu at first
but it's amazing, and very different than any other time you've probably had cotton candy.
cotton candy.author: Rashmi J.
cotton candy.review: The boba is great - but try the cotton candy! It seems like a weird addition to the menu at first but it's amazing, and very different than any other time you've probably had cotton candy.

excerpts: we also tried the cotton candy and the owner made us some hong-kong style toast.
it was delicious and love the staff!
cotton candy.author: Janet Y.
cotton candy.review:
pretty good milk tea. except i drank it around 6 right before dinner and i was up all night..

we also tried the cotton candy and the owner made us some hong-kong style toast. it was delicious and love the staff!

excerpts: The one saving grace so far was the green tea cotton candy.
It was a little shocking at first, strong, slightly salty matcha with sweet sugar, but it was soon addicting.
cotton candy.author: Malia B.
cotton candy.review:
Went here today after seeing friends' photos of milk tea and boba in Mason jars and thought, "How hipster!" I knew coming in that the price was high ($4 compared to Teaway Express's $1.07) but I thought it would be worth it. It really wasn't. I got the Hong Kong style milk tea expecting it to be sweet and creamy with condensed milk-- it wasn't. It was very watery and thin. The tapioca itself is average-- good flavor, average texture; not as soft as Tpumps's honey boba. Also, my drink didn't even come in a mason jar! Disappointment all around. I didn't really like my boyfriend's iced matcha latte. 
Honestly I love the attitude and lifestyle of the neighborhood, especially since I live nearby. However it really irked me and my elitist view of being Asian and knowing boba when people come in here not knowing a thing about tapioca. But that's just my own personal tick. 
The one saving grace so far was the green tea cotton candy. It was a little shocking at first, strong, slightly salty matcha with sweet sugar, but it was soon addicting.

excerpts: The guy working was also handing out samples of the cotton candy they make.
They had chocolate and matcha - I especially liked the matcha.
I would definitely come again when in the neighborhood.
cotton candy.author: Jackie M.
cotton candy.review: My friends and I dropped by for tapioca after dinner. They offer your traditional tapioca flavors - HK milk tea, jasmine milk tea, etc. Some other unconventional flavors included Soy milk tea and Horchata. My friends and I tried these 4 flavors. The one that made a lasting impression was surprisingly the soy milk tea. It was surprisingly sweet and full of flavor, totally opposite of what you think it would taste like. The guy working was also handing out samples of the cotton candy they make. They had chocolate and matcha - I especially liked the matcha. I would definitely come again when in the neighborhood.

excerpts: KAYA TOAST - $3.50
A thick slice of brioche toast served warm with their own housemade kaya coconut jam.
So the kaya coconut jam is like this sweet custardy spread that is mixed with coconut milk and has pandan leaf flavor.
The consistency is like condensed milk.
The Boba Guys made their very own!
This took some time to make
but the it's worth it!
I would say around 5 minutes (it just seems long compared to how fast drinks are made here).
The kaya toast was served warm, cute into 4 and topped with a decent amount of kaya.
It was so delightful and made me miss Singapore so much.
kaya toast.author: Tu-Anh N.
kaya toast.review:
I've heard of Boba Guys for some time now and have been wanting to give that place a try. What I didn't know was that they were all over San Francisco, including the Mission!

It was a Saturday evening coming here, so parking was extra difficult.  While one of circle around, the 3 of us jumped out to get in NO line (woo-hoo!) and ordered.

This location is very small with no where to sit or really to stick around for long.  This place is more of a "take-out" place.

Looking at their menu, I can see what the big deal was! They seem to have a variety of unique Boba drinks that I don't usually see at other Boba spots.  They also have merchandise, haha.

So here's what I had:

MATCHATA (16 oz) - $4.75
+$0.50 Boba 
A secret menu item turned not-so-secret.  Organic matcha whisked over their house made horchata.
See what I mean?!! Matcha AND horchata!!! I could I possibly pass this up!  The only thing about this one is there is no sweetness adjustment, which I'm completely fine about.  I did like how it's not so sweet.  Besides you get a lot of the sweetness from the warm and chewy (pretty much perfect) tapioca balls.  When this was given to me, you have the bottom layer of the warm boba, then the white layer of matcha, and the top layer is the matcha.  You stir it and let be ice mix it all up! This taste was quite unique--you get this slight gritty semi-sweet texture from the horchata and the earthy taste from the matcha.  I recommend trying this one.

KAYA TOAST - $3.50
A thick slice of brioche toast served warm with their own housemade kaya coconut jam.
So the kaya coconut jam is like this sweet custardy spread that is mixed with coconut milk and has pandan leaf flavor.  The consistency is like condensed milk.  The Boba Guys made their very own!  This took some time to make but the it's worth it!  I would say around 5 minutes (it just seems long compared to how fast drinks are made here).  The kaya toast was served warm, cute into 4 and topped with a decent amount of kaya.  It was so delightful and made me miss Singapore so much.  I wish I had taken a look to see if they sell a jar of their kaya.

I really am impressed. The staff was friendly and efficient.  I hope to come back soon to try everything else. Thanks Boba Guys!

excerpts: (Kaya toast was just okay...
the plush, thick slice of toast took a few minutes, and was a little conservative on coconut spread.)
I caught them just before peak evening rush and was glad to control the sweetness towards the lower end of the scale.
Good quality milk.
Snagged one of the few stools to nosh for a few minutes before wading back out through the line of customers.
kaya toast.author: Ruth C.
kaya toast.review: Jasmine milk tea with scrambled almond jelly was exactly what my body craved. (Kaya toast was just okay... the plush, thick slice of toast took a few minutes, and was a little conservative on coconut spread.) I caught them just before peak evening rush and was glad to control the sweetness towards the lower end of the scale. Good quality milk. Snagged one of the few stools to nosh for a few minutes before wading back out through the line of customers.

excerpts: For desserts, there are Hong Kong style French toast and Kaya toast from Malaysia/Singapore.
kaya toast.author: Charles S.
kaya toast.review:
High quality tea and milk.  There are numbers of selection from Thai Tea, black tea, oolong, and even Indian Chai (rare at tapioca tea place).  Milk includes regular milk, almond milk, and soy milk.  Toppings include tapioca, almond jelly, and grass jelly.  For desserts, there are Hong Kong style French toast and Kaya toast from Malaysia/Singapore.  Also, you can buy tea leaf by pounds.

I drink Chai without sugar the most and taste is authentic.

excerpts: However, I'm really looking forward to trying the kaya toast.
I haven't had kaya toast since coming home from Singapore October 2013~!
As far as I know, no one in the bay area serves kaya toast so try that out!
I will too :)
kaya toast.author: Margaret S.
kaya toast.review:
Hey! Some of these 1 star reviews are blatantly complaining about the price and saying boba shouldn't be $4. You shouldn't be disliking boba guys because they're "hipster" or because "it's too expensive." You guys are terrible. And you suck. And YES Boba Guys does use quality tea. I think. I never actually asked to see the leaves. Ehehe.


However, I'm really looking forward to trying the kaya toast. I haven't had kaya toast since coming home from Singapore October 2013~! As far as I know, no one in the bay area serves kaya toast so try that out! I will too :)

excerpts: We also had the really expensive Kaya toast at $3.75.
A thick slice of Toasted brioche smothered in kaya and drizzled with honey.
The kaya is supposed to be home made but is inauthentic in flavour and it was way too sweet.
kaya toast.author: May C.
kaya toast.review:
This place supposedly serves "gourmet" bubble tea which really means that they serve you tea that is breed to border. They also offer some funky combinations, if that's how you like it. The tea was perfectly fine but spoilt by having to drink it through a straw and the bubbles actually ruined it.  

We also had the really expensive Kaya toast at $3.75. A thick slice of Toasted brioche smothered in kaya and drizzled with honey. The kaya is supposed to be home made but is inauthentic in flavour and it was way too sweet.

excerpts: I also have had their kaya toast and its really good
but it's really big
: I was sharing it with a friend
and it was a lot just to eat half of it!
kaya toast.author: Alex J.
kaya toast.review: Boba Guys is my favorite boba place in the bay area. I love their jasmine milk tea. All the staff are so nice! If it's not super full, they will take the time to talk to you about their teas. I also have had their kaya toast and its really good but it's really big: I was sharing it with a friend and it was a lot just to eat half of it!

excerpts: Chamomile Mint: $5
chamomile mint.author: Kitty K.
chamomile mint.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts:
Horchata, Hong Kong style, Chamomile Mint, Pumpkin Chai, Muscat Oolong, and Coconut Green Tea.
5.
Not just boba.
They recently started selling snacks too (macarons, toast, etc), but I have yet to try.
They sell cute glass mason jars with handles for $10 with the Boba Guys logo in the front.
If you bring the Boba Guys jar or your own mug, you will receive a discount off your drink!
Grade-A balls
AKA fresh.
Homemade syrup.
They don't use powder or artificial syrup.
Homemade almond and grass jelly.
Slightly hipster and more "Americanized.
The Classic Milk Tea is WAY more sweet compared to the Hong Kong style milk tea.
chamomile mint.author: Vicki L.
chamomile mint.review:
What makes Boba Guys unique:

1. Limited selection. Only 9 milk tea's. And 8 "Slow Bar" brewed tea's. 
2. Only toppings available are boba and jelly. Very limited.
3. Expensive compared to other places. $4 per drink with no size options.
4. Some unique flavors. Horchata, Hong Kong style, Chamomile Mint, Pumpkin Chai, Muscat Oolong, and Coconut Green Tea.
5. Not just boba. They recently started selling snacks too (macarons, toast, etc), but I have yet to try.
6. They sell cute glass mason jars with handles for $10 with the Boba Guys logo in the front.
7. If you bring the Boba Guys jar or your own mug, you will receive a discount off your drink!
8. Grade-A balls AKA fresh.
9. Homemade syrup. They don't use powder or artificial syrup.
10. Homemade almond and grass jelly.
11. Slightly hipster and more "Americanized." They have some non-Asian staff, which makes this boba shop a little more unique!

Note: The Classic Milk Tea is WAY more sweet compared to the Hong Kong style milk tea.

excerpts: They have variety of interesting flavors that I was surprised to see and would definitely like to try when i come back: horchata, decaf, hong kong style, coconut green tea, chamomile mint, muscat oolong, etc.
You can also order online and choose a pick up time!
How convenient!
The place is pretty small, with some window seating, so it's primarily a to-go place.
There is also a bench right outside as well.
I would definitely come back!
I'm excited to hear that they're going to open a store in Union Square, closer to where I live!
I'm sure they'll get a lot of business.
chamomile mint.author: Anna L.
chamomile mint.review:
I tried the Soy Milk Tea with grass jelly and I really like the strong tea flavor! I felt like it was the right sweetness for me, so there was no reason to adjust the sugar percentage which I realized later I could have done. I thought the grass jelly was okay..I felt like it had a weird texture - more firm and dense than the regular grass jelly that I'm used to. 
I came at a good time when there were not too many people..around 3 something..so I got my drink in like 2 minutes. I like that they have a little station for water with cups and also a jug where you could add extra syrup! According to their website, the syrup, almond jelly, and grass jelly are homemade! I appreciate that they strive to use the best possible ingredients (organic tea and organic condensed milk!) and the best possible milk-tea-making methods to produce good quality drinks. They have variety of interesting flavors that I was surprised to see and would definitely like to try when i come back: horchata, decaf, hong kong style, coconut green tea, chamomile mint, muscat oolong, etc. You can also order online and choose a pick up time! How convenient! 
The place is pretty small, with some window seating, so it's primarily a to-go place. There is also a bench right outside as well.
I would definitely come back! I'm excited to hear that they're going to open a store in Union Square, closer to where I live! I'm sure they'll get a lot of business.

excerpts: Ordered the coconut green tea with milk, almond jelly, and 75% sweet.
The drink was delicious and I was pretty sad that I finished it so quickly.
Wish I got it less sweet, but I tend to not enjoy sweet drinks all that much.
A little pricy though, I paid $7 ($6 for drink + $1 tip), so won't be a regular here unfortunately.
They do have other specialty drinks posted on the side of the register though, and those looked really good as well.
Looking forward to trying those eventually.
Parking can be a little difficult and the meters are $5.25 for an hour in the area.
Nice place to stop by after hanging out at Dolores Park if you don't feel like ice cream at Bi-Rite.
The wait on a Friday afternoon was about 30 mins from standing in line to receiving my drink.
coconut green tea.author: Sandy K.
coconut green tea.review: Ordered the coconut green tea with milk, almond jelly, and 75% sweet. The drink was delicious and I was pretty sad that I finished it so quickly. Wish I got it less sweet, but I tend to not enjoy sweet drinks all that much. A little pricy though, I paid $7 ($6 for drink + $1 tip), so won't be a regular here unfortunately. They do have other specialty drinks posted on the side of the register though, and those looked really good as well. Looking forward to trying those eventually. Parking can be a little difficult and the meters are $5.25 for an hour in the area. Nice place to stop by after hanging out at Dolores Park if you don't feel like ice cream at Bi-Rite. The wait on a Friday afternoon was about 30 mins from standing in line to receiving my drink.

excerpts: I ordered the Earl grey and the coconut green tea with almond milk and almond jelly.
Our drinks came out looking a little light.
Both of them tasted watered down, not like milk teas but more like water.
I was so disappointed because we stood in line for it.
I'm not sure if choosing the almond milk made it taste watered down, but it really lacked flavor.
I did however, like the almond jelly.
coconut green tea.author: Vy T.
coconut green tea.review: Such a let down...I ordered the Earl grey and the coconut green tea with almond milk and almond jelly. Our drinks came out looking a little light. Both of them tasted watered down, not like milk teas but more like water. I was so disappointed because we stood in line for it. I'm not sure if choosing the almond milk made it taste watered down, but it really lacked flavor. I did however, like the almond jelly.

excerpts:
its good
- Jelly - Grass jelly is good
- I had the coconut green tea with milk and 50% sweetness.
WOW.
Something I wish I had more of after i was slurping my straw at the end for more.
coconut green tea.author: Shaila S.
coconut green tea.review:
The best part about this place is there is no powder mix. The tea is actually brewed loose leaf. 

Hypes:
- Boba - Theres something about their boba that is magical and different. The texture, the perfect amount of sweetness...its good
- Jelly - Grass jelly is good
- I had the coconut green tea with milk and 50% sweetness. WOW. Something I wish I had more of after i was slurping my straw at the end for more. 
- Black milk tea also is a hit
- You can choose your amount of sweetness in quarter percentages (i'd go with 25 or 50)

Gripes:
- Sounds good, but honestly wasn't a fan of the almond jelly. Don't fall for the reviews...its really not all that

excerpts: Coconut green tea was phenomenal and very refreshing.
I just wish they had more variety in what you can order.
coconut green tea.author: Jess Y.
coconut green tea.review:
Finally, some accessible bubble tea in the city!  Only problem is that it is super busy so there is always a line!  Also, very very very limited space inside to hang out.  

I find a lot of their drinks way too sweet at the regular level of sweetness so I always order either half sweet or less sweet.  So definitely order at least half sweet if this is your first time around!  Besides, if you don't think it's sweet enough, you can always add some simple syrup to the tea afterwards.  The tapioca balls are the right consistency and delicious.  The best add-in though is definitely their homemade almond jello.  It's not too sweet and has a nice chewy fragrant consistency.  It's a perfect addition to a traditional milk tea.  I love that you can also order any of the drinks with soy milk instead for lactose-intolerant people.

The tea flavors are strong and good.  Coconut green tea was phenomenal and very refreshing.  I just wish they had more variety in what you can order.  There are some limited combinations and I'd love some more options--especially of the non-milky variety.

Also, they have the most awesome logo ever.  Duh.

excerpts: I ordered the coconut green tea, muscat oolong, and horchata boba in that order.
I have to say, I was not blown away by their horchata at all.
You could definitely taste the cinnamon, no doubt about that and the boba was hella soft, but it just wasn't spectacular.
I actually ended up liking my boyfriend's muscat oolong better.
coconut green tea.author: Venus L.
coconut green tea.review:
I've had this place bookmarked for the longest time and thanks to my cousin's spontaneous idea of coming here, I was able to uncheck it from my list. 

The inside is sort of small. There's standing room, but only 4 chairs to sit at so it's best to take your drink and go. The counter where you order has a lot of goodies behind glass so be sure to check those out. They also sell Sugar n Spun cotton candy at $4 a container which is $1 cheaper than buying it from an actual Sugar n Spun stand so that was cool. And their adorable mason jar glasses? $10 each. 

Parking is all on the street and it's metered so make sure to bring coins! 

My cousin, my boyfriend, and I ordered the coconut green tea, muscat oolong, and horchata boba in that order. I have to say, I was not blown away by their horchata at all. You could definitely taste the cinnamon, no doubt about that and the boba was hella soft, but it just wasn't spectacular. I actually ended up liking my boyfriend's muscat oolong better. 

Overall, it's decent. Maybe I set my expectations too high for the horchata. Definitely gonna come back and try something else next time!

excerpts: Coconut Green Tea:

excerpts: Ordered coconut green tea with boba and their coffee milk tea with boba.
They get points for having both almond milk and soy milk.
Both drink were seriously not good,both thin and watery.
Coconut tasted very fake.
The coffee milk tea lacked black tea flavor, and the coffee part tasted like gas station coffee.
The chai milk tea sounded good, maybe the others are better.
But I won't be back to find out.
Go to i-tea, Honey-B, or Bambu.
Those places are delicious!
coconut green tea.author: Traci K.
coconut green tea.review:
First time here, last time here. Line was out the door. Wasn't sure what to expect,  and was okay with being surprised with the very limited menu (I'm used to all the other bubble tea places with gigantic selection). I thought maybe it was a testament to the high quality drinks I would be getting. Ordered coconut green tea with boba and their coffee milk tea with boba. They get points for having both almond milk and soy milk. 
Both drink were seriously not good,both thin and watery. Coconut tasted very fake. The coffee milk tea lacked black tea flavor, and the coffee part tasted like gas station coffee. 
The chai milk tea sounded good, maybe the others are better. But I won't be back to find out. 
Go to i-tea, Honey-B, or Bambu. Those places are delicious!

excerpts: Maybe it was the item I chose though - the coconut green tea latte with almond milk.
coconut green tea.author: Sarah L.
coconut green tea.review:
A little too sweet for my taste - even after adjusting by adding "no sweetness" to my order. Maybe it was the item I chose though - the coconut green tea latte with almond milk. I wish the place had nutritional info available for sick people like me who have to watch how much fat and sugar I intake.

My stomach didn't hurt too badly after drinking it though so I might come back and just get an unflavored tea or something. Definitely a tasty dessert drink for those who don't have to worry too much about their diet/health!

excerpts: Coconut green tea.
Enough said.
Ask to have it brewed a bit longer for more flavor.
Get the almond jelly and call it a drink.
You won't be disappointed!
That's my usual go to order.
I've tried many of the other drinks too.
The green tea latte was definitely on point as well.
I enjoy how they freshly brew the tea and the taste is where you'd want it to be.
coconut green tea.author: Audrey K.
coconut green tea.review: Coconut green tea. Enough said. Ask to have it brewed a bit longer for more flavor. Get the almond jelly and call it a drink. You won't be disappointed! That's my usual go to order. I've tried many of the other drinks too. The green tea latte was definitely on point as well. I enjoy how they freshly brew the tea and the taste is where you'd want it to be.

excerpts: There was no AC, and since it was a little hot outside, it did get a little uncomfortable, especially since my wife ordered the slow brew coconut green tea.
coconut green tea.author: Tony L.
coconut green tea.review:
You gotta give these guys credit. They're trying to do something different without breaking the bank.

My wife and I strolled in here after she read about Boba Guys on Yelp. The interior of this place is pretty tight. There was no AC, and since it was a little hot outside, it did get a little uncomfortable, especially since my wife ordered the slow brew coconut green tea. And unlike traditional boba shops, these guys aren't nearly as fast at cutting down the line.

I guess my biggest complaint is how pretentious everything feels. Slow brew tea. C'mon, really? All tea is slow brew. You brew tea by steeping it in hot water. This is the way tea has been brewed for thousands of years. It's nothing new.

And then there's this acrylic contraption that's supposed to look like a coffee siphon bar. But unlike a coffee siphon, you're not watching water steam in separate chambers, forcing hot water through a filter. Again, they're just steeping tea in hot water. It's silly. 

To top it all off there's all this stuff on the menu boasting about the best quality ingredients from around the world. And as I'm reading this, I'm watching the hipster kids behind the counter use Kirkland cinnamon and vanilla. Don't get me wrong, I love Costco. But I don't consider Costco ingredients rare or exotic.

Anyway, the tea was alright. I had the horchata boba. It had a good flavor without being too sweet. And since most boba shops have at least 30 different flavors, to find something fresh and unique is notable. My wife's green tea with coconut milk and almond jello was also a nice twist. I liked that.

And for about $3.50 a pop, which is just about the same price you'd pay for this stuff on Clement Street or in Chinatown, it's not a bad deal. But it's not anything worth going out of your way for.

excerpts: On my recent visit I ordered their Thai iced tea and coconut green tea with organic almond milk at 50% sweetness with boba and almond jelly.
The Thai tea was for the hubby, which he loved.
I really enjoyed my boba tea and the homemade almond jelly was delicious.
coconut green tea.author: Rosella S.
coconut green tea.review: I like the simplicity of their menu with the added appeal of quality ingredients like Strauss milk and Three Trees organic almond milk that some other boba places don't offer. I also like the fact that they offer decaf tea, which my kid enjoys a lot. On my recent visit I ordered their Thai iced tea and coconut green tea with organic almond milk at 50% sweetness with boba and almond jelly. The Thai tea was for the hubby, which he loved. I really enjoyed my boba tea and the homemade almond jelly was delicious.

excerpts: I got the coconut green tea.
It was brewed on the spot, so extra brownie points for freshness.
coconut green tea.author: Francesca M.
coconut green tea.review:
I got the coconut green tea. It was brewed on the spot, so extra brownie points for freshness. The coconut flavor was strong but not overbearing. 

As my friend put it, the boba to drink ratio was just right. 

It's not your traditional boba spot but it's certainly a good different. The presentation, the set-up, and the flavors are definitely for the modern day foodies.

I'm only knocking down a star because I wish the service was as warm as their tea.

excerpts: Love the coconut green tea boba drink.
It's pretty sweet though-
so next time I'll adjust that a bit.
But love this place!
coconut green tea.author: Lisa M.
coconut green tea.review: Soymilk, vegan tapioca balls or jelly square, vegan & GF cotton candy. Great spot!  Love the coconut green tea boba drink. It's pretty sweet though- so next time I'll adjust that a bit.  But love this place!

How convenient!

I'm sure they'll get a lot of business.

coconut green tea.review:
I tried the Soy Milk Tea with grass jelly and I really like the strong tea flavor! I felt like it was the right sweetness for me, so there was no reason to adjust the sugar percentage which I realized later I could have done. I thought the grass jelly was okay..I felt like it had a weird texture - more firm and dense than the regular grass jelly that I'm used to. 
I came at a good time when there were not too many people..around 3 something..so I got my drink in like 2 minutes. I like that they have a little station for water with cups and also a jug where you could add extra syrup! According to their website, the syrup, almond jelly, and grass jelly are homemade! I appreciate that they strive to use the best possible ingredients (organic tea and organic condensed milk!) and the best possible milk-tea-making methods to produce good quality drinks. They have variety of interesting flavors that I was surprised to see and would definitely like to try when i come back: horchata, decaf, hong kong style, coconut green tea, chamomile mint, muscat oolong, etc. You can also order online and choose a pick up time! How convenient! 
The place is pretty small, with some window seating, so it's primarily a to-go place. There is also a bench right outside as well.
I would definitely come back! I'm excited to hear that they're going to open a store in Union Square, closer to where I live! I'm sure they'll get a lot of business.

excerpts: Got the coconut green tea with almond milk.
coconut green tea.author: Faten A.
coconut green tea.review:
Got the coconut green tea with almond milk. Hubby got the duke of earl grey with dairy milk. Both with tapioca balls.

Good stuff!!!
Really friendly staff.
This is going to develop into an addiction I can just feel it.

excerpts: I then ordered my usual coconut green tea and matcha latte despite what I just witnessed.
The coconut drink didn't even taste like coconut and the matcha drink had black bitter chunks in it!
Later when I got home, I realized the chunks were matcha.
I would love to come back here, but never am I going to have this girl make my drinks.
coconut green tea.author: Kathleen N.
coconut green tea.review: I've been to this place a couple times and it's amazing! The boba is great and the drinks actually taste like tea, unlike other places like quickly. I would have given this place 5 stars, but I just had the worst experience ever. First off, BEWARE OF THE BLONDE GIRL MAKING DRINKS. I saw her mix a drink with a spoon, taste the drink with the spoon, and then put the spoon back into the drink to mix it some more!!!! Someone needs to be retrained. I then ordered my usual coconut green tea and matcha latte despite what I just witnessed. The coconut drink didn't even taste like coconut and the matcha drink had black bitter chunks in it! Later when I got home, I realized the chunks were matcha. I would love to come back here, but never am I going to have this girl make my drinks.

excerpts: Ever since that first time, I've paid Boba Guys multiple visits and tried their classic milk tea, hong kong style tea, and the earl grey tea.
All of them are great and their "grade A balls" live up to the name.
ALSO, there are plenty of customization options (sweetness, milk, toppings)!
Note: just like in-n-out fries, the shelf life for boba guys boba isn't very long...
earl grey.author: Alex J.
earl grey.review:
From my various samplings of boba places around the bay area, I've always heard rumblings of the popular boba guys, but never had the chance to give it a try.  Luckily, we were in the area and I finally got to give it a try...the best thing? NO LINE! woop woop!
Ever since that first time, I've paid Boba Guys multiple visits and tried their classic milk tea, hong kong style tea, and the earl grey tea.  All of them are great and their "grade A balls" live up to the name.  ALSO, there are plenty of customization options (sweetness, milk, toppings)!
Note: just like in-n-out fries, the shelf life for boba guys boba isn't very long...

excerpts: I ordered the Earl grey and the coconut green tea with almond milk and almond jelly.
Our drinks came out looking a little light.
Both of them tasted watered down, not like milk teas but more like water.
I was so disappointed because we stood in line for it.
I'm not sure if choosing the almond milk made it taste watered down, but it really lacked flavor.
I did however, like the almond jelly.
earl grey.author: Vy T.
earl grey.review: Such a let down...I ordered the Earl grey and the coconut green tea with almond milk and almond jelly. Our drinks came out looking a little light. Both of them tasted watered down, not like milk teas but more like water. I was so disappointed because we stood in line for it. I'm not sure if choosing the almond milk made it taste watered down, but it really lacked flavor. I did however, like the almond jelly.

excerpts: I ordered a Earl Grey milk tea with almond jelly (75% sugar), and my friend ordered a Hong Kong style milk tea with boba (25% sugar).
earl grey.author: Julie Z.
earl grey.review:
Had my first Boba Guys experience here recently and am now dying to go back to try more drinks! I ordered a Earl Grey milk tea with almond jelly (75% sugar), and my friend ordered a Hong Kong style milk tea with boba (25% sugar). Both were delicious! 

Boba Guys is known for using real tea, not powders, and I could really tell! The tea was of excellent quality, and the homemade almond jelly really tastes of almond and adds a nice texture to the drink. 

Service was super friendly and quick! There's often a line out the door, but it moves really fast and the drink is worth the few minute wait.

This location is in a prime spot on Valencia Street in the Mission District, near many shops and restaurants, perfect to stop in for a quick drink!

excerpts: I usually go for the more "traditional" teas like Jasmine and Earl Grey, but I love their Horchata and Lavender Black as well!
I LOVE that they use real, loose-leaf teas.
I also appreciate that they use real milk and even offer dairy-free options for the lactose intolerant who still want to enjoy milk tea.
Their drinks taste freshly made and high quality.
They are also one of the few places I've found that offer almond pudding (house made) as one of their toppings.
If you enjoy almond pudding like I do, definitely give it a try with your drink here!
I really love it in my Jasmine Milk Tea.
If you're a milk tea connoisseur, this place is DEFINITELY worth checking out!
earl grey.author: Carole Y.
earl grey.review:
My favorite boba joint to date!

Their menu offers a variety of teas, but it's not so extensive that indecisive people like me get perplexed just looking at it. I usually go for the more "traditional" teas like Jasmine and Earl Grey, but I love their Horchata and Lavender Black as well! I LOVE that they use real, loose-leaf teas. I also appreciate that they use real milk and even offer dairy-free options for the lactose intolerant who still want to enjoy milk tea. Their drinks taste freshly made and high quality. 
They are also one of the few places I've found that offer almond pudding (house made) as one of their toppings. If you enjoy almond pudding like I do, definitely give it a try with your drink here! I really love it in my Jasmine Milk Tea.
If you're a milk tea connoisseur, this place is DEFINITELY worth checking out!

excerpts: Favorites are Earl Grey from the slow bar, Matcha Green Tea Latte, and Jasmine Milk Tea.
All delicioso!
Sucks that this place is $5 a cup though :(
They should consider doing a stamp card like Quickly's and all the other boba places!
earl grey.author: Angela L.
earl grey.review:
For the most part this place is pretty consistent. I've sometimes had waaaay too sweet drinks, and then when I ask for less sugar, they're like super watered down.

Favorites are Earl Grey from the slow bar, Matcha Green Tea Latte, and Jasmine Milk Tea. All delicioso! Sucks that this place is $5 a cup though :( They should consider doing a stamp card like Quickly's and all the other boba places!

excerpts: I've been to the Stockton location a few times and tried different drinks such as classic, jasmine, earl grey, and oolong all with regular sweetness, less ice, and boba.
Hojicha is a stronger version of jasmine tea
so I was expecting more flavor.
earl grey.author: Danae L.
earl grey.review:
Their classic milk tea is awesome and I should probably stick with that from now on.

I've been to the Stockton location a few times and tried different drinks such as classic, jasmine, earl grey, and oolong all with regular sweetness, less ice, and boba.
Hojicha is a stronger version of jasmine tea so I was expecting more flavor. I'm guessing this tea isn't their forte since I barely tasted any tea. 

If you have a choice, I would recommend visiting the Stockton location instead. There are more pedestrians given that it's near Union Square.

excerpts: I also ordered the earl grey tea with almond jelly and the tea itself wasn't too tasty either.
It had a hint of the earl grey tea but lots of sugar (I ordered it at 50% sweetness).
I also ordered the strawberry matcha tea.
That was good.
earl grey.author: Michael S.
earl grey.review:
Went to "the best boba in town" stated by some yelpers. I wasn't impressed. The 3 stars is for quickness and friendliness of the staff. Although there was a small line the staff was quick at taking orders and completing the order. I ordered 3 drinks. 

What I didn't like was the actual products. I love horchata and so I ordered it. It did not taste like horchata at all!!! It tasted more like Vietnamese coffee but watered down. I also ordered the earl grey tea with almond jelly and the tea itself wasn't too tasty either. It had a hint of the earl grey tea but lots of sugar (I ordered it at 50% sweetness). I also ordered the strawberry matcha tea. That was good. No complaints there. 

So 1/3 teas I ordered was to my liking. I hope I find a better places during my visit to SF otherwise I will stay in OC lol

excerpts: I ordered the Earl Grey with boba at 75% sweetness and I have never loved boba more.
Earl Grey is my favorite tea and I would've never thought to drink it iced with pearls
but I swear to you, it works.
IT WORKS.
The tea tasted like it was steeped perfectly and the boba was just right.
My only complaint?
That there isn't a Boba Guys where I live.
earl grey.author: Alex Q.
earl grey.review: After reading Stacy Y.'s review of this place, I knew I had to check it out. I ordered the Earl Grey with boba at 75% sweetness and I have never loved boba more. Earl Grey is my favorite tea and I would've never thought to drink it iced with pearls but I swear to you, it works. IT WORKS. The tea tasted like it was steeped perfectly and the boba was just right. My only complaint? That there isn't a Boba Guys where I live.

excerpts: My Thai Iced Tea tasted like water and the Earl Grey tasted like eraser.
Would not come back
earl grey.author: Catherine S.
earl grey.review: Not sure why this place is so hyped. My Thai Iced Tea tasted like water and the Earl Grey tasted like eraser. Would not come back

excerpts: Earl Grey Milk Tea with Boba (from their premium drinks list)
earl grey.author: Jash P.
earl grey.review:
Drinks: Earl Grey Milk Tea with Boba (from their premium drinks list) 

Takes: Finally found their store front! I've been to their pop up location in Berkeley (holla to that delicious alcoholic boba horchata nigori over there) I loved how they don't use the powder stuff to make their drinks. Boba was chewy. The only downside is the price. As other yelpers have mentioned, I honestly don't think it's worth the $5 sticker price, but that must cover the higher quality ingredients they use.

Service: The guy making the drinks was the same one from the pop up location! Pretty chill dude, and he answered questions customers had regarding the drinks as well as how this business came about.

Parking: street parking 

Price: Drinks range from $4-$5 each depending whether you get premium or not.

Bottom line: Go here for your unique premium boba drinks fix!

excerpts: I usually can't even pretend to justify paying 5 bucks for boba, but I'd do it all day erry day for more of your muscat and earl grey Boba Guys.
Please, send someone to the NYC shop to fix it because they are behind, my friend.
Also, put one in Flushing or something, so I can go more often.
Also, while I'm wishing for things, I want a unicorn and a date with Daisy Ridley, Santa.
Sincerely, Ruobin.
earl grey.author: Ruobin W.
earl grey.review: The tea, the milk, the boba, the crazy hipster gourmet flavor - all so good, it'll blow your mind. I usually can't even pretend to justify paying 5 bucks for boba, but I'd do it all day erry day for more of your muscat and earl grey Boba Guys. Please, send someone to the NYC shop to fix it because they are behind, my friend. Also, put one in Flushing or something, so I can go more often. Also, while I'm wishing for things, I want a unicorn and a date with Daisy Ridley, Santa. Sincerely, Ruobin.

excerpts:
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
earl grey.author: Kitty K.
earl grey.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: I had a matcha latte with boba and tried some of the earl grey.
The boba was the perfect amount of sweet, right amount of warmth, and had the perfect chewy texture.
earl grey.author: Steven V.
earl grey.review:
Best boba in SF and some of the best I've ever had! 

This tiny shop is almost a boba booth, with only a few seats inside and outside. It's pretty modern and hipster, so it's a perfect fit for the mission. 

We went right at opening, so we had to wait a bit while they were still making the boba. I had a matcha latte with boba and tried some of the earl grey. The boba was the perfect amount of sweet, right amount of warmth, and had the perfect chewy texture. The drink wasn't too sweet and quite refreshing. 

High quality drinks and boba!

excerpts: Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye.
I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each):
Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.
earl grey.author: Jennifer L.
earl grey.review:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!

excerpts:
Super flavorful and fresh
- Earl Grey tea is incredibly fragrant
- Honey black tea is fresh too
- cute cups and logo
- (only?)
earl grey.author: Jiann M.
earl grey.review:
Pros:
- premium teas are great! Super flavorful and fresh
- Earl Grey tea is incredibly fragrant
- Honey black tea is fresh too
- cute cups and logo
- (only?) decent place in the Mission
- not sickeningly sweet (I can get 50% sweetness here, but have to get 30% elsewhere)

Cons:
- boba is alright (a bit too firm and not as chewy as I would like)
- their regular milk tea is just not great. The tea isn't that fresh and the finished product isn't that creamy.... it almost tastes watered down
- the milk doesn't blend well with the tea-- it just tastes like milk AND tea, but they don't work together to produce a full, creamy product

Bottom line: They make a decent milk tea, which I believe is above the San Francisco average. But, they're also quite pricey for the quantity. I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to come here, but it's still a solid place to go if you're already in the area.

excerpts: I got the earl grey 75% sweet with boba.
Idk if it's cuz i got 75% but it tasted rather bland and not that flavorful.
It's like a hint of earl grey.
Okay their boba quality is good but just as how any descent boba place make their boba.
I would give 2 stars for this drink
I got
but I feel like other drinks here might taste better
so I give it a 3.
earl grey.author: Irene L.
earl grey.review:
I heard so much about boba guys that I was really excited to try it out!
But it was disappointing. I got the earl grey 75% sweet with boba. 
Idk if it's cuz i got 75% but it tasted rather bland and not that flavorful. It's like a hint of earl grey.
Okay their boba quality is good but just as how any descent boba place make their boba. 
I would give 2 stars for this drink I got but I feel like other drinks here might taste better so I give it a 3.

excerpts: I was deciding between Jasmine Milk Tea, Duke of Earl Grey, and Rose Tea
and since this was my first time here, I decided to go simple and get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.

JASMINE MILK TEA W/ BOBA
Was a hefty $4 and though it was good, it wasn't $4 good.
You can taste both the jasmine and the milk tea without either flavor overwhelming the other.
But the boba was... interesting.
I have mixed feelings toward it.
It hardened a bit
so it wasn't fresh
and if you're going to call yourself "Boba Guys", ya better have some good boba!
But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea.
Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm...
We'll see how this goes.
But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea.
Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm...
We'll see how this goes.
earl grey.author: Sandy T.
earl grey.review:
I finally made it out to Boba Guys! I was deciding between Jasmine Milk Tea, Duke of Earl Grey, and Rose Tea and since this was my first time here, I decided to go simple and get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.

JASMINE MILK TEA W/ BOBA
Was a hefty $4 and though it was good, it wasn't $4 good. You can taste both the jasmine and the milk tea without either flavor overwhelming the other. But the boba was... interesting. I have mixed feelings toward it. It hardened a bit so it wasn't fresh and if you're going to call yourself "Boba Guys", ya better have some good boba! It did have an interesting chew to it though, almost like the Hi-Chew candy.

With this drink alone, Boba Guys did not win me over. But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea. Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm... We'll see how this goes. Until next time!

TIP: Watch out for the step! I didn't realize it was there when I was leaving and tweaked my ankle a bit. Thankfully, I wasn't hurt for more than two minutes but do be careful.

excerpts: * Earl Grey milk tea ($5, includes choice of one add in.
The pearls are cooked to perfection; soft, chewy, sweet and fresh.
The tea was excellent too, smooth and not bitter.
