The drink had a nice creaminess.
I asked for it less sweet...still found it a little sweeter than I'd prefer so I might ask for half as sweet next time.
They didn't add much ice (yay) but the downside was that the drink could have been colder.
Also they could be better organized.
earl grey.author: Lolia S.
earl grey.review:
I'm definitely happy to see that Boba Guys now has a brick and mortar location of their own. The quality of their boba drinks is much better than average. They brew their tea using organic Five Mountains Tea, and add Straus organic milk and housemade syrup.

They don't have as many flavors but I like how the emphasis is on quality not quantity. The drinks come in one size (the usual size not the crazy huge size that has become popular) and are priced at $4 and up. Brewed to order drinks ($5) take a little more time. The price includes an add in (boba, housemade almond jelly, grass jelly, aloe vera) though coffee jelly costs extra.

* Earl Grey milk tea ($5, includes choice of one add in. The pearls are cooked to perfection; soft, chewy, sweet and fresh. The tea was excellent too, smooth and not bitter. The drink had a nice creaminess. I asked for it less sweet...still found it a little sweeter than I'd prefer so I might ask for half as sweet next time. They didn't add much ice (yay) but the downside was that the drink could have been colder. Also they could be better organized. The person who ordered a slow bar drink after me got her drink before me.

Boba Guys is open Friday - Sunday only for now. Later they'll add macarons and cupcakes. It's a cute spot, mostly white with wood. There are only has four chairs. Boba Guys drinks are also available at Suika.

excerpts: I always get the regular earl grey milk tea, 30%, with boba every single time.
Ever since I tried this drink, this is the only drink I will ever get because it never fails me.
I would say try to avoid the almond milk substitution because the taste is not for everyone.
I've tried the strawberry matcha and Muscat oolong and they are both good, but Earl grey milk tea wins every time.
In fact, im craving one as I write this review!
earl grey.author: Michelle O.
earl grey.review: This is my absolute favorite boba shop ever. Sometimes there can be a long line depending on the time you go, but it's always worth the wait. I always get the regular earl grey milk tea, 30%, with boba every single time. Ever since I tried this drink, this is the only drink I will ever get because it never fails me. I would say try to avoid the almond milk substitution because the taste is not for everyone. I've tried the strawberry matcha and Muscat oolong and they are both good, but Earl grey milk tea wins every time. In fact, im craving one as I write this review!

excerpts: I ordered Classic Milk Tea with boba, 75% sweet and he ordered Duke of Earl Grey with boba, 100% sweet.
earl grey.author: Annaliese D.
earl grey.review:
The fiance and I had been eyeing Boba Guys since they were a pop-up shop a few years ago. We didn't make it in until this past weekend when we visited their shop in the Mission. There was a slight line out the door, but it moved pretty fast. I ordered Classic Milk Tea with boba, 75% sweet and he ordered Duke of Earl Grey with boba, 100% sweet.

They use organic Straus milk and I think it does make a different in the taste. It is very milky, but the tea flavor was strong as well. Some of the tapioca pearls were a little hard and they were also an odd size, which caused them to get clogged in the straw. 

Overall, it was a good cup of boba, but at $4+ each a little pricy except as a special treat.

excerpts:
I ordered Duke Earl Grey Tea with tapioca and it came out to $5 flat. 

The earl grey flavor was present in my drink but wasn't Asian sweet like I thought it may have been or expected it to be.
earl grey.author: Yeanne L.
earl grey.review:
This place has definitely been a hype for my friends to go to, however, it is just so out of the way from the Sunset to try a beverage that may not meet your expectations..

But luckily enough! I have a friend who works nearby. We came in around 6:30pm to 7pm and it was totally empty. We were greeted by the two workers behind the cash machine. The drinks on the menu were all $4 and the slow-brewed teas were a dollar extra. I ordered Duke Earl Grey Tea with tapioca and it came out to $5 flat. 

I was a bit surprised for what the price turned out to be for a 16oz beverage at an Asian fusion place. The earl grey flavor was present in my drink but wasn't Asian sweet like I thought it may have been or expected it to be. 

Probably won't be back but happy I got to cross this place off my list. I use foursquare and several of my friends have visited this place, after trying it out, I see why they've only visited once.. haha just kidding.

excerpts: Couple of my favorites are the Hong Kong, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Earl Grey.
They have options on sugar levels.
I take my friends here and they usually get something different from me and they end up loving their drink.
They can do wrong.
My friends like jellys in their boba which they say are good, but I always get boba balls.
Let me tell you their boba balls are made to perfection.
Not too chewy or hard.
Perfectly made.
earl grey.author: Soroosh A.
earl grey.review:
My favorite boba place in SF, in CA, and therefore my favorite boba place anywhere. Their diverse menu has led me to drink a plethora of their boba which have been amazing. Couple of my favorites are the Hong Kong, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Earl Grey. They have options on sugar levels. I take my friends here and they usually get something different from me and they end up loving their drink. They can do wrong. My friends like jellys in their boba which they say are good, but I always get boba balls. Let me tell you their boba balls are made to perfection. Not too chewy or hard. Perfectly made. If you like boba you must go here. 

Con: there lines are ridiculously long. I hate to wait but they are worth the wait....granted after waiting that long I usually end up getting two boba's.

excerpts: The next few times I came by, I tried the earl grey with boba, regular milk tea, and hong kong milk tea.
They were all alright, but what keeps me coming back is their Hong Kong milk tea!
My favorite.
Nice tea flavor that you can taste and chewy boba!
earl grey.author: Christina C.
earl grey.review: When I first came to this place, I was quite unimpressed, especially since it's on the pricier side and very hipster. I love matcha and so that was the very first drink I ordered. Boba was good and chewy! Drink was too sweet, but I usually am a little sensitive to sweetness so I go for less sweet in my drinks when I can. The next few times I came by, I tried the earl grey with boba, regular milk tea, and hong kong milk tea. They were all alright, but what keeps me coming back is their Hong Kong milk tea! My favorite. Nice tea flavor that you can taste and chewy boba!

excerpts: Earl Grey Milk tea: This is my staple order at any milk tea place that would serve it.
I've tried it EVERYWHERE.
You can say I'm a bit of a harlot for earl grey milk tea...
I've been everywhere for it.
Well, Boba Guys destroyed this drink.
Good job.
B for effort.
It was too watery; had a sharp hint of lychee; had a gross accent of lavender, which I now assume they used the BUTT of all teas--TAZO.. or
they used the post 2012 Mighty Leaf version of Earl Grey... which is beyond butt.. and I distinctly remember that nightmare to this day, and I slightly relived it in this milk tea.
And the tea to mlik to water ratio was obviously wrong.
earl grey.author: Gregory F.
earl grey.review:
Gimmick or the real deal? 

It's a gimmick. And it's hype. People are just convincing themselve it's good because of the marketing (that's marketing anyway). I don't know which is worse, Tea Pumps or this place. And if you think Tea Pumps is good, you're not Asian enough or you're too Americanized to know what is "good." (Americanized versions of Asian things are always bad if you've tried the Asian-original, whether it be movies or food) And Tea Pumps and Boba Guys are oviously the PF Changs of Chinese food. "chinese" food.

For a company that markets themselves as meticulous guys scientifically crafting the best milk tea recipes, I'd say these scientists missed the mark pretty hard. I think it was not so much meticulous crafting, but more just a few guys in a kitchen mixing stuff together without the slightest culinary skill or wit whatsover... like college dorm kids that don't know how to cook or mix flavors... because these are by far the worst ratios and recipes I've ever had, aside from Tea Pumps.  

Political news needs to fact-check, BobaGuys needs to flavor-check. But they really need to think about flavors not so much in a scientific process. It's also wit and experience in a culinary sense. Like I said, it's like college dorm kids without the slightest sophistication of taste or the slightest art of cooking trying to play with a bunch of beakers n pans. Mixing flavors and devising combinations is wit and intuition, not calculation and process.

-------------
I came in with a large party and tried several flavors:

Jasmine milk tea: I often jude a milk tea shop by this standard. It's classic, simple, but takes understanding of milk tea to get it PROPERLY made. Well, these guys managed to screw this up. 3 of us ordered it just to be sure. And yes, they all came out identically disgusting.  -- too watery, yet milk to tea ratio... too much milk--so it tasted plain. 75% sweet. 100% sweet. Both pointless It's like adding more sugar to water. The tea was standard jasmine but more importantly, the ratios were all wrong. 

Earl Grey Milk tea: This is my staple order at any milk tea place that would serve it. I've tried it EVERYWHERE. You can say I'm a bit of a harlot for earl grey milk tea... I've been everywhere for it. Well, Boba Guys destroyed this drink. Good job. B for effort. 
It was too watery; had a sharp hint of lychee; had a gross accent of lavender, which I now assume they used the BUTT of all teas--TAZO.. or they used the post 2012 Mighty Leaf version of Earl Grey... which is beyond butt.. and I distinctly remember that nightmare to this day, and I slightly relived it in this milk tea. And the tea to mlik to water ratio was obviously wrong. It just did NOT taste good.

Horchatta Milk tea: not bad. not great. It was like a watery Horchatta with boba. Not so great. They're better off with the store-bought and just throwing boba in it. They don't know how to make horchatta properly.

Hong Kong Style: This was their best drink out of the lot. Surprisingly, for such a terrible milk tea place that Americanized the milk tea industry like Tea Pumps, which just means... detroying it.... they managed to get HONG KONG STYLE pretty good. I tried this one last in the lot... maybe anything par would seem good.

I'm not a fan of Quickly's or TapEx, but there are a few with owners that really know how to make it. But I've also had the worst of the lot, to the point of spitting it back into the cup and chucking it into the trash. And Boba Guys, along with Tea Pumps, are in a tight race for the worst.

excerpts: Earl grey tea with Boba is my favorite!
earl grey.author: Kit T.
earl grey.review:
The Mission badly needed a great boba tea joint and this is IT. 
Earl grey tea with Boba is my favorite!

excerpts: Loved the earl grey tea.
This boba is the best I've ever had.
Better than my usual Wonderful Foods in the Sunset.
It's pricier than most boba shops, but the quality makes up for it.
earl grey.author: Laurie M.
earl grey.review: Loved the earl grey tea. This boba is the best I've ever had. Better than my usual Wonderful Foods in the Sunset. It's pricier than most boba shops, but the quality makes up for it.

excerpts: *Earl Grey: Soooooo good
earl grey.author: Kathy Y.
earl grey.review:
I LOVE BOBA GUYS.

Let's get it straight, it's not your typical boba joint and it does cost a bit more, but it's SO WORTH IT. I am not someone who has to get their daily/weekly boba fix (seriously, I get almond milk instead of real milk), but I come here every time I visit SF. The employees are super nice and they are all about organics, so what's not to love??

*Iced Matcha Latte: My fave
*Thai Tea: Dee-lish
*Earl Grey: Soooooo good
*Muscat Oolong: Yuuumm

excerpts: Hubby got the duke of earl grey with dairy milk.
earl grey.author: Faten A.
earl grey.review:
Got the coconut green tea with almond milk. Hubby got the duke of earl grey with dairy milk. Both with tapioca balls.

Good stuff!!!
Really friendly staff.
This is going to develop into an addiction I can just feel it.

excerpts: The honey did not stand out in the golden honey black tea - and neither did the tea for that matter.
golden honey black tea.author: Jocelyn K.
golden honey black tea.review:
I have been to boba guys a few times now and honestly, I do not get the hype at all. I am starting to think that people only like this place because it is one of the few places in the mission that has boba and that you can stand in line without feeling embarrassed that you are surrounded by middle schoolers. In terms of the quality of the drink, I find boba guys super disappointing.

I have had the golden honey black milk tea and the horchata milk tea and in both cases, the drinks tasted very watered down. The honey did not stand out in the golden honey black tea - and neither did the tea for that matter. The horchata was really only ok.

However, the texture of the boba is very good, chewy but not too soft or hard. Also, the service has always been really good and the cashier extremely pleasant to talk to. They also sell small batch cotton candy from local makers, sugar and spun (I met them at a food truck fair before and they seem super nice) which I love.

In terms of the ambiance, the place has no seating and can get super crowded. There is usually a line and there is no parking. It is more expensive than a regular boba place but it does have a hipster vibe. Generally I would say pass to boba guys unless you have some out of town guest that you are afraid will judge you for bringing them to a less hipster (more authentic or teeny boppy) boba place. If you want good boba, better to go to the sunset or richmond.

excerpts: I got the golden honey black tea, and although my taste buds aren't refined enough to differentiate the many subtleties they talked about (the golden tips are the sweetest part of the tea leaf and creates the honey-like taste and the rest flew over my head), I did enjoy my tea and was excited when I caught onto the sweet aftertaste.
golden honey black tea.author: Wendy W.
golden honey black tea.review:
Ahhhh the Boba Guys! I totally love this place--the vibe, the decor, the aardvark cups--it's the tea equivalent to the trendy hipster San Franciscan coffee house, minus the pretentiousness. 

I was pleasantly surprised when my friends and I got to catch the owners working the time we went in (see Sabrina C.'s review). They were super friendly and patient as they helped me make my choice as to what to order, and really helped make our experience (especially since we were showing visiting friends around SF). 

I got the golden honey black tea, and although my taste buds aren't refined enough to differentiate the many subtleties they talked about (the golden tips are the sweetest part of the tea leaf and creates the honey-like taste and the rest flew over my head), I did enjoy my tea and was excited when I caught onto the sweet aftertaste. It was pricey, but worth it. 

To me, the fact that they really stand behind the quality of their teas ("If you don't like it, we'll make you anything else on the menu, whatever you want!")  means a lot and isn't something you always find at a PMT/boba place. 

Watery? A bit, but that's only because they use milk and not cream, and real tea rather than powder--the way that tea should be.

excerpts: My friend and I asked about the Golden Honey Black Tea and why it was more expensive than the rest, and he happily gave us a background of the tea and what makes it so special (basically, this tea is made up of the tips aka the most expensive part of the leaf, which produces a honey-like sweetness when brewed).
He told us that if we're tea enthusiasts then we would be able to tell the difference, and encouraged us to try it.
golden honey black tea.author: Sabrina C.
golden honey black tea.review:
Small shop, but the guys who work here are so welcoming it's crazy. Upon ordering, the man behind the register introduced himself and a fellow barista as the owners, and gave a brief introduction to the shop and the organic, fresh ingredients they use (no creamer!). My friend and I asked about the Golden Honey Black Tea and why it was more expensive than the rest, and he happily gave us a background of the tea and what makes it so special (basically, this tea is made up of the tips aka the most expensive part of the leaf, which produces a honey-like sweetness when brewed). He told us that if we're tea enthusiasts then we would be able to tell the difference, and encouraged us to try it. If we didn't like it, he pointed to the sign posted on the wall that dictated their promise to make any drink on the menu for us if we didn't like what we got. 

Since he was so convincing, both of us decided to try it, Golden Honey Black Milk Tea with half sugar and pearls, and neither of us were disappointed. At first, it tasted kind of watery, but it occurred to me that this was due to the fact that they use fresh milk instead of creamer, which gives milk tea that thicker consistency, so I shifted my focus onto the tea instead. You really could taste the difference in this type of black tea; the aftertaste was indeed much sweeter, though not sugary, making this a very light and refreshing drink on a surprisingly warm San Francisco day.

Another thing -- they sell Sunny Hills Pineapple Cakes!! These are my favorite pineapple cakes that I'm only able to find in Taiwan, and I usually bring back boxes and boxes of these when either my mom or I get the chance to go visit family, so it's amazing to see that this cute little boba joint sells this too! I'm not sure how fresh it is though, but now that I know that Boba Guys carries this, I know where to get my hands on one if I ever get a craving. THANKS BOBA GUYS!!

excerpts: Golden Honey black tea iced (slow bar)
- this was ok.
Made the mistake of ordering without sugar.
golden honey black tea.author: Stephanie C.
golden honey black tea.review:
Regular milk tea with pearls (less sweet) - decently strong tea flavor. Pearls were just right in chewiness and sweetness. Overall not as good in my opinion as other reviews seem to rate it.

Golden Honey black tea iced (slow bar) - this was ok. Made the mistake of ordering without sugar. Even so, not mind blowing.

This place is pretty good but don't think it lives up to all the hype. I actually prefer ShareTea in San Mateo or Tea Island in Fremont.

excerpts: I actually did take advantage of it one day, ordering the golden honey black tea.
I was pleasantly surprised.

Not only was the cashier (a guy this time) much more friendly, but the drink was much better--it was not half filled with ice, requesting light sweet actually resulted in a light sweet drink, the boba texture was also much more consistent.
golden honey black tea.author: Chris L.
golden honey black tea.review: Updating my rating to 4 stars. After my disappointing initial experience, the owners actually reached out to apologize and offer me a "make good" drink on them so I could try it again. I actually did take advantage of it one day, ordering the golden honey black tea. I was pleasantly surprised. Not only was the cashier (a guy this time) much more friendly, but the drink was much better--it was not half filled with ice, requesting light sweet actually resulted in a light sweet drink, the boba texture was also much more consistent.

excerpts: Got the basic milk tea, coffee milk tea, and golden honey black tea.
Their drinks aren't bad at all, they definitely taste like real tea, made with real effort, but I feel the tea-milk-syrup ratios are a little off.
Maybe just my taste.
The coffee milk tea is cool because they definitely use cold-brew coffee to mix with tea, but again, the ratios are off.
I like cold brew coffee, but it tends to be more acidic, and their recipe doesn't balance out the sourness of the cold brew's acidity.
It doesn't beat a milk tea with a shot of espresso.
The golden honey black tea, one of their special, "slow brewed" to-order teas, just tasted like a milk tea with honey..good, but not worth $5.
golden honey black tea.author: Peter N.
golden honey black tea.review:
3.5
Been here a few times, and based on their style, presentation, and philosophy, I wanted to really like this place, but they're just not quite there. 

Got the basic milk tea, coffee milk tea, and golden honey black tea.  Their drinks aren't bad at all, they definitely taste like real tea, made with real effort, but I feel the tea-milk-syrup ratios are a little off. Maybe just my taste. The boba itself was awesome though, chewy, and just sweet enough to complement the drink.

The coffee milk tea is cool because they definitely use cold-brew coffee to mix with tea, but again, the ratios are off. I like cold brew coffee, but it tends to be more acidic, and their recipe doesn't balance out the sourness of the cold brew's acidity. It doesn't beat a milk tea with a shot of espresso. The golden honey black tea, one of their special, "slow brewed" to-order teas, just tasted like a milk tea with honey..good, but not worth $5. 

Again, I love their style, commitment to using organic ingredients, and I can appreciate the hipster, "third wave" kind of approach to brewing milk teas, especially in the Mission. It just hasn't translated into great tasting tea that could stand out in an oversaturated boba market. I'll keep coming back to support the biz because I believe in the potential. And because I go into the Mission a lot. In the meantime I hope they're seeking and being receptive to feedback that could improve their recipes.

excerpts: But, my Indian Chai really hit the spot.
indian chai.author: Lilian L.
indian chai.review:
Yes, overhyped. But, I really liked my drink.

Still probably not the best milk tea place out there.

Went here about a month ago, came up to hang out with my partner's grandma.

***

My partner and I just came from Serrano's and got this before seeing our first movie in theaters together (and it was a terrible movie, my friends). 

But, my Indian Chai really hit the spot.

excerpts: Favorites are the Indian Chai with Almond Jelly and Tapioca and Black Milk Tea, and the Matcha Almond Latte (or Matcha Strawberry).
indian chai.author: Jess C.
indian chai.review:
I forgot to update this review! 

Boba Guys may have had a slow start but I love this place. Favorites are the Indian Chai with Almond Jelly and Tapioca and Black Milk Tea, and the Matcha Almond Latte (or Matcha Strawberry). Although everything is good (except I'm not a huge fan of the HK milk and the Thai Tea - too sweet). 

I love that they offer Califia Farms Almond Milk. Pro tip - ask for it less sweet I go for 25-50% depending on what I order. 

Make sure to try their homemade almond jelly!

Pro-tip: Get the Hong Kong toast is served on thick cut brioche bread and topped with a heavenly condensed milk cream spread and honey.

excerpts: INDIAN CHAI (??)
--but
it was freshly-brewed in front of me on what they term their "slow bar.
indian chai.author: Adele F.
indian chai.review:
My relationship with my Boba Guys drink was positively correlated: the more I drank the drink, the more I liked it.

I guess that's like some of my relationships with people. Don't worry, I'm not a vampire...I think.

I can't quite recall what specific drink I had--perhaps their $4.50 (?) INDIAN CHAI (??)--but it was freshly-brewed in front of me on what they term their "slow bar." The tea is tasty, but they're way too generous with their ice, so much so that I had to ask them to remove a chunk for me because it was just getting all up in my boba business.

Irritating ice aside, Boba Guys' tapioca pearls are definitely the best I've had. I've stopped consuming chewy balls, for health reasons (don't even), but I would make an exception for Boba Guys' balls.

I just like saying that. ;)

excerpts: Binky ordered a HK style MT with boba and I ordered the Indian Chai with boba.
WOW, both drinks were SUCH a treat.
The tea was wonderfully strong (and very high quality...) and the cream was fresh, thick and delicious -- EVERYTHING we could have ever asked in a boba drink and MORE.
The boba in my drink was a tinnnnnnnnnny bit inconsistent (some tapioca balls were harder than others...)
but the drink was so delicious (overall) that I hardly cared (big deal for me since I LOVE boba and could eat it on its own.....).
Binky and I normally prefer to go to more traditional boba locations.
We have tried similar locations (probably Boba Guys knock-offs) in San Jose but have never been too impressed.
Boba Guys has changed the game for us -- can't wait to be back!
indian chai.author: Christine H.
indian chai.review:
Binky and I have heard so many good things about Boba Guys for WAY too long! Finally, this past weekend, Binky and I decided to grab some tacos and boba in the Mission. When we got to the location (very, very small), we were taken aback by how LONG the line was. Binky was a little hesitant to wait ~25 min for boba (we parked in 2 hour parking....). However, the boba fanatic in me persevered and I was able to whine about this "once in a lifetime" chance until Binky relented. 

Boba Guys has SUCH interesting flavors. Binky ordered a HK style MT with boba and I ordered the Indian Chai with boba. WOW, both drinks were SUCH a treat. The tea was wonderfully strong (and very high quality...) and the cream was fresh, thick and delicious -- EVERYTHING we could have ever asked in a boba drink and MORE. The boba in my drink was a tinnnnnnnnnny bit inconsistent (some tapioca balls were harder than others...) but the drink was so delicious (overall) that I hardly cared (big deal for me since I LOVE boba and could eat it on its own.....). Binky and I normally prefer to go to more traditional boba locations. We have tried similar locations (probably Boba Guys knock-offs) in San Jose but have never been too impressed. Boba Guys has changed the game for us -- can't wait to be back!

excerpts: I had the Indian chai with 75% sweetener, which is the recommended amount.
Next time I will go for 50% sweetener, though the 75% wasn't sickeningly sweet.
I can't wait to be back.
indian chai.author: Serena L.
indian chai.review: This was the best boba tea experience of my life. I can't wait to come back for the matcha flavor. I had the Indian chai with 75% sweetener, which is the recommended amount. Next time I will go for 50% sweetener, though the 75% wasn't sickeningly sweet.  I can't wait to be back.

excerpts: They've got some other really interesting flavors we wanted to try like Camomile Mint, Lychee Green Tea, Indian Chai, and Roe Black Tea.
indian chai.author: Cara O.
indian chai.review:
Did I just drive down to the Mission so that I could get milk tea from Boba Guys? Yeah, I did, and I would do it again.

I first discovered Boba Guys after a night out in the Mission getting my Wing Wednesday on, down the street. Of course, when we saw this ultra hipster boba spot, we just had to try it. I originally got the Duke of Earl Grey Milk Tea w/Boba ($4.45), which was absolutely delicious.

Today, I drove down with my roommate because we just had to get out of the library. I was surprised to see that the line went well out the door. However, the staff were all very quick and kind. I got the Iced Matcha Latte w/ Boba ($4.50) and my roommate got the Horchata w/Boba ($4.50). I know it's a little pricey, but you can taste it in the quality of the tea and the boba. I really liked the Matcha Latte, it certainly had a very strong matcha taste, and didn't taste watered down at all like other milk teas. You could tell this tea was made with love! 

They've got some other really interesting flavors we wanted to try like Camomile Mint, Lychee Green Tea, Indian Chai, and Roe Black Tea. Their almond jelly and grass jelly are made in-house, AND you can have the option between Straus Family Organic Milk, Almond Milk, or Organic Soy Milk. 

Yep, totally worth the drive.

excerpts: There are numbers of selection from Thai Tea, black tea, oolong, and even Indian Chai (rare at tapioca tea place).
Milk includes regular milk, almond milk, and soy milk.
Toppings include tapioca, almond jelly, and grass jelly.
indian chai.author: Charles S.
indian chai.review:
High quality tea and milk.  There are numbers of selection from Thai Tea, black tea, oolong, and even Indian Chai (rare at tapioca tea place).  Milk includes regular milk, almond milk, and soy milk.  Toppings include tapioca, almond jelly, and grass jelly.  For desserts, there are Hong Kong style French toast and Kaya toast from Malaysia/Singapore.  Also, you can buy tea leaf by pounds.

I drink Chai without sugar the most and taste is authentic.

excerpts: This includes Indian Chai, Jasmine Green tea, various milk teas etc.
indian chai.author: Jake N.
indian chai.review:
I was very impressed with this place. It is the best boba tea I have had so far in San Francisco.

They offer a range of interesting flavors, including decaf (which some other places don't have). This includes Indian Chai, Jasmine Green tea, various milk teas etc.

The boba balls themselves are delicious, chewy and flavorful, while still fairly soft. I had them in a warm tea, which was a new experience and great for a cold afternoon. I am really looking forward to going back.

excerpts: The premium Indian Chai and Rose Black Tea stand apart as original and astonishingly rich blends.
The chai blend achieves the ideal balance between sugar and spice without sweetener.
indian chai.author: Julia-Rose K.
indian chai.review:
Locals and visitors alike line up out the door and down the block outside of the self-proclaimed tea bar with the "highest quality boba in San Francisco," drawing customers off the Mission's populous Valencia Street.
Patient patrons enter into a minimalist white-on-wooden motif tea bar to try Boba Guys'  impressive boba tea selection, facing a black on white decal of the shop's boba-slurping anteater mascot.
The boba -- chewy, honey-soaked tapioca pearls that add both texture and flavor to each drink -- are not the only item that gives Boba Guys bragging rights. A variety of incomparably revitalizing house-made tea blends sets Boba Guys apart from other Bay Area boba joints.
Boba Guys offers both heated and iced drinks from a menu of year-round flavors like jasmine, horchata and "classic milk," and a choice between three additions -- referred to as toppings -- include its popular tapioca pearls and house-made grass and almond jellies.
While most boba shops in the Bay Area rely heavily on artificial syrups and flavorings, Boba Guys' use of natural and organic resources captures distinct flavors. Real jasmine, rose, strawberry and lavender exemplify the best of its signature and seasonal blends.
Nervous first-time visitors might want to start with the Jasmine Milk Tea, its flavor a step above the basic, but no-less-tasty Classic Milk Tea.
The premium Indian Chai and Rose Black Tea stand apart as original and astonishingly rich blends. The chai blend achieves the ideal balance between sugar and spice without sweetener.
Seasonal selections include a light Strawberry Jasmine Fresca, which makes for the perfect refreshment, but a large is suggested because a regular 16-ounce cup leaves the customer wanting more.
The locally-sourced organic Straus Creamery milk has a tendency to be too thick and creamy for my taste, albeit better than the Coffeemate creamer powder used by other boba tea shops. Soy milk and Califia Almondmilk are perhaps better alternative options.
A house-made simple syrup of white and brown sugars that sweetens all drinks overwhelms most tastes, but chatting with the "bobaristas" increases the customer's chances of getting the perfect level of sweetness.
Customizable high quality thirst-quenchers served with a smile from bobaristas for around $5 constitutes a steal by San Francisco standards.
Boba Guys is located at 19th and Valencia streets and on Stockton Street in Union Square. Loose-leaf tea blends are available online. The 19th Street location is open noon to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, until 10 p.m. Friday and Saturday, and 6 p.m. on Sunday. The Union Square location is open 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. on Friday, noon to 10 p.m. on Saturday, and is closed on Sunday.
- See more at: http://broadview.sacredsf.org/9190/features/tas-tea-boba/#sthash.emzNb5hl.dpuf

excerpts: I tried the Indian chai, which was pretty good, but could've easily purchased at a local Indian restaurant.
indian chai.author: Nicole F.
indian chai.review:
I honestly don't understand the huge fuss and long lines. Drinks are good, but nothing special. Very small selection. I appreciate that most things are "homemade," but at nearly $4 for the smallest size, I kinda feel like I'm at Starbucks. I tried the Indian chai, which was pretty good, but could've easily purchased at a local Indian restaurant. Boyfriend tried the horchata, and as he's a mission native, said it was good, but not much different than the local tacqueria. 

That said, try it, but don't believe the hype.

excerpts: Indian Chai with Tapioca is amazing but WATCHOUT their sweet is REALLY SWEET.
indian chai.author: Cameron M.
indian chai.review: Indian Chai with Tapioca is amazing but WATCHOUT their sweet is REALLY SWEET.

excerpts: We got the Lychee Green Tea, Strawberry Matcha, and Hong Kong Style Milk Tea.
The HK Milk Tea was flavorful, except next time I think I would go for a lower sweetness level, you definitely taste the sweetness at 100%.
lychee green tea.author: Hong L.
lychee green tea.review:
After seeing so many pictures of Boba Guys, we finally got to try it on our day in the city. We got the Lychee Green Tea, Strawberry Matcha, and Hong Kong Style Milk Tea. The HK Milk Tea was flavorful, except next time I think I would go for a lower sweetness level, you definitely taste the sweetness at 100%. Boba pearls were chewy and cooked to perfection. 

As per recommendations, Strawberry Matcha was definitely worth the try. My boyfriend really enjoyed his drink and it's something different. It's not on the menu above but when you get to the register it's posted to the side. 

Store itself is pretty small so it's more of a grab and go. Street parking so best to walk or take public transportation. Prices were reasonable and I like their anteater logo, nicely designed.

excerpts: My hubby ordered lychee green tea with black pearl.
lychee green tea.author: Jaane F.
lychee green tea.review:
I get to know this boba shop from my sister, she came here on last Monday but it closed. My hubby and I came on yesterday Sunday around 3 something. And we line for 20 minutes to get inside the shop and ordered drinks. Their shop really small and not much space you can stand or sit. The wait for getting drink wasn't too long maybe only 3-5 minutes. They are efficient once you ordered. 

I looked at their menu from their shop, I was undecided because they have so much premium tea and house special tea. Finally, I ordered classic milk tea (Decaf Black) that is non-caffeine which is really suit me. Because I cannot take coffee or stronger tea. They could make me feel very awake later. I added black pearl into my drink because they are famous with their boba. The boba is soft and sweet. I got unsweetened milk tea and less ice. I would say it's perfect for me. Because the tea don't taste sweet but with its boba, it's kind satisfied. My hubby ordered lychee green tea with black pearl. And it taste light to us.

You can choose organic milk, soy milk or almond milk. Added topping would cost $0.50. You can adjust sugar and ice level. They serve 2 sizes for hot and cold. The parking here I guess not that easy to find. We got über here so everything is easy for us, we just get down from the car and line.

I would really recommended their decaf milk tea for people who can't take caffeine because you don't really can see it much from any boba shop. I like it.

excerpts: They only have one drink that consists of fruit - Lychee green tea.
lychee green tea.author: Shelly S.
lychee green tea.review:
A little disappointed in this place. From the long line outside of this place, I'd expect their drinks to be extraordinary. I'm very picky when it comes to boba drinks, especially coming from SoCal where there are boba shops literally in every block. 

From all the Instagram and snap chat pictures, I was looking forward to my visit here. Boba guys was nothing but ordinary. I got their jasmine milk tea which is one of their most popular drinks according to yelp. I felt like this drink was a little too watered down even with light ice. The drink wasn't too sweet which I actually prefer, but it lacked flavor from both milk and green tea. 

If you're a fruity type of person, you may not find anything on the menu that you like. They only have one drink that consists of fruit - Lychee green tea. 

Boba guys is most likely a one time visit for me. Now that I've tried it, I can cross that off my bucket list.

excerpts: I decided on getting the 24 oz Lychee Green Tea with almond milk, boba, almond jelly, regular ice and 50% sweetness (only $5.45 which is actually a little less than what I paid for a similar drink at Sharetea).
It was great!
The boba was nice and chewy and the almond jelly was tasty.
Perfect for a warm afternoon.
lychee green tea.author: Hazel C.
lychee green tea.review:
Luck was evidently with me one Sunday afternoon as when we finally decided to stop by here, the line happened to be short. I didn't have to wait in line too long to get my boba fix!  It was my first time here, and everything looked good, so I wasn't sure what to get. My friend who was with me and who has been here before, told me everything she's tried here has been good, so she wasn't much help. 

I decided on getting the 24 oz Lychee Green Tea with almond milk, boba, almond jelly, regular ice and 50% sweetness (only $5.45 which is actually a little less than what I paid for a similar drink at Sharetea). It was great! The boba was nice and chewy and the almond jelly was tasty. Perfect for a warm afternoon.  There was a long line by the time we left the place. 

Service was very friendly. The cashier actually took the time to ask me how my day was going even though there was a line. (Am I in San Francisco? lol) My drink also came with a smile when my name was finally called. 

This place also sells quality loose leaf teas in bags, and if you need more sweetness in your life, Sugar& Spun Cotton Candy. And if you're a fan, they also sell Boba Guys totes, mason jars and pins. 

We'll be back Boba Guys!

excerpts: I got the lychee green tea + rose black milk tea and also lavender black milk tea thats in the september special.
lychee green tea.author: Inez J.
lychee green tea.review:
No restroom - knock off one star. Had to use another store's restaurant.

Interesting flavors. They have monthly specials. I got the lychee green tea + rose black milk tea and also lavender black milk tea thats in the september special.

I like how they didn't skimp on the milk tea when I ordered no ice (unlike other places that give you less). And also you can control the sweetness cause they have a sweetness jar/pot that you can add to your drink yourself if it's not sweet enough. Smart move.

Saw pandan macarons on yelp but they didn't have it here when I came. Just the cotton candy.

Yummy boba and HOMEMADE grass jelly whattt 

Lots of parking here. Coming back next time, but to the union square location.

excerpts: I got the 16oz lychee green tea with milk and boba ($4.50).
50% sugar level seemed like the right call.
It was super refreshing and different than what other boba places offer.
You can tell everything is high quality.
Highly recommend this place!
lychee green tea.author: Linda X.
lychee green tea.review:
My favorite boba place in SF! I love the chewiness of the boba and interesting flavors offered here. 

I got the 16oz lychee green tea with milk and boba ($4.50). 50% sugar level seemed like the right call. It was super refreshing and different than what other boba places offer. You can tell everything is high quality. Highly recommend this place!

excerpts: I've tried the strawberry fresca jasmine tea, classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and lychee green tea.
All were good except for the lychee green tea... there was no lychee flavor and tasted a little weird...
Definitely try their milk tea drinks instead.
Their most popular drinks are the classic milk tea and jasmine milk tea.
This place won't disappoint.
I also love their homemade almond jelly topping!
Add this to your drink!
lychee green tea.author: Kimberly H.
lychee green tea.review:
Definitely one of the better boba drink places around. 

I've tried the strawberry fresca jasmine tea, classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and lychee green tea. All were good except for the lychee green tea... there was no lychee flavor and tasted a little weird... Definitely try their milk tea drinks instead. You can adjust the sweetness level as well. 

Their most popular drinks are the classic milk tea and jasmine milk tea. This place won't disappoint. I also love their homemade almond jelly topping! Add this to your drink! (+50c)

excerpts: There are so many cool and creative flavors; I've tried the lavender black tea w/ milk as well as the lychee green tea w/ milk.
The grass jelly and almond jelly are made in-house and the tapioca is grade A. All of them are fantastic.
I also love that you can customize the sweetness and ice in the teas as well.
lychee green tea.author: Katherine Z.
lychee green tea.review: Best boba place, easily. Lines get long and go out the door, but that's totally expected. There are so many cool and creative flavors; I've tried the lavender black tea w/ milk as well as the lychee green tea w/ milk. The grass jelly and almond jelly are made in-house and the tapioca is grade A. All of them are fantastic. I also love that you can customize the sweetness and ice in the teas as well.

excerpts: I went with the lychee green tea bathed with almond jelly and of course, boba.
My boyfriend went with the matcha green tea with almond jelly.
lychee green tea.author: Sally H.
lychee green tea.review:
Boba Guys had me at "boba".  Came here on a recent trip to San Fran and I am in love.  This place is not your typical boba shop where drinks are heavily loaded with sugar and artificial flavors.  It's fresh brewed coffee and steamed tea.  I am an tea enthusiast and this makes me quite happy.  They have plenty of classic milk teas to choose from as well as premium milk teas.  I went with the lychee green tea bathed with almond jelly and of course, boba.  My boyfriend went with the matcha green tea with almond jelly.  Both were really delicious, however mine was more so due to the sweetness level.  

Boba guys allow you to choose your own sweetness level and the milk used for your drink; PERFECT.  However, what is not perfect is the size of this place and the parking issue.  This place is super tiny.  It is hard to maneuver around this place and it's very crowded.  Also, we paid $6 for an hour of parking and that's as much as our drink.

excerpts: Ordered the Lychee green tea w/ boba and their house made almond
jelly w/
50% sweet
I think.
The drink itself was pretty good, and the boba was definitely not the best or worst I have tried, but still pretty good and chewy.
For size though, (16oz
)  it was about $5 or 6 (including toppings).
lychee green tea.author: Rocky B.
lychee green tea.review:
3.5 but rounded-up.Size options, and wait times are the only downsides.

Not too bad of a place, just not worth the wait and hassle of finding a parking spot for.

As someone who's not from here, I'm not used to the small ass shops that can only fit a maximum of 5-6 people, and the hard to find parking (especially meters that charge $.25/cents for every 4 mins?!) for a boba place that serves a 16 oz as their "large" serving.

Ordered the Lychee green tea w/ boba and their house made almond jelly w/ 50% sweet I think. The drink itself was pretty good, and the boba was definitely not the best or worst I have tried, but still pretty good and chewy. For size though, (16oz)  it was about $5 or 6 (including toppings). I wish they had a bigger size!

Hong Kong toast was good. Tasted kind of like a French Toast w/ butter, cream and condensed milk I think? Goes pretty good with the drinks. 

Credit cards are taken, and service was friendly even though it took a while for them to take our order.

excerpts: I usually order something different every time, but I have to say my favorites are the strawberry fresca with soy milk and the lychee green tea with soy milk.
lychee green tea.author: Michelle F.
lychee green tea.review:
I have been always been a loyal Boba Guys fan before it became so popular. I live quite far away but I still make a trip here at least once a week to get my boba fix. 
I usually order something different every time, but I have to say my favorites are the strawberry fresca with soy milk and the lychee green tea with soy milk. 
And if you're feeling hungry, make sure to try the almond croissant or HK toast! 

I love everything about Boba guys, including the quality of ingredients, clean modern interior, and friendly service.

excerpts: They've got some other really interesting flavors we wanted to try like Camomile Mint, Lychee Green Tea, Indian Chai, and Roe Black Tea.
lychee green tea.author: Cara O.
lychee green tea.review:
Did I just drive down to the Mission so that I could get milk tea from Boba Guys? Yeah, I did, and I would do it again.

I first discovered Boba Guys after a night out in the Mission getting my Wing Wednesday on, down the street. Of course, when we saw this ultra hipster boba spot, we just had to try it. I originally got the Duke of Earl Grey Milk Tea w/Boba ($4.45), which was absolutely delicious.

Today, I drove down with my roommate because we just had to get out of the library. I was surprised to see that the line went well out the door. However, the staff were all very quick and kind. I got the Iced Matcha Latte w/ Boba ($4.50) and my roommate got the Horchata w/Boba ($4.50). I know it's a little pricey, but you can taste it in the quality of the tea and the boba. I really liked the Matcha Latte, it certainly had a very strong matcha taste, and didn't taste watered down at all like other milk teas. You could tell this tea was made with love! 

They've got some other really interesting flavors we wanted to try like Camomile Mint, Lychee Green Tea, Indian Chai, and Roe Black Tea. Their almond jelly and grass jelly are made in-house, AND you can have the option between Straus Family Organic Milk, Almond Milk, or Organic Soy Milk. 

Yep, totally worth the drive.

excerpts: I'm glad I got to try this place while it's still new, though I really wanted to try their Lychee Green Tea.
It's definitely a "East Meets West" experience and they're starting out small with some main Hong Kong food staples--it's a good experience for Americans who want to try that style.
Will be back the next time I'm in San Francisco and hopefully, their menu will expand!
lychee green tea.author: Sharon T.
lychee green tea.review:
The name is Boba Guys but I didn't get any balls. I'll get them on my own terms--anytime, anywhere, any place. 

This place is super hipster as it's in Mission and with the range of bubble tea places in SF, you'll probably see less Asians here. Thanks to my OCD on Tumblr, I only know of this place through the photos of their drinks on mason jars. Turns out those jars are $10. Came here with a few friends from the area who also wanted to check the place out. You'd definitely miss this place if you don't look for it because it is small. You know you're not in Chinatown anymore when you see the iPad station and the decor and design--from ceiling to floor--is hip.

Menu is limited, to my surprise and a small costs $4, which is high for SF standard pricing and also high for New York bubble tea pricing, which $3 is a minimum. I got the Classic Milk Tea with Almond Jelly and to my surprise, the milk tea had a great balance of sweetness to it. I've never had almond jelly before so it was a first for me and I really liked it. Reminds me of solidified almond tofu. I'm glad I got to try this place while it's still new, though I really wanted to try their Lychee Green Tea. It's definitely a "East Meets West" experience and they're starting out small with some main Hong Kong food staples--it's a good experience for Americans who want to try that style. Will be back the next time I'm in San Francisco and hopefully, their menu will expand!

excerpts: I ordered the lychee green tea with boba.
The tea was good, but the boba was pretty bad.
They were overly sweet and some were nice and chewy and some had a weird bite to them.
Very inconsistent.
lychee green tea.author: Beverly C.
lychee green tea.review: The line was so long, but the wait wasn't too terrible. I ordered the lychee green tea with boba. The tea was good, but the boba was pretty bad. They were overly sweet and some were nice and chewy and some had a weird bite to them. Very inconsistent.

excerpts: The lychee green tea was mediocre but the boba itself was nice and soft.
lychee green tea.author: Alison T.
lychee green tea.review: The drinks are all customizable but they tend to be less sweet that other places. I got mine extra sweet which the person told he would be about 125% sweet since it already comes sweetened. I thought this was perfect because I tried the 100% sweetened version and it tasted pretty bland. The lychee green tea was mediocre but the boba itself was nice and soft.

excerpts: And then I got an iced lychee green tea with soymilk - perfect.
Awwww :)
lychee green tea.author: Maile N.
lychee green tea.review: Yummy yum!  There's a Boba Guys near me in Union Square but this one in the Misson is open on Sundays!  It was a warm, sunny Sunday and I wanted a good boba drink before going to a class.  I bought a reusable cup, check.  And then I got an iced lychee green tea with soymilk - perfect.  Awwww :)

excerpts: I've gotten the lychee green tea, strawberry green tea fresca, and strawberry matcha latte, all with boba.
I wouldn't recommend the lychee green tea, it really didn't taste like lychee to me.
The strawberry matcha latte has a cool mix of flavors that somehow works, but in the end the strawberry green tea fresca is my favorite.
lychee green tea.author: Connie C.
lychee green tea.review:
Great boba quality!! 

I've gotten the lychee green tea, strawberry green tea fresca, and strawberry matcha latte, all with boba. 

I wouldn't recommend the lychee green tea, it really didn't taste like lychee to me. The strawberry matcha latte has a cool mix of flavors that somehow works, but in the end the strawberry green tea fresca is my favorite. Super refreshing and great for the fruit tea lovers. 

Depending on when you go there will be a line, but the drinks come out quickly.

excerpts: Tried the lychee green tea, horchata, & classic flavor and all was ok.
lychee green tea.author: Criselle O.
lychee green tea.review:
Tried the lychee green tea, horchata, & classic flavor and all was ok.  

Yes, just ok (I've had better TBH)

excerpts: My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar.
lychee green tea.author: Kitty K.
lychee green tea.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: I ended up with the lychee green tea with almond jelly and my husband got the jasmine milk tea with almond jelly as well, both 50% sweetness.
lychee green tea.author: Jacklyn L.
lychee green tea.review:
This was my first time at boba guys and it was great! The barista was super helpful with recommendations and patient as I waffled between the many choices. 

I ended up with the lychee green tea with almond jelly and my husband got the jasmine milk tea with almond jelly as well, both 50% sweetness. Mine didn't have a super robust lychee flavor, and was mote heavy on the tea, but well balanced with the sweetness of the jelly. 

A great spot to get boba, will definitely come again! Lives up to the hype!

excerpts: Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye.
I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each):
Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.
lychee green tea.author: Jennifer L.
lychee green tea.review:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!

excerpts: I ordered the slow dripped lychee green tea with boba ($5).
My friend ordered the normal milk tea ($4).
A lot pricier from what I am used to, but pretty tasty!
The boba texture was soft and chewy.
It's definitely worth a try, but I'll stick with my Asian boba places on Irving!
lychee green tea.author: Corinna T.
lychee green tea.review: Cute little hipster boba place in the mission. I ordered the slow dripped lychee green tea with boba ($5). My friend ordered the normal milk tea ($4). A lot pricier from what I am used to, but pretty tasty! The boba texture was soft and chewy. It's definitely worth a try, but I'll stick with my Asian boba places on Irving!

excerpts: The lychee green tea was okay too.
It had a nice hint of lychee flavor that did not overwhelm the taste of the green tea.
lychee green tea.author: Lien T.
lychee green tea.review:
Despite being disappointed with their pre-mixed milk tea from their original pop-up store, I gave their new store a shot anyway. We came in about an hour before closing and there was a long line outside. The wait in line was less than ten minutes and the wait for our tea was a little over five minutes, since we ordered one of their "slow bar" items. Their "slow bar" items are made from fresh tea leaves and so they take a little longer to prepare than their other items.

I went with the matcha latte with extra ice and my boyfriend went with the lychee milk green tea ("slow bar" item). The matcha latte was good, but it was not the best that I have tasted. I liked that they use organic milk though. The lychee green tea was okay too. It had a nice hint of lychee flavor that did not overwhelm the taste of the green tea. I am not typically a fan of boba, but the boba had the perfect consistency--soft and chewy.

The quality and taste was definitely better than our first experience and it's great that they have a nice store front now--it's very modern, clean, and "hipster" like. The only gripe I have is with plastic lids that were used for our cups. I'm not sure if they are made specifically for large straws, but my friend and I had a hard time getting our straws into the hole without our drink overflowing. I noticed a few others having the same problem too. Other than that, their teas are good!

excerpts: I tried the lychee green tea and that was fantastic as well - steep at $5 for the slow bar drinks but it warrants a try.
lychee green tea.author: Ryan L.
lychee green tea.review: Came here on a few occasions, there's never a wait so the drinks come out relatively fast except if you get the slow bar drinks. Classic, jasmine, and HK milk tea are all superb, the horchata was watered down in comparison to the other drinks, I wasn't a fan. My friends got their drinks with no boba and I think it dropped the price by like 50 cents. I tried the lychee green tea and that was fantastic as well - steep at $5 for the slow bar drinks but it warrants a try.

excerpts: The problem is, after ordering the Lychee Green Tea they serve here...
you get that repetitious "thristy" feeling in the back of your throat that lasted for 2 hours...
lychee green tea.author: Eric C.
lychee green tea.review:
Unfortunately, This establishment makes fresh boba tea yes, brewed from simple machines and all that good stuff..The problem is, after ordering the Lychee Green Tea they serve here... you get that repetitious "thristy" feeling in the back of your throat that lasted for 2 hours...(-2)

By te way, when people including me see your signage...it makes me think of 
National geographic rather than boba. (-1)

If you really wanna charge more for boba than teaway in the sunset...at least make sure you are up to standards because so far, the only thing floating up from you guys is the liquid buoy that preceeds a flush.....(-1)

Then again this is the. Mission soi guesshaving asian standards isnt exactly fitting for you guys but on the same coin.... you're IN the BOBA business....soo yes...you are expected to abide by the same standards....


By that notions mentioned above,  I've lowered this location far below Tpumps Status. theres much more consistncy and flavor at Tpumps. Whether youre in SF, SM or Burlingame. Anything is better than here...

They don't have/give out bags, so NOT recommended for to-go for Big groups unless you're all there in person...

'

excerpts: I had the iced matcha latte and the muscat oolong (my favorite), while my friend tried the classic, hong kong style, and lychee green tea (i think she liked the classic best out of those options).
lychee green tea.author: Ellen K.
lychee green tea.review:
My friend and I came back from SF three weeks ago, and we're still talking about Boba Guys. We had it almost everyday we were there.

Bubbles are the perfect consistency. Almond jelly is sooooo good. 25% sweetened is just enough.

I had the iced matcha latte and the muscat oolong (my favorite), while my friend tried the classic, hong kong style, and lychee green tea (i think she liked the classic best out of those options).

Ugh, now I'm sitting at work craving Boba Guys... :(

excerpts: I had the lychee green tea, and my friends had the classic milk tea.
They all said it tasted pretty bueno.
lychee green tea.author: Bonnie T.
lychee green tea.review: Finally checked out this place. Since they don't have BG in SJ I decided to visit it with two of my friends during this winterbreak's SF trip. The boba tasted really fresh (no powders/syrups I guess) and it was nice and light! The prices are a little more expensive for normal sized cups, but I'd expect it because of all the organic products BG uses. The inside of BG looks pretty nice, (and hipster!) and I love how they incorporated the science-y theme into everything. The place however, is a bit small, and in an awkward location. Getting through mission itself was a little scary, (especially for high school girls during the late afternoon) but the trek was worth it! Nice location near Clarion Alley as well! Quick service and good drinks. Don't know if I'd go out of my way to visit BG though. I had the lychee green tea, and my friends had the classic milk tea. They all said it tasted pretty bueno.

excerpts: I ordered the lychee green tea from the slow bar and even though it took a while, it was still pretty yummy!
I can't wait to come back here the next time I head to the city!
lychee green tea.author: Cynthia L.
lychee green tea.review: I'm a big fan of this place after only coming here once! The person taking the orders was the nicest guy and he loved to talk! He offered us samples of a new drink they were going to come out with soon and it was absolutely delicious! I ordered the lychee green tea from the slow bar and even though it took a while, it was still pretty yummy! I can't wait to come back here the next time I head to the city!

excerpts: Try their any tea, my favorite is lychee green tea.
lychee green tea.author: R P.
lychee green tea.review:
My favorite bubba tea place in the whole bay are! 

Why?: please check their website and you will know about quality and promise.
http://www.bobaguys.com/nextlevelquality/

Unlike most places, this guys use premium quality tea, milk (straus organic milk) and their pearl aka buba are really tastly. Try their any tea, my favorite is lychee green tea. 

Most other places add powders, artificial syrups, and God know what. If you taste bud for detecting real stuff than you will enjoy this one!

excerpts: We got lychee green tea, and strawberry Jasmine tea!!
They sweetened it with real strawberriew!!
So good!!
Definitely a must if you're visiting San Francisco
lychee green tea.author: Krissy C.
lychee green tea.review: Really good drinks! They even have ice cream!  We got lychee green tea, and strawberry Jasmine tea!!  They sweetened it with real strawberriew!!  So good!!  Definitely a must if you're visiting San Francisco

excerpts: The lychee green tea didn't have much lychee flavor, could only taste the green tea.
I've ordered those two drinks with the tapioca and grass jelly
but I would go without it next time because the texture of the grass jelly and tapioca was a soft on the outside but a bit hard when you chew into it.
Sadly they are always out of macarons :(
Would be a great snack when you have a sweet tooth, perfect with their drinks.
lychee green tea.author: Pam Ela Y.
lychee green tea.review: Fell in love with their drinks here! Absolutely better than many other tapioca places. Love love love their rose black tea! The lychee green tea didn't have much lychee flavor, could only taste the green tea. I've ordered those two drinks with the tapioca and grass jelly but I would go without it next time because the texture of the grass jelly and tapioca was a soft on the outside but a bit hard when you chew into it. Sadly they are always out of macarons :( Would be a great snack when you have a sweet tooth, perfect with their drinks.

excerpts: Tried the Lychee Green Tea iced with boba and 25% sweetness.
Was very disappointed as I don't like the aftertaste of flowers and such.
Took a few sips but couldn't get myself to finish it.
Won't be ordering from here again.
lychee green tea.author: Ratany L.
lychee green tea.review: Tried the Lychee Green Tea iced with boba and 25% sweetness.  Was very disappointed as I don't like the aftertaste of flowers and such.  Took a few sips but couldn't get myself to finish it.  Won't be ordering from here again.  :(

excerpts: I did their Muscat Oolong and it was heavenly!
I normally do the tapioca balls, but the gentleman serving us recommended the grass jelly and it was well worth it!
muscat oolong.author: Mary P.
muscat oolong.review:
I love their bubble tea. This has to be the best bubble tea I've had beyond making my own at home from super high end ingredients. 

I did their Muscat Oolong and it was heavenly! I normally do the tapioca balls, but the gentleman serving us recommended the grass jelly and it was well worth it! I love that they use high end ingredients like Straus Organic milk and Califia Farms Almond Milk. 

You can adjust the sweetness and I went with 50% and it was just right, just a hint of sweet without being overwhelming. 

On this visit I also picked up Cotton Candy they were selling by Sugar and Spun and oh my goodness - divine. I don't even like cotton candy.

excerpts: Of all the flavours that we ordered, i enjoyed the Muscat Oolong the most.
Will likely come back to try more flavours while we are here visiting.
muscat oolong.author: Justina L.
muscat oolong.review:
First thing I thought when I heard about this place was "$7 for bubble tea?! That's so expensive!". Considering we usually get it for $5. 

However, I understand that they only use the freshest ingredients. Of all the flavours that we ordered, i enjoyed the Muscat Oolong the most. Will likely come back to try more flavours while we are here visiting.

excerpts: I can't say this is one of my favorite boba spots, but I'd definitely come back to try some of their other things, like the muscat oolong!
muscat oolong.author: Nicole M.
muscat oolong.review:
There is so much hype regarding this place, and the only time I've ever had it was at an amazing wedding I attended - so I was very excited to come to the actual shop for the first time. 

Horchata - very smooth with a great cinnamon flavor. I only tried a sample of this and liked it, but do think that it would have been too heavy for me as a whole drink. 
Strawberry matcha latte - I hear that this is the drink to get, so I've been wanting to try it for quite some time. It comes out in three beautifully-colored layers. I personally would have preferred more of a strawberry flavor, but I enjoyed this regardless (though not as much as other people seem to).
Hojicha roasted green milk tea - I absolutely love hojicha in general because of the fragrant "ricey" flavor. It was good here and my fiance liked his drink.
Strawberry jasmine tea fresca - I had this at the wedding I attended and not at this shop, but I'll throw it in this review anyway because it was perfectly refreshing, just like the description says. I liked it a lot!
Soy milk tea - also an item I tried at the wedding. The couple was so thoughtful to include this milk tea option for guests who can't have dairy! I'm so glad I'm not lactose intolerant though, because the soy milk tea tastes watered down and isn't nearly as delicious as regular milk tea.

I love how they allow you to sample things at the counter - one of the things we tried was this lychee coconut juice that isn't on their regular menu. I took a sip of it after I had already ordered, but we all agreed it would be something we would like to get next time! Great taste with both the lychee and coconut flavors coming through, and wonderfully refreshing on a warm day. I do feel that the prices at Boba Guys are very slightly higher than some other places, but they use organic milk and no powders in their drinks, so it's worth it. I can't say this is one of my favorite boba spots, but I'd definitely come back to try some of their other things, like the muscat oolong!

excerpts:
- Jasmine milk tea with boba
- Horchata with boba
- Muscat oolong milk tea with boba
My jasmine milk tea felt very watered down.
I couldn't really taste the tea.
I know people might say it tastes watered down because they use milk instead of creamer, but that shouldn't affect the tea strength, just the creaminess.
I had adjusted mine to be no ice and 25% sugar, too.
muscat oolong.author: Eifeh S.
muscat oolong.review:
If you're looking for trendy, hipster boba, Boba Guys is for you. If you're looking for authentic, Taiwan-style boba, do not expect to get it here. 

I think that living in Taiwan has made me hypercritical of boba in the US. That said, I can still appreciate boba here. With all the hype around Boba Guys, I was very skeptical. Now that I've been, I can say that I was unimpressed. 

- Jasmine milk tea with boba
- Horchata with boba
- Muscat oolong milk tea with boba

I went with three friends: all of us of Taiwanese decent, all of us have lived in Taiwan. We all felt the tea was very bland and the boba itself too sweet. My jasmine milk tea felt very watered down. I couldn't really taste the tea. I know people might say it tastes watered down because they use milk instead of creamer, but that shouldn't affect the tea strength, just the creaminess. I had adjusted mine to be no ice and 25% sugar, too. My other friends also felt the teas were watered down and the drinks too sweet. 

My friend complained about the cups. The lids are a little annoying and pop off if you squeeze the cup. Also, the tea kind of goes everywhere when you try putting the straw in. 

I feel like Boba Guys is targeted at a very specific group of people: the trendy, hip crowd. Boba isn't meant to be fancy and describing it as "heirloom tea with organic milk" only adds to the annoyingness of Boba Guys. But that's just me. I mean, boba wasn't created to be some healthy, pretentious drink, but that seems to be how they're trying to market it here. 

Anyways, boba goodness might be subjective. As long as you're not looking for a CoCo or 50嵐, you can try Boba Guys and decide for yourselves. Personally, I won't be back. There is better boba in the city.

excerpts: My friend's muscat oolong was the same way, and way too sweet for me at 75%.
muscat oolong.author: Jessica L.
muscat oolong.review:
We wanted boba/PMT while in the SF area, and we had all heard of Boba Guys before so we thought to give it a try. Luckily, there wasn't much of a line when we entered, though one formed as soon as we got our drinks. The store is pretty small so don't be too daunted by the line going out the store!

The interior was clean and modern. We had a hard time deciding which drinks to get because we had heard so much about which ones were good! To be able to get a taste of what they were, I decided to get their classic milk tea. It ended up tasting sort of...bland. The tea could definitely be brewed stronger as I could hardly taste it. The pearls did not live up to standard. Some of them were hard and even the chewier ones had hard centers. Did not live up to the hype!! My friend's muscat oolong was the same way, and way too sweet for me at 75%.

The person taking my order was nice and made sure that I would get what I wanted. My drink also came out super fast. The store was marketing itself as having high class, special blend teas when I could hardly even taste it. It felt like it was hopping on the boba trend and trying to turn it hip and trendy whilst not paying attention to their drinks. I would come back maybe one more time if I find myself in the area to try their matcha latte, but it's not worth a trip especially with so many other places closer to South Bay.

excerpts: I got the muscat oolong
milk tea with almond jelly (75% sweet).
It was a really amazing combination :)
And quite different-
I've never had muscat (grapes) in milk tea before.
They also make their almond jelly and grass jelly in house which makes it extra amazing.
muscat oolong.author: Tiffany O.
muscat oolong.review:
Oh man...I wish they would open one of these in SoCal! I'm so glad I made the drive out here despite the traffic and parking because I love some good boba.
I got the muscat oolong  milk tea with almond jelly (75% sweet). It was a really amazing combination :) And quite different- I've never had muscat (grapes) in milk tea before. They also make their almond jelly and grass jelly in house which makes it extra amazing. I also tried their jasmine milk tea with boba that was pretty yummy. The boba is perfectly soft and chewy. I appreciate that they use high quality teas and milks (organic). The only reason I had to knock it down a star is because I didn't like the regular (black) milk tea very much. It tasted bland and watery to me. But overall, a great boba place. I want to try the whole menu 0_o

excerpts: Heirloom muscat oolong boba tea?
What?!?!
muscat oolong.author: Cynthia C.
muscat oolong.review:
Heirloom muscat oolong boba tea?  What?!?!  Sign me up.  

Hold the milk and sugar.  Amazingly refreshing for boba tea.  Loved the subtle muscat flavors.  Check the mason jars for sale.  Super cute with the little anteater on the side, of course.  

Next time, I would prob opt for half the boba.  Super filling after dinner.

excerpts:
First time here, let me try their slow drip tea and see if they have done the fundamentals right.



-) Muscat Oolong Milk Tea with boba: A.
muscat oolong.author: Simon C.
muscat oolong.review:
I just moved from Fremont to San Francisco few weeks ago - one of the things I truly miss is the different boba tea houses - tea island, gong cha, T4, tea papa... You name it. And I live far away from sunset so I can't really go purple kow that often; luckily, I found this little gem in the Mission district.

Boba guys - the name doesn't sound really serious and at first I would thought it's another "me too" boba tea houses. But no! Just by reading their menu you can understand the owner has put a lot of thoughts on their drinks. Not only the detailed explanation of each of their signature drinks; you can also find a lot of little notes on the counter, wall etc about their vision, philosophy and origins. You can learn a lot about this place just by reading those signs.

So basically there are two big categories on their menu: specialty or signature drinks, and slow drip tea. For the latter category, you can choose sweetness and whether you want to add milk in it (and they have organic milk, California farm milk or soy milk as well). First time here, let me try their slow drip tea and see if they have done the fundamentals right.



-) Muscat Oolong Milk Tea with boba: A. They brewed the tea fresh from your order, turn the teapot/funnel thing upside down, and literally let the tea drip slowly. After it's done, they would pour it into a prepared beaker with iced milk, and there you go your drink. When I first sipped it, it definitely had a very strong oolong tea flavor in it. I really like the fact that the milk was not creamy at all; rather, the milk helped bring out the taste of the tea, make it more smooth, and definitely enhanced the overall experience. Boba was definitely way above average. Soft and chewy, but it's not honey boba so it's not sweet at all, which actually makes sense or else it would not go well with the strong flavor tea.

Definitely a place that I will be visiting more often. Next time I would like to try their Hong Kong style milk tea and see how it is!

excerpts: I ordered the coconut green tea, muscat oolong, and horchata boba in that order.
I have to say, I was not blown away by their horchata at all.
You could definitely taste the cinnamon, no doubt about that and the boba was hella soft, but it just wasn't spectacular.
I actually ended up liking my boyfriend's muscat oolong better.
muscat oolong.author: Venus L.
muscat oolong.review:
I've had this place bookmarked for the longest time and thanks to my cousin's spontaneous idea of coming here, I was able to uncheck it from my list. 

The inside is sort of small. There's standing room, but only 4 chairs to sit at so it's best to take your drink and go. The counter where you order has a lot of goodies behind glass so be sure to check those out. They also sell Sugar n Spun cotton candy at $4 a container which is $1 cheaper than buying it from an actual Sugar n Spun stand so that was cool. And their adorable mason jar glasses? $10 each. 

Parking is all on the street and it's metered so make sure to bring coins! 

My cousin, my boyfriend, and I ordered the coconut green tea, muscat oolong, and horchata boba in that order. I have to say, I was not blown away by their horchata at all. You could definitely taste the cinnamon, no doubt about that and the boba was hella soft, but it just wasn't spectacular. I actually ended up liking my boyfriend's muscat oolong better. 

Overall, it's decent. Maybe I set my expectations too high for the horchata. Definitely gonna come back and try something else next time!

excerpts: I ordered the Muscat Oolong milk tea with boba.
The taste was definitely interesting and worth the wait.
It felt very authentic and flavorful.
The only thing that disappointed me was the small size of the drink for the price.
muscat oolong.author: Calvin T.
muscat oolong.review:
This is one of the most popular boba spots in the Bay Area. I was pleased with the quality of my drink, but I don't think it's something I'd go out of my way for. For the price point and wait time, it was a great experience, but not a must-have.

I went to this location on Black Friday (2016). To our surprise, the line was already out of the door. It's a very small shop and the wait took some time. I got to the front of the line and ordered my drink. The workers were very nice and went through orders very quickly. I personally don't like spending more than $5 for boba, but for the one time, I was definitely willing, especially with all of the hype surrounding the shop.
