The wait time for the actual drink wasn't too long. I ordered the Muscat Oolong milk tea with boba. The taste was definitely interesting and worth the wait. It felt very authentic and flavorful. The only thing that disappointed me was the small size of the drink for the price. However, I left feeling pleased.

There's a ton of hype surrounding boba guys and it is well deserved. However, if you're like me and love boba all over the Bay Area, this isn't anything to go out of your way for. The price point brings it down a little bit, in my opinion, but in many ways, you get what you pay for. I would highly suggest Boba Guys to any first timer or SF tourist.

excerpts: Had the Muscat oolong tea with light sweetness, almond milk, and boba today.
I liked the flavor of the oolong with the almond milk and the boba had great chewiness and a slight sweetness, which is a great combo.
muscat oolong.author: Megan D.
muscat oolong.review:
I've come to this location and the one in Chinatown a few times and I gotta say, it's not really worth the hype for me. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.

Is Boba Guys delicious? Yes. Are their drinks of higher quality? Yes. Is the actual business pleasant to be in? Sure, as far as a grab-n-go concept like boba are concerned. The branding is pretty cute, with that cheeky little aardvark just doin' his thang in the center of the logo. So why the 3 stars?

Something about Boba Guys just doesn't do it for me. I feel like part of my issue is that my drink is gone in three sips...maybe instead of the 16oz size I should be ordering the 20oz? But I also feel like a lot of a 16oz from Boba Guys is mostly ice...

Had the Muscat oolong tea with light sweetness, almond milk, and boba today. I liked the flavor of the oolong with the almond milk and the boba had great chewiness and a slight sweetness, which is a great combo. Recently, I had my first oolong milk tea at Little Sweet in the Richmond and while it was a completely different variety than the one served at BG, it set the bar pretty high. 

This drink, as well as all the other drinks I've gotten from here, are good. But they're a little steep in price for what you end up with, which is delicious, and gone instantly. You want to be able to justify spending $5 on tasty boba but when the experience is so short-lived, and there are sooo many other boba places to try, I feel like it's okay to try this place at least once, just to check it off the list.

I will be back, at some point, but eagerly await exploring the other boba options in the bay.

excerpts: I got the Muscat Oolong which was super good and rightly sweet the way I like it.
4 Stars cause a bit pricey after the addons but sall gucc
muscat oolong.author: Justin H.
muscat oolong.review:
Boba Guys was dope, they got these cool ass cups that have Arthur on one side and a Vulcan symbol on the other. Their little black balls are so ballsy good. I got the Muscat Oolong which was super good and rightly sweet the way I like it.
4 Stars cause a bit pricey after the addons but sall gucc

excerpts: the Muscat oolong milk tea was really good &
muscat oolong.author: Moriah D.
muscat oolong.review: First time here & parking is an ass, I really wish parking in sf wasn't this horrible! Esp getting something quick & easy like a drink. But regardless, so glad I came! A few friends really wanted to try this place out so my bf & I tagged along. I got a coconut green milk tea (4/5) I tried my friends drinks & honestly thought their drinks tasted better, definitely coming back for my own full cup! the Muscat oolong milk tea was really good & a hot Hong Kong style milk tea was perfect for a breezy sf night. I did the most for my photo to post on yelp that I accidentally dropped a full cup of boba & they were nice enough to clean it up for me & replace it for free  5/5 for overall the freshness of the tea & great customer service, will definitely be back!

excerpts: I ordered the rose black milk tea with boba and almond jelly, my mom ordered the Muscat oolong, my dad got a coconut milk green tea...and I can definitely say this placed is overhyped-- not exactly bad tea or boba but not great either.
The flavor wasn't as pungent as I would've liked, though you should take that in your own way because I personally like my rose teas strong.
The Muscat oolong and coconut green teas did not have that traditional taste
muscat oolong.author: Ariel M.
muscat oolong.review:
As someone who frequents boba places in San Diego, CA I was extremely excited to try this place when I visited SF. Not only that but my favorite bloggers on YouTube seem to like this place a lot. I ordered the rose black milk tea with boba and almond jelly, my mom ordered the Muscat oolong, my dad got a coconut milk green tea...and I can definitely say this placed is overhyped-- not exactly bad tea or boba but not great either. The flavor wasn't as pungent as I would've liked, though you should take that in your own way because I personally like my rose teas strong. Boba and almond jelly not impressive either. 

Originally I was drawn by the unique tea flavors and promise of "no powder" tea, but I felt like the overall authentic taste of milk tea was lost. The Muscat oolong and coconut green teas did not have that traditional taste I'm used to. 

Or, I may just be spoiled by the boba places in southern ca, specifically kung fu tea. It's so good even Usher is a regular.

excerpts: Muscat oolong milk tea w/ 75% sweetness.
I liked the almond pudding with my drink.
The guy told me that the regular sweet is at 100% which is equivalent to the amount of sugar in a soda...
Eeks.
Never thought of it like that.
muscat oolong.author: Stephanie L.
muscat oolong.review: I finally found a drink that I really like here! Muscat oolong milk tea w/ 75% sweetness. I liked the almond pudding with my drink. The guy told me that the regular sweet is at 100% which is equivalent to the amount of sugar in a soda... Eeks. Never thought of it like that.

excerpts:
May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee 
Green Tea: $5
muscat oolong.author: Kitty K.
muscat oolong.review:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D

excerpts: My boyfriend got the muscat oolong milk tea which is a slow brew tea which means they brew the tea leaves on the spot!
I tried my boyfriend's muscat oolong milk tea and that was definitely unique.
It has this nice surprising kick at the end where the muscat taste comes through.
Overall I think their drinks are good and I would come back again if I'm in the area.
muscat oolong.author: Jennifer H.
muscat oolong.review:
Love the name and I think the place is adorable! 

It's a small little shop around the street corner. Their menu is simple and clean so you're not bombarded with so many different choices. They let you customize your drink to any way you want it! (ex: wanting more tea as opposed to milk in your drink or vice versa, 50% sugar, 50% ice, etc..) It is pricey for boba around 4-6 dollars but it's NOT cash only so yay! They accept credit card which makes it super convenient! I couldn't decide between getting the jasmine milk tea or the regular milk tea. I decided to go with the regular milk tea because it's the most popular drink to get. My boyfriend got the muscat oolong milk tea which is a slow brew tea which means they brew the tea leaves on the spot! The slow brew options are also more expensive, because each drink is $5.50 and the regular ones are only $4.00. 

I enjoyed their black milk tea with boba. I got mine at 75% sugar because I like my drinks not too sweet. The tea was good and it was balanced with the milk. However, I didn't think it stood out to me in comparison to other black milk teas I've had before. I thought their boba was good. It was slightly too firm for me but it was still chewy. I tried my boyfriend's muscat oolong milk tea and that was definitely unique. It has this nice surprising kick at the end where the muscat taste comes through. Overall I think their drinks are good and I would come back again if I'm in the area.

excerpts:
Horchata, Hong Kong style, Chamomile Mint, Pumpkin Chai, Muscat Oolong, and Coconut Green Tea.
5.
Not just boba.
They recently started selling snacks too (macarons, toast, etc), but I have yet to try.
They sell cute glass mason jars with handles for $10 with the Boba Guys logo in the front.
If you bring the Boba Guys jar or your own mug, you will receive a discount off your drink!
Grade-A balls
AKA fresh.
Homemade syrup.
They don't use powder or artificial syrup.
Homemade almond and grass jelly.
Slightly hipster and more "Americanized.
The Classic Milk Tea is WAY more sweet compared to the Hong Kong style milk tea.
muscat oolong.author: Vicki L.
muscat oolong.review:
What makes Boba Guys unique:

1. Limited selection. Only 9 milk tea's. And 8 "Slow Bar" brewed tea's. 
2. Only toppings available are boba and jelly. Very limited.
3. Expensive compared to other places. $4 per drink with no size options.
4. Some unique flavors. Horchata, Hong Kong style, Chamomile Mint, Pumpkin Chai, Muscat Oolong, and Coconut Green Tea.
5. Not just boba. They recently started selling snacks too (macarons, toast, etc), but I have yet to try.
6. They sell cute glass mason jars with handles for $10 with the Boba Guys logo in the front.
7. If you bring the Boba Guys jar or your own mug, you will receive a discount off your drink!
8. Grade-A balls AKA fresh.
9. Homemade syrup. They don't use powder or artificial syrup.
10. Homemade almond and grass jelly.
11. Slightly hipster and more "Americanized." They have some non-Asian staff, which makes this boba shop a little more unique!

Note: The Classic Milk Tea is WAY more sweet compared to the Hong Kong style milk tea.

excerpts: I've tried the strawberry matcha and Muscat oolong and they are both good, but Earl grey milk tea wins every time.
In fact, im craving one as I write this review!
muscat oolong.author: Michelle O.
muscat oolong.review: This is my absolute favorite boba shop ever. Sometimes there can be a long line depending on the time you go, but it's always worth the wait. I always get the regular earl grey milk tea, 30%, with boba every single time. Ever since I tried this drink, this is the only drink I will ever get because it never fails me. I would say try to avoid the almond milk substitution because the taste is not for everyone. I've tried the strawberry matcha and Muscat oolong and they are both good, but Earl grey milk tea wins every time. In fact, im craving one as I write this review!

excerpts: Another great one is the Muscat oolong milk tea!
What I love about these two drinks is that they're so unique to this boba shop!
Try it and see!
muscat oolong.author: Taylor W.
muscat oolong.review: YUM. I never thought a strawberry matcha latte would be very tasty but oh. my. goodness. It was amazing! It's a little bit sweet for my taste but once everything is all mixed together, it's so tasty! The drink comes out looking like the Italian flag with the strawberry, milk, and matcha layers. I would definitely recommend this place :) it's a little pricey and the wait can be really long, but it's worth a try. You do have to pay extra for toppings but they use premium milk (like the almond milk is free!). So it balances out kinda. Another great one is the Muscat oolong milk tea! What I love about these two drinks is that they're so unique to this boba shop! Try it and see!

excerpts: Two words: MUSCAT OOLONG
muscat oolong.author: Jennifer L.
muscat oolong.review:
Two words: MUSCAT OOLONG

I adore oolong and the best oolong milk tea I've had so far is at Boba Guys. 

I've ordered it half sweet with grass jelly and boba on separate occasions and I think their boba is better than their grass jelly as it has the right level of chewiness. The last time I was there, the half sweet was still a bit too sweet for me, so I think 1/4 sweet would be good for next time. 

It is a bit pricey compared to other boba places, but hey, quality over quantity.

excerpts: This is my first time at Boba Guys and I got the Muscat Oolong milk tea with boba ($5) with regular sweetness.
The muscat oolong was an interesting combination, but it wasn't amazing.
muscat oolong.author: Amy T.
muscat oolong.review:
Very relaxing little shop. I liked the variety of drinks here. This is my first time at Boba Guys and I got the Muscat Oolong milk tea with boba ($5) with regular sweetness. 

I usually get my boba with regular amount of sweet but this was too sweet for me. I would recommend reducing the sugar for drinks here. The muscat oolong was an interesting combination, but it wasn't amazing.

excerpts: I had the iced matcha latte and the muscat oolong (my favorite), while my friend tried the classic, hong kong style, and lychee green tea (i think she liked the classic best out of those options).
muscat oolong.author: Ellen K.
muscat oolong.review:
My friend and I came back from SF three weeks ago, and we're still talking about Boba Guys. We had it almost everyday we were there.

Bubbles are the perfect consistency. Almond jelly is sooooo good. 25% sweetened is just enough.

I had the iced matcha latte and the muscat oolong (my favorite), while my friend tried the classic, hong kong style, and lychee green tea (i think she liked the classic best out of those options).

Ugh, now I'm sitting at work craving Boba Guys... :(

excerpts: Their Jasmine Milk Tea was amazing and their slow brewed Muscat Oolong was the best milk tea I've had -- even in Asia.
Maybe in a sucker for loose leaf tea and organic milk.
muscat oolong.author: Thomas C.
muscat oolong.review: Boba in the Mission? I was skeptical, but won over by their honest tea and organic milk. Their Jasmine Milk Tea was amazing and their slow brewed Muscat Oolong was the best milk tea I've had -- even in Asia. Maybe in a sucker for loose leaf tea and organic milk.

excerpts: Muscat oolong with almond jelly, and a pandan macaron.
muscat oolong.author: Andrew Y.
muscat oolong.review:
There are plenty of boba places throughout the city, but Boba Guys is the shop I frequent the most.

They have tripled their menu items since expanding out of their Ken Ken Ramen location, and every new addition is new and exciting.  Boba Guys have several of the classics like black milk tea and jasmine milk tea, but have also added horchata, matcha, Thai, and HK style to the mix.  Several of the toppings that were originally experimental have made the move to the regular menu as well.  If you're a bit tired from drinking boba, try switching in to their almond jelly!

Boba Guys are also offering macarons and cupcakes here too.  They have unique flavors like sesame and mango.

My favorite part of the new shop would have to be the slow bar, where the baristas brew your tea to order.  They have spent hours honing the perfect time and temperature for each type of tea in order to make some of the tastiest and unique tea blends I've had.  The slow bar menu changes here and there, but teas to try include lychee green and golden honey black.

My go-to: Muscat oolong with almond jelly, and a pandan macaron.

The shop is pretty small though, so if you want a place to sit down, try their Ken Ken Ramen location on 18th and Mission instead.  They also serve alcoholic boba there too.

excerpts: My favorites in order are the Muscat Oolong, Horchata, and regular milk tea.
In the end, you just need to know what flavors you do and do not like - this place won't be for everyone.
muscat oolong.author: Sandy T.
muscat oolong.review:
I would actually rate this 3.5 stars but will round up to be kind.

I wish they had larger sizes. If I think about how long it took me to find parking, the time I've waited in line plus how long it takes for them to make my tea - a 30-40 minute wait time for consumption far outweighs the 2 minutes it took for me to drink it.

People complain about the price - I say shut up and get over it (especially if you go to the newly opened Plentea in FiDi and see their prices!) - If you want boba milk tea for $0.99, go ahead and go to Quickly. The profit margin in the boba business is slim and people are used to either cheap pre-made/powdered mixed drinks, coffee creamer (instead of high quality milk - I'm pointing at you T-Pumps), and basic flavors. I appreciate their mission statement and intent for using the highest quality of everything (esp. when everyone is trying to cut costs everywhere and doesn't care that pesticides and hormones are 80% of the end product). The best thing about this place for me is that they have almond jelly, which I can't find in any other place in the bay area. My favorites in order are the Muscat Oolong, Horchata, and regular milk tea. In the end, you just need to know what flavors you do and do not like - this place won't be for everyone.

excerpts: *Muscat Oolong: Yuuumm
muscat oolong.author: Kathy Y.
muscat oolong.review:
I LOVE BOBA GUYS.

Let's get it straight, it's not your typical boba joint and it does cost a bit more, but it's SO WORTH IT. I am not someone who has to get their daily/weekly boba fix (seriously, I get almond milk instead of real milk), but I come here every time I visit SF. The employees are super nice and they are all about organics, so what's not to love??

*Iced Matcha Latte: My fave
*Thai Tea: Dee-lish
*Earl Grey: Soooooo good
*Muscat Oolong: Yuuumm

excerpts: The teas have a beautiful flavor, particularly the muscat oolong (you can really taste the muscat).
muscat oolong.author: Courtney N.
muscat oolong.review:
Such a wonderful boba shop! My friends and I joke that it's the most artisan our boba gets, and it's not that much more expensive than the boba shops closer to home.

What I particularly love about this shop is that it doesn't have too many options. Most boba places have a gazillion options, and for indecisive people like me, I spend forever deciding what I want. Having fewer options makes me trust that their options were all carefully crafted/tested and are of high quality, which has been true so far! 

They even brew your tea right when you order, so it's fresh! The teas have a beautiful flavor, particularly the muscat oolong (you can really taste the muscat). I also appreciate that they have so many different options for milk (including almond and soy milk), and that they use healthy, organic products :)

My favorite so far has been the horchata with boba, which always has a delicious amount of spice and flavor. I've also tried their thai iced tea, as well as their hong kong style, which were both a bit too sweet (although I could have asked them to tone it down). I would suggest sticking with their boba, which has a great consistency, and is quite sweet, mostly because I'm not the biggest fan of jellies. Also, try substituting in almond milk for the regular milk! It adds nice body and flavor :)

excerpts: They have variety of interesting flavors that I was surprised to see and would definitely like to try when i come back: horchata, decaf, hong kong style, coconut green tea, chamomile mint, muscat oolong, etc.
You can also order online and choose a pick up time!
How convenient!
The place is pretty small, with some window seating, so it's primarily a to-go place.
There is also a bench right outside as well.
I would definitely come back!
I'm excited to hear that they're going to open a store in Union Square, closer to where I live!
I'm sure they'll get a lot of business.
muscat oolong.author: Anna L.
muscat oolong.review:
I tried the Soy Milk Tea with grass jelly and I really like the strong tea flavor! I felt like it was the right sweetness for me, so there was no reason to adjust the sugar percentage which I realized later I could have done. I thought the grass jelly was okay..I felt like it had a weird texture - more firm and dense than the regular grass jelly that I'm used to. 
I came at a good time when there were not too many people..around 3 something..so I got my drink in like 2 minutes. I like that they have a little station for water with cups and also a jug where you could add extra syrup! According to their website, the syrup, almond jelly, and grass jelly are homemade! I appreciate that they strive to use the best possible ingredients (organic tea and organic condensed milk!) and the best possible milk-tea-making methods to produce good quality drinks. They have variety of interesting flavors that I was surprised to see and would definitely like to try when i come back: horchata, decaf, hong kong style, coconut green tea, chamomile mint, muscat oolong, etc. You can also order online and choose a pick up time! How convenient! 
The place is pretty small, with some window seating, so it's primarily a to-go place. There is also a bench right outside as well.
I would definitely come back! I'm excited to hear that they're going to open a store in Union Square, closer to where I live! I'm sure they'll get a lot of business.

excerpts: I had the muscat oolong milk tea.
Didn't have a strong milk tea taste I was expecting.
It's mediocre average with an above average price at $5.50.
I'd prefer Quickly over this place.
muscat oolong.author: Garrick G.
muscat oolong.review: I had the muscat oolong milk tea. Didn't have a strong milk tea taste I was expecting. It's mediocre average with an above average price at $5.50. I'd prefer Quickly over this place.

excerpts: The Muscat Oolong milk tea from the slow bar is the best!
Full oolong scent and flavor.
Minus 1 star since it's pretty pricey, but worth the 0.5 mile walk.
muscat oolong.author: Cheryl X.
muscat oolong.review: The Muscat Oolong milk tea from the slow bar is the best! Full oolong scent and flavor. Minus 1 star since it's pretty pricey, but worth the 0.5 mile walk.

excerpts: We got the Horchata and the Rose tea, both with boba.
Neither were as flavorful as almost any other decent boba place.
rose tea.author: Thomas S.
rose tea.review: It didn't feel nearly worth the hype nor the price, let alone the combination of the two. We got the Horchata and the Rose tea, both with boba. Neither were as flavorful as almost any other decent boba place.

excerpts: But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black.
I feel like I was rigged.
The rose tea had a very aromatic, flora scent, while the ice matcha was just beautiful to look at.
rose tea.author: Wendy F.
rose tea.review:
SO SWEET. Please have more less-sweet decaf drink options!!! 

This was my first time drinking boba in more than a year and I was a little disappointed.

I got the DECAF BLACK (50% sugar) because I wanted something decaffeinated (my body doesn't tolerate caffeine well). At first I was going to pick the HORCHATA, which is the most popular decaf drink on the menu, but I could NOT adjust the sugar level on that one so I went with the decaf black tea, which the girl at the store "recommended". Not sure if she really knows the drinks all that well yet. 

The decaf black was VERY SWEET at 50%. It did not taste anything like a decaf black tea, but more like jasmine tea...I could not tell what was special about this drink or this boba place from drinking this tea. I think this is why there is only one picture of that drink on Yelp right now (which is mine lol).

But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black. I feel like I was rigged. The rose tea had a very aromatic, flora scent, while the ice matcha was just beautiful to look at. 

Anyways, if I liked boba more I would have loved this place. Just sucks that I don't drink caffeinated that often.

excerpts: I love ordering the rose tea, with extra boba.
I would totally recommend this place.
rose tea.author: Summer B.
rose tea.review: I love this place! The boba here is amazing. There are sometimes long lines, but not always. The staff are very friendly. It is a little bit expensive, but worth it. I love ordering the rose tea, with extra boba. I would totally recommend this place.

excerpts: We got 3 drinks - thai tea, rose tea with almond jelly, and honey tea with boba.
The thai tea was the most unlucky and more than what hsould have spilled but that's separate from Boba Guys.
I got the rose tea unsweetend with almond jelly for pretty much $5.
The quantity is about the size of a grande from starbucks which is pretty pricey
I think.
The drink itself though was good but a little sweeter than what I thought it would be even without sugar.
The almond jelly was pretty good though - not sweet at all which is greatly appreciated.
rose tea.author: Tao Tao W.
rose tea.review:
was feeling some tea and also wanted some jelly this afternoon so Boba Guys was the closest. I usually always go to sharetea but my signature drink would not ever make it over here for ice blended. We did postmates Boba Guys which btw arrived wrapped in plastic wrap to prevent spillage - nice job on the packaging. We got 3 drinks - thai tea, rose tea with almond jelly, and honey tea with boba. The thai tea was the most unlucky and more than what hsould have spilled but that's separate from Boba Guys.

I got the rose tea unsweetend with almond jelly for pretty much $5. The quantity is about the size of a grande from starbucks which is pretty pricey I think. The drink itself though was good but a little sweeter than what I thought it would be even without sugar. The almond jelly was pretty good though - not sweet at all which is greatly appreciated.  I did get enough almond jelly to be able to save some for tomororw to drink with regular tea. 

overall, I found my drink at least that I can appreciate for the next time but still its PRICEY. I finished it in like 5 minutes...

excerpts: Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye.
I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each):
Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.
rose tea.author: Jennifer L.
rose tea.review:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!

excerpts: You can really taste the rose tea flavor.
I think this would be my favorite drink!
The almond jelly was soft and yummy.
rose tea.author: Philana C.
rose tea.review:
I've been wanting to try Boba Guys for a pretty long time! I finally got to try them on a hot and sunny day in San Francisco. Perfect for the cold drink! When we first arrived, there was a small crowd inside and outside the store. We ordered and shared the following drinks:

Rose Milk Tea with Almond Jelly - I noticed that the tea was actually brewed from real tea leaves! I really liked this drink! You can really taste the rose tea flavor. I think this would be my favorite drink! The almond jelly was soft and yummy. However, I definitely prefer their boba over the almond jelly.

Ice Matcha Latte with Tapioca - I love anything with matcha in it, so I had to get this. Flavor was pretty strong. One thing I did not like was that every sip I took, there were small specks of the matcha powder. However, I did loved the bobas! They were sweet and chewy! 

Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly - I tasted more of the milk versus the jasmine tea flavor. I think I have had better at other boba places.

Prices are a bit expensive; however, Boba Guys do use fresh ingredients including organic milk and they brew tea leaves instead of using all that powder and artificial ingredients. Also, we only had to wait for about 10 minutes even though there was a huge line and crowd ordering and waiting for their drinks.

excerpts: I was deciding between Jasmine Milk Tea, Duke of Earl Grey, and Rose Tea
and since this was my first time here, I decided to go simple and get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.

JASMINE MILK TEA W/ BOBA
Was a hefty $4 and though it was good, it wasn't $4 good.
You can taste both the jasmine and the milk tea without either flavor overwhelming the other.
But the boba was... interesting.
I have mixed feelings toward it.
It hardened a bit
so it wasn't fresh
and if you're going to call yourself "Boba Guys", ya better have some good boba!
But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea.
Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm...
We'll see how this goes.
But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea.
Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm...
We'll see how this goes.
rose tea.author: Sandy T.
rose tea.review:
I finally made it out to Boba Guys! I was deciding between Jasmine Milk Tea, Duke of Earl Grey, and Rose Tea and since this was my first time here, I decided to go simple and get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.

JASMINE MILK TEA W/ BOBA
Was a hefty $4 and though it was good, it wasn't $4 good. You can taste both the jasmine and the milk tea without either flavor overwhelming the other. But the boba was... interesting. I have mixed feelings toward it. It hardened a bit so it wasn't fresh and if you're going to call yourself "Boba Guys", ya better have some good boba! It did have an interesting chew to it though, almost like the Hi-Chew candy.

With this drink alone, Boba Guys did not win me over. But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea. Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm... We'll see how this goes. Until next time!

TIP: Watch out for the step! I didn't realize it was there when I was leaving and tweaked my ankle a bit. Thankfully, I wasn't hurt for more than two minutes but do be careful.

excerpts: My favorite is the rose tea half sweet.
The owners are great, the classic small business success story.
Definitely go out and support them!
rose tea.author: Jamil M.
rose tea.review: I'm not sure why this place has less than a 5-star rating, it is the best bubble tea in town. Not like that Quickly powdered crap, this bubble tea is made from real tea and real milk. We've been fans since they were a popup in Ken Ken Ramen, and it's become one my family's favorite weekend treats. My favorite is the rose tea half sweet. The owners are great, the classic small business success story. Definitely go out and support them!

excerpts: Rose tea.
rose tea.author: Ben C.
rose tea.review: Every time when I m pop up on mission, here's my always must-go drink place. Good, maybe? Addicted, yes!!!! What was I fond for over here? Rose tea.

excerpts: My favorite kind of mix for bubble on a cold winter day (like right now) is: hot tea from the slow bar (I tried rose tea) + milk + tapioca.
No sugar.
rose tea.author: Elizabeth T.
rose tea.review:
High-quality boba milk tea! The best you can ask for. 

This is not the artificially-flavored unhealthy and disgusting kind of bubble tea that gives boba a bad rep. They use real tea leaves, real milk (instead of powdered cream), and tapioca cooked to the right consistency. Even the popular bubble tea places in SF asian land AKA inner sunset, joints such as TeaWay still use flavored powder in most of their products.

Trust me, I know what I'm talking about. After all, I'm from Taiwan, where bubble tea was invented! 

My favorite kind of mix for bubble on a cold winter day (like right now) is: hot tea from the slow bar (I tried rose tea) + milk + tapioca. No sugar. The tapioca is already coated with sugar and that's enough sweetness for me. 

The first time I came here it was about to close and I got the jasmine milk tea w/ boba. The tapioca was very hard. I suspected it had something to do with the fact it was at the end of day and having cooked tapioca myself I knew that it could've just been a bad batch. So I came back and gave it a second try. Just as I thought, this time the boba was soft and chewy, just right!

Pro: 
 --- real, high-quality tea
 --- real milk
 --- good boba consistency
 --- reasonable pricing ($4-$5)
 
(Not really) Con:
  --- shop is small and doesn't have much space
  --- in the mission, so don't expect to be able to park

This is from now on my goto place for bubble tea!

excerpts: I got the Ice Rose Tea with boba.
It was very good.
Very strong rose flavors and the right amount of sweetness.
rose tea.author: Liza T.
rose tea.review:
Finally got a chance to try Boba Guys.  

The decor was nice and clean.  The staffs was friendly and helpful.

I got the Ice Rose Tea with boba.  It was very good.  Very strong rose flavors and the right amount of sweetness.  The balls were good too, soft but chewy.  

The price was little higher than other boba places but they used fine ingredients, definitely worth it.

excerpts: I didn't even really taste the rose tea at all.
It was like water and milk mixed together, same with my friend's drink
rose tea.author: Polly L.
rose tea.review: Definitely NOT worth the hype. I've been seeing this place on instagram all the time and thought that it'd be amazing milk tea. I got the Rose Black Milk Tea from the slow bar expecting that it'd be superrr amazing but not really. I got it with 50% sugar since everyone here said it was too sweet and my drink ended up tasting like water. I didn't even really taste the rose tea at all. It was like water and milk mixed together, same with my friend's drink (Jasmine Milk Tea). It was probably the worst milk tea I've had, worst than getting powdered milk tea. I probably would not come back to Boba Guys just because it's not good and it was definitely not worth $5 a cup.
